review_body: Dated basic hotel in need of a facelift. Expensive as well for a moderate room, everything is relatively close in Waikiki so location was ok. Staff were very helpful with all my requests. It was booked through a travel agent and was staying solo so I also had to pay a single supplement which made the price expensive considering the facilities. Breakfast was included i tried it one didn't bother the other three mornings you can read into that.

We enjoyed our 3 night stay. The breakfast that was included was enjoyable. I actually enjoyed eating noodles for breakfast The pancakes were very good as well. Parking is expensive but we found free parking on the street by the canal . The hotel is close to the beach, the international market and many restaurants. Our room was clean and the bed was comfortable. We didn’t use the pool, it is very small.

Check in staff (and check-out) were very, very rude and unwelcoming. You'd expect when welcoming fellow Kama'aina there'd be a bit more Aloha, but nothing. They didn't want to be there. They also tried to tell me my rate wasn't Kama'aina and wouldn't remove the Resort Fee despite my confirmation stating it was. It really was a terrible first impression, and as they say, first impressions last. Also, their website states they offer Kama'aina a free upgrade if available - no mention of this either.Secondly, elevators were very slow - there are only 2, and one was broken. You need to plan a LOT of time; sometimes as much as 10 minutes, to get up and down.Carpet in the room was dirty. Rooms were NOT serviced (no towels replaced, no cleaning) as my stay was only 2 nights (3 days). When I inquired at reception I was told "... We only do that for stays over 3 nights". This was NOT clear anywhere, nor was I told this at check-in. If I was, I would have been OK, and would have realized I could have just asked for new towels.. but the lack of communication was poor.Also, CONSTRUCTION. Lots of drilling beginning at 7am. I was not informed of this during check-in either. Go back to your room at 4pm for a rest? Forget about it - DRILLING. Loud. In reality, I think they give Kama'aina the *worst* rooms.Admittedly, hotels in HNL are only for you to sleep in. They are cheap, good location, but that is it. I would rather spend more $ to get some Aloha. Will NOT recommend, or stay here again, sorry.

If you want to be in the busy city, then the location of this hotel is decent; near the beach, many restaurants and shops. There is a parking garage where you pay I think $30 USD per night, however it was full when we arrived so we had to find another parking garage, about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The room was large and the bed was comfortable but everything else was sub par. The couch had large stains and the room looked old. There is also construction next to the hotel, which we could hear in the morning. The free breakfast buffet was just OK. They had toast, scrambled eggs, fruit, pancakes, noodles, some meat and coffee and warm water to drink. I would not stay here again.

Located within walking distance from the beach. This hotel provides breakfast and it is good. I booked through booking.com and got a small room. Rooms are clean. Hotel staff members are very good and cooperative.

Everything was perfect except for the free buffet breakfast. Its the same everyday. The juice tasted like water. But everything else was good. The room was nice and near the beach and markets. The room was spacious and the people are very nice.

Great location, within walking distances of Waikiki Strip, International Market, Hawaiian Royal Centre, central to Honolulu CBD/Waikiki. We got great service from staff at reception and maintenance, whenever needed e.g. I couldn't work out how to work my room card. We also used the car parking facility, you will have a car space allotted. The room was very basic, the photos don't show how dated the rooms are. But we were happy with them because they were spotlessly clean and were serviced every day. We had the best night's sleeps on their beds and pillows each night, air conditioning wasn't noisy for me. And there is a room next to the bathroom for make up etc. It was the best value for money at Christmas time in Waikiki. Would definitely stay here again. If you come here expecting 4 star or to look exactly as the pictures suggest e.g. brand spanking new, this isn't likely to meet your expectations if you are after fancy hotel. But if you're after value for money in Waikiki, a clean room to stay and a budget to stick to, and a laidback chill atmosphere that feels like you are at the beach, this is a great choice. We regretted that we weren't able to stay in this hotel for our entire stay in Honolulu. The one we went to after we left Aqua (Pacific Marina Inn) made us wish we had been able to stay at Aqua.

We booked a last minute trip to Oahu over Xmas week and then realized that everything was full and expensive. We were able to get a room at Aqua Aloha Surf. It is a good hotel- they have a hearty breakfast with Asian lunch food as well as good pancakes (we got tired of it after a few days). It is a great location and the service was mostly very good. They have laundry facilities in the basement, cold water in the lobby, and free movie rentals. The deluxe room was big enough for a family of four if you don’t mind a double size bed. We got the deluxe room that has a double, twin, and sofa bed. We didn’t try pulling out the sofa but it worked as a single bed. One issue was the noise outside of the hotel. For the first couple of nights we left the glass door open (prefer no a/c) but it was terribly noisy with a bar across the street as well as construction. For the rest of the time we slept with the glass door closed, and a/c on and the noise was no longer an issue. There is a nice place to walk on a canal right next to the hotel, and plenty of rental bikes nearby. Excellent, cheap food everywhere. Overall, a great stay! Room has a microwave and mini fridge.

The first morning I was there I was awoken by heavy construction noise on the 'beach' side of the hotel (203). I would not rent this room to a deaf person! Maybe if you're an early riser it would be fine. Room 313 was bigger and quiet!

When we travel to Hawaii we always stay on the North Shore for the surf comp. Our last night is always spent in Waikiki before flying home early. Year after year we waste money on accomodation that we don’t really use as we are on the town until late and leave at 5:30am. This year we decided to save some money and stay a couple of streets back from the action. The location was fine, even though there was a lot of construction happening right next door. Very clean and first impressions were excellent. Spacious room with great facilities in the room. The bed was super comfy. Only complaint is we were room 803 (last room on the block) the wind from outside kept banging our door, all night, sounded like someone was trying to break in. This was consistent all night even though my husband tried several methods of trying to block it out. Such a shame as otherwise this place was excellent value for money.

My wife and I stayed here for 9 nights in December.The rooms were small but clean.The breakfast was average.The kitchen staff were very unfriendly and pushy.All other staff just did their jobs.Rather stoic I thought.The best part was the location and the daily room service.

Clean, tidy and comfortable. Quick and easy access to the beach, shopping and restaurants.Could do with a lick of paint and some new carpet, though. Beds are a bit smaller than your average side.It’s biggest and only let down was the breakfast. It was very much orientated to the Japanese market. So if you are happy with fried rice for breakfast, then you will have no issues

We stayed in this hotel to spend a night in Waikiki before heading off on a flight the next day, and can I just say it was a huge disappointment. The room was tiny, the fridge hadn’t been cleaned out. There was sludge around the sink in the bathroom, appearing as though it hadn’t been cleaned in a while. Basically all of the fixtures were falling apart and the couch had stains on it. The pool does not look as advertised - we are a family of four and if we were in the pool it was basically full. As well, the staff were pushy and unpleasant as we were checking in. Over all, I would not recommend this hotel for your stay in Waikiki.

Stayed here for 4 nights nice location in that its 5-10 minutes walk from beach and busy area and 2 mins from bus and amenities.Hotel is nice clean with open plan reception with seating area. Staff on arrival helpful and nice.Rooms were clean but a little dated but bed was comfy and aircon was included. Also get in room was coffee maker and fridge large tele and safe.We overlooked the road but it is relatively quiet so wasnt an issue.Also building work is taking place next door and across the road which starts early but no more noisy that normal delivery lorries and bin wagons, but not an issue to us as we are early risers.Breakfast good but plenty of variety of warm food but very basic cereals hoola hoops or bran flakes also only thing to put on toast was maple syrup no jam or marmalade when the stern asian front of house no was the answer which i find strange when offering breakfast. but could have had spicey cabbage noodles egg fried rise items more suitable for dinner.All in all enjoyed our stay.

Stayed here 10 days very good location! Close walk to the beach only 2 blocks please don’t rent the beach chairs at the beach ..hotel front desk offered beach towels and chair free of charge just sign out for the day ...desk people are very helpful and friendly...breakfast ok mostly had pancakes sauges eggs ham ..you can find something is included in price of hotel not many offer this only 2 hours thou 7 to 9..had a great stay not fancy but clean and professional..pool small but works to take a dip not many people never down there and abc stores on every corner have lots of things to buy and snacks and alcohol Christine Nova Scotia Canada

this hotel is a good location and access to the restaurant one i can recommend is called chucks which is ineasy access walking and the best steak we have had and the price was right if you want good time there is alsoa house band and the staff are top notch

We stayed in a queensized guestroom, without balcony. Although the room was outdated, it was clean. Very basic bathroom, without a closet. But then again, we only need our room to sleep. The hotel is perfect located to make trips around the island. Breakfast is good, but there’s no variety.

We were visiting Waikiki for the first time, and wanted to have a room under $200 per night and walking distance from the beach. We first found out about the hotel through an Airbnb listing, and then checked out the hotel on its on site. The hotel is a mixture of rooms owned and managed by the hotel, and rooms/condos owned by private owners. The hotel has remodeled many, but not all of its rooms, and the rooms by the owners can be remodeled or very old and in disrepair.We found that the room that we rented through Airbnb was in the old and disrepair category. The owner was friendly and responsive, and fixed the toilet and the lights. We saw a room belonging to the hotle, and it looked fresh and modern. Good things about the hotel are that it is about a 10 minute walk to the beach; relatively low price; it has a good WiFi signal; and there is a good breakfast for hotel guests (or for purchase for Airbnb guests), and that the elevator worked well.Bad things are that it has no view of either beach or city due to being surrounded by higher buildings, and that we did not enjoy the Airbnb room.

I'd rate no stars if I could. Limited selection, same everyday - scrambled and boiled eggs, rice, noodles, spam, mini wieners, cabbage, beans, apple and oranges, pancakes. No customer service...even by self-service buffet standards.

From the moment we got here to the moment we left it was terrible. They never gave any type of service in fact instead of a greeting we received a “did you need something” uh yeah I want to check in. We came early had to wait forever to check in and once checked it it was terrible the beds were kids beds for a double room.The walls are popcorn ceilings with cracks where the AC is, the use a key to turn on power in sorry that is not new actually motels use that type of service and it’s not eco friendly it’s terrible use of electricity management. The safe was old and rusted I definitely didn’t want anything to do with it. They have a PS2 games not included and not taken care of either. Two of the buildings are in construction next to them until March 2020or later, so the fees should have been waived. Because there is no “resort” nor is quiet because they have looversfor windows not insulated windows. The pool is literally the size of a king bed from 3ft to 8ft. It was hard because asking for anything wasn’t just asking we had to call down several times for one item. Just extra conditioner. Example! The very next day we checked into a larger well managed hotel on Waikiki strip.We got our luggage taken in, ideas of places to go while we waited in for our rooms and our numbers were taken down to text us when room was ready now that’s a check in service. We were checked in before 11am I’ll never forget that me and my travel partner decided we were definitely coming back to that hotel! This place is a hostel but I’ve actually been to nice ones so even that’s not accurate. The manager T.C. likes to comment back on ratings like these and on google. Suggestion: stop commenting and make it better. The room rates from now til 2020 should not be that high and for not being renovated.Also huge red flag when it literally does not say hotel in the name it literally means it does not need to act like one. Which clearly they didn’t feel like. definitely not family friendly or any friendly.Its like their entire staff avoids tourist but they work in tourism and in a “hotel” bizarre behaviors to say the least. Just spend more and go somewhere else. We definitely learned our lesson we won’t ever come back. Horrible. Period.

So we traveled with another couple, and she wanted to go cheap but close to beach. So we went cheap - and not so close to the beach. The area looks like a warzone because of renovation and building. The room was tiny which was not much of an issue because thank goodness we were only there for one night. The windows in the room are apparently pretty non existent because on the 2 floor we could hear everything going on outside - thank goodness the AC was so loud and noisy it drowned out a lot of the noise. The place was relatively clean - except for the stains on the skimpy curtains, the carpeting, the chipped paint, even the pad of notepaper was all wrinkled from something wet and sticky having been set on it. And there were things left in the refrigerator. The bathroom was old - even the handle for the sink stopper was all bent, and the pocket door did not shut completely. The front desk - the only information the woman gave us was 'here is your parking permit - put it on the dash'. We had to call down later to find out where the ice machine was, and when the breakfast started. The breakfast of course caters to Asians - along with watery eggs, mini hot dogs trying to disguise themselves as sausages, the only juice was what appeared to be Hawaiian punch. The pastries included some sort of cake, and the mini donuts you get at the grocery store. And oh - dont even bother looking for jelly for the toast - they dont have it! They do not offer any assistance with unloading your car - if you use one of their carts be careful, they wheels dont work right and the ramp up from the driveway is a killer. We have stayed in other Aqua hotels but this was the worst ever.

The Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki Hotel is perfectly located near the Royal Hawaiian Center and Waikiki Beach. I recommend asking for a high-up room that overlooks the canal because it is a gorgeous view. The hotel has a pool and underground parking available for guests. The rooms are in good condition and we greatly enjoyed our patio with chairs to sit in. I would definitely stay here if I were in Waikiki again.

The Hotel was good and close to everything awesome little coffee shop in the lobby which we loved! But the staff in the hotel (There was one nice lady) were so grumpy especially the older man in the restaurant he was terrible, it was so unbelievably we nearly laughed, it’s ashame the staff bring down this place

Sometimes something is so bad that it makes it comically good, thats almost the case here and then you realise that you did actually pay money to stay here so its not that funny. On the positives - it is relatively cheap for the area, it is located close to the beach and the room did have a bed in it.Thats about when the good parts of the experience end - I cant speak for all the check in staff (so there might be some good ones), the one we had was just particularly surly (always a top trait for someone that works in hospitality), there is the $25 a day resort /amentie fee which is of course a joke as you have no option to pay it (just include it in the room price ffs) but this is a standard gouging across Hawaii so I wont blame this hotel specifically for that, however where it does get amazing is when you do look at the amenities - the gym aka "Exercise Area" which is a single broken wieder multi gym sitting outside the lobby, Im not sure if you could legally describe it as something safe to exercise on, Ive added a photo as I found it particularly amusing - note the fact that if you did roll the dice and actualy use that machine it is located almost in the lobby and next to the vending machines adding to the special ambiance they have created. The rooms have a bed, TV and bathroom in them, we were concerned the bathroom door was going to fall to pieces in our hands every time we touched it but it did manage to survive our stay (win!), the use of PS3s as inroom DVD players is an interesting one I guess you could look at that as a positive. The air conditioner definitely worked you had a choice of either OFF or MEAT LOCKER COLD, we chose to dance between the two settings throughout the evening to keep things interesting.A few reviews have mentioned the breakfast and they are reasonably spot on, the angry greeting by the woman cooking pancakes is a bit of a low light but then the pancakes themselves are somewhat of a highlight of the whole hotel experience so its a real roller coaster of emotions throughout breakfast. It is served in an Asian buffet restaurant complete with large fishtank and ornate oval tables which does make for an interesting touch.If you are looking for a cheap hotel close to the beach and can overlook getting any sort of pleasure out of the hotel you are staying at on holiday then this is a fabulous choice, if not perhaps spend a few more dollars and keep hunting around

We stayed here through VRBO and the Ali'i beach rentals. The property is a bit dated, but pretty nice overall. The staff, however, is what I'd call apathetic and unfriendly. They are often also unavailable. They have a hotel where they have regular guests, Airbnb, and VRBO all staying under one roof. They freely admit they treat their guests differently than the VRBO or Airbnb. Understand you only need staff for onsite issues like parking and use of facilities. Seems easy right? These guys sold our parking space while we were still parked in it! They couldn't tell my wife where the swap meet is? You live here, right? They refused us pool towels causing a trip all the way back to the 16th floor? Like we wouldn't bring them back. Worse than all of that, they are flat out rude. Their apathy is obvious and they are unapologetic about it saying we are here staying with their competitors? Just wow. If they had treated us equal they may have gotten good reviews. Heck, I may have considered them as an option next time I come here, but after this experience I never would. Ali'I beach rentals are thoughtful and listen to their guests. I'd use them again just never to stay here!

We stayed at the Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki on our recent vacation in Honolulu. It wasn’t a pleasant experience. During our first night our air conditioner put out a horrible moldy smell all night. We complained and were moved to another room. All the rooms are very cramped and old looking. The breakfast buffet provided isn’t very good. The person running the buffet each morning is grouchy with guests and rude. My wife complained to the hotel of the way she was treated by this person. She was told that it was t run “officially” by the hotel, but was contracted. No excuse! I wouldn’t recommend this hotel.

The hotel was clean with free breakfast buffet every day. Good laundry facilities and we loved the hire towel system. Spa on site but pricey, mind you, so is everywhere in Waikiki. This hotel was in a fantastic location- which did mean we could hear a lot of traffic from our room. There was a car park in the basement (very tight considering everyone has enormous trucks here) which is expensive at $30 a day. Remember they chuck a resort fee at you too- $25 a day to include everything you could ever want... NOT (free water in lobby, a newspaper, tea and coffee in room- ours didn’t have any)The staff weren’t quite up to scratch. Seeing as I work in hospitality, I do always expect a nice welcome- ours was far from it. I detest when they take your credit card as a ‘bond’ and automatically charge it when you check out, despite making it clear that I actually wanted to use another card. This caused big and unnecessary issues for us!! They also don’t explain anything about resort fees or parking when you arrive. I did hear a colleague say to the woman who checked us in ‘Don’t be so down about it, you can always try again’ so she was clearly having a bad day- which turned into a bad week for the whole time we were there. I did feel bad for her, however ...her bad attitude shouldn’t have been put onto me & her customer service.

My 18 year old son and I stayed here for five nights. The hotel staff were so courteous and helpful. Our room had two twin beds that were really comfortable. This hotel is not fancy so if your looking for luxury don’t stay here. But if you’re looking for great value in an excellent location that has absolutely EVERYTHING you need to be comfortable then I highly recommend this place. The room had absolutely everything we could need. The cleaning staff kept it clean and stocked with plenty of towels and toiletries. We had a refrigerator an iron with full sized ironing board a microwave a coffee maker and a big flat screen tv and a safe. Even though we were in Hawaii and come on let’s face it with so much to see and do we weren’t in the room that much but when we were we had everything we needed. We did have the free breakfast option as well. Again not fancy but you could get full on the delicious fluffy pancakes scrambled eggs and toast every day. They also had cakes coffee water and juice daily. There was also an assortment of Chinese options which my son really liked. The location was great too. So close to shopping Main Street to the beach and the bus stop. You do not need more than this for the price we paid it was a fantastic value! Thank you Aqua Aloha Surf! We will be back!!!!!

I stayed here for a shopping holiday with my daughter and we loved the convenience of being centrally located close to the main tourist areas the beach, restaurants and shopping. The hotel is very Hawaii with suf decor. The staff were very friendly and helpful and as two ladies travelling we always felt safe. The amenities at this hotel are not what I call resort like, as the pool area is small and restaurant is limited but it is a very comfortable, clean and practical hotel. I usually go at least four or five star but would happily return as my holiday base for Waikiki.

I stayed for 8 nights at this hotel and found the whole experience fantastic! Yes the rooms are dated that you cant not deny however they are clean and homey. The beds are so comfortable and they have the best pillows. Another bonus: unlimited internet so no need to buy data packs while travelling overseas. You do have to pay a resort fee of $25 per night which covers your breakfast, towels, internet and a shuttle to Ala Moana shopping mall. I felt this was great value for money. The staff were extremely helpful whenever we needed anything they were happy and accommodating of our needs. They have a cute little coffee shop inside the hotel and they do the best coffee! They also have a little nail/beauty shop onsite. I never used this so cant give feedback. Only negative was the breakfast. We actually only used our voucher for this once as we didnt like the choices. The only thing we ate was the freshly made pancakes. Everything else was not to our liking. Its more tailored to the Asian tourists. They do have toast but no toppings to go on it which is strange. Other than breakfast eveything else was awesome. If you are wanting a safe place to stay with friendly staff and brilliantly located motel (5mins walk to the beach an shopping) and you can look past the dated look then this is the place to staying wouldn't hesitate to stay here again when I come back to Hawaii.

I've been staying at this hotel on and off for years, and each and every time I'm a little more disappointed with the stay. For those who do not know how "hotel rooms" work in Hawaii, let me explain. The hotel rooms are considered "condos", and are each owned by someone. They are not owned by the "hotel". They simply maintain them and clean them after each guest leaves. With that being said, I'm very disappointed this time around. First of all I go through a third party to book, as its cheaper. The third party collects the taxes and fees. When I got to the property after paying over $500 for my 4 day stay, I was charged another $133 for a "resort fee". This "hotel" is far from a "resort". The staff are very very nice, I will give them that, however this is not a resort, its barely a hotel at this point. The lobby is okay, but has the same furniture in it that it had when I started staying here in 2010. Very old, worn and outdated. The rooms are no exception. They are suppose to require the owners to keep them up, and great condition and not to look like a dump. When I first checked in I was sent to 204, which was the size of a bathroom. Smells horrible and could barely turn around in the room and had no patio. They moved me to 609 with a fee of $10 per day "upgrade fee", however the only upgrade was a larger room and a patio. The condition of the room however was nowhere near an upgrade. With a king size bed that the mattress is broken down on the side and the foot, sagging and in horrible condition. The carpet is filthy, the walls have wallpaper that is peeling and ripped. The baseboards are water damaged. The lamp shades are gross with stains and dust. The sofa I wouldn't let a dog lay on it was so dirty. The tile in the bathroom shower looks like it was put in when the place was built. The furniture is chipped, broken and looks like its from the 80's. This is the last time I will stay at Aqua Surf Waikiki. I love the area because it is so close to everything, but I think it is time to start staying at the large corporate owned hotels that have better standards and requirements. Hopefully this building will get bought out and tore down for condos or something. BTW... the WiFi is horrible too! (See Photos)

Aqua Aloha Surf Gad great amenities. We chose the package with the buffet breakfast, which was prepared well. There options were diverse. Aqua Aloha Surf provided beach towels for us as well. In my opinion the hotel is also in a good location. It is not far from the beach, so walking may not be a problem. It is also close to a bus stop which may take you to the airport. We were also provided with friendly customer service. I recommend Aqua Aloha Surf to individuals, couples, or small families.

This is a good choice for a budget hotel in Waikiki. It is located in the center of Waikiki about two blocks from the beach. My room was on the small side ( but one doesn’t spend much time in a hotel room in Hawaii ). My room did have a good size lanai though. The room was very comfortable with a safe, refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker. They also provide free beach towels. Breakfast was included however I did not find it to be very good ( I actually didn’t take the breakfast most days ).

Traveling alone, I didn't want to pay huge bucks for a hotel, and Aqua Aloha Surf was easily the least expensive from several online searches I conducted, so I booked it skeptically... but I couldn't have been more pleased! I felt the room was very well maintained, comfortable, clean, and well equipped. Clean, new looking microwave, fridge, coffee maker, and game station DVD player! Remote control a/c, balcony, safe, hair dryer, ironing board, and stocked with Hawaiian Tropic products. Hot breakfast buffet choices reminded me of a cruise ship selection, and the "resort fee" included free beach towel rental and a huge, and unlimited, dvd and game selection. That fee is charged by all of the hotels in Waikiki, just like in Miami Beach, it comes with the territory. Everyone... the front desk people, breakfast servers, and cleaning people... were kind and friendly. They have their own laundromat in the basement if you need to do a load, and they're about a ten minute walk to everything... restaurants, the beach, even yoga... plus there's an ABC shop right on the corner. I was very pleased with the Aqua Aloha Surf Hotel and will definitely stay there again!

I wish our room had been as lovely as these photos. They will not allow enough characters to let us say how absolutely disgusted we were, I would give it minus 50.. We arrived at about 10.10 pm for an over night stay till the plane left in the morning and other than the lovely cleaning lady next day, there was no welcoming smile from the sour faced reception staff, and the staff was no better when we left. We had a tiny room (about 3 m x 2 m), which was so small that they had the rottenly uncomfortable double bed pushed against the wall to give enough room to get past to the coffee machine/jug and even though I am over 60, the bed was so uncomfortable that to get some sleep, I put three pillows on the floor and slept on them.. It is so shabby that renovations should have been done 10 years ago. And then they charged an extra $25 for use of amenities. My husband was a school principal of a Australian/Queensland distance education school, and when we visited families in the dry out back, we had far better motel rooms than this hotel in an expensive down town Waikiki beach.

Hotel wasnt horrible. It definitely needs upgrades! Staff was friendly and very accommodating. It was extremely close the the beach and all the upscale shopping. Ton of restaurants and food trucks within a block of walking. Easy to get onto the highway but you need to purchase a vehicle pass for your car. Parking is pretty hard to come by.

The property location was close to the Waikiki beach and many other amenities, as well as next to the Ala Moana Canal. The convention center is a short bus ride or a 25 minute walk, by the side of the canal. The room was sufficient with a very comfortable bed and in room microwave was great, as well as the Hawaiian coffee. The Breakfast is decent, and has a heavy Asian touch to it. The hotel can do better by upgrading some of its fixtures in the bathroom, where I could actually see some rust stains. No Big Deal for me, but it can be better.

I guess you get what you paid for but the Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki didn’t really meet our expectations. We booked a “Moderate” room for 7 nights and it was absolutely tiny. No room even for a chair although management did provide one when we asked. The whole facility is very rundown and in desperate need of a renovation. The domestic staff did their best to keep it clean but there was mould in the sealing around the shower etc. The air-con Unit is the old style through the wall and sits about a foot from the floor right next to the bed. There is also no balcony in the moderate room. Breakfast was included in our price but we didn’t eat it on three mornings. The menu is clearly aimed at the Asian market and it was difficult to find anything to suit a western diet. Didn’t use the pool as it was very tiny. Easy walk to town however. Management were kind and responsive to any requests. Basically we won’t stay here again and really can’t recommend it to other travelers.

I thought the rooms were small and very basic. A very old hotel that may need some renovations. Should have included this hospitality fee in the total cost of the rooms.You don't want to worry about paying extra money to stay somewhere once you arrive. Give it a 6/10

This Hotel is absolutely fantastic. The Location is unbeatable. You are blocks away from the Waikiki Beach and all the great restaurants , shopping and fun! The Rooms are well equipped and they also have a free breakfast! Hawaii is expensive and the breakfast is fine to cover you and save some money. No complaints! Beds were good. The City Views from the balcony is breathtaking and it's nice and ventilated. Microwave, Coffee brewers and great bathrooms made it a pleasant stay . Staff was extremely polite and helpful. If you are a budget traveler but want to stay in Waikiki in a decent, safe place, this is it!

We decided to stay another night in hawaii. Was not able to stay at the same hotel so we booked this one as it was very well priced and location was not too bad. Requested for early check-in and was able to check-in couple hours earlier (check in time). Vinh got us checked in pretty quickly. Very limited parking. First come first serve. Movie rental was not bad. Old school PS2 system in the room to play games and play dvds. Room was very small. The electricity did not work when we insert our key to the slot but was fix when we returned back to the hotel. Breakfast was alright, but we were to stay here more than 1 night we probably will end up eating out.

Best part of our stay was checking out. Luckily we only stayed 1 night before a cruise and 2 nights after. If we hadn’t booked a non refundable stay we wouldn’t have gone back. Bathroom in both rooms was awful, the second stay - sink was all cracked, no storage for toiletries. Didn’t look clean. Bed uncomfortable - big dip in the middle of the bed. Have a cheek to charge resort fee - I understand this is compulsory but we didn’t use beach towels - breakfast was disgusting. We chose to go out and pay for real breakfast. Not the Chinese restaurant attached to the hotel providing the breakfast. Milk for tea/coffee was disgusting - watered down so much. Very poor quality. Street felt unsafe - directly outside the hotel was constantly rubbish piled up at the side of the road. Although it was only a few blocks from the beach/main shopping street the further you walked along got really dark, homeless people sitting on the grass on way along. Photos on website were nothing like our room, only one tiny lamp in bedroom. Dark and dingy. Windows were slats and when on first floor felt unsafe. Staff pleasant enough but hotel very poor.

Checked in here very late for one night despite incorrectly booking through booking.com on my phone for the following night. It was late and I needed a bed. The clerk on duty, would have nothing to do with helping me change my reservation from the following to the current night. NP. Dealt with the manager the next morning. Still no resolution, but much nicer to deal with.As for the motel. Other than being a little noisy outside, due to various buildings, sirens and an occasional dog bark, it's quiet enough to sleep. Bed for me was hard and was only a twin size bed. Haven't seen them in a motel in a very long time???Water pressure good for being on the 3rd floor. Breakfast was good. Hot. Diverse in it's selections. Wouldn't be my first choice if I had time to research, but where I was, when I was, it worked.

We stayed here in early Nov 2018 and would definately stay here again. It is clean and very close to everything. The breakfast buffet was not great but included. The front desk does have beach chairs to borrow along with the beach towels. There is a Food Pantry just across the parking lot, great selection. The rooms have a small fridge, microwave and coffee maker. The hotel offers a free shuttle to Ala Moana which has a Target inside and Walmart close by if you want to buy some groceries. Front desk was always helpful. Pool is small but it is only a few blocks to the beach. There is laundry facilities with huge washers and dryers, it was $1.50 for each washer and dryer.

We stayed 3 nights here and it was definitely the low point of our trip to Hawaii. The reason why I only give this property a 2 is because the room we stayed in had louver windows which would not shut completely so it was very, very loud day and night and when we asked (more than once) if we could change rooms they just sent people to try and close them which didnt work so we barely slept. The decor of the room we had was pretty bad and not a fair representation of the photos on their website or online which is disappointing. The aircon unit was temperamental and not to mention right at head height out of the wall next to you so we could not use it without it blowing directly on you when you sleep. The bathroom was in pretty poor shape and the shower was either scolding hot or cold, no in between here. They also charge a resort fee of $25 and I am unsure why when there are no special amenities. The only saving graces to give this property a 2 were that the towels and bedding were clean and comfy and they have an onsite guest laundry so if you have been travelling a while you can do this chore at the hotel. They also have a good selection of TV channels. I have learnt that you do not try and save money on accommodation in Waikiki as you get what you pay for (but I wouldn't think this should be rated 3 star).

We just had 10 nights at this hotel, and found it to be comfortable, the air conditioner was not too loud, but the noise from the road was. We were up on the 12th floor right near the Ala Wai canal, and this is the main thoroughfare for the fire engines, ambulances, police cars, all of which have very loud sirens, and as Waikiki has a lot of one way systems, this was the most direct route for them to go.There is also a bar across the road in another hotel, and boy do the drunks create merry hell at any time from 2.30am onwards.If you were staying on the other side of the hotel, I am sure this wouldnt be a problem.Some people complain about the breakfasts, but if you are at home, you usually have the same regular things to eat. There was scrambled eggs, boiled, and some of them seemed to be done a sort of way that turned the shell brown, ham, noodles, corn,small sausages, lovely hot pancakes with whipped butter, and maple syrup, scones, donuts,some pastry type of things,orange and apple pieces, rice, some Asian foods, that I could identify, so didnt try, but that was ok. toast, tea, coffee, juice. All in all, I was satisifed with what we had each morning. There was an uptight staff member that did a bit of shouting, but maybe she was stressed when a lot of people came in, like busloads of people
user_name:
Judith B
Havelock North, New Zealand

review_body: hello,we ware staying in small (20m2) room.the room was clean and maintance, but you can not get perfect room for a 100$.the last evening we saw two bugs in the bathroom.a location was good to reach waiki and the local buses stops close.the stuff was very friendly and the breakfast was fine. in the lobby there was also the water to file up.they could clean in front of the hotel, because there was a lot of waste in front of the hotel.brmatjaz

The Hotelrooms are nice and clean.Its close to waikiki beach :)Why i give this bad rating:As we checked in, we asked for an late ckeck out, at 11 PM.The woman an the counter told us, that we had to pay 75 Dollars and could check out at 11 PM.This was great. But at the check out day we get told, that this was a misunderstanding, and that we have to leave the hotel at 7PM. There ist nothing they can do about it.it was their mistake and they made it to our problem.On top-the breakfast is horrible. Never had such a bad breakfast. Cheap products prepared without effort.-there is no fitnessroom. There are some Training Tools at the ground floor (outside from the lobby).

Stayed here in September 2018.Booked this through booking.comRooms are old and dated. Air conditioning is so noicy and doesn't cool the room.Made the mistake of booking a superior room thinking this should be nice. However superior room here does not give you a lounge to sit on or a kitchen unit.Asked to be upgraded to a deluxe room had to wait for a week for a change of room.While waiting for the change in the superior room had a scheduled visit from the pest man. Who came through the room to spray for pests.Finally shifted to the deluxe room. Which gives you a lounge to sit on and a kitchen sink. The mini fridge is in a cupboard and the smell every time the fridge was opened was disgusting.The accommodation also came with breakfast. Avoid avoid the so called buffet breakfast was terrible only went once as opted to go elsewhere. The staff are the rudest you will ever come across. The food was terrible. You are even expected to clear your own table.Would not recommend this hotel. Would not stay here again.

Probably the worst place we've ever stayed by far. No customer service other than tour information. Certainly no general knowledge of the area when asked to some staff. They advertised as featuring disability friendly i.e. personal disability lift as well as hydraulic chair lift for pool access. That's the only reason I booked this hotel and cost of course suited our budget and not too far to walk to beach with wheelchair, advertised as 3-4☆ on booking dot com. The lift worked once going down to street and never again during our stay nor did they bother to fix it or attempt to. The ramp out front stops at steps. Ramp in side says no prams or♿ disability. No wheel chair can get up or down the step to ramp that goes nowhere. I went for a swim in the pool which I thought I could manage to get in by myself, with aid of the handrail,however the top step,which looked achievable, certainly wasn't,which I unfortunately found out was way too steep and felt like it nearly ripped my leg off. The pain was excruciating. There was no signage to say' beware steep step'anywhere! After trying to ease the pain by swimming and moving about in the water. I needed to get out. I couldn't get out no matter how I tried and asked for the hydro lift to be available to staff in outside area. I asked if it worked,as I may need it. He told me "yes, it did".I asked for help. Eventually someone came,no communication to me whatsoever. Took out the battery after punching buttons. The battery didn't work. Three & half hours later(which in that amount of time caused eczema on my body and limbs from pool chemicals, i later found out)When i complained about the lack of communication to me or husband of what was going on,I was told battery needed to be 25% to work and it was only at 17%. All this time the battery still wasn't charged nor was there a spare. Throughout this period of time there was no communication from any of the staff. Only after I and my husband complained, to any staff walking by,and his, numerous visits to the service desk, to ask for assistance or at least some sort of communication,did the duty day manager finally appear. A Spanish guy I was told can't remember his name.His problem solving was ridiculous. No other staff assisted either. He preceded to tell me that they "never use the lift,maybe twice in 50 weeks". "That this was a...(he didn't finish the sentence)that there's other hotels like Trump Tower and high end ones down the road etc I could have stayed at". A full on discussion proceeded for about 15 minutes about the area and low sociological housing development etc taking place. That had nothing to do with me. After telling him i needed to get out and to get something for me to stand on as I couldn't get a leg up onto that top step as I injured my muscle when i got in. I told him to get a brick, so i could climb up to that top step. I'm 5'2" not 7'. He asked if i got in myself and i told him i had as it looked like a normal step. I tried to check, to feel but fell as the reflection was deceiving. He disappeared for a while and brought back a wooden crate. He said "will this do? Try it" Which I replied "you try it". He didn't but expected me to. I had get out with the help of my husband and him lifting me onto it, then out. A risk! I was scared. It was a flimsy pinewood, crate that if my footing was wrong i could have snapped the pinewood and gone straight through. I that told him there should be a signage. 6 days later the crate was still there on the side of pool. The hydraulic lift into the pool hadn't been fixed neither had the disability lift to carpark. Or any signage placed there. This could have happened to anyone. There are other steps built into the pool wall, that kids could manage but not too many adults could. Certainly not disabled or elderly. I swim for exercise as I cannot walk very well. Yet they still take money for disability false advertising. There were quite a few guests staying there that had assistance aids e.g. wheel chairs n walkers. The gym is non existent it's one piece of equipment in outside in open space n weather, next to dining area. 7 hours people waited on 27th September,2018 just to check into rooms due to early morning flight. No communication again. Breakfast,(don't even bother,go down the road,it was disgusting with rude miserable and disgusting service)advertised as all you can eat,you wouldn't want to unless your Asian as its designed for Asian palate. Scrambled eggs n noodles which looked like a bit of onion or cabbage nothing else,spongey pancakes every day. Stale bread,n day old cakes. Red cordial instead of fruit juice. The only thing descent is room cleaning service. Even the transfer man was lazy,didn't want to lift luggage let alone speak politely or smile. The rooms were as small as cupboards with mirrors on two walls like an FBI investigation room only twenty times smaller. Shocking place to stay!

Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki: I stayed for a week. the breaskfast sucked. No bottled water in the room. No tea in the room. It's an old hotel and it shows the carpet looks very old and the wall paper is falling off the wall. No set time when they cleaned the rooms. I would leave every morning at 7am and return around 1pm and my room still wasn't cleaned. I was out walking around, swiming and I want to rest/relax but I couldn't because I room was not ready.  The best thing about the hotel was the price, the people who worked there were very nice and the location for me... I didn't have to rent a car - everything I want to see and do was in walking distance.I would stay there again because of the price and location only.

We stayed here based on reviews. To start with when we checked in the front desk staff weren’t very friendly or welcoming. There was no offer to take our luggage to our room. When we checked there was no question to whether we had a good stay...very poor customer service. They also knew little about surrounding activities etc. The rooms were acceptable - the housekeeping staff were the best. The worst part of the whole experience was breakfast. The staff were rude and had no interaction with the customers. The food was good if you are Chinese of Japanese. On top of that they didn’t speak or understand English. I saw them being very rude to some of the patrons. Do yourself a favor don’t have breakfast there, walk down to the Cheeseburger $5.99 and have a great breakfast and exceptionally better customer service. The gym consisted of two pieces of equipment that were both out of order, and left out in the rain. Overall very poor experience.

This past August, my husband and I, celebrated our 30th Wedding Anniversary on the beautiful island of Oahu. We didn't want to spend all our funds on accomodations that we wouldn't be spending much time in, except to sleep, bathe and dress. The Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki, is a little dated, but for me cleanliness is more important than how modern the furniture is. We had a suite with a firm King bed with plush, high end linens. There were complimentary Hawaiian Tropic soaps and shampoo. Bath and shower were clean and well stocked with high end towels as well. So what may be lacking aestetically is made up for with these items of importance. The Aqua Aloha Surf has a pool, although world famous Waikiki beach is within walking distance. There is ample shopping, bars and food choices a few blocks away. Our favorite evening spots were the Maui Brewing Company and Tiki's Grill and Bar at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel(also within walking distance). The staff was very friendly and helpful whenever we had questions or needed assistance. I recommend the Aqua Aloha Surf and would definitely stay at this facility again.

We had 7 nights here and found it a very comfortable stay. Only 5 minutes from the beach and main shopping. Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms very clean and comfortable. A nice Cafe in the lobby with very friendly staff. Breakfast, although not run by the hotel, was very disappointing. Mainly Asian food apart from scrambled eggs and where was all the fresh fruit ??? We would certainly stay again but would not inc. breakfast.

Our hotel for staycation including breakfast. Like it cause it's a very lay back hotel. Kamaaina rates are ok could be better especially when it's slow with tourist locals can give back to our state. Wish there was a Jacuzzi. Otherwise overall is a great hotel.

We stayed at the Aqua Aloha Surf for 2 nights during a short stay in Waikiki. Check-In was a little complicated since first no one could find our reservation and when it turned up it was only for one night. Eventually things got sorted out though. Reception staff was not particularly friendly and always seemed a little annoyed whenever they were approached.The hotel itself appeared to be newly renovated for most parts and our room was very nice. A large comfortable bed, a nice sofa and big TV and a clean although rather small bathroom. Breakfast was rather underwhelming. It was served in a Chinese restaurant adjacent to the hotel and the selection was aimed at Asian guests/tourists. Not much of a choice when it comes to a continental breakfast. The pool was not spectacular but OK. All in all our stay was fine, but I don’t think I would stay there again.

Decent hotel for the price. It was a few blocks from the ocean and in a good area. We slept comfortable and the rooms were clean. The coffee shops was great. It was close to shopping and good. We enjoyed our time in Oahu.

Showing its age but staff friendly and very helpful.clean, No double glazing, louver windows every room so noisy, stayed in a bigger room on arrival to Hawaii for 1 night, and several weeks later was in a smaller room for 2 nights prior to departing.It is showing its age but Was ok for the price. and only a couple of blocks to the beach.The restaurant however is another world.Evening meals it is a feeding trough for bus after bus of Asian tourists, you find a table and sit to eat and a bus load arrives, seems like is on a time limit to eat then out before the next bus arrives.Breakfast ! well, the lady needs to go on a course for host responsibility.The "free" continental breakfast does not come anywhere near a continental breakfast as far as I have seen in many hotels around the globe.Normally a choice of cereals, Toast, butter, spreads for toast, fruits cheeses yoghurts etc etc BUT here there were only 1 cereal, milk watered down so much it looked more like dirty water, toast and butter only, and pancakes.And her attitude to patrons when asked about the breakfast, got a to the point rebuttal !So if you want cheaper accommodation close to the beach and don't mind a bit of noise, then spot on. but find somewhere else to eat.
user_name:
Wal W
Palmerston North, New Zealand

review_body: Ok I just got off the plane and arrived back in Australia. This place is a short walk to everything good, so location is ticked for those that have not been there. This is my third stay at the Aqua Aloha Surf. I like the place. It's older and has a comfortable feel about it. The check in staff are happy to see you, but don't jump the counter. When I checked out, the lady was pretty cold, but I wasn't after a hug. It's not the five star joint where they pretend we are family. I have some complaints on this trip that I'm not happy about. I did the 15th floor for three nights. Construction drilling at 8.30am on two of the mornings removed my relaxation and I was annoyed by it. Very loud drilling. I did call the counter to be informed by an indifferent male that construction would be from 8am to 4pm. I personally think they should do the loud stuff after 10am. The first day my shower water pressure didn't work and I couldn't shower. Annoying. I liked the cagey house keeper. She asks you if you want your room turned over. This is in the hope you decline. Not normal for hotels. She does it in a nice way. But read between the lines on that work ethic. And made the room up to an outstanding standard when asked to do it. So this trip Aqua Aloha Surf you only get a three star from me. In my two priors it would have been a five if I had rated. Don't be discouraged by my comments. Plus don;'t dare reply with something generic.

Great location in the heart of Waikiki. Perfect for a short-term stay. However, the breakfast was sub-par especially considering that you can get a healthy and delicious Acai bowl somewhere else for about the same price. My room on the 2nd floor was infested with cockroaches and I could only change to a higher floor room after paying the difference in room price per night for the better room...

We really enjoyed staying at Aqua Aloha. From the moment we walked we were welcomed by Hawaiian hospitality. The hotel is in a great location. The room was comfortable & had a great view. The breakfast was delicious.

We stayed here for 5 nights, the staff were very friendly and attentive..the best feature of this hotel. The pool n cabana were closed most days yellow tape across gate. The dining room for breakfast was insufficient we had to sit outside in reception area . The breakfast itself was disappointing not much choice only 2 cereals cut up oranges and apples and bread and pancakes however there was plenty of asian cuisine. Only are here once.Our room was tiny 5m x 3m had to keep moving cases to get around bed. No balcony only shutter Windows but only 2 opened. Air con is partially blocked by cupboard that TV sits on. Pot coffee in room we used on day 1 and its been sitting there ever since.Rooms are extremely noisy shutters don't block any noise sirens, doors banging ,neighbors if your a light sleeper bring ear plugs. Bathroom is old and tiny and although very clean there is no ventalation after toilet use.PositivesLocation is good close to beach and plenty of shoppingFront desk Staff are very friendly .

Got to the hotel at 6 or 7am and check in was 3pm. I had to leave my bags there at the counter which they accepted till checkin. I paid for my booking from home which included a breakfast amungst other things. There is a tax that you need to pay at check in.I asked that as i was checking that day and paying tax for that day could i have breakfast for that day...they said no as checkin was at 3pm. Very dissatisfied as Im paying tax for that day!In regard to check-in i was asked for $25 a night tax but remembered my paperwork stated $20 so check your paper work.The room was an ok size for 3 star but there were some issues. There is a sliding door to the balcony that doesnt lock with no fly screen. The aircon works but is a little noisy. I had troubles with my electric key and the light's at times.The one thing i really didnt like was the neighboring car park. Waikiki i found very safe but i didn't like people loitering around the car park at night.There is a pool but its small and not functioning for this period.The staff were on the main ok. There is a free shuttle to Ala Moana but you need to walk to another hotel my hotel forgot to mention or give me a ticket for the shuttle.Its 3 star and generally ok. If your on a budget and prices are cheap its ok.

OK if you just want to stay overnight and get out often. Breakfast was just horrible, no cheese, ham, tuna, salmon, whatever a Western country citizen would like to see on a sandwich. Instead there was a lot of Asian cuisine, which I don't like. Continental breakfast? Yes, Asia is a continent, too. In my room the air conditioning was placed right at my bedside - ridiculous, I couldn't do anything not to feel the cold breeze while sleeping, short of turning it off. I had a street-side apartment - it was very noisy up until 3 o'clock AM.

Hotel was not what we expected. The website does not match what you are making reservations for. Walls in rooms were dirty, main doors were dirty, bathtubs had major rust and other unknown substances on the faucet, one of our rooms smelled like cigarette smoke and there was a burn mark in one of the blankets. Also had a very bad experience with customer service during breakfast. Definitely not worth the money you spend on this hotel.

First of all - the name. It's like they threw a bunch of random Hawaiian-themed words together into something they though sounded good. Day 1 - we land at the airport and I call the hotel to ask (politely) if they have airport shuttle service. I was told they only offer service TO the airport and do not pick up. When I repeated this to the person on the phone to make sure I heard him correctly and he responded with "yes, that's what I just advised you." So we had to pay $15 each to a shuttle company to take us to the hotel. Something we didn't budget for. We get to the hotel and are told our room won't be ready for an hour, that we could stash our stuff, find some lunch and come back later. I was "hangry" at that point so that just wasn't acceptable to me. I muttered under my breath (loud enough for the girl at the desk (Fanny) to hear me that I was going to note that in my review on Trip Advisor. Miraculously, our room was instantly ready. Or should I Say our hole. It was clean, I will give it that- the first thing I do when I go to any hotel, doesn't matter how top notch, is check for mold, excessive dust, etc. Surprisingly I didn't find any in the obvious spots like the bathroom and refrigerator. The carpet is wearing thin, but no holes or anything noticeable. Then I started noticing little things like the tear in the wallpaper on one side of the bed, the chips in the paint in various spots around the bathroom, heavy rust on the A/C unit outside and filth underneath of it on the inside. There was also a random chair in the corner that was heavily stained with what looked like coffee. In the bathroom, the silver ring around the ceiling light above the tub/toilet is rusted and the towel bar is coming loose from the wall. The top of the safe in the closet is also mysteriously rusted when it's not exposed to the elements.I wanted to go relax in the pool after a long day of travel, but there was a notice posted that it would be closed each day until 4pm and be open until 10pm on certain days and normal openings on weekends. (this was Tuesday) due to construction on the outside of the building, but guests were welcome to use the pool around the block at their sister property the Aqua Bamboo by obtaining a pass at the front desk. Day 2 - we come downstairs for breakfast and the first thing I notice are various wild birds and pigeons hopping in and out of the room, and their "remnants" spattered on the floor. The attendant I'm not sure spoke English very well. She was barely able to get out "Good morning." Another guest walked in behind us and walked past her. She made some sort of noise to get the girl's attention and pointed to the little punch cards we were given for daily breakfast vouchers. She didn't speak English well enough to say "excuse me, do you have your ticket?" The guest is a far better person than I would be because I don't respond to grunts and gestures. It was extremely humid and the front part of the breakfast area was in sort of an open air area adjacent to the pool. On the coffee/juice station table, there was a juice dispenser that was some kind of sugary Koolaid style fruit punch. No fresh fruit juices. Next to that was a tray of bread next to a conveyor belt toaster and two big bowls of spreads - butter and cream cheese. Dairy products sitting out in the heat? Yeah that's safe. Walk into the next room that had permanent buffet stations set up. Again, no fresh fruit, bacon or anything a typical hotel continental breakfast would be. Now I understand there's a very large population of Asian tourists that come and expect their traditional foods, but have options for other guests as well. Not just unidentifiable items that smell worse than a wet diaper. Once breakfast is over, the place does convert to an Asian buffet restaurant supposedly. There was a selection of Hostess donuts out near the Koolaid dispenser and their flavor varied each day between chocolate, coconut and white powder and the bread changed every other day for toast from white to wheat. There were also random exercise equipment pieces sitting outside just randomly there.(expensive-looking equipment) I walked up to the front desk to ask about the nail salon that's in the corner and if I needed to make an appointment. I instantly recognized the voice as the condescending jerk that answered my call about the airport shuttle. I glanced at his nametag, but could not get a clear reading of it. It was something Hawaiian anyway - started with a K - heavy guy with spiky brown hair. I simply asked if I had to make an appointment and all he said was "they're closed right now" (well yes I can see that, the room is dark) and "we don't take her appointments" (well I didn't figure you did, I just asked a simple question). The neighborhood itself is sort of a slum. No problems, just unsightly. Fast forward ahead to our last day. We awoke to find the railing of our balcony wrapped with DANGER tape and a chunk missing out of the edge of it. It would have been nice to be notified ahead of time that this would be happening. The shuttle picked us up to take us to the airport. He crammed as many people in that van as he could get, it was like being in a clown car! We weren't told ahead of time there would be a cost (so we could budget ahead), until my husband asked how much. We were told $28. Neither of us had enough cash so we asked if he could take a card. He responded with a heavy sigh and eye roll and "give me the card." I will NEVER stay here again and never recommend this to anyone else. We stayed here through a travel company and they have been notified as well.

We booked this room based on price and location with the added bonus of breakfast.Upon arriving, the hotel looked nice enough. The room itself, not so nice. It was clean. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was in desperate need of work. Old and broken tiles. There is an AC unit but the only thing it did was make noise. One of our windows did not open. If you're menopausal, skip this place!Ah breakfast....they don't tell you they bring tour buses in for breakfast. They do. I saw at least three. And the food is not american fare. Yes, there are pancakes, toast but mostly geared for the tour buses. My husband put his plate down at a table, went back for coffee and came back to a table of people that had moved his plate. This actually happened.If you're looking for a luxury hotel, keep looking. This place is good for location only.

We stayed at this property as part of a package deal. It was in a good central location within walking distance of all there is to see in Waikiki. Our room was very small but clean. The air con kept the room cool but it was a bit of a struggle. Being at the front of the hotel the room was extremely noisy, but other guests reported their rooms to be quiet, so I guess it's the luck of the draw. The hotel was undergoing refurbishment so the pool was closed for our entire stay. Not sure if I would stay here again.

I travel overseas a lot and always come home to my beloved Islands and stay at the Aqua Aloha Surf Hotel. The staff always makes me feel like family and welcomes me home. I wouldn't stay anywhere else. Thank you Aqua Aloha Surf Hotel

There is potential for this review to become very long so I’ll break it down into short sections. Reception / staff We were surprised about the lack of hospitality from staff, right from the moment we arrived. Interactions with staff were cursory, verging on rude, and I don’t think a single one cracked a smile. Ever. Rooms The rooms are dated. On seeing the decor, my partner and I played a game - ‘when was this hotel last decorated?’. I said the 80s. She said early 90s. I think she was being generous. This hotel is shabby. There were holes in walls that had been patched and not repainted. The floor lamp - the main source of light in our room - was literally held together with blu-tak (see photo for evidence). It is the kind of place where you want to check the soft furnishings for bedbugs - we did. There weren’t any - it was clean enough. In fact the bed was very comfortable. Location Three blocks from the beach - a short walk, which is great. However the block that the hotel is in, that third block from the beach, is poorly-lit and dingy. I wouldn’t feel safe walking that final block alone at night. Breakfast Actually a joke. Like, seriously seriously bad. Bain maries of cold eggs, spam and a selection of asian dishes (noodles, vegetables etc). My partner thought she’d try a boiled egg - can’t go too wrong with that, right? Nope, there was a dead bug floating in amongst the eggs. There was bread and a toaster, with margarine but no other spreads on offer (one table nearby had brought their own jar of peanut butter to breakfast with them). Little pancakes (also cold) and one type of cereal - sugar coated. Avoid. Value This is the kind of place that should cost $50 a night. While the location is okay, for a relatively small investment you could stay somewhere much, much nicer. Overall verdict Avoid... unless you’re desperate.

I was booked into this hotel when I was on Oahu for work. As I've found with other properties in the Aqua chain, the rooms tend to be a bit dated and/or worn (but clean). What they do offer is a central Waikiki location at a bargain rate. The parking lot is small and fills up quickly. When I finished work for the day, I snagged a parking space and walked to my dinner destination. Drive out in the evening and the lot might be full when you return. Fortunately, there's loads of great dining within walking distance. They gave me a video rental card upon check in. A nice gesture I was too tired to bother with at the end of the day. As others have mentioned, the complimentary breakfast was not very good. I wish I hadn't bothered. FYI...it's in a Chinese restaurant hence some of the odd offerings. They would be better served doing a few items well rather than offering lots of items done poorly. The elevators were so slow, I gave up and used the stairs. Unfortunately, my stay coincided with a big Samoan sporting event. (Probably had something to do with the slow elevators.) The lobby was filled with teams during my stay rendering it unusable by anyone else. The staff were friendly but swamped.
user_name:
Nancy Z
Captain Cook, Hawaii, United States

review_body: PROS:Location - Brilliant location. Couple of minutes' walk to Waikiki beach, loads of shops, bars and restaurants.Room - Includes safe, fridge & microwave. Kept very clean by the friendly staff. Big bed, big TV and a Playstation. Breakfast - Nice selection of pancakes, toast, eggs, sausages, cakes, rice & noodles. Reception staff - Very helpful. We booked a superior room but the 1st room we got really wasn't up to standard (small, no view, no bath) but they moved us to a higher floor which was great.DVDs - They give you a card for free DVD rentals in the lobby which was a sweet touch. CONS:Car park - Charged $25 a night for this but often found there was no space due to work trucks. Didn't think it was right that they parked in the handicapped bay either. Building work - Extremely noisy building work on the hotel between 8am-4pm, Mon-Fri made it impossible to ever sleep in or spend much time in the room. Our travel agent didn't tell us about this & neither did the hotel staff until we asked. Safety - We only found out when checking out that we weren't meant to go on our balcony because they were all unstable (hence the building work). This was written on a tiny sign on the far side of the reception desk. We'd spent quite a bit of time on ours. Whoops!Air con - The loudest I've ever heard!

We did our research; checking out the reviews and Aloha Surf was our choice. If you are on a budget but want a good sleep--ask for the 15th floor--three walkable blocks from the beach, this is your place. Our room had AC, outside patio with table/chairs, beach mats, coffee maker (with filters), fridge, microwave....and, SPF 15 lotion. Large screen tv--which we never turned on. Open up Google Maps and plot the hotel and zoom out to see just how close you are to Alamo rental car (2 blocks) and great beachside foods and shopping

I stayed here for a couple of nights and I was surprised. I found the location to be ok, not too far from the beach but far away enough that it was quiet at night. I do have to say that the beds were in rough shape. Not comfy, but this affordable hotel makes up for that with its service, staff, and for their quiet rooms. I didn't hear a single guest during my stay... Thanks Aqua Aloha!

We stayed here our first and last nights on Oahu. The rooms were comfortable, clean and pleasant. I would stay here again, any time. So near Waikiki and all the other main beach areas that you can walk to most of them.

We stayed 3 weeks, no complaints. Waikiki area is noisy day and night. Higher floors are less noisy, Aloha has 15 floors. Japanese/America breakfast consisted of pancakes, eggs, toast, sausage, donuts, lomein, beans, tofu, etc. Washer/dryer in basement, Tuesday Manager’s reception, shuttle van to Ala Mona mall/Walmart area, walking distance to zoo, diamond head, lighthouse, aquarium, beach. Basically, a nice clean economical hotel. We would stay there again.

I have stayed at the Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki hotel 2 times and I had a great experience both times. I recommend this hotel because it is relatively low priced, has great customer service, and location is close to the beach!

Stayed here as part of our honeymoon to Hawaii. Greeted with a room upgrade and comp chocs and sparkling wine as a gesture to congratulate us on our wedding. We always felt well looked after, nothing too much trouble and all questions (no matter how silly) answered courteously. Good breakfast (fresh pancakes!!), easy to get towels/boogie board/lilo for beach, good WiFi, great coffee/water/newspapers provided daily and added bonus of free dvd rental for a lazy night in (hard going out every night for a week!!!). The Tuesday cocktail eve with management was a good end to our trip, yummy Wipe Outs and beautiful live ukulele music. Thankyou so much for your hospitality. 100% recommend.

This hotel is not in the very centre of Waikiki. It’s ok but the rooms are tired looking. It’s the favourite of the soccer groups. When we stayed there the hotel was full of soccer athletes from South Pacific. Front desk staff were very friendly and accommodating. They mocked up our booking inspite of our email and call before leaving home.We reserved for a twin room as I was travelling with my daughter. On the phone when we did the follow up call they said yes your room is ready. Upon checked in they told us our room is 1 queen bed. Both of us was devastated. The front desk staff tried to facify us by throwing in free breakfast and bottled water but we were not impressed at all. After a long flight this is the reception we got. Got no choice but to stay with them for few days.A day before we checked out we booked for a taxi to take us to the airport. The front desk staff and the concierce where so helpful.

Nice location. Lots of amenities available within walking distance. A short walk to the beach. ABC store just around the corner if you need anything, Restaurants nearby, Etc. Rooms are a little small, but that’s to be expected in Waikiki boutique hotels. There is parking available for hotel guests if you have a rental car.

We arrived at this hotel and on first impression it seemed the budget style hotel and so we didn't have great expectations. Our room had a strange smell like that of tobacco. We wanted to use the safe for our valuables but when we opened it there was mouldy ginger. Yes, you read that right mouldy ginger. We reported this to reception at the same time we had to get our key reprogrammed as it had stopped working. At the time of reporting this, a young and obviously distressed woman walked into reception shouting at no one. While the receptionist assured us he would send someone to our room to remove the mouldy ginger, he turned to us and said, “don't worry about her she's schizophrenic and lives in the building”. Clearly sympathetic of those with mental health problems. He turned to his colleague and asked him to “call the cops”, perhaps some way of reassuring us.The breakfast was the strangest I'd ever seen. Chicken chow mein, cabbage and kidney beans was part of the selection. There were pancakes, some cereals and porridge oats floating in milk as well as the standard tea and coffee in polystyrene cups. It was nice to be visited by the resident pigeon during our first morning.Despite asking reception three times to remove the ginger, it was never removed. We simply closed and locked the safe to avoid the smell. The hotel is in a good location, however, the noise is very bad which I guess is to be expected. You have to choose between the racket of the old air conditioning unit or outside. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for light sleepers.All in all, this hotel is recommended to those with a good sense of humour. If this would cause you stress (as it did to a family member we were travelling with) then this is not the hotel for you. This is clearly a budget hotel and therefore expectations must remain low.

We stayed at this hotel in over the New year period between 2017-2018. The staff were lovely and very helpful. We arrived early in the morning (8am) from the airport and were able to store our bags in the storeroom until our room was ready - which the staff arranged to be earlier than the expected 2pm! We took advantage of the international date line 'do-over day' and went to Ala Moana shopping centre to pass away the morning. Staff explained local buses and shuttle options.The first room we were allocated was an ok size, had a decent bathroom, windows that opened, A/C...etc. There was a bit of a problem with the A/C after the first night. I spoke the staff and they simply asked me to pack up all our gear and they would move us to a different room, while we were out for the day. So so helpful. The next room we got was brilliant. Bigger, quieter A/C, balcony, ensuite...etc. Felt very grateful that the staff sorted out the issue so promptly, and without any fuss.Breakfast and WIFI (in the room and in the public hotel spaces) was all included in the price. The breakfast wasn't too fancy, but there was the usual toast, cereal, eggs and coffee (plus many Asian inspired dishes as well). This hotel also had a private pool, and a small outdoor gym area.Location-wise, this hotel is closer to the canal than the beach - but its only a short 5 minute walk to Waikiki Beach (about 2 blocks), and all that shopping/eating that happens in the Waikiki "hub". In fact, I could argue that it was better to be a little away from all the busy hustle and bustle of the main very touristy Waikiki Beach strip!!!It was pretty quiet location - even on the balcony - and certainly in the hotel, you couldn't hear your neighbours, or the lifts going..etc. I think there was one night where you could hear some people larking about in the street (but it was New Years Eve - so that is only to be expected!).There were a fair few amenities close by as well - a Food Pantry (grocery store), Alamo car rental place, fast food and other restaurants..as well as the obligatory ABC shops! So I would have to say the location, while not right on the beach, was really great.Overall, this hotel is not bright and shiny/ brand new - but it is very comfortable, well-appointed, good facilities and great staff. I would stay here again.

Lovely place a short walk away from the beach, modernly decorates, nice and clean rooms, the bed was very comfy. I have had my nails done in the salon in the lobby area, I would definitely recommend Momo to anyone, she’s very nice and creative and works quick like a dream. Highly recommend it. We will definitely stay there again.The reception staff is very nice, friendly and helpful.

Could not close the strange windows,so the street noise kept us awake. Some kind of lever seemed to be missing.Staff was friendly. Be aware of the extra costs they charge you. Our rooms were booked bij a travel agency.Seeming a reasonable priced hotel.Paid for in advance. Still we had to pay extra parking for the rental car and obligatory amenity fee . For 3 days, room 2 persons this was 137,82 dollars extra!Only book this hotel if you have no other options left.

The rooms were smaller than advertised and had very out dated, inefficient and noisy air conditioning units which was annoying as they were definitely needed. The communal areas were excellent with a restaurant on site, pleasant sitting areas and an excellent concierge service

when we arrived at midnight at our Hotel one of the elevators did not work that leaves only one that did work the whole time that we stayed there one week ! So that was one of the things bad # 2 was the rooms really need a up grade the bathroom floors the tile is coming off towel rack is very loose the sliding bathroom door was broken the room safe was so rusty when you open it that everyone in the room would wake up ! So over all we will never come back to this hotel ever again . Please read this Review if you don"t want to be ripped off ?

I booked for this hotel on Dec 13th at 5pm. Date of Checkin was Dec 29th. Due to family emergency i requested a cancel within 12hours of booking (less than 24hours). Still 15 days before travel. The hotel didn't refund any of my money $1500 was total cost of hotel. They completely kept my entire money. BE AWARE: All other hotels have full cancellation service (for any event) before 7 days or even 15 days. This shows this hotel is not making money. BE AWARE when booking for this hotel.
