You'll get good 3 star hotel of same price in same block. Do not book until you really have no options left.

Accommodation is close to everything!! The room was clean and neat. Breakfast could be improved but better than the reviews I read before I went. Tour desk not helpful with basic info unless you are booking tours. Staff were polite.Great value for money and yes I would stay here again :)

It is quite cheap hotel comparing to others in Waikiki. A free coffee and tea in lobby. Breakfast for free, wide choice. Rooms are great, clean, well equipped. Walking distance to Waikiki Beach. Beach towels are provided at the reception.

I'm not sure what others experience was, but for the money I thought this was a very good value. I had a huge room with a balcony on the 12th floor. The breakfast had a variety of east and western foods... It was decent. The bed is amazing... to me that's the most important thing. The only setback was that one of the two elevators was out of service, but they were doing repairs. It wasn't like it was just shut down.I would recommend this hotel. Higher floors have a nice view, cool breeze, and a balcony.

Fast check in, was offered free upgrade to upper floor with balcony without being asked. Room was clean and comfortable all around except for the shower which could use a good scrub. Only one elevator was in service but still manageable. Excellent location. Front desk service was top notch. Continental breakfast was good but they must keep the pigeons out of the dinning area. I would stay there again.

The Aloha Surf is a nice lower price hotel set among all the expensive hotels. Location was great and an average but nice room for the price in Waikiki. It's conveniently located next to the only grocery store in Waikiki and only 3 blocks from famous Waikiki Beach.If you want to experience Hawaii, but don't think you can afford it, this is the place to stay.

We splurged for a top floor room and loved it. Nothing fancy, but very clean and comfortable. Staff were consistently cheerful and helpful. We received an incredibly warm welcome at arrival, friendly daily maid service, and a breakfast buffet that provided choices like fresh pancakes, fresh fruit, scrambled and hard boiled eggs, a variety of vegetables, oatmeal and cream of wheat, toast and sweet cakes. We especially enjoyed the complimentary Tuesday 'Wipe Out' hour of cocktails and socializing to the sounds of a local musician. Thank you to Aqua Aloha Surf for making our stay so enjoyable!

I have spent a week there with my fiancé, his parents and my mum (so 3 rooms in total). We paid the same price but had completely different experiences. My mum had a very small room with direct view on a roof. My fiancé's parents had a better room but it was apparently very noisy. Both rooms were on the 2nd floor. My fiancé and I had a room on the 12th floor and it was great, we even had a partial view on the ocean and on diamond head. The hotel is ideally located however I am unsure I would stay there again as the room allocation is a bit of a gamble. Also the quality of the breakfast was poor so we preferred to pay a bit more and have something we would actually enjoy somewhere else.

This hotel is well located but the disappoint came in the rooms. They are very small and ours looked straight into another building balcony. I can say though the room was clean and serviced daily. The breakfast was nothing less than disgusting and definitely not suited to international tourists. I was disappointed that we paid the resort fee and we ended up having to buy supplies for our breakfast. The restaurant appeared dirty and the food was absolutely disgusting. Black eggs floating in water, cabbage and bread with no spreads just to mention a few things. They definitely need to offer something more edible even it was just pastries and decent juice. So disappointing and would not recommend this hotel to others.

Excellent Location however incredibly noisy... street noise and paper thin walls. Earplugs are a must for a good nights sleep. Rooms are tired, rusty mirror in bathroom, rusty brackets around bathroom light. Water damage in the bathroom under sink cupboard. Shower Temp not consistent. Aircon sounds like a 50cc Moped but at least its cold. On the first night i spotted bugs crawling in the bathroom. Only 2 positives Bed is comfy and location is perfect. Daily Fee has gone up to $25. Part of this fee includes a Daily Breakfast as the restaurant down stairs which is of Asian Cuisine not your simple continental breaky. For myself being Fructose, Lactose and Gluten Intolerant I was not impressed that I have to pay for these meals and cannot eat anything they provide. Very cheeky way for them to make money. Not worth the price at all. Will not be returning to this hotel.

I chose this hotel for its location and did not expect much for the price. However you need to expect the following, if you check in earlier there are no facilities. Facilities such as pay for an early check in, or as I doubt the hotel was 100% full there must be an empty room somewhere, so we waited for 3 hours to check in. After a 10 hour (no sleep flight due to turbulence) we tried to cope by resting by the pool. I tried to make use of this time by asking for the Pearl Harbour tickets I had booked directly with the hotel, I had called directly to make the reservation so would assume that they would put me on to THEIR concierge. When I learned that the tickets were not there and they tied to tell me that I had not made the reservation, I thought lucky I had brought the contact numbers with me, it turns out the concierge I had been forwarded on to was at a completely different hotel? How does that happen? Also the concierge at this hotel was not helpful at all in helping me beyond loaning me the phone. So with this disappointment I noticed during our wait I counted the growing number of people also in our situation (24) all with their luggage in the lobby. I had assumed (incorrectly) that the reservation clerk would serve us first (first arrival etc) when our room became available but as I listened to the multiple complaints of fellow travellers - just knew there was no chance. I also note with interest the exercise equipment that was outside and rusted (not sure if there was a room elsewhere) When we finally got to our room, it was on the second floor that overlooked the filthy roof of the lobby entrance. My first concern was security - the windows are louvered (the kind that can be easily removed and there weren't winders on all the windows so could not shut one of the windows). The room itself smelled bad, and the hotel safe was a remnant of the 60's - keyed and rusty. We were so tired we tried to sleep straight away (beds looked clean) but woke up 2 hours later due to the noise. The traffic is so noisy, so if you aren't a fan you might want to consider this. We also woke up with the heat, so tried to get the air conditioner going (note I said tried). The final straw for us was, a group of very loud party of women returning home at 11pm who were booked next door to us and kept up the chatter and laughter. So I made the decision to walk to the Hilton Garden View in the next street for availability. Upon check out the lady at reception wanted to know why we were cancelling. She said we should have complained about the noise and she would send security to check on it. It was interesting to note that the whole time we spent moving hotels, the security guard had not move from his spot. I was charged for the use of the room (fair enough we had used it ) but I can tell you the change to the Hilton Garden View was SO MUCH WORTH IT!. They were so friendlier, nicer and put us in a quiet spot and when I explained the mess with the Pearl Harbour tickets, they contacted Roberts Hawaii Tours and straightened it all out.

Loved our stay. Bright, modern style furnishings. Friendly staff. Rooms cleaned daily. Eco-friendly. Close to everything in waikiki. Good accommodations for couples, families, or individuals. Comes with buffet breakfast, ok but not traditional continental breakfast items.

We had booked this hotel through a vacation package, it was the lowest priced option available so I went with low expectations. We were in room 1112, front of building facing the street. There was some street noise but not enough that it interrupted our sleep. The view was nice, the canal on one side and the busy streets of Honolulu on the other. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was sufficient, definitely could use some updating.The free coffee and water station in the lobby was appreciated. We checked out the breakfast one morning but found it not to our taste. Lots of places to eat in the area.I would recommend this hotel.

We just stayed 15 nights, we had a superior room. I was hesitant booking because of the cheap price and previous reviews and photos, I had read and seen. - I saved $1500 staying here rather than another hotel I had booked prior. I was pleasantly surprised, the hotel is older but clean and exactly what we needed. A 5 minute stroll to the beach. It is currently under renovation however we were not disturbed. Staff were great and always happy to help. The free buffet breakfast consists of toast, pancakes, eggs, sausages, steamed veggies, fried rice and noodles. We were happy to have toast. My only complaint is that the breakfast hours are rather short (7-9am) could be extended for late risers. We had a wonderful time and would gladly stay again.

We recently stayed for 3 days. The Hotel rooms were average, the breakfast was inedible.The staff were quite abrupt and not helpful at all. The concierge lady (Caroline) who did not work for the hotel was wonderful and helped us out a lot.Arriving at 7 a.m. and not being able to get into a room till 3pm was outrageous. The Hotel was not full, surely a room could have been made available earlier.I would not recommend this hotel at all

Overview: average to good quality hotel for travellers on a budget. Aqua Aloah Surf Waikikki is located about 10 minutes walk from the famous Waikiki beach. Most of the staff are friendly and helpful. The open plan lobby area is spacious with plenty of comfortable seating for guests and their visitors. The free coffee and the water fountain are a nice touch of hospitality. The pool is small, but we did not use it, so unable to comment. The room we were allocated was smallish and without windows that fully open. (See photo).The furnishings -especially in the bathroom looked a little tired in need of upgrade sometime in the future. The room would also benefit from a chair to sit on. This said, the in room amenities were good, clean and everything worked as expected. The beds were comfortable. Breakfast is provided by a Chinese family possibly subcontracted by the hotel, and caters for Chinese and Polynesian guests rather than Europeans. There are 2 cereals: Cornflakes and Cherios. The milk for it is so diluted, you can see through it. The coffee was good, though, so was the scrambled eggs.There are no crusty breadrolls, just sliced bread for toast. If you like cold sliced meats or cheese, jam or honey, you will be disappointed. We bought our own.There are no waiting staff in the breakfast room, everything is self service and you are asked to clear your own tables (YMCA style). Just glad we didn't have to do the dishes.Pigeons roam freely and unchallenged around the buffet table. (See photo).Would I stay here again? Maybe- but in a room other than the second floor and with a balcony. Or I might save up a bit more and go for a more modern hotel on Waikiki beach.

Stayed here for six nights had a superior room which was ok on the sixth floor so no view except people living opposite! The main complaint was the air conditioning a small unit which was totally unsuitable for the size of the room it was too hot to sleep and all the time we spent in room we were uncomfortable.We only went for the free breakfast once not very nice mostly catered for Chinese cuisine. The hotel pool was extremely small three people and it was full!! It was a good location and we did enjoy the beauty of Hawaii but if returned would not return to this hotel it was disappointing.

I stayed in this hotel while attending a conference. I was sleeping on a sofa bed because I was sharing the room. I must say it was not the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. Breakfast was pretty disappointing. In the end the hotel is ok but nothing special.

We stayed here in sept 2017. Service was nice, they assisted on the couple of minimal times we asked for something. Relaxed environment. Pool is certainly not adequate, it’s more like a spa in size but with beaches only two blocks away who needed a pool! Activities desk gentleman was no help, very disinterested in his job, disappointing reallyNo bar open while we visited, maybe they open seasonal?? The breakfast buffet was very very basic, could do with an overhaul. Even going so far as having a sign asking guests to clear away all plates cutlery....safe to say we only ate here the once and never went back. Rooms are sufficient, tired but you don’t spend long in your room, only used to sleepHotel location was walking distance to everything we needed Laundry was defiantly not usabale, but there is a laundromat within 2min walk that was perfect to use instead

Location was very good, we had read a lot of reviews on how bad breakfast was going to be, it didn't disappoint, just give me a normal nice American breakfast and IM very happy, awful is being to kind, I really hope the management staff can really go over these reviews and do some changes rather than just thanking us for voicing are concern. The staff was very nice, and I would stay here again, just make sure to eat breakfast out.

We were booked to stay for 4 nights after travelling Route 66.They first put us (four fairly large guys )in two rooms with double beds !!We were eventually moved to rooms with two single beds but room was so small we could hardly get our cases in.Stayed one terrible sleepless night and left in the morning.If this is your only option, get arrested and spend the night in jail you'll have a better sleep !!!

Location is excellent. Walking distance from the main street in Waikiki plenty of restaurants and shops and close to the beach. I don't think it's worth the price. We only used the hotel to sleep for 3 nights. Rooms were not spacious and it was outdated. Breakfast was included but was not so good. I think it was pricey considering what you get. Was not very well maintained and they charge $25 for parking fee. It's a lot. You can park for free if you find a spot on Ala Wai Blvd but if you can't find a spot there it's hard to park. And if you do find a spot you have to take the car out in the morning on week days (always read the parking signs!). I'd not stay again here...
user_name:
jesica00
New York City, New York

review_body: Fanny, Diana & Kalei are always so helpful. Diana is always so wonderful when we are checking in, her customer service is amazing & she is great at multi tasking & keeping customers satisfied. Fanny helped me find something last minute. Kalei is the last face we see when checking out & he always has such a great attitude & is genuine when he says come back which makes us always return. It's perfect to get away for the weekend & very family oriented & they always go above & beyond to accommodate your needs. The rooms are always clean & it's a perfect location from the beach, nightlife & food pantry. The price of the rooms aren't to bad either.

Although it's significantly before my time, think Hawaii Five-O. Everything about the hotel: decor, furnishing, bathroom and shower, lifts, foyer is 1970s - don't expect the niceties of a Shangri-La. Having stated this, the staff work hard to keep the place tidy. Other things I disliked about the hotel were: 1) The beds - they sink in and are really uncomfortable. I stayed 10 nights and upgraded rooms (to a superior) half way; the beds were terrible in both rooms. I had back pains in the night and couldn't get a good night sleep. 2) The breakfast wasn't very nice, oily noodles, soggy eggs, etc. The breakfast choice doesn't change, so after a few mornings, it becomes very tedious. 3) The pool is more like a big bath tub, not even children bother to use it. Not sure why it's there to be honest. The hotel is well located, 3mins walk from Waikiki beach and close to a main bus route from which you can get access to busses to all over the island (although it's better to have access to car). The staff at reception are very helpful and the hotel is clean.

We were on our honeymoon and was given room 1200This is right behind the elevator-shaft = so you hear the elevator-cars rumbling by every day and also at night.But my wife kinda liked the view so we stayed in that room.There is NO shelf or a suitcase-stand / luggage-rack. There is only a tiny closet with some hangers and a cupboard under the TV.So we literally have to live out of our suitcases on the floor.And in the bathroom there is really no space to put on your toiletry = horrible! (see pictures)They charge $ 25.00 for parking per night at the hotel-garage (which is not much for Honululu), IF you are able to get a parking-space. So park first and pay immediately after that at the front-desk.We didn't like the breakfast = the breakfast-room is not very clean and if you are eating outside there will be birds and nobody scare them away.The variety is not very wide = it's breakfast with a touch of asia...

The purpose of our visit was to see Oahu and not to spend time in our room. So, we didn't mind going super budget in order to save money for the more important things. So, for a bed to sleep on and a shower it was perfect. We attended breakfast only on one morning but unless you are keen on stepping outside the comfort zone and trying an asian style buffet (did not look at all appealing) then you're better off eating elsewhere.The fire alarm was set off one night around midnight and the staff's communication as to what the problem was, was very poor. We were sent back to our rooms with no explanation just hopes and dreams that there was no threat. That was comforting..(not). I asked reception to check with housekeeping for an item we had that seemed to vanish and there was absolutely no follow up. It could very well have been our own fault but a follow up would have been nice.Rooms seemed clean enough.Over all, if you're after budget accom - its suitable but just keep your expectations low and you won't be disappointed.

A nice standard room. Any higher than 2nd floor and you get a balcony. We were on the 2nd floor and only got a view from the adjacent hotel. Our king size bed cane with the usual closet space,safe, ironing board. Small shower but adequate. The room had a fridge, TV and a PS3. I kid you notYou can rent DVDs and Games at no additional cost. The beach towels are also included, you just collect them from front desk and swap them for the cards they give you when checking in. You can take them anywhere you like. Just not home. Breakfast is a little different than I expected. Scrambled eggs and hard boiled eggs with toast, coffee and cereal were available along with Chinese meals. Veg, noodles, dumplings and rice. There is a coin operated laundry downstairs in the basement. Quarters are needed and are available at the front desk which is where the soap is and $1.25 for the wash and the same for the drying. Each cycle is around 40mins. If you are not around when the cycle finishes be prepared to find your clothes on the side. The only thing that I was a little shocked was the price of the cleaning tax. $18 a night is expensive. The hotel is literally 6mins from Waikiki Beach and 8mins to the main shopping area. Tesla, Apple, Dior, Rolex and other high end shops adorn the streets. It gets very busy from 8pmDon’t forget you are in Waikiki and eating out can be expensive depending where you go. The usual fast food restaurants are average price for cheap eats.

Good value hotel, about 3 blocks from the beach, my room had a view of the water and mountains and canal on the other side.Large rooms, hotel is a little dated but it's clean and comfortable, friendly staff, there is a pool but I never used it, they have a laundry in the basement, just ask reception for the code, they can also give you detergent for $1 and change for quarters to use.There's plenty of stores nearby to stock up, ABC and Food Pantry are just around the corner, there is also a stop for The Bus, which can take you anywhere on Oahu at the end of the street, good for a visit to Ala Moana shopping mall and Diamond head.

We have visited this lovely island several times and usually stay along in Nahua. Unable to book it this year we decided to choose this hotel as we know the area and that it's 10 minutes walk from the beach and central to all amenities in Waikki. We arrived at 10.30pm after traveling 25 hours to a warm reception from the receptionist and an ungrade as we were staying 20 nights. The lobby was very welcoming and nicely decorated.Our room was freshly decorated and very clean. Our lay/balcony had lovely sea views and city view as we were 15 floors up. During our stay I found the staff busy and very pleasant maintaining the apartments and always happy to help. You can borrow towels/chairs/ swimming equipment from reception which was a great bonus. We were able to rent out films for free if we decided to have a night in. The managers special was his own cocktail and lovely Hawaiian music, very informal which we liked. The laundry service was a blessing as we were staying so long, $2.25 for a was and a dollar to dry,you share the two machines with the residents so up early is advisable. My only three complaints,two of which the hotel can do nothing about is that the road is very noisy,it's a two way road and you also have the traffic along the canal,even up at 15 floors we could hear everything. The hotel across the road has a bar that's open till 3am and as there are no window you can hear everything. Not music,just very load talking! The last one is the breakfast, it's different. A selection of pancakes/ bread/cakes/ spiced onions/fried rice/chow mien/ porridge. I'm a boring eater so toast and porridge suited me for a while but a bit of rotation would be good and also food labelled as I'm a vegetarian and had no idea what some of the food was. Toward the end of the holiday we tended to eat out for breakfast,maybe because we had stayed so long it just got boring and if we went down at 8.30 it seemed to be the leftovers and the stale bread not replenished etc!! Over all a great stay and hope to return next year.

No frills. A get what you pay for kinda place. Staff was friendly and rooms were clean. Breakfast was kind of Asian inspired. The eggs were terrible so we stuck to the staples. Pancakes, corn and rice. You can get cheap drinks at the hotel bar and talk to a lot of locals. Bartender very friendly.

Good size able to swing a cat and more microwave close to popular locations staff very obliging. Large range of food for breakfast catering for nationalities. Could have gone for another hour finished at 9am . 10am would be better for the late rises. Staff most helpful for arranging tours

My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights and have no complaints. Although the hotel may appear a little old, rooms were clean, cozy, and very comfortable. Everyone - from the front desk staff to housekeeping - was always nice, pleasant, and extremely helpful. There's a PS3 in the room if you have children who play games or you can use it to watch DVDs, both of which you can "rent" in the lobby for free. Complimentary continental breakfast offered daily was okay, but we opted to venture out and see what Hawaii had to offer on some days. The hotel is located about 3 blocks from the beach and within walking distance from many shopping centers, restaurants, and the city bus system. It's even close enough to walk to the "local side" of Waikiki to eat some local food at local prices. The hotel offers guests free wi-fi in the rooms and lobby area, and there is a bar in the lobby for those who wish to grab a cold one. Laundry room is in the basement and available to all guests from 6am to 10pm. The bed was super comfortable. We stayed on the 14th floor and there was always a breeze on the patio; so sitting outside on the patio enjoying the warm sun and cool breezes were a plus for us. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone needing a nice, comfortable room without wanting to pay the high prices of the 5 star hotels on the beach. Well done, Aqua Aloha Surf...you helped to make our stay enjoyable! Mahalo!

My stay at the Aqua Aloha Surf was extremely pleasant and stress free! The staff were all friendly and helpful; the location was only a short stroll away from the main Waikiki strip which was perfect, because you're just far enough away from the crowds and noise. This hotel is not luxury, however it provides you with all the basic essentials if you are an easily pleased traveller. The pool and breakfast facilities weren't excellent, my partner and I much preferred to get breakfast out and do all our swimming at the beach, however once again it is sufficient enough for the easily pleased traveller. The also have a bar and laundry facilities which came in handy.I would highly recommend this hotel and will be choosing to stay here on my future travels to Hawaii

I was impressed walking into the open breezy lobby! Fortunate for me, I was upgraded to a suite on the 6th floor- the view of the city was phenomenal! I was even able to view the ocean in the distance. The interior of the room was obviously older (ie: walls, bathroom tiles, shower, ACs, etc) but everything was clean and cozy! I loved that the room had the louvre windows to let the breeze blow through. It was such a comfortable stay- and the beach and shops are all within walking distance. I had no disturbances during my stay and the front desk staff were all so friendly and kind. The continental breakfast was interesting with fried rice, noodles, and kimchee on the buffet- but it was all a pleasant surprise and tasty! I would definitely recommend this place and stay again should I return to Hawaii!

Good location,close to everything including the beach shops and restaurants.Avoid the standard rooms,too small and very noisy. We paid for an upgrade to a deluxe and was done promptly. Much more spacious with sofa,balcony with pleasant views to the ranges and the golf course, Also had a sink,microwave refrigerator and facilities to prepare a snack or have take away.Has a bar for drinks and a small pool.The breakfast is rather basic and mainly Asian dishes. The pancakes were fabulous.Also the coffee was very good.Has office to book tours and the staff is very informative and very helpful.There is a canal very close which has an excellent walking/running track,You can park there your car for free but a bit of advice here.Mondays and Fridays is no standing between 8:30 and 11:30. We happened to walk there on a Friday morning and 8:30 exactly three police cars and four or five tow tracks cleaned the parked cars there within minutes.So take care of the time.Overall we had a pleasant stay and recommend this hotel if you are not looking for luxury and if you don't mine to walk a few hundred meters to the beach.

The Aqua Aloha Surf has nice helpful front office staff, a good bar where locals hang out and pleasant, efficient housekeeping staff. The location is great, two blocks from the beach, and all the restaurants and shopping you could want. BUT, and it's a big but, this hotel needs some major updating. The front office was nice enough to upgrade us to a mini suite (at a $10 a day extra charge, of course) when the first room they gave us only had one bed when we requested two, but the room had definitely seen better days. Plaster patches on the wall over wallpaper, cruddy shower tile and a toilet tank cover that was mismatched. And the a/c went out later in the week and was replaced but they really jerry rigged it to get it to fit the space. We had a nice view of the canal from the 11th floor, but the boarded up apt next door was a turn off and so was the creepy, dirty empty lot next door.The pool was tiny, tiny, and the breakfast (included) was not great so we didn't eat there. The resort fee is too much for this hotel, and the parking fee is too high, with limited spaces.I gave the hotel 3 stars for the nice staff and location but I doubt if I would stay here again.

Have stayed in several budget hotels around Waikiki. This is one of the better ones. The room was standard with a small balcony and a view of the Ala Wai Canal and other high-rises. The decor is a little dated but in fairly good condition. It was clean and had a small fridge, microwave and coffee maker. They provide the standard hotel coffee, but we brought our own. The coffee maker was a Mr. Coffee 4 cup that uses Melita #2 filters if you're interested. We were on the 6th floor, so with the door open you could hear the traffic. We kept the AC on all night which was enough to drown out any other noise. The free Wifi worked great in the room. Parking is $25 per day, which is about the same as everyone else. They provide beach towels and chairs, but we didn't use them. There is a tiny pool, which was very clean, but no hot tub. They do add on an "amenity charge" for the free breakfast and beach towels, even if you don't use them. We didn't have the breakfast, so I can't vouch for that. Staff was friendly and helpful. Hotel is 3 blocks from Waikiki Beach with plenty of restaurants and a grocery store nearby. Would probably stay here again.

I traveled to Honolulu with my husband and my sister...the hotel location was great, close to everything that we needed...we didn't like the Asian food for breakfast, should have more option for regular continental breakfast..and also, some of the dishes were dirty with old food stucked on it...but the best part of being there was all the help we had from Kalei, in front desk... he helped us with our accommodation and gave us lots of information about the touristic sites and how to get there...he was awesome...thanks Kalei for your attention...

Less than five minute walk from beach which was wonderful and included an Asian continental breakfast at restaurant in the hotel. Stayed in room 306 and room was smaller than several Asian and European rooms I have stayed in. The room also had peeling paint and some rusted towel fixtures that were in the bathroom. Booked it last minute for one night and if had to, would do again but not for more than one night stays. Wonderful location to shops and beaches but the hotel itself is not more than a one to two star stretch of a hotel.

Very disappointed in the venue. I didn't expect 5 stars but being non Asian is a disadvantage in the dining room for breakfast. We stayed on the 15th floor but were kept awake each night by the 4am close open air bar across the street. The noise was so loud you would think we were in the floor above the bar. The louvred windows do little to keep the noise out.

I enjoyed my solo trip .Where I went shopping and also did Historical things like visit Perl Harbors.I did the chopper ride which was fun.Arrived on Thanksgiving so for a NZ it was interested to see all the great Parades.The prawns were just beautiful to eat also.

Stayed May 6 for one night in one of their remodeled rooms. Very nice room and amenities. Fridge, microwave, coffee maker, dishes, etc,. and very nice toiletries and shower in the bathroom. Very comfortable bed. Breakfast was okay, plenty to eat and the coffee was good. Juice could be improved as it was drink mix not real juice. Short walk to beach. All in all a great place to stay.

Just spent a week in beautiful downtown location, and central to everything. Included full buffet breakfast, so great way to load up before your busy day. Nice view from our lanai, out over the Ali Wai Canal in one direction, and down to Waikiki beach in the other. Staff were great & quick to provide service, from the front desk, down to the cleaning and wait staff. Beach toys, chairs, and towels also included too. Would stay again.

Stayed at the hotel for 4 days as part of a multi city trip. Disappointed...rooms are outdated and dont expect a garden view, if your booking states it. All you get is the view of apartments.When it comes to the breakfast, dont except a wide variety. It will suit you if you are from Japan. Location is good....only a 5-10 in walk to centre of town.Will not be visiting again

I have been coming to this hotel for several years because I am very happy here. I was upgraded to a small suite upon arrival, which I thought was really nice. The rooms are comfortable and clean. Like that there is a decent sized fridge and microwave for my to make my own snacks. Their breakfast has also really improved over the years. Pancakes, scrambled, eggs, fruit, coffee, juice, pastries, and rice and Asian specialties for their Asian clientele. Always enjoy the Tuesday afternoon Blue Hawaiian drinks in the lobby prepared by the manager and the wonderful music. This hotel really treats you like family. Mahalo for everything.

I've been to quite a few hotels and various ones Aqua ones but I must say this hotel tops it and is affordable. Diana G. checked us in & accommodated us through out our stay. She is very good at what she does. Excellent customer service and represents the aloha spirit to the fullest. She made our stay very welcoming and makes us want to return. The hotel is perfect location for us because it's right next to the grocery store, beach right down the road and perfect location if you like the night life too. We definitely will be back to stay. Thank you Aqua Aloha Surf for an awesome stay.

Queen bed room on 8th floor. Bathroom facilities a bit worn but otherwise room spotlessly clean and with a neat little kitchenette, which came in very handy for doing our own breakfast as the continental provided by the Asian restaurant on site was simply dreadful. Very easy walk to the local supermarket and the beach. Would go back to this hotel for sure.
user_name:
Jenny P
Albury, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: My husband and I stayed 18-25April17 in Unit 1210, a "Moderate Room with Lanai'. The room served its purpose. We had a queen bed (requested King, but not available, supposedly - tried to get us to upgrade to get a king-nope), corner room overlooking the Alai Wai Canal and a bit of an oceanview from afar. Great location, 3 blocks from beach access. Plenty of restaurants, shops close by. The USD18 plus tax resort fee per day includes wifi, beach chairs, umbrellas, breakfast and some other things. Folks rip the breakfast but we did not mind it - there was enough to chose from to start our day and it meant we did not have to get ready and go hunting for a place for breakfast and the price was right as Waikiki is not cheap by any means! We liked the purified water station in the lobby and would fill up our water bottles to take to the beach and back to our room daily.There was a coffee maker with coffee provided, a microwave and mini fridge - all nice to have and we used them. A/C was off when we entered the room so it was stuffy but did not take too long to start to cool down and we kept it on throughout our stay. One time when we returned to our room, housekeeping has turned it off and so it took another while to cool down the room. Housekeeping did a good job until our last couple days - we never got clean sheets during our stay and our bed was made up rather messily and looked shoddy, like a 5 year old was trying to make the bed. Seriously, little things like that go a long way in guest satisfaction! I emailed Tim Clark, the GM, before we left and still have not heard anything back from him.He hosted the Tuesday Manager Cocktail party; the complimentary beverage was tasty albeit sweet. There was a decent gathering of guests and I was surprised he did not 'address' us; no words, nothing. They also served chocolate covered Macadamia Nuts as a snack - nice touch.The room we stayed in was in need of a paint job; it looked a little run down, even though all things worked well. For the price we paid, we were OK with what we got. Suggestion: If you have a late flight out of Honolulu, keep your room for an extra night; we were glad we had the room right up until we left for the airport at 8pm. It confused the front desk gal though.If the price was right would stay again. an afford 7 nights here or just one at a Waikiki Beachfront one!PS... Mr Clark, would appreciate you responding to my email!

Just had a layover in Honolulu, decided to stay one night and it was so worth it. This hotel was very nice! I was on floor 14, I loved being so high above the city, great location could walk to the beach under 10 minutes, lots of shopping down the street! Room was very clean, bed was so comfortable, this hotel was very nice for how cheap it was. Would recommend for everyone!

We only spent 1 night but were not impressed. We were given a 2nd floor room which is probably the worst hotel room I've ever stayed in. Not even a chair to sit in. We asked for a wakeup call which we never received. Good thing I woke up or we could have missed our flight. Very average.

Not a bad hotel, we stayed in a standard room where the beds were extremely comfortable and the room was well air conditioned with a good TV. However, although the staff at reception are nice, the cleaners can be rude. Make sure you put up your 'Do Not Disturb' sign whilst your in your room at all times, and then remove when you are going out. The range for breakfast is very unusual and some may find it too filling just for breakfast. Also, as a pre-warning, there will be extra charges when you check out that your not aware of. We were charged for the borrowing of beach towels and breakfast which we thought was included when we had already payed for the hotel.

We actually stayed in an air bnb within the hotel which was excellent. The Asian I'm writing this review is to send special thanks to the desk staff. Because we weren't actually guests of the hotel, we couldn't store our luggage. However, Helene made some calls for us and found us a place to leave them so we could enjoy our last eight hours before our flight. This place and the staff come happily recommended! Thanks Helene

I arrived fairly late Saturday at 11:30pm to check in for 2 nights and was greeted by Kalei at the front desk who was very friendly and helpful in helping me to check in and with where to park my car. I was able to upgrade my room to a suite on the 5th floor at a nominal fee and thoroughly enjoyed it! The bed was comfortable, the room was clean and comfortable and the free WIFI was fast. I had one complimentary buffet breakfast which had enough food selections for me to enjoy it. The location was perfect for what I wanted to do. I Got beach towels from the front desk then walked a few blocks to the beach and found a great spot to relax there. I window shopped and enjoyed watching the tourists and the scenery. I was able to drive in a few minutes to the Diamond Head Crater Park to hike to the summit. I also drove in approx 20 minutes to the Pearl Harbor Memorial Park. Doug greeted me when I checked out and he was also very friendly and helpful. The next time I visit Honolulu I will definitely stay at this hotel.

Arrived early to mid morning, first impressions were ok, staff helpful and room clean. food in this place recommend eat out, Breakfast was cold when ask if could warm up pancakes woman said no these are first which a pile of around 20 were sitting going cold but you were not allowed to have the ones just cooked. around the 5th day breakfast still cold, went to go in main area of restaurant where there was plenty of free tables to eat at and was refused entry told to eat in other area tried to explain no seats but would not let me past but other guests were allowed, which ill keep my own opinions as to why, i eventually went to see the manager but was told there was not one around told front dest that after 5 days of cold food and then told i could not site in main area . i then refused to eat there again, front desk gave me a refund for the remained 4days i paid to eat there. you need a vias to pay a deposit or cash. this area of waikiki is very expensive eating and buying things. i know the reply from this review will be seen by the manager of this hotel and the usual comments they will pass on to their catering team but as ive seen other reviews this is not the case and the food is still cold. this issue does need addressing customers / Guests need to have warm food if paying for it and seat where they need to not be told you cant site in here.
user_name:
Mark G
West Yorkshire, United Kingdom

review_body: We have just returned home from 8 nights in Hawaii at the Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki. Reading other reviews and not being there before we were both sceptical about what to expect but were more than pleased with our stay at the Aqua Aloha. We could not afford the top end pricing of beachfront but were more than satisfied with what we had chosen with Aqua Aloha,The rooms were clean and filled our needs of being clean and comfortable to sleep. They were on the older side but the fact the rooms were clean and serviced daily was a plus for us. We were more than happy with the breakfast provided. You just needed to choose what was suitable for you. The hotel is a couple of blocks back from the beach but this is no hassle as everything is within comfortable walking distance.

I stayed at the hotel with my son over spring break during our first trip ever to Hawaii. Here is a summary of our experienceThe staff (manager, room cleaners, maintenance men, front desk) are great. They were always friendly and accommodating.Hotel offers fresh beach towels any time you want them and beach chairs.This is an older hotel, so don't expect everything to look brand new.The rooms are decent, the fridge was great, and the room layout was excellent. We had a room with a single bed and double bed.The hotel location is great, just a couple of blocks from the main Waikiki beach. There is a Food Pantry grocery store that had everything we needed (PS I don't recommend buying any of the pre-cooked whole chickens because they tended to be way overcooked, dry and tasteless)The hotel has a free shuttle service that takes you from the hotel to various destinations in and around Waikiki which we used often.For other travel, we used the city buses which take you almost anywhere on the island you want to go. The hotel staff were great giving advice on how to get to various locations on the island.You have to be aware that you will pay $18 per day "resort fee" which covers daily newspapers, video rentals, beach towels, and the breakfast. Its not over the top, but after we booked the package, the hotel raised the cost of this. Truth be told, a majority of this cost covers the breakfast, which was pricey given the food offered was at the lower end of quality and selection. It caters more to an oriental clientele. We stopped eating there after three days. The food was not what I would call "kid friendly", and they served the exact same food every day.

We stayed Friday March 24-Sunday March 26. We actually live on Hilo but came down to Oahu to visit family & friends. The hotel itself was very welcoming and nice atmosphere. Loved the fact that there was complimentary coffee, tea, & water in the lobby & breakfast in the mornings. The rooms were nice and cozy loved the lanai. We were on the 12th floor view was nice. I was impressed that the toiletries were replenished the next day! The lights were eco friendly energy savings! The cons:Limited parking areas in basement & side lot. Paid for two days parking $25/ a day and we could barely find parking. The second night we drove around for 20 minutes and finally found a tight space parking. Also I paid for two rooms online thru hotel site $196. I didn't know I would have to pay for the second night upon checkout. It was kinda surprising, glad I had money in my account for them to charge it. Idk how I paid $196 online then I had to pay $108 for the second night upon checkout. I enjoyed the stay but would like to not be surprised upon check out when I thought I paid for the rooms in full online

My partner and I stayed here for 6 nights the hotel was perfect for us! The hotel is just 5 minutes walk from the beach, and the shops and restaurants are just a very short walk! The room was a better standard than expected! Was very clean although there seemed to be an issue with small ants/insects crawling round the tap in the bathroom! The room was tided daily! would definitely recommend this hotel!

I booked through Agoda for a standard room, but none of the standard rooms had a chair or desk. I called down to the front desk, and requested both, but only the deluxe rooms had a desk and chair. I was quite upset and informed them as such. I spoke with Glenn and he gave me a free upgrade. Thank you Glenn. Also, the free breakfast buffet was surprisingly very good, even had oatmeal. I even returned while staying at another hotel just for the breakfast at only $8 I believe.

As a first impression of Hawaii, this set the bar very low. Hotel is outdated, cramped, and in need of major renovation or demolition. AC system was poor. Breakfast was not very good. "Beer garden" was a joke.Next visit to Hawaii will be to a much better place.

The staff were very helpful, the room was clean. The prices are good (comparatively), Breakfast options were more Asian than Western, located away from the hustle and bustle of the town, the beach is about Five minutes walking.

Excellent Hotel, The room was well appointed and the staff helpful. Located in a great part of town out of the hustle and bustle of the main street. Easy and convenient for the beach the freeway and close to everything. Highly recommended.

This hotel could use a bit of customer service. It seems that unless you are Chinese they don't treat you very well or respectfully. They also tend to quickly dismiss any issues you might have. Staff seems quite clueless as well, every question asked required a collective check to get a response. If you have breakfast here be warned the swarm of Chinese tourist will actually push you away from the bar while you are trying to get food. Food is much to be desired and the two Chinese ladies working there have a foul face and don't seem to like being there.Parking is the excessive at $25 dollars a day on top of a $18 for amenities. You might want to add that to the price and see if there are better hotels out there, which I'm sure there are. Putting the rudeness aside, the hotel is nicely located and you can walk to anywhere from there. That's pretty much it when it comes to what's nice about the place. If you want to put up with the hotel staff, the tiny rooms and the amount of fees, than stay here, I will be looking else where next time. Really didn't expect the lack of service like this in Hawaii.

Cons: Our room was NOTHING as advertised, (much smaller than pictured), patched up holes in walls etc. "Free" breakfast was greasy scrambled eggs (not fully cooked), greasy noodles, greasy rice, $18/day, whether you eat it or not. Everything old/out-dated, in disrepair, old noisy air conditioner, underground parking NOT nice ($25/night), stale old vehicles/motorcycles/bicycles collecting dust in parking area... terrible. A local advised that it was formerly low-end housing used by drug dealers. We stayed 2 weeks and never complained but were glad to leave the hotel. Wish we could give a better report but felt ripped off.Pro: Hotel staff were very friendly and sweet people.

We stayed twice in this hotel during our trip to Hawaii - at the beginning and at the end of our stay. The rooms are nice, very clean. For the second stay they gave us free upgrade of our room. which was very nice and the room was so much better - very spacious, nicely decorated, with a kitchenette. The staff is average, some people were very nice, others were rather unpleasant. The location is good, it is about 15 minutes from Waikiki beach. If you need to have any package delivered to the front desk during your stay, there's no problem (some hotels don't accept packages for guests).What is really tragic about this hotel though is the breakfast. First. the cleanliness and the smell of the breakfast room is so poor. Second, there's no choice for non Asian people, almost all food is Asian breakfast choice. The breakfast staff was rude. I ended up not going to the breakfast at all and instead made coffee in the room. Which is really a shame, beacuse the overall standard of the hotel is so much higher than one would judge based on the breakfast experience. Huge impovements are needed when it comes to breakfast.

There are so few affordable buffets in Waikiki - we thought we had lucked out for dinner at $15.95 off the front lobby.NOT - ABSOLUTELY AWLFUL. Food was barely warm, most was crunchy/dry/overcooked/or mushy. Do not eat here.

Is it the Ritz? No. But the rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable, the breakfast buffet is plentiful, and it's steps away from all of the action. What more do you want in a hotel? I'm not the type to spend all day at the hotel. If you are, you may not like this place. If you are like and just want a clean, safe place to sleep and take a shower, then this spot is fantastic.

Overall, I was very satisfied with my stay. The rooms were comfortable, roomy, and clean. I felt the staff was friendly and helpful. The location was excellent and you are in walking distance from the beach, many fabulous restaurants, and shopping. The only complaint I would have is that I wasn't crazy about the breakfast there. I found the quality ok but not great!

While everyone was very helpful we were a bit dissappointed that the rooms hadn't really been updated since our last visit. (had been told then they would all be.) Breakfast was included and there was lots of it but it was obviously catering to the Asian visitors. It is close to everything and we had a great break.

This was our first trip to Hawaii and the experiences at Aqua Aloha Surf made it all the more enjoyable. Very friendly and helpfull staff, from the wee morning coffee talks to mid day directions they were all great. Although the room we were in is starting to show some age (so are we) it was clean and comfortable. Of all the places i have stayed over the years this gets top rating from me. Not even close to the robot staff of other hotels, the staff here was just like being with family and friends on a relaxing sunny afternoon. Thanks again Aqua Aloha Surf for a great experience.

Firstly, yes the rooms are decent, bathrooms clean and Hotel is in a good location. But that is ALL.I am beyond angry right now. The staff were rude and unfriendly. I questioned about the prices I was being charged and they kept assuring it was correct. WRONG. I was overcharged. so 3 emails, a facebook complaint and facebook message later, thwir heas office responded and apologised for the over charge and were sincere and prompt in fixing the problem. I was satisfied and had hope for the Hotel.BUT. it is now Thursday, I checked out Sunday, and low and behold, they STILL have a hold on my credit card of $275, meaning, I can not use my money till they release the hold. and why such a big hold? I have been charged for the room, paid for the room in full, refund of overcharge has gone through, but you now want to hold back my $275 which is $380 Australian dollars. this while experience is un acceptable and un professional. I was willing to let my anger go when they fixed the over charge. But still having a hold of my money, mixed with rude staff who do not want to speak or be friendly to guests at check in desks and do not seem to know what they are charging. im disgusted in this hotel. It would take some amazing offer and the staff to lift their apirits and be nicer to your guests before I ever consider staying here again.As i said, rooms are decent and clean and in a good location. But if you do not want to have to fight for your money or deal with rude staff, id spend your money elsewhere.Thank you to to the staff who were so kind in fixing the over charge. but 2 monewy problems from a 2 night stay has ruined what I hoped would be a decent review for you.

Room is clean and comfortable.Enjoyed breakfast but very Asian.Pancakes and oranges my favorite.Loved free drinks on Tuesday evening.Have free beach chairs,towels for beach and free shuttle to Mall.Close to beach and easy walk to AliWai canal

Budget friendly hotel in the middle of Waikiki. Hotel is close to the beach (no more than a 5 minute walk), and very close to restaurants, shops, (international marketplace), bars, etc. If you like noodles, you must check out Marukame Udon. Amazing noodles for cheap. The line is usually out the door, but it goes fairly quickly. Definitely check this place out. Hotel provides beach towels and chairs for free. Rooms are out dated, but clean. ACs are window units and very loud (this is probably my biggest con). If you have a room facing the back of the hotel, you are directly facing a not so nice looking apartment complex. There is a very small pool, however I never used it as the beach was so close. There is a small bar attached to the lobby. There is also a decent bar directly across the street at the Sand Villa Hotel, which also has decent food. Staff are very friendly. They can book tours for you around the island. I did the Pearl Harbor tour which worked out well and as advertised. Diamond Head is only about a 15 minute bus ride from the hotel. (only $2.50 round trip). Bus stop is only one block away (take the 23 or 2 bus). All in all, not that bad of a hotel for the area. This is not a "resort" type of hotel, rather a place to sleep and then spend your day out and about.

This is a good hotel located just 2 blocks from the beach. Affordable for Wikiki. Continental breakfast. Rooms a bit outdated. Towels and chairs for beach available for free. Staff is gracious and trying to be helpfull. Parking is extra.

If you are looking for an inexpensive,kid friendly place to lay your head while in Waikiki, you could do a lot worse. Pros; the hotel is downtown, a short walk to the beach and tons of restaurants. There are about 30 ABC convenience stores within walking distance. The staff are friendly and do their best to accommodate. Th y are the positive in this review. There is a 'continental breakfast'...., Cons; the street side of the hotel is LOUD. Not just a little loud, but RIDICULOUSLY loud. Even on the 8th floor - we were woken up nightly by the sounds of cars, police sirens, arguing drunks - blaring music from the parking lot next door. Buying ear plus did not help. It's not a safe spot to walk late at night, many transients. The parking fee is $25 PER DAY, the 'resort' fee is $18, which I think is excessive for this hotel. For the added resort fees you are paying, this breakfast should be a LOT better. You are better off grabbing packaged foods at ABC or walking a block to a restaurant. Some of this is kinda typical of downtown Waikiki, other things like the security / noise could be addressed by the resort. All in all, try to use the cheaper parking lots a few blocks down to save $$$. Be aware of your surroundings at night. You will save money here - but don't expect a Hilton experience.

The hotel is centrally located in the heart of Waikiki. There are a couple of.restaurants and bars in the same building and an ABC Store is down the street. A continental breakfast is included in the room rate. The rooms are nicely appointed and they are reasonably quiet. In room wifi is offered at no additional charge. On site parking is available for an additional charge. There is "green room" technology which we were not made aware of when we checked in, so we thought that there was no power to the room. Only after fumbling in the dark did we discover that the room key must be inserted into a device in the wall in order for the lights to operate. It would be helpful to be advised of this at check in.

Pros:1. Relative value for money 2. The Staff is great they really make sure you're ok3. Packed breakfast!!Cons:1. Older rooms2. The windows don't fully close and maybe a bit noisy.3. The doors don't lock well so people bang the doors

My husband and I go to Oahu every year just to escape the frosty winter in Canada...brrrr. This year, my daughter recommended the Aqua Resorts because she only stays there when she is in Waikiki. We are so glad we listened to her. The staff and team were absolutely amazing at Aloha Surf! They treated like family during our entire stay...there were a few hiccups with the room changes but the outstanding service overshadowed everything else. We felt so welcomed and at home at this property. Thank you Tim, Julian and staff for making our stay so comfortable! See you soon. (This review was submitted on behalf of my Mother and Father).
user_name:
Atsquared
New York City, New York

review_body: I love staying here. I have been visiting this city for months now on business and of all the hotels I have tried Aqua Aloha Surf is one of the best. I love the location just right down the street from the center of shopping, a slight walk to the beach, and I love the rooms. Here's a hint join their club for the room upgrade when they have it !! I always enjoy my stay and the staff is always helpful and attentive.

vacationing solo. the lobby has a nice wait area, but the rooms are old and could use some upgrade. the room was very small which i dint mind much especially where i dint have much luggage. the room was well equipped with the essentials ( hair drier, microwave, refrigerator ). service was done regularly and staff was friendly. Location is great, afew blocks from the beach (not beach front) and right near the canal (for those morning and evening walks/runs). they offer free dvd and game rentals which was a plus. Their breakfast buffet was aweful. not very inclusive/diverse. Pool is small but has great depth (5-8ft )

We stayed at this hotel in 2015 September the hotel is clean however rooms seem like they need to be refurbished however the room was good size and had comfortable bed . The hotel is in great locTion however the hotel definelty need to be extended the pool area is so small and the pool itself the pool is clean but not roomy definelty an extension is needed in this hotel also the breakfast needs to be improved . Staff however treat u like family they give u Beach chairs and surfboards for kids really family friendly people .Basically this hotel is clean and rooms are good and staff are friendly it just needs to be extended refurbished and breakfasts improved

We spent a week at this hotel where a daily breakfast was included and free cocktails provided once a week, among a disparate group of international tourists. It was only about a pleasant ten minute walk to the beach at Waikiki and there were eating places along the way. The room was clean and comfortable and there was small swimming pool on the site. The price were reasonable for Waikiki but it's always worth looking at hotel choices on Tripadvisor to get the beat price.

We have just got back from 7 nights at this fabulous hotel. A really central location, with everything you need within walking distance. Staff were really helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them. From lending us an adaptor to giving us beach chairs (rather than paying $30 per day EACH every day on the beach).We were a bit dubious about breakfast from the reviews, but there was absolutely nothing to worry about. And if you don't like it, there's loads of other places nearby.A ridiculously comfortable bed that was hard to get out of, but we didn't go halfway across the world to sleep!The bar is really good and has some of the best priced drinks in Waikiki. Along with the friendliest most fun bar staff.We didn't try out the pool as we spent every day out and about or on the beach, but it looked refreshing and clean!

Coming to Oahu for a quick vacation weekend, I wasn't super interested in getting a really nice hotel, as I knew we weren't going to be there much. I concentrated on some 3 and 3.5 star hotels (per Expedia) and that's when I saw this place. The rooms looked nice, so I mentioned it to the wife and we agreed we'd stay here. Upon checking in, the lobby looked just like the pictures, which made me feel good. The room, however, did not. It wasn't horrible, just run down and neglected. Thin layer of dust on the air conditioner and fridge, cracks in the grout in the bathroom, etc. Shower was very cramped, although that could just be because I'm 6'2". As I said in the title, we weren't there very much, so it was good enough... I guess. Side note, the complimentary breakfast was... odd. Have a plan B.

location was not bad at all, approximately 10 minutes walk to Waikiki beach.there are more than several sound restaurants in 10~15 minutes in walk radius.but hotel was just qualified for the cheap price, breakfast meal was very poor and room was too small and loud.receptionist told me that i was upgraded but it was smallest room on floor which is just next to main elevator.even their facility was very poor, resort fee was high and parking lot extra cost was high too. i would ever visit this facility

Stuck here to wait out arrival of e-visas; all Airbnb's full, reduced to this wretched ghetto.PROS: Better than an Airbnb 'private room' bec. of own bathroom. It was available. Annominity. Only $1 from airport on city bus. Kudos to concierge Jesse Savio for helping us out with difficult visa processing. Thanks to housekeeping Corazon for sweetness and politeness. Mgmt. has tried to provide 'all the necessarys'. But...CONS: ... bed is lousey, foam topper doesn't really fix it; very high, hard to get onto it, easy to roll or slide off of it. Old style box A/C 18" from bed throws out cool air to make you sick after two nights. Only reading light on one side of the double bed. No chair. Of course, no desk...room too small. And, of course, breakfast is cheap, greasy, mostly Chinese. We stopped eating it after first day. Even the hacked-cut apples were mushy. Only the oranges and fried rice (not too fried) were decent.

Had some clients come in last week and the boss decided that I should stay in Waikiki one night to be closer to the clients. The Aloha Surf came up as one of the cheapest for this peak time period. Booked the cheapest room they had on line for about $145 not including resort fee. Hotel is smack in the middle of Waikiki but on Ala Wai side. of course the room they gave me was on the Ala Wai and while nice to look at the mountains, it can be a bit loud (4th floor). But I expect most hotels in Waikiki to be loud so I brought spare of ear plugs. Although one of the smaller and older Aqua properties, they try to offer what they can. My room was small, bed pretty small but at least there was a fridge and coffee maker. They actually give you a free DVD card to rent DVDs, free continental breakfast (don't remember any other Aqua offering this), and towel cards. There is a tiny pool and a "gym" area with 2 machines and one was broken. Lobby is open air and just about the "nicest" part of the hotel. There is coffee in lobby that looks like it was there all day and there is even a shuttle that goes to Ala Moana shopping mall (picks up at other Aqua Properties).Some of the clients complained that the rooms were too small but hey, they got their rooms for free. Since I was by myself it was fine and a last minute booking for peak January it was ok. The windows aren't sound proof so you can definitely hear noise if you are not on the quiet side. But with breakfast and Ala Moana shuttle and tiny pool included, plus waking distance to everywhere including Food Pantry supermarket, it was decent.

We stayed at this hotel for 2 wks and would stay longer. Location was close to beach,shopping and great restaurants. Our room was large and the staff were ALL very kind and helpful.Our view was lovely with the canal, mountains and city lights.Breakfast, shuttle service around Waikiki and to Ala Moana shopping center, beach towels and beach chairs were included in the resort fee. Very nice.Our Gal - Candida - looked after our room and it was always spotless and she is so SWEET. We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to all. Just a little hint - turn on the fan at night so that you cannot hear the traffic or the bar across the street that stays open until 4 a.m. the fan blocks it out. It was a great vacation because of the hotel and staff.

Cheap but you can stay for 1-2 nights, we stay here for 1 night and want tomove to another place, location is good, but condition is not well, waikiki beach is located 5 minut from here, in room deluxe can stay up to 4 person

An average hotel a couple of blocks from the beach, staff are very friendly & helpful & they do a free cocktail afternoon once a week also a free bus to the outlet centres. Rooms are average, try to get a beach view or mountain view one as ours looked directly into someone elses room

We were looking for a hotel with a good value for a great price. The hotel was perfect for our stay. We got a great price, we could walk a couple blocks to get to Waikiki, or take a complimentary shuttle to the mall. A motorcycle and luxury car rental was just a couple blocks away. We rented a motorcycle and it was awesome.We had a room on one of the highest floors, this was nice to be able to see the city, landscape, and a bit of the ocean. All the staff we dealt with were awesome. Coming from overseas I had some questions beforehand so had to call the hotel and I talked with Diana. She was the best and very helpful, and her helpfulness convinced me it'd be a good place to stay. For the price of the hotel I was quite happy with the hotel itself. The main only downside was that the Chinese supper food for breakfast isn't really our thing... But really there were enough other things to satisfy and can't complain with a free breakfast. Pancakes, apples and eggs is what I had. Some yogurt and granola would be a nice addition.I would definitely go back.

Hotel rating 4/5:The hotel is situated few blocks away from the main Waikiki shopping and dining streets. Multiple grocery stores and fast food joints are also within 5 minutes of walking. There is an additional and mandatory resort fee of $15 per night which gives you access to WiFi, DVD rentals, coffee, pool, pool/beach towels and other amenities. I find this fee unnecessary and it could very well be in the room price itself. Unfortunately this seems to be common practice among Hawaii hotels to distract customers.WiFi worked fine. Gym consisted of a treading mill and 2 other equipment and was quite disappointing. Coffee at the lobby was great to take to room when passing by. Beach towels exchange was a great and easy service.The lobby area looked fine and the staff were friendly and spoke understandable English to a non-native speaker.Room rating 3/5:We stayed at the superior room on 7th floor. Room looked a bit old and worn down but was mostly clean. It was spacious enough but was missing any chairs or sofa to relax and sit on. Also no tables to eat or write on. Windows were louvre style and provided absolutely no noise insulation from the street traffic below. Pack your ear plugs if you want a peaceful sleep. The double bed mattress had gotten noticeably softer on the other side.Bathroom was ok but the shower area had a bit rusty appearance. The shower was in a bath tub. The tub was so rusty and dirty looking that you didn't really want to bath in it. The shower head was way too low for a tall person (+180cm) to have a comfortable shower. The balcony had a nice view to the canal and city. There was also a microwave, coffee maker, TV and decent side refrigerator provided, which was nice. Housekeeping kept the room clean and tidy.Breakfast 1/5:Worst breakfast buffet I have ever eaten. It seemed more like a cheap Chinese lunch than the continental breakfast advertised. No bacon, no proper bread, no ham, no cheese... One type of juice was provided each day and tasted very watery and fake. The pancakes were ok.The breakfast area looked dull and smelled weird. Lady at the front checking breakfast passes looked grumpy all the time and didn't speak English very well. Utensils and plates had to be checked every time for dirty spots. You had to carry your own dishes to a messy collection cart. Serving tables were all over the place and caused people to walk back and forth the area and try not bump to each other.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel/condo location on our stay on Oahu a few weeks ago. The place is clean and you get maid service every day. It also includes a breakfast each day. Our room was one step up from the basic, it was nothing special but served our needs for a place to rest at night. We needed to bring a chair from the balcony in to sit on otherwise it was the bed. There was a microwave, fridge and tv. The breakfast was very basic and something that I would not pay for if not included . A few people came in off the street to eat but mostly it was people from the hotel. This was made up of regular hotel rooms and some owner condos Like I said it served it's purpose and it was clean. It is about 3 blocks from the beach, a nice little walk with lots of shops on the way. There is a small grocery store right around the corner. Watch out right beside the store there is one with almost the same name but it is "Express" more expensive and don't shop for groceries at the ABC store, way to expensive. ABC stores great for stuff to take home and save your receipts till the end and cash them in for free gifts. Good on all the islands.

I have stayed at this hotel twice now. What brings me back is the price and only the price. I find that most hotel rooms in Waikiki are pretty much the same, the only main variance is the price and that mainly being dictated by the distance to the beach. A shower is a shower, a bed is a bed. Price doesn't guarantee mattress age or quality. I have been in a lot of hotels and a room is a room. You have to ask yourself what your needs are and how much you are willing to pay to have them met. Like airlines, hotels create an artificial value system based on very little. Ocean views? How long will you spend looking at those? Just go to the beach. Closeness to the beach? Most are a short walk from the beach. A taxi ride to and from the beach will probably cost you $20 a day. Compare that to your room price.Aqua Aloha Surf is great value for money. There is a free courtesy bus, which used judiciously can get you within a short walk of most places. It runs a loop around Waikiki and out to Ala Moana Shopping Center. The loop takes approximately 30 mins. Tip the driver $1 or more per passenger every trip and he will probably drop you off just about anywhere along the route. The free breakfast buffet is not bad but not great. It consists mainly of toast, pancakes, eggs (boiled and scrambled), spam, sausages, noodles, cupcakes, oranges, apples, coffee, etc. Everything is made on the cheap. My best advice is bring spreads for your toast as there is none. Bring milk as the milk supplied is powdered and watery. The syrup for the pancakes is watery also. Share what you bring with those around you and you will have friends for life. The free bus will drop and pick you up from Walmart or Don Quijote to get groceries on the cheap. PLEASE NOTE.....the buffet is well timed by the hotel to have only a few guests, being 7-9am. This is important because if you are using tour buses to do a "circle island tour", "Pearl Harbour tour", trip to Kualoa Ranch, etc they all leave prior to 7am. The hotel knows this! So no free breakfast for you.The most annoying part of this hotel is the loudness of the door locking mechanisms when closing. A minor irritation during the day can be very sleep disruptive at night for lighter sleepers. My room was adjacent the fire exit (902) with a smoker in the room next door that kept on popping out all night for a quick fix. Bang, bang, bang all night long.The hotel is reasonably maintained and everything is fresh and clean. The staff are average, not excessively rude but not attentive to service either. This hotel is average all the way with a cheap price. To get a cheaper price search with a third party provider, get their price then ring up the hotel and ask for a cheaper price if you go directly through the hotel. The hotel has to pay the third party provider a percentage so often you will get a discount and the hotel will actually make a larger profit.To get top class service as you do sometimes at the pricier hotels just tip the staff. Treat them well and they will do the same. Learn their names. A small amount of kindness and a little money will see you treated like royalty and cost you less than a more expensive hotel overall.

This hotel was part of an all-inclusive package that we signed up for. It's an older hotel, and could use some renovations, but it's fine for a place to sleep and store your things. We had so many activities going on so it was sufficient. The breakfast could use a little help though. They need to learn to cook eggs! Being someone who needs protein, and cannot eat just pastries or toast for breakfast, it was a bit lacking. But there are tons of places nearby to get a decent breakfast. This hotel is close enough to everything and we just walked everywhere. No need to rent a car if you plan on staying in the Waikiki area. And Uber has a pretty good presence should you need transportation anywhere. The staff here is pretty great. We were on our honeymoon and they gave us a bottle of champagne and chocolates when we checked in. Nice touch! They have a meet-n-greet thing in Tuesday nights with a complimentary cocktail and a chance to meet the staff and manager. Another nice touch:-)

Basic hotel which I would not recommend to any of my friends or family. The rooms are a bit dated, but that's not a very big issue for me. It's clean and that's what matters the most. But at arrival us was told to pay an 18 dollar extra fee per day above the hotelfee we allready payed extra. I'm still wondering what I got for that extra money. Also to park our car in the hotel parking lot we had to pay 25 dollar a day. I think that's a brutal price concidering the hotel with all it's fee's isn't very cheap at all. That's allmost the price I rented the car for!!The breakfast area needs a serious make over. It's like it's not a part of the hotel and the ambience is very strange. Most of the staff was very friendly, so no complains about that.Friendly regardsJurgen.

The goodFront desk staff were always nice, helpful and welcoming.They gave us leis at arrivalOutdoor eating area although small, worked well.Location was good. It was close to shops, main road, canal and a couple of blocks from beach.You can rent DVDs for free and movies are current.TV is a good sizeThe room had a microwave and fridgeGood size bedThe bad Don't be surprised to see what appeared to be hookers. However no issues and I am not necessarily insulting, just warning you. I didn't like that but as long as they don't cause a scene or get my child's attention I just ignore them.Saw a scaffold and some dirty guests.There is homeless people everywhere in Hawaii but I noticed a few outside of this hotel hanging out in the public parking lot beside it, also men and women possibly working some deals.......more than twice with suspicious behaviour. However I minded my own business. No taking chances with a child.Don't expect anything fancy or modern, bathroom and kitchennettee area are outdated, cheap, rusty and not very clean. The rust I understand as it is humid climate, the mildew is gross but I clean it before using and sanitize everything. The old is fine as long as it works.The gym is three broken pieces of equipment in the corner back of the lobby. It's a safety hazard, zapped strapped to keep some things together. It's garbage.The uglyOh boy! The continental breakfast is the worst I have ever seen but to be fair the fresh off the grill mini pancakes were nice to have.If you like Chinese food for breakfast you will love it. There's a mini Chinese food including fried rice every morning. I just couldn't but looked alright.As they do have all you can eat in the day I was too afraid it might just be left overs from the night beforeThere was scrambled eggs and hard boiled eggs as well as bread and some cakes and powdered mini doughnuts.Now, the coffee was cheap coffeeThe tea was so watered down, didn't even taste like teaThe milk was powdered milk, how cheap!The juice......no juice, it was punch so no milk and no juice.....I ended up bringing my own milkThere was butter and cream cheese, the cream cheese always had water on it...grossThere was apple and orange cut up. The apple was bruised apple, obviously bought cheap and it was always wet....why?Oh yeah there was oatmeal......it was so runny, like water with some oatmeal floating.No jam, no peanut butter oh and I did not appreciate that they use styrofoam. Also you have to clean your table and your plates and separate the cutlery etc. I wouldn't mind if the breakfast was better but in this case I found this ridicoulous.In the end,for the money we paid I suppose we couldn't expect much. It's all about the beach anyway.

My partner and I both stayed here during our honeymoon in November. Was a quiet hotel with friendly staff on hand to help you out with anything u need to know about the area and able to make reservations for you if you require. Whilst it's a little out dated it offered everything we needed for our stay in Hawaii. Close to the beach and surrounding attractions we were very happy with our stay. The buffet breakfast was dedicated more for the Asian population but still was ok. The managers reception held every Tuesday is a good hour of relaxing with a cocktail in hand (provided by hotel) and live Hawaiian music playing in the foyer. We also were upgraded to a better room for our stayed once the new it was our honeymoon. Thanks for a lovely time.

10 day stay from the 16 - 26. The rooms are small and dated but, it was clean and had everything we needed during our stay. King size bed was comfortable and housekeeping was good. Small bar fridge and a microwave. Front desk staff was helpful and always had tips for us to help us get around. The Aqua Resorts shuttle bus app was very helpful. We were on the 8th. floor and had a great view off our balcony. Honolulu is a busy city and you should be prepared for traffic and emergency vehicle noise 24/7. This Hotel is older and has the old school louvred glass windows, so there is no sound proofing but we were usually so tired it didn't matter. Wifi was good and worked through out the Hotel. The breakfast buffet was the only disappointment during our stay. I realize that there are a lot of Asian folks on holidays but, the buffet could probably do better catering to the North American style of breakfast and spend a little extra to use real butter for toast and pancakes instead of whatever that yellow goo is that has no flavour and basically makes everything soggy and gross.
