Other reviewers have mentioned the food and I thought maybe they were exaggerating but, they weren't. We sat with many different people and all had the same complaint. Bacon and real butter would immediately improve the breakfast buffet. Under cooked ham and cocktail wieners are no substitute for bacon. Parking is at a premium so be prepared to pay $25 per day or take your chances trying to find street parking. But, aside from that, if you want a comfortable room to sleep in with friendly helpful staff, I highly recommend you stay here. 10 minute walk to the beach and even less for shopping.

We have just come back from a 10 night stay at this hotel, it was perfect! Its in a great location just a 5 min walk from Waikiki beach, all the shops and a 2 min walk from the bus stop for all the main routes. We arrived late the Saturday night to a warm welcome and a fast check in. We did however end up with a double bed for the first night (think this was due to the tour company not the hotel) they couldn't give us another room that night however they assured us they could give us a new room on the Sunday. We did choose to upgrade which I would recommend for $10 dollars a night it was well worth it we ended up with a balcony and a sofa (a much bigger room) They also moved all or stuff for us when the room was ready. This just advise you to keep your cases packed . Be aware you do pay $18 a night fee for the hotel however included in this is breakfast every morning ( this is in the Chinese on the side of the hotel so don't be alarmed with the egg fried rice, however there was a number of other stuff that was more than edible), free beach towels that you can change every day, free unlimited tea and coffee in you room ( none of this cheap instant stuff, it was lovely fresh perculater coffee which was a nice change compare to what you receive when traveling Europe) The cleaners done a wonderful job and the room was left spotless every day, I also left comfortable enough to not put stuff in the safe every day (mainly as I forgot) but everything was left as we placed it. All rooms seemed to have air con which is not extra, we didn't really use ours as it can be loud, we just chose to sleep with balcony door open a little ( the street outside can be noisy at certain times ) but we where on the 15th floor so wasn't too bad. We spent one day in the hotel and left just as the cleaners where at the end of their shift and offered to clean our room then for us. We declined but I thought this we just that little bit extra you look for when staying in a hotel. The pool is small and sun loungers limited. However you can't go to Waikiki and spend your whole time by the hotel pool. I would recommend going to the beach , but the pool is ideal for just an afternoon chilling out. The hotel bar is great. Beer is cheaper than in any of the restaurants you eat at. The staff where very friendly and more than helpful. It has a small smoking area outside that you can sit in and watch tv if you wish. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel. Its very clean, very friendly, not expensive. ( I would recommend upgrading ) and central to everything, They also offer a free shuttle to the main shopping centre. You do catch this at the hotel down the road but worth the free ride.

I chose this hotel as it is near the beach and relatively inexpensive for Honolulu. Less than 2 blocks from the beach, around the corner to most public bus stops, easy walk to Ala Moana shops, Kapiolani Park etc (must enjoy walking though). As with the majority of hotels you also pay a resort tax which funds a free shuttle to the Ala Moana centre, free in room and Waikiki wifi, free DVD rental (not a great choice) and breakfast. The breakfast times are strict so I didn't eat it a few days that I had to get up early and there was no breakfast -to-go option even though you paid the tax. Breakfast is adequate but definitely geared towards the Asian market. Every Tuesday @ 4.30 the manager supplies free cocktails to guests and there is musical entertainment. I found the staff pleasant, the hotel clean. On the downside the pool is small and nothing special and the 'gym' is just some basic equipment next to the open dining area so its not an appealing area. The room was good, bathroom is a bit small and dated but served its purpose. LOVED the bed. So comfortable and I had great sleeps ( a problem for me in hotels). I would stay here again and recommend it to friends outlining the plus/minus features

We booked a package holiday this time out and the Aqua Aloha Surf was one of the hotel options. We did a little research on Trip Advisor and saw that overall the reviews were decent, but there was some consternation with the breakfast buffet. We don't usually eat at hotels anyway as trying new places and food is part of our trip experience, so we went with the Aqua Aloha Surf. Very happy we did. As with any place/event/experience, the people make the difference, and at the Aqua Aloha Surf it is no different. We were greeted like friends by Nicole on our arrival, and that set a tone that lasted throughout our stay at the hotel. The cleaning staff are so nice, and did an amazing job every day. Our room always looked so nice when we returned from our day. We were given the option of a 6th or 14th floor room and we took the 14th floor. This was a good decision - all the rooms are great, but not all the veiws are million-dollar views. On the back side, if you are lower than the 10th floor, you may not have the best view. It will be mostly buildings. Higher up though and you can see the mountains, the Ala Wai Canal, the golf course and in some units you even get a peek at the ocean. The room is huge (by our standards), and nicely decorated - felt like the perfect Hawaiian atmosphere. Waking up every day with the windows/doors open is a treat (from Canada - gets a bit cool at night). Televisions in the room are big, but in our view unnecessary as we rarely returned before 10:00pm, and for some reason television in the States is terrible. Mostly all commercials and angry commentators. Now, on to the breakfast buffet. This is the weak spot, unless you have a good sense of humour and then it is pretty darn cute and funny. We tried it our first day knowing the reviews from others were not glowing. Have to say, the reviews on the buffet are spot on. The toast is good, though. The buffet has a huge selection, and we give props to the hotel for being ambitious, but our suggestion is to dial down the options and maybe focus on fewer items done a bit better. But, as mentioned, even an amazing buffet would only have been used by us once or twice - there are so many options in Hawaii, not the least is the fresh, local tropical fruit like pineapples, papayas, avocados, ..... Overall, an enjoyable stay and a great hotel to make your home base in Waikiki.

This is the story how the actions of one single employee lifted this review from a clear 1 to a 4. The value of good employees and human customer service to a business can never be underestimated.We arrived quite late in the evening to the horror of realising that our reservation had not been registered by the hotel. I am not the one to say if it was otel.com or the hotel who had made a mistake, but it really doesn't matter much since ultimately the hotel has chose otel.com as a service provider. It took the reception and otel.com more than an hour to solve the issue and part of the problem was that both parties refused to spend money calling the other part and required to fix the problem via fax (this is 2016)...We got room 205 and that part of the hotel has sort of moist slightly moldy smell to it. Not too bad, but clearly noticeable. Room was quite small but that was expected as this hotel after all is a budget option in Waikiki. Bed was sold as a double bed, but I must say it was good fortune that both of us are relatively slim and we are pretty comfortable in intimate situations. Bet was small (maybe 120cm). All this was acceptable but the room is located just above a generator set, main air condition unit or something similar noisy. The first night was unbearable with a constant noise and hardly no sleep. Next morning we zombied down to the reception asking the receptionist to change room. It took him 15 sec to review the situation before offering us room 609 (surely a free upgrade) and our remainder of the stay was flawless.Big thank you to Vinh - you saved our vacation and this TripAdvisor review. Wish you all the best in the futureIf a reader considers staying there please pay close attention to the room you get. Avoid west wing of floor 2 is a great start

Very nice hotel staff very friendly ,breakfast is ok but more for the Asian market also very noisy at night so had to shut windows which made the room very warm couldn't use air conditioning as it was situated right next to the bed blowing cold air in your face not very nice.

The Aqua Aloha Surf is kept clean and it has what you need; however, it is in great need of renovations! The breakfast room was in the same shape...a little depressing for my taste. The breakfast can be improved...it was just ok. They also had food choices for The Asian tourist which is the majority in Honolulu! Will not recommend it unless you are only looking for a place to sleep!

Aqua Aloha Surf is located 3 blocks from Waikiki Beach and close to everything, but far enough away that you are not disturbed by the Night Clubs. Breakfast is included and a great way to start your day. Staff is friendly and attentive, there is a pool, exercise equipment and excursion desk on site. They also have a shuttle to get you to the Mall and other Aqua locations.

We booked this hotel because it was one of the more inexpensive hotels in the area. It also provided complimentary breakfast, which is hard to come by. We were greeted pleasantly by the staff and had no negative interactions with them during our week long stay. Upon check-in we informed them about the reason for the trip: birthday/ 10th anniversary, so they upgraded our room. And while it was an adequate room with microwave and fridge, it was nothing special. Bed was comfortable, view was pretty good, but at night it was quite noisy and both my wife and I occasionally woke up. This was easily solved by having the A/C fan run at night. We only ate breakfast 4 times because we were busy doing sunrise hikes on the other days. Breakfast is definitely catered to an Asian population: kimchi, fried rice and noodles, but there were other things, scrambled eggs, pancakes, orange slices, coffee cake and coconut doughnuts. The quality of food was fair: eggs were pretty runny and there was an odd flavor on the rice and noodles, but mix pancakes were...well...pancakes from a mix and tasted as such. We didn't use their pool or gym, which were not extravagant by any means. Hotel parking is $25/day, but street parking on Ala Wai Blvd is free (hit or miss), or there is paid parking next to the hotel for $15/$18 from 5pm-7am on weekday/weekends (had no trouble with availability). After paying for hotel parking 1 day we figured out the other options (wish staff had told us about those options). The hotel is conveniently located to shopping, grocery store (which we used for many of our meals), restaurants and the beach. We were able to get beach towels each day, use wi-fi and checked out some movies for free (part of resort fees). I won't go too much into the rooms, as there are plenty of other reviews. Yes the rooms are outdated and could use some extra cleaning, but we didn't go to Hawaii to spend a lot of time in our room. We used the room to sleep in and once we figured out how to solve the noise problem, we were able to get decent sleep on the beds, which were pretty comfortable.Pro: cheap rooms, free breakfast, free wifi, decent views, location to beach/shoppingCons: quality of food, street noise, outdated rooms

I've just left this hotel and I must say that our stay here was awesome!! I found that there were very Friendly hotel staff and I also got to know all of the super friendly barstaff at the bar called Tradewinds Lounge located downstairs near the lobby!! They certainly look after you and allow a good time! The Barman Ramon, serves the tastiest cocktails Yummmmy! I'll certainly miss this Bar!!The location is fantastic in the heart of Waikiki. Short walk to the beach. Buses leave from around the corner, there is a food pantry ( supermarket ) right behind it. I didnt need to use the pool as i swam in the beautiful ocean but the pool did look nice. Housekeeping was great! Room was fine, comfy beds too!We got upgraded when we got there :) to a balcony room facing the street that looks out over to the river. (5th floor) on a noisy road but that didn't bother me , everywhere in Waikiki is loud and alive. Breakfast is asian style ( noodles, spam, little sausages, apples, oranges, hard boiled eggs and pancakes with syrup, they have toast but no spreads so be sure to take your own vegemite with you ;)I would definitely stay here again that's for sure!Thankyou to every single person at this place that made our stay enjoyable, safe and fun!!!

The hotel has 15 floors but its somewhat old and needs updating. We stayed on the 10th floor on the even numbered side of the building so we had a great view of the beach. The rooms are small and we had no where to place our suitcases so we brought the plastic lawn chairs in from the balcony. Our room had a frig and microwave which was nice. The only ice machine is located on the first floor which I felt was a huge inconvenience. The bed was comfortable and the water always hot but the bathroom fixtures are outdated. The towels were of pretty good quality. I really needed to get on a pc but they have not business center nor could they find me a place where I could log on to a computer - the front desk person printed me a map and we walked a couple blocks to where he said there was a internet café but never found it. I asked at a Holiday Inn Express and they said they doubted if the internet café existed so I was out of luck. The front desk could print boarding passes but that's about it. I do want to say that all the staff are extremely friendly and the bartender was the nicest person.
user_name:
TRenee B
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Aloha! I'm a frequent traveler to this beautiful Island and have stayed mostly in Aqua / Ohana Resorts the last 30 years, this was my first at the Aloha Surf as the Wave is no longer - First and foremost the Staff is really nice & friendly :) The lobby and pool (small, noisy but super cute) area is kept clean with a nice Island vibe. ABC & Food Pantry is very close and the Beach in about a 10 min walk away. Free Breakfast is always a bonus - we ate there 2 out of the 7 days the staff in the buffet area wasn't the friendliest the food was average at best. Sadly our room was not at all the greatest, it was very dirty, the bathroom needed a really good clean, the light fixtures , walls, doors, TV remote, night stand were very sticky and you could see it very clearly, its a shame the cleaning staff missed this all it needed was a good wipe, we ended up buying products and doing a quick clean ourselves. The couch smelt so bad and was so worn out you couldn't sit comfortably on it. BUT the beds were comfy & free WiFi worked well. I am writing a fair review as I myself read reviews often and it really helps. I have traveled and have stayed many places in Waikiki, this is a really nice hotel, great location if you are on a budget and like free breakfasts ..

Recently spent a night here prior to joining a cruise of 4 islands, then one night after the cruise before returning home. It only takes approx. 10 mins, if that, to walk to the beach, shops, restaurants, although there are many side streets with shops and eateries. This hotel is comfortable, clean, has tea coffee making and fridge in the rooms. Breakfast is also included. If like me, you are a Coeliac, the choices are limited, but certainly adequate. It's run by Asians, so there is a leaning towards kimichi, congee wtc, but theres scrambled eggs, fruit, tea/ coffee, juice, pancakes, toast etc and various asian type stir fry medleys. When I arrived the restaurant wasn't open at night, but was on my return, but was Asian food. There's so many other options nearby which are better. Would stay there again.

Stayed 5 nights here in September 2016. Its within easy walking distance of the beach and the main shopping/eating streets of Waikiki and as such is a good place to stay. The reception staff are helpful, the housekeeping staff are lovely and there is a nice, friendly little bar. Eating there was not so great - you get a `free` buffet breakfast but feel like a 2nd class guest as there is much more choice for the walk-in customers and risk getting yelled at if you walk into the wrong section (saw this happen). Also, there was work being done to the pool area so not only was the pool out of action, there was noise and reduced seating at breakfast so we decided to eat elsewhere. The restaurant has no atmosphere at all and is full of Chinese guests eating mountains of food as it is a self-service buffet. Not much else to say except we didn`t need the PlayStation we had to pay for in the room as that wasn`t what we went half way around the world to do. Good views from the higher floors but an ice machine on each floor is what you expect in that part of the world, not 10 floors down! Noisy outside as lots of traffic - the price you pay for a good location.

Older hotel in need of a makeover. Staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast is something akin to a minor scuffle with food involved. Heavily caters for asian clients. As with all hotels in the area, there are hudden "hospitality fees" added to the bill for no reason. All in all, rather average and expensive for a tired hotel.

I stayed a few nights at this hotel with my sister. I am not one to like being in the city, but staying at this hotel was quite convenient! It's a short walk to Waikiki Beach and plenty of shops and restaurants. The rooms are slightly outdated but they were very comfortable and the staff is most helpful! I would stay here again.

This hotel is very good for the money. The staff are very friendly and it's clean. The decoration is very dated but this did not bother us because we where out most of the time exploring. There is a PlayStation 3 in the room and you can rent games and DVDs from the Hotel if you are in the room. There are washers and dryers in the basement and you can get beach towels from reception. You also get free internet. We only went down for breakfast once because it was not my sort of thing so we went out for breakfast. It's only 5 mins from the beach and lots of shopping.

Small room but good shower and amenities Close to everything in WaiikikiWe could walk to supermarket and beach good service with laundry in basement at a small charge Breakfast every morning was Ok and included in priceIt suited our needs for the week we were there

Nice hotel! The staff were very polite and helpful at all times. The room was decent size, clean and had a super comfortable bed! Wifi worked great and the air con worked perfectly. Was a bit further from the beach but was good as it was out of the busy streets so the surroundings were a lot less noisy. Would recommend to family and friends for sure.

My husband and I just visited Hawaii for the first time. I actually fractured my ankle during the trip. They let me borrow crutches for free and called and ordered a wheelchair to rent. The housekeeping staff were very efficient with our needs. I thought our room was cute and up to date. We had an all inclusive package, so we didn't really eat the breakfast, but what we did it wasn't that great. However, I highly recommend this hotel!

I stayed at this hotel for 3 days.The hotel is well located with nice staff.Shops & restaurants everywhere !It is important to do your wonderful holiday in this beautiful landscape, where the hotel Aqua Surf is located.Mahalo!!

Nice lobby. Friendly and helpful staff. Very small room (two single beds and quite dated bathroom) which was fine as we did not spend a huge amount of time there. However, very clean room and lovely housekeeping staff. About three blocks from main drag/beach. Breakfast is a bit ordinary but plentiful. Overall experience was just ok - I would not stay there again.

Good hotel. Nice sized room and did just what we needed for a night in Waikiki. 5 min walk to Waikiki beach and all the shops. Great for sunset. The pool is under construction from sept - October which was a bit inconvenient but they give you a pass to their sister hotel. Parking is an additional 25$ and they hit you with a hospitality fee as well upon check out.
user_name:
kates197
New York City, New York

review_body: My family and I travel pretty often and rarely are we so disappointed that we feel we must warn fellow travelers about an establishment but our experience definitely warrants the following review. My wife booked 3 nights at the Aqua Aloha Surf in error thinking she was booking the Aston Wakiki (a hotel we've stayed at during a previous visit and had a WONDERFUL experience). BIG MISTAKE! Upon noticing the mistake, it was too late to cancel the reservation without penalty so we proceeded to check in. Tripadvisor presented some favorable reviews so we thought this may not be so bad... I WAS WRONG!Upon entering our room, we immediately noticed how dated and small the room was. But the ULTIMATE turn off was not the paint peeling from the dressers, rusted spacesavers in the bathroom or even the accumulated mildew on the bathroom fixtures... it was the potential hepatitis the poor housekeeping exposed my family and I to with the DRIED UP BLOOD i found on one of the dressers!!!Upon bringing the matter to the managers (Julian Martinez) attention, they promptly changed my room. However, this already set the tone for the unpleasant experience. The new room included all of the amenities of the previous room: the rusted and soap scum/mildew infested bathroom, stained couch pillows, etc. However, thankfully, I didn't notice any blood in this room.Given the horrific experience of night 1, I was under the impression that management would at least offer to discount the first night, provide a complimentary room upgrade, SOMETHING! But no... that didn't happen. My wife and I spent the entire night browsing for affordable lodging elsewhere for the duration of our trip. The next day we woke up to having a TERRIBLE breakfast at the hotel. This put the icing on the cake for our decision to end our stay there prematurely. I strongly advice against staying there... as friendly as the staff is, it does not make up for the very poor service and outdated, poorly maintained rooms. I write this review from the comfort of another hotel less than 2 miles from the Aqua Aloha Surf for about $40 less per night!

The room was ok. Old but clean. Medicine was stolen from our safe while we were there. The front desk employees were the most rude and unfriendly people I have ever encountered during any of my travels! The lobby ladies restroom was so filthy that I could not even stay in there long enough to use the facilities. It was sickening!

Great hotel, friendly staff, great central location close to everything !Includes breakfast, wifi (room & lobby) , pool , towels, newspaper & much more.Close to buses that take you all over Oahu or rent a car, underground car park.Tour buses leave from Koa Ave. 200 m walk. Shops & restaurants everywhere !

I have stayed at this hotel a few times and it has never let me down always clean friendly staff very comfy while it isn't a 4 star hotel it is all you need central too every thing super market around the corner and close to the beach a short walk to the new international markets what more could you ask for

The hotel is well maintained and the staff are quite responsive. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. Nice kitchenette. Want to call out Kalei and Cheynne who were particularly helpful and very friendly. Helped with parking and luggage.

Nice and decent. Clean. 2-3 blocks from the beach. Close to Food Pantry (supermarket). Close to shops. Close to bus stops. Offers free shuttle to Ala Moana mall. Staff are friendly. The restaurant serves buffet breakfast lunch and dinner at affordable price. The breakfast which I tried is average. Dont expect fancy food.

The free breakfast is pretty good because the cheapest breakfast down the street is about $10Us ($13Aud) so this was worth it. It's about a 5min walk to the beach if you don't get the red light on the corner . Abc store right near there . They have free wifi also that works pretty good . $15Us a day for resort fee not sure what it's for but every hotel has it. This hotel is the only hotel we found with free breakfast so it's well worth it. The pool area is small but will do if u want a Tan go between 10:30-2:30 other wise the buildings block the sun. They have there own bar down stairs it's pretty good also . Free shuttle bus to alamona shopping centre . The bus has aircon set on zero so wear a jumper even on the hottest day . Dunno why they have ps3's in every room they don't have game for them that I know of . Plenty of Pokemon around there also lol .

All ok...Location of hotel is a bit sketchy as there are a lot of homeless men around. Breakfast is awful. Courtesy bus downright rude and we did not get a pass from the staff so they would not let us on the bus at the shopping centre. Patio looked onto squalor apartments. No tea bags, sugar or creamer in the room - just one single coffee bag and a decaff coffee bag for the perculator.

Booked this place at the travel agency. Couldn't fault one bit. Rooms were big enough, staff were friendly. Great location. Just far enough from the noise of the waterfront. Had a room on the opposite side to the road, helped with the noise. The only thing I wouldn't do again if I stayed here was breakfast. We ended up going out for breakfast which was a bummer. But overall I absolutely loved staying here and would stay again next time.

This BUDGET, Asian Bus Tour hotel is a disgrace. The noise level and breakfasts are disgusting, pay attention to people's comments. The louvre windows in rooms cannot open and are not aligned so the noise level is constant. Aircon.remote so old , it doesn't work. Paint peeling off bathroom walls, towel rail dislodged from wall, no clothes cupboard door, merely a curtain! Reception area of dining area has toilet rolls thrown on cupboard, room dividers hide a multitude of old, dust ridden junk next to tea urn. Juice is so watered down it almost colourless. No variety in cereal (same stale kiddie cereal)fruit is what you expect on a sports field, quartered oranges & apples. No selection, choice or presentation.It is toast with cottage cheese or butter every day. Cooked breakfasts are equally appalling, no exaggeration from guests comments. I couldn't look at it, let alone eat it! Woman checking breakfast pass is surly & unfriendly

Hotel needs TLC. Don't bother with the breakfast, it's a little dodgy. Pool very small Double bedded rooms are Queen and single, not as as stated twin room. Area run down around hotel. However in easy access to beach and town. Staff very polite and nothing is too much trouble

Location was one of two positives. Second one was the day staff. Was a pleasure to meet the wonderful ladies when they came to attend the room daily. Super expensive already, then an added amount daily for cold drink water .... never came across anything like it before. The rooms are dated with an added fire hazard with not enough power points for coffee machine and microwave. Continental breakfast was not continental at all. Very loud street noise. Sorry guys, really disappointing.

This hotel served my needs perfectly. It was a great rate for an affordable stay in Waikiki and I felt that it delivered great value even for that low rate. The staff is terrific in an quiet way; they upgraded me to the next level room without even asking. I enjoyed a king bed room with lanai and city views. The room itself is basic but was everything I needed. The bed was comfortable and I enjoyed the views from my corner location. The air conditioning worked and there was coffee maker and minifridge. They provide free wifi, complimentary beach chair and towel, and free dvd (which I was too busy to use). They just don't nickel and dime you to death. I so greatly appreciated being allowed a late checkout which other hotels can be very stingy about. I felt they were always accommodating. I liked it so much that I brought my friends staying at another hotel by and they decided to switch to this hotel later in the week and also loved their stay.I am surprised at the negative reviews on the breakfast buffet. It was far better than most breakfasts provided at hotels especially in this price range. Sure, it is not the typical American or continental breakfast and it is geared to a more Asian market but the quality was very good. Their scrambled eggs were delicious and they had delicious sponge cake and she was making pancakes all the time. I enjoyed the fried rice with fried cabbage; it was all fresh and delicious. There was also sliced oranges.The lobby is a little worn and dated and it is not one of the swanky hotels on the beach but it was all fine and a great value for the price. There was some noise in the morning so those who are sensitive to that may want to ask for a rear location as some other reviews suggest. I loved my city corner views so the noise was worth it for me. It is only about 3 blocks walk to the beach and is very well located. The bus stop is about a block away and you can take the public bus to Hanauma Bay. Another tip for transportation: I found a shuttle bus company (8088412928) that was only $12.50 each way to the airport. They picked me up right at the hotel and is the lowest rate I could fine. This is my go to hotel now for future trips to Honolulu. Thanks to the staff for being so accommodating and service oriented!

It is not the Hawaiian Hilton, but then it's substantially less money. The service is good, the staff polite. The food is mediocre. I recommend it for families on budget. The morning breakfast is good. It's pretty much standard fare, but certainly better than most breakfasts featured as part of the deal. All in all, it was fine for what it was , --- a moderately priced hotel near Waikiki.

So I gave it a 3 star not because it's a bad hotel at all. It's a 3 star hotel. Staff is great! Price reasonable for Wakiki. I walked to beach, kapiolani park, diamond head state park, etc. parking is very limited. The gym is not a gym - it's a treadmill and one other machine outside in back patio. Don't eat here. Great food just blocks away. Rooms are clean and definitely I'd stay here again on a budget.

The staff were very rude. I have never stayed anywhere where I was treated so badly. Our room was adequate, somewhat worn down but clean enough. The beds were very comfortable. My medication (antibiotic) was stolen out of the safe. They have keys to get into the safe so beware! Don't leave anything valuable or medications in your room! The lobby restroom was so filthy and smelled so badly we could not use the facilities. The location was great. The breakfast was adequate, nothing special. No jelly, jams, or juices were provided.

Stayed here with my husband and daughter last June 14-16 . It was part of the travel package. Room is clean , size is good more than enough for us. There's mini kitchen and sofa. It is clean nothing luxurious. But then who goes to hawaii and stay in their room whole day. Our room is on the 9th floor with the view of apartments beside the hotel lol. Check in was quick, Shane took care of us and was very helpful. We didn't check the breakfast because it is always full of chinese visitors plus we leave really early for the scheduled tours. All in all it was a pleasant stay.

Great location, clean and friendly, the breakfast was an embarrassment to the rest of the hotel, what a shame when everything else was so good. In the end I just didn't go Wi-Fi good with daily cleaning services.

This place looked decent online, but upon arrival it was clear to see that with paint job they attempted to turn a run down hotel into a nice facility. Our rooms were dirty and the bathroom smelt like mold. Parking was full onsite (at this time they state on their website that u don't need a parking reservation) but we were forced to pay double the parking at a nearby lot because they were full. We found two dirty towels between our bed and the wall, right where one would have to put their hands to change the sheets. Leaving me to wonder if they actually did change the sheets. The way I judge establishments is not only what the place does correct but also how they deal with the things that are not done right. The customer service was horrible. I called down to ask for a set of clean sheets and got a rude response with a ill get to it when I can attitude. That being said I think the hotel would be fine for younger kids or those not too concerned about cleanliness or amenities. At the very least it's habitable.

This hotel is situated right in the centre amazing location for food, bars, beach and tours. Staff are really helpful when it comes to booking tours of the island and do it for you for no extra fee. Rooms are good size and maid service every day so are clean and provide clean towels daily. Lovely balcony and view of the river and lovely place to sit at night. As the hotel is situated in the centre it is very noisy all night/morning and often found ourselves waking up. Free continental breakfast was appalling. We chose to pay and go elsewhere. The staff are very friendly and helpful and would really go out their way to help. Pool was small but often empty and in the sun. Free beach towels, beach chairs, wifi and films. Would stay here again good price for everything they offer. Just take extra money for breakfast!

Excellent location,friendly and helpful staff, clean and comfortable rooms and beds.Comfortable walk to beach and shopsBreakfasts were aimed at the Asian market. Bus loads arrived on mass causing much pushing and shoving.I would recommend not paying for the breakfasts as there is very little variety for other cultures. There are plenty of excellent and cost effective breakfast restaurants close by.Sandra New Zealand

was good, close to shooping centre and beach , room was clean , service was good enjoyed my stay , will go back , value for money , will recommoned my friend and family my friend stayed too they like too

The hotel itself is a reasonable three star hotel with very nice and helpful staff. The breakfast was diabolical muck mostly. We are Australian and used to good quality healthy food but this hotels choice for breakfast in a Western country is diabolical. Possibly directed at the Asian market of which there were many in attendance. The only thing I felt I could eat was the raw orange and apple (still with the labels on them) a boiled egg and a pancake with maple syrup and the tea was only warm! A huge disappointment in my opinion! The birds that fly in and perch on the tables and dirty dishes trolley were most annoying.

Lots of amenities, newspapers, coffee, safe, microwave, fridge etc but breakfast quite poor a part from the pancakes. And the location is okay but definitely no room with a view (over looked an apartment block). If can afford it go for an ocean front hotel. Staff were lovely. Got free upgrade to room with sofa area which was nice (where as another couple didn't even have a balcony but did get moved). They seem to try which is good. Needs a bit of updating on the bathroom area and a bedside table both sides of the bed. Only USA hotel been too with 1 normal sized double. Not the hotels fault but wish had stayed at another island, more Pacific like as it's a long way.

Short distance from Waikiki Beach and local restaurants. Checked in late, staff were friendly and helpful but could have given us more information. Room was good size but bathroom was small with not much shelf space. Would say breakfast was an experience I have never had before, hotel guests had a small room attached to their eat as you much want restaurant which was geared to the Chinese. That was very busy and spilt into the guest area making it very difficult to find a seat. Limited choice but got by just a shame that the paying guests got the most choice instead of the hotel guests.

We spent 5 nights in this "hotel". Ants in the bathroom. Small and old room. $25 per night parking.The "delightful" women in the breakfast room were just rude with everybody. No doubt one of them used to work in prison! lol If you're hesitating between this one and another hotel, please choose the other one. I hope I'll never go back to this place despite its perfect location.

We checked in at night and the hotel looked pretty shabby, the room very tiny and old, with noise from the parking area. Tiny, tiny pool! However the breakfast was quite excellent! That was a nice surprise. The location is ok, off the higher end area... nicer in the day time for sure.

On April 26, 2016, We checked into our hotel, The woman who helped us had so much Aloha and greeted us with her beautiful warm smile, being we were from Maui she ask us if it was our first time, I said yes. She told us all what we needed to know. All the staff were very friendly too, I felt like they were my Ohana, they ask if we needed any assistance, the front desk clerk name if I remember was Helene, even if it was only for a night she made our trip awesome. I am looking forward to staying again and told others about it. The rooms were clean and just enough for that night that we got a movie and the next morning my buddy went downstairs for breakfast. I apologize if I didn't do this as soon as possible, due to health issues. But I didn't want this beautiful people go unnoticed. Thank you for having us and making us feel at home away from home. Mahalo nui loa,  Lei Lay Maui, Hawaii

1. We paid in advance to secure our room, but upon arrival, the hotel had no booking for us. They gave us a small room which adjoined a standard-sized hotel room. No partial refund was offered for the inconvenience of accommodating us in an inferior room.2. Ensuite had absolutely NO counter space to put cosmetics or shaving gear. Had to use toilet lid. 3. Noise from the street below was unbearable, even with doors and windows closed. 4. Our reason for selecting this hotel was the offer of continental breakfast. We needn't have held our breath - there was no jam or marmalade; only maple syrup because we were told: "it's too expensive", The dining room where we ate was a DISGRACE. In any other Western country such a building would be condemned, but alas, we sat in a room with ceiling only half there and bits of ceiling were hanging down. The walls had exposed framing and cables, but no plaster. A concertina divider supposedly hid all the junk (ladders, tools etc). behind it. At the conclusion of breakfast, we neatly stacked out plates on the table and got up to leave, when a female employee rushed over and ordered us to clean the table and scrape our leftovers into the uncovered plastic bin situated in the centre of the room. 5. Two doors provided access to this dining room (entry and exit). In the event we mistakenly used the wrong door, we were quickly reminded by a "doorman" in dark shades to go the other way. Pulling a towel taut in front of our faces, he barred us leaving the room. Not once did he speak or smile. 6. Staff at the front desk were friendly enough and obliging. 7. Day Two in the hotel: We asked for milk with our coffee and were directed to a separate room which was specifically allocated to Asian tourists. In that room, we found a vat of milk which we had to scoop out with a ladle! 8. Would NEVER, EVER go there again and would recommend that people avoid this hotel. It is more like a backpackers' hovel.

The night we spent was an included one in a deal. Our check in was very slow. The room was acceptable but I will give the bed a big plus it was a deep mattress and a wide one. The room size was good. There was some amazingly noisy pipes in the room above our bed. After two people showering it was a bit much.An old style aircon was terribly noisy but luckily we hardly needed it. Breakfast was ok if not different. It seemed the Asian people were sitting in one area and westerners in another probably because of breakfast preferences. The scrambled egg was oiley ugh. American hotels seem to have percolators rather than electric jugs.

Our check in was very well managed and timely considering the number of people checking in at the same time, no real introduction to hotel facilities, room was clean and met our needs, would have like to have a jug, plates and cutlery in room. Bed and pillows were great, our room was noisy due to sirens and party goers. We did not use our included breakfast die to what was on offer and the small area available for the hugh volume of guests. overall we were comfortable. general observation, renos are underway but the whole hotel is showing its age. Short walk to beach, ABC shop close by.

Location was great, really handy to the beach, room was great, staff were very friendly and helpful, would definitely stay there again. Breakfast was good, but it did cater for Asians, but it was nice. Reception staff also very nice and friendly.

Location great, handy to the beach and restaurants/bars. Room was basic but very comfortable and for price in the area more than adequate. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful (with the exception of the breakfast staff- I work in hospitality and am very sympathetic to the challenges presented by large tour groups, but I'm sure the independent travellers could be handles differently). Special mention to the housekeeping staff, who were lovely. Thanks for the manager's reception, we enjoyed a few 'wipe outs' by the pool in the rain. Hope to come back again one day!

Location's not bad, far from the beach but walking distance. Hotel room so small when I tried to pack the suitcases my husband had to sit in the bathroom. No chair, no room to put the 2 suitcases in. Same in the bathroom, no shelfs, had to keep toothbrushes in the room. Cockroaches roaming around in the room and bathroom. Staff not so friendly, breakfast tailored only for Asian tourists. when checking out slapped with $ 15,-/day with Hospitality Fees.

We stayed here for 2 nights before taking a cruise, lets get the bad out of the way....VERY tiny rooms, and please..management why cant you screw in a shelf on the wall so we have a place for our toiletries....that was a real pain, no shelf space anywhere....now for the good parts....good price for the area, about a 5 minute walk to the beach .....on the way back from the beach there is 2 ABC stores, KFC,Burger King and a little mall area that has food offerings....we would pick up 6 bear from the ABC and sit on our Balcony in our hotel over looking the canal or enjoying a glass of wine at night....birds were around us and no noise day or night.....desk staff were very helpful....free breakfast had a little western and asian food in their buffet...only wish a bit more fruit but again way enough food......pool area was small but usable...the front desk lent you beach towels and 5 short minutes later we were bobbing up and down in the surf....a hop on hop off was again right at the beach area near the Duke Kahanamoku Statue which was where we entered the beach.we will be doing a cruise again from hawaii and will definitely stay here again...please install a shelf or two though!...oh and very good free wifi

the room was small but very clean and the staff were very nice. I'd definitely recommend based on the location and price. the bathroom lights and air conditioning are dependent on you leaving the key in a slot by the door entrance in order for them to work since removal of the key automatically turns off the systems but fine afterward. Would have been nice for the staff to mention this when checking in.

After staying here for 5 nights, we realized that people really like to complain about evvverything! This was one of the cheapest hotels you can find in Waikiki! It's 10 minute walk to the beach, right around the corner there is a good grocery store, free breakfast (average), wifi, free shuttle to and from ala moana, free & amazing manager reception with free tropical alcohol drinks, chocolate macadamia nuts and live music. Yes, rooms are small, and the AC unit was placed right by our heads, so we just put the.luggage in front so it doesn't bother us much. But other than than it was a clean room, very comfortable bed and great toiletries! You get a mini fridge and a microwave in your room, room safe and a decent closet to store your things. We spent most of the time exploring and going to the beach, so this was not a hang out spot. Who comes to Hawai'i to stay in their room? Staff was super amazing, accommodating and really good about everything!! They let us check out late at no extracharge (1:30pm) & held our bags until we left that night. I think that if you need a good place to see and experience Hawaii, and you don't want anything expensive, you should really consider this place!

The foyer and public facilities were really nice. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms are a bit tired but still very comfortable. Only 5 minute walk from the sand.Conveneint location for anything you want to do in Waikiki.

My stay here was absolutely terrible.- Check in was SLOW and painful- Unit was run down and falling apart, basin was cracked and leaking, grout missing from tiles, mould in showers, louvres all broken and forced shut.- Aircon was 40cm away from the bed and blew into your face, had to use a magazine to angle the air under the bed.- Street noise was the worst - even from floor 7- Rooms were shoebox sized. The person in the room next to me kept banging on the wall for having my tv on volume 1.- The free breakfast was plain and boring. Lady who hosted it kept watching us closely and the minute it ticked 10.00 she would pack it away while we are still toasting our toast.I honestly have nothing good to say about this place. Aqua should seriously consider taking this hotel off their chains until they clean it up a little.We did not choose this place it came in a package deal. I would never go back.I have stayed at $30/night backpackers which are nicer then this place.

Stayer bere 8 nights. Very clean room and beautiful lounge. Wellcomed from the front desk to the roommaid and pancakes maider. They manage very quikly the pipe problem, moving me în a new room, at 16 th floor.All appliances made their job and the coffee îs the best ever.Mahalo!

This hotel is in the perfect location in Waikiki. It is close to restraunts, shopping, and trolley stops. The staff at the hotel were fantastic and very helpful. The rooms were fantastic. There were a few of us staying together and some of us had our rooms upgraded so that we were all together which was great. We were on the top floor and the views were fantastic.Bed wasn't too soft, however I like quite a firm mattress so it was ok. There was a microwave, crockery and cutlery supplied in the room also. The pool was clean and not overpowered with chlorine. It was small, but there were not many peoe in it when we used it.The only problem that we experienced during our stay was the breakfast. There was a toaster and butter, but no spreads. There were pancakes but the only topping was maple syrup and all the other foods available we catered for the Japanese and other asian tourists. Therefore we pn4ly had breakfast at the hotel on the first morning. IHOP was a short walk from the hotel and was very handy!

We were going on a cruise, so just stayed for one night. It was a nice hotel, clean and in a great location near the markets. We had a quiet room and a very comfortable bed but after the 13 hour flight, we may and slept on anything.

they messed up our booking and were extremely difficult for us and our travel agent to deal with. the room was clean but very noisy and the breakfast was awfulthe only thing edible was pancakes, not so great every day for a week !the location was good and the pool was nice but hotel was very tired looking

Don't think my review of the place is any different to other reviewers :). It is a nice clean place. The furniture is a bit outdated and the kitchen does serve food mainly geared for Asian customers. I guess its enough to start off your day. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was kept very clean and fresh towels etc was provided as and when requested. My flight came in at 8am in the morning and the staff were able to accommodate an early check-in for me which was really great as I had my 15 month old. The pool is small (and deep at one end 8ft) but the walk to the beach isn't that far. you get towels and beach chair from the front desk. They even let my kid borrow a boogie board without asking which was great. yes early morning trucks do make some noise but I was so tired from the swimming and exploring to really be bothered by the noise. Overall a nice clean place to stay even with family at a bit of a budget price - accommodation isn't cheap in waikiki.

Rooms are clean but outdated, souroundings are very poor closed restaurant, condemned building. The staff at the front desk are very nice and helpful. The worse part is the breakfast which is only meant for chinese guests: noodles, rice, Brown eggs in mushroom sauce, cabbage with hot peppers....there is bread and a toaster but no jam, no peanut butter....really not a nice breakfast. Complained to front desk but no improvment

Our second time in this hotel. Last time was 6 years ago. It is a modest place nothing grand, but affordable. We had the moderate room the least costly. It has all the amenities you need. Who stays in a hotel room when the beach is 5 minutes away. Waikiki.Front rooms can be noisy due traffic on the road. The front desk staff is very helpful .The restaurant is another thing. Buffet breakfast is included. A Chinese restaurant in the lobby. 0700 until 0900 exact!! Do not be late.

Have stayed here a few times now and nothing much has changed since our first stay about 10 years ago. Rooms are clean but dated, breakfast is very average but the hotel is in a great location 2 streets back from the beach and if Waikiki has one thing its plenty of eating options! My tip is unless you're an early riser try and get a room at the back of the hotel as those facing the street can get a bit noisy early in the morning. Also, if your flight arrives early in the day its worth booking a room for the preceding night (depending on what rate you can get) so you can have a shower and change as they rarely have rooms available before the afternoon.

We were late getting there because to airlines. They didn't have record of our stay.. Put us in a room we didn't ask for and the food was horrible. The desk people were rude. We will never stay there again.. We hated the card electricity... put a room card in a box to have electricity......

In February this year, my husband and I (from Australia) stayed at the Aqua Aloha Waikiki for the third time and we had friends (from Kentucky, USA) meeting us there. Tim Clark, the Manager, and the reception team were wonderful when we arrived early in the morning and checked us in early too. They were very welcoming and helped us with some final booking requests. This hotel may not be right on the water, or 5 star, however it is very comfortable, clean, easy to walk to everything, welcoming, professional and has a very helpful concierge desk. I would recommend using Michael at Concierge for any bookings, he is honest and supportive! Shout out to Cheyne on Reception for giving us all the info and advice on the Big Waves/The Eddie and for just being so helpful! We will be back again soon! Thanks again - Eliza and Craig!

The hotel is a bit old. But...it is clean and the staff are attentive and helpful. The breakfast is nothing to crow about. It is exactly two blocks to the beach from here. The hotel supplies beach towels. Shopping and dining are all within walking distance. The price is right. But, do yourself a favor. Book an upper floor with a balcony. The lower rooms are quite small. I would stay here again.

Good points - hotel was only a few short blocks from the beach and shops. The front of house staff were extremely helpful and considerate. But, when I first checked in, they gave me an out of the way room that actually had itchy things (?) in the bed, so I immediately asked for another room. I felt they didn't get many singles and so those rooms weren't used much. Whatever, that was a horrible experience, but the rest of my stay was delightful and I really appreciated the proximity to the beach!
user_name:
Independent1776
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is in a good location, within walking distance to Waikiki Beach. At the time of our stay there was construction everywhere so it was a bit noisy. There is free continental breakfast and it is decent. We didn't realize until after we checked out that they charged $25 per day for parking onsite, which by the way there is very little parking, very tight underground area. The rooms were a decent size and clean. The shower area was decently clean. The AC and refrigerator worked well. Overall, it's not a bad place to stay. I felt safe in the area and would stay here again.

Aqua Aloha is in a great spot as a quick walk to the shops and beach in Waikiki. The front of house staff were the best thing about the restaurant as all helpful and friendly. We got complimentary breakfast with our booking, unfortunately the buffet area and the breakfast options at the buffet are very undesirable and the lady that takes your buffet ticket and flips pancakes was really rude!! Also there is an area outside where you can eat breakfast but there are many dirty pigeons around and they are all over tables etc - a bit grose when you are eating they are spreading there filthy diseases over the tables you eat from. The buffet restaurant leave a trolley outside so you can put your dirty dishes in there - the pigeons are all over it and it is really unhygienic and off putting while you are eating. The room itself is a little dated and tired looking, but tidy enough. We were on floor 10 and it was quite noisy - road traffic and could hear parties going on quite loudly. Also there was a door which adjoined to the next room and the walls were quite thin as we often heard the tv very loud in the next room and also heard other more "physical" activities going on rather loudly too! Good things about Aqua are the location, beach towels to take to the beach and also free DVD rental and nice staff.

We stayed here for 7 days, we were charged for a long distance calls that we did not even used the phone, my wife talked to the front desk and they waived it right away. It was a good place! Room was clean, staff were friendly and helpful specially to Vinh and Nolan! This 2 guys are awesome! I will definitely come back here, however the breakfast is always the same, hopefully they will changed the menu sometimes but other than that, it was good and close to beach and amenities.

Not worth it the have an extra charge for housekeeper but all they did was place clean towels on top of the luggage in the room. And extra for parking but it not always available. Also rooms are old and outdated and not very well maintained. Was not able to eat the free breakfast since we forgot the voucher room key not acceptable. The sliding door didn't lock and we had a superior room with a view It was nothing to brag about. Save your money don't stay!!!

Grossest hotel we have ever stayed at.stains on towels, we didn't even feel like we could sit on the couch it was so gross.within 5 minutes of being in the room we saw 2 cockroaches, one 2-3 inches long. Breakfast was odd, very Japanese (noodles and fried rice)
user_name:
Jennifer20087
Fargo, North Dakota, United States

review_body: Good value for money in a rather expensive Honolulu. It's close to the beach and main roads.The hotel and rooms are a bit older, but it's not a blocker. The room is equipped with a fridge and microwave. Would skip breakfast though, definitely not good. Small remark: didn't appreciate that at 8:30 in the morning housekeeping was at my door and insisted I would leave the room at once.

First time Ive not bothered with breakfasts as just watched pigeons pooing and feeding off dishes near pool area. Noise is unbearable at nights due to main road. Gym not private and couldnt use pool due to maintenance guys there.

Excellent location amazing staff great prices n close to a lot of shopping, I would definitely go back with my family , my Lil girl wants to move to Hawaii ,we all had a fabulous time for our first time in Hawaii can't wait to go again someday soon

Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights while visiting Honolulu. Our room was very big and comfortable,with a balcony , with a gtreat view of the Canal, Golf Course and mountains in the distance! 5 minute walk to the Beach and the Hotel provides you with free. Beach towels and beach chairs!Staff very friendly and could not do enough to make our stay memorable! The breakfast was buffet style and was very good! Microwave, Coffee Maker and fridge in room! Free shuttle to Shopping Mall from nearby hotel is available!

Accomodation clean, of an earlier period, or built for Japanese trade, an comfy. I cant stand big rooms and huge beds. The front desk made me make a deposit, suggesting vacation trade can be abusive. I tipped the maid in hand and got my money back. Breakfast aplenty, but hard to find salt and pepper for eggs, -the scene was mayhem and messy. Good though, and fresh orange slices helped. Out the door two blocks to fabulous Waikiki, the reason to book this for sure. Honolulu has few inland hotels, too bad because life is not a beach. Apple store 4 blocks and tons of glitzy shopping, next wedding I honeymoon here for sure with my banker bride. Good dining everywhere!

Hotel is close to everything you are looking for in Waikiki. Waikiki beach three blocks away, Public transit one block away, Food store two blocks away, Numerous restaurants all close by. And yet hotel is situated in a quiet neighborhood. The staff set this hotel apart from all the rest, friendly, positive can do attitude that is unsurpassed. The breakfast is fresh and plentiful a great way to start the day. I always look forward to coming back to my home in Waikiki.

Rooms are comfortable and clean, super location close to beach, amenities are good with an excellent breakfast buffet. The entire staff including cleaning personal are professional, friendly, courteous, and the absolute best. Staff treats us as family on our return visits. We have stayed here at least 5 times and this is always our first choice when choosing a hotel.

Super friendly and helpful staff! Michael at the concierge desk was amazing. Everyone at the front desk was welcoming and a pleasure to deal with. This is an amazing value for the price, it is a 5-10 minute walk to the beach (just depends on your pace) and has great mountain views. If you aren't looking to spend $$$$$$ on your room, this is the place for you.

We requested a room with a view of Ali Wai and we are very pleased to have the room with a balcony that has everything we asked for. The location is ideal for walking to Diamond Head tennis courts in one direction and Waikiki beach in another. Every employee has been friendly and helpful, but there are three that I would like to say have given us outstanding service. They are Vihn, Nolan and Merlinda.

We stayed here for two nights on a layover from the U.S. to Australia. This was a great choice for many reasons:* Staff: we arrived before check-in. The staff member at reception. I am sorry I don't remember his name, I was rather jet lagged. He asked us if we wanted beach towels so we could go for a swim. It was a very simple and thoughtful gesture. It made me feel at home immediately.* Location: it is only a couple of blocks away from Waikiki Beach. It is located right next to a Japanese Seafood Buffet. Across the road from that is an ABC store, a Thai Restaurant and many other restaurants, supermarket, etc. * Breakfast buffet: an Asian/American buffet. There is probably enough food for everyone but I was slightly disappointed that there was no tropical fruit and the coffee was not drinkable, but perhaps that is just my personal taste. I had some of the Kona coffee in reception instead. * The pool area is not big but it is enough and really, the beach is where you want to be. * We had a nice view of the mountains, and some water view. * Our room had a little kitchen, with plates and utensils. We had all that we need. We didn't have time to get the complimentary DVDs and we didn't use the complimentary beach chairs. I enjoyed my stay and I would stay again.

This place did not end up being as bad as some reviewers had mentioned. I found the service to be great. The room wasn't anything special, but it was clean with no cockroaches. The air conditioner worked fine, although I wish I had the option of blowing it in a direction that was not right on the bed.

Travelling around the world I have never had such a friendly reception from staff with free cocktail hour on a Tuesday done by the manager and a box of chocolates from a director the open foyer with relaxed seating and free coffee and complimentary coffee 5 minute walk to beach and at a great price for this part of town thanks to Craig Tim and Shane for a great holiday and service well done and highly recommend

We checked in on 1/16/16. Excellent location, walk to town, but quite noisy with street traffics.The room was horrible! AC in wall was right next to the bed..blew right on the head, or if off, too hot in the room. Very old looking, and ancient carpeting. Lobby is fine. Breakfast is free, but unless you like cold pancakes, tasteless scrambled eggs or Asian style fare, lo mein, kimchee, steamed tasteless buns, eat the dry cereal or hard boiled eggs. Vinh, at the front desk, was great! He was able to change our room the n still day to a much better one, still old, but with a lanai.Very much in need of refurbishing. We would not recommend it.

Hotel is very close to every thing in Waikiki area. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I was surprised that they provide free breakfast. It is more than continental breakfast, more like full fare with both Asian and western breakfast buffet food. The room is rather small but it is clean and for the price in Waikiki, this hotel is hard to beat. I am especially impressed by how friendly everyone of the staff is. They are very welcoming and happy to see you stay at their hotel. Room is somewhat noisy as the noise from the road does travel up to the roomI will definitely come back to the same hotel againMahalo

The hotel isn't right on the beach, but it's in a wondrful location just far enough away to avoid all the tourist noise at night but close enough to have a short walk to the beach and Duke's. But THE STAFF are amazing! They treat the guests so awesome. I would come back here just for that. Their corporate reservations people suck and have bad customer service so avoid them, but the hotel staff is among the best people I've ever encountered. Thoroughly impressed!

Is worth the money. They really should call it a full meal rather than continental. Tons of unhealthy and healthy options to choose from. I really enjoyed the buffet that extends tothe neighboring restraunt.

Great hotel. The staff are amazing. So helpful. I love the relaxed and welcoming feel. The little extras like staff walking around and talking to guests, the complimentary house specialty drink time in which guests are all mingling together just made my solo trip all the more enjoyable. Yes, the rooms are a little dated but they are clean. The location is perfect- a short walk from the beach and main areas. I didn't use public transport at all to get around the Waikiki area. Will definitely stay here again if I return to Hawaii in the near future! Special mention to Doug- this guy was my personal savior a number of times and just a warm and welcoming face. I hope he gets the recognition he deserves!!

We were a group of three friends who paid equal amounts for a room with three beds for a 10 night stay.Disappointments:• The website said one king bed and one single and sleeps three. But when we arrived, it was two single beds and one sofa bed. Three adults can in no way fit on two single beds that were not even joined. • The sofa bed was terrible, could feel every spring in it. When we informed staff they gave us another wheel in bed but that was just as bad. They made no attempts to relocate us to a different room. Thought this was unfair as we all paid equal amounts and so all deserve a proper decent bed to sleep in.• We decided then to put the mattress on the floor and take turns sleeping on it, and even though room service saw our mattress on the floor they made no attempts to rectify this, a simple sorry would have gone a long way.• One light in the room was missing, which meant we had to rely on the bathroom light for one half of the room• They never left enough toilet paper for us, so for those 10 nights we asked for toilet paper every day. Wouldn’t be the worst idea to leave a stock of them in the bathroom though.• Room service meant doing the beds and literally nothing else. The shower and toilet wasn’t cleaned once for those ten nights.• The room had no salt, pepper, sugar, tea or milk. Only one sachet of coffee was provided for 10 days. No kettle or toaster either.• Some curtains wouldn’t work and that meant we could only close half of the window, so we always had light streaming into our room at night. Not good!• At breakfast time, we were meant to present the breakfast lady with our breakfast cards, after a few days I forgot mine and though she recognised me she wouldn’t let me have any food unless and until I went upstairs and got my card which she would just scribble on. It was embarrassing being denied food, considering she had seen me every day for the past 5 days and knew I had a breakfast card. Not like she was keeping count or making a record of anything.• Also during breakfast there were a bunch of rules: “Only two eggs per person”. No jam or honey was provided either and it was the same breakfast all 10 days. • They said they had a gym but there were a grand total of 3 machines and 2 of which were incredibly rusted and the treadmill was always covered and not accessible. We’re new to this country and paid a pretty decent amount for this accommodation, I don’t expect 5 star quality, but the general amenities would have been nice. The staff were helpful when we asked about tours and other activities and did give us some helpful advice. A big thank you to staff member Douglas who has amazing customer service. I hope you get promoted if you’re not already the manager there! Overall a few small tweaks would have really made our experience there a pleasant one. If the bed situation was resolved I’d have not paid mind to the rest of the annoyances.

Generally we had a great stay at the Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki, the hotel is ideally located in Waikiki with close access to the beach a lot of restaurants and shopping. The rooms are nice and spacious and the staff super friendly and accommodating.The breakfast option is not really worth extra and we ended up eating other places most days. The main 'complaint' is though the noise level - we stayed at the 4th floor and was woken very early (no later than 5am) every night either by people having parties in the nearby buildings or by delivery and/or garbage trucks using the nearby parking lot which is the entry to the local supermarket.Guessing it might have been worth while asking for a room not facing the parking lot and perhaps a bit higher up would have helped as well. As we were quite jetlagged arriving in Honolulu we made the most of our early mornings and got early out to explore the island.

I will be checking out on Monday. My stay has been okay. Housekeeping is a little lax, and upkeep on the rooms is just so so. Parking is a nightmare here and very costly at $25 a night. Washer and Dryer is very old and worn out. Dryer doesn't get clothes dry. Staff is very friendly, sheets and towels clean. Beds are nice. Overall it is an average hotel in a excellent location.

The hotel is located near the Waikiki shopping disctrict and about a 5-10 minute walk to the beach. The room was small but clean with everything we needed including hair dryer, iron, TV, small fridge, coffee and tea on the main floor. Complimetary continental breakfast was included which was mostly fruit and pasteries. We only spent one night but we were quite pleased with the staff support and presentation of the room. Staff were friendly and helpful.

We stayed at this hotel from Christmas through New Years and we had so much fun. The hotel was really within walking distance to everything. It was clean, but the rooms are super small. However, we never spent much time there anyway, so it didn't matter much to us. We had a wonderful trip!

Stayed at this hotel in august 2015 with another couple , the hotel was ideally situated to explore Honolulu ,the staff were friendly and the rooms were clean , But a little dissapointed with hawaii , we went to pearl harbour and an island tour , they were both ok but nothing to get too excited about ,the locals were friendly and the island was clean and tidy , but if anyone asked my opinion i would tell them go to spain or the canaries instead , why spend 11 hours flying half way across the world when you can get the same weather and scenery in europe. and a lot cheaper too

We arrived at Aqua Aloha Surf. The place was open and clean and the staff, though confused by pre-bookings in various names, eventually sorted us out. Up several floors to the room, and we found basic fittings and fixtures in a quite large room to be shared by myself and a family member. The noises of Waikiki came in and the night and early morning noises of hotel operations echoed through the single glazed windows. The air conditioners were very noisy to operate. The beds were comfortable and with earplugs fitted, allowed for a great night's sleep. Showers were fine. We breakfasted with a lovely Californian gentleman called Tom on several occasions. Having been given a clip-card for a continental breakfast, we proceeded down to eat. Most of us were expecting to be welcomed to a selection of fresh fruits to be juiced as we chose. Instead we found porridge and American coffee with creamer powder or liquid. The pancakes were plain and maple syrup was offered as a topper. It seemed to be the most edible choice. There were also cocktail franks and very little else. If you have had croissants and fresh rolls with eggs and various sliced meats and cheeses in Europe, you would not call the breakfast continental, but American.The fruit doves and big pigeons and sparrows accompanied each other to the tables. They stole food if you left it momentarily, They walked on eating surfaces and left the general area unsightly.We only breakfasted there twice in five days and chose to go elsewhere. Ohana East being a good option. The staff were friendly and helpful every tourist option seemed to be close to hand and the trip was wonderful.

This hotel is at a good location.The best part of the stay was customer service: Douglas was helpful and accomodating.He was always smiling and made you feel like you had chosen the right place to stay!Other than that everything else was very basic.We stayed in the back of the hotel and on a high floor so room was quiet and we slept very well.We did not have a nice view but we were only there for one night so it didn't matter that much.Breakfast was average: continental breakfast.The hotel is overdue for an an update/faceliftThe sofa in the bedroom is stained and old.the furnishings look old and worn.It could do with new furnishings with better colors.If you wanted just to stay 1-2 nights then it is fine but I would not choose this hotel for a long stay

Only a couple of blocks from the beach in waikiki. The breakfast was terrible!The rooms are small but that's all you need - who spends time in their room when they are in waikiki?The staff were friendly.The parking was self park and very easy to access.

Can't go wrong with this hotel and the location itself. It is walking distance to the beach a couple blocks away but it's hawaii enjoy the sun. Not by the beach itself but very accessible. I was here for business with side leisure a couple of hours a day so i made the most of it. The hotel is clean and after several requests from housekeeping, they served with a great smile. I commend the staff for attending to my wife's demands even after past midnight. Will definitely recommend this hotel to friends as this hotel doesn't break the wallet.

I had an all around enjoyable stay here at the Aqua Surf.The first thing I noticed was that the front entrance wasn't closed. In Japan, all hotels are closed entrance, with a front door, but here in Hawaii, the entrance was opened. It was a first time experience for me to see this. It felt really homie, like I'm in paradise.Obviously, this isn't a high class, 5 star hotel, so I wasn't expecting that experience. But I felt like I received something close. I don't understand how this hotel gets low ratings. I loved it here. My only complaint is not necessarily for just the hotel, but for all of Hawaii. In Japan, we have bidets in all the bathrooms, but not having one here was a little inconveniencing. I hope Hawaii can install some in the near future.They even went out of their way and gave me a complimentary upgrade when I asked if they had any rooms with a balcony because my room didn't have one. I had a pretty amazing view. over all, I had a wonderful stay! looking forward to coming back again next year.

This hotel is well located near Waikiki beach but doesn't charge the high prices of others nearby. Its daily "resort charge" of US$16 per day is one of the best in the area. In addition it provides breakfast at $6.00 per day. It's a basic breakfast but sufficient if like us you are a budget traveller. The hotel is clean with airy rooms and each room has a microwave. There is a supermarket nearby called the Food Pantry where one can buy cost saving meals. In addition the bus stop for no 23 for Diamond Head and 42 for Pearl Harbour is located outside the Food Pantry. Reception were friendly and helpful.

The staff went out of their way to see we were looked after. My fiancé and myself were treated great. We got champagne in an ice bucket delivered and chocolate. The room was nice and very clean. I would definitely stay here again.

Probably the best part of my two night stay was the service. The reception staff were always helpful when we wanted to make restaurant reservations or shuttle bookings. On the whole the hotel itself is okay, but nothing outstanding.- The reception area is nice and big and has free WIFI- Breakfast is included and it's a step up from a continental. You get two hard boiled eggs, toast, porridge, fruit, pancakes, donuts, sausages, and juice.- WIFI in your room is included in the resort fee they charge (which is extra on top of the nightly rate).- The rooms have pretty crappy windows (those ones that are made of multiple panels of glass and open like a set of blinds) so it can get pretty noisy at all times of the day/night.- The bed my partner and I slept on was pretty tiny (just a double not a queen or king). For some reason the other couples we were with all had larger beds than us.- The shower pressure is average.- The door between the room with the sink and the room with the shower/toilet was a fold out screen (a pretty poor excuse for a door).- Coffee is included in the resort fee but not tea, and there was no kettle in our room but we did have a fridge. They don't give you milk either, just creamer.- The room is actually really spacious and has a couch which is great!On the whole it was a nice stay. Great location (close to the shops and beach), nice staff. It was cheap ish compared with lots of the other places in Waikiki so I would probably stay there again if I couldn't afford a beach front hotel.
user_name:
jktweed
New York City, New York

review_body: Our experience with this hotel was phenomenal! Nothing can compare with the service we received from the front desk to the housekeeping staff. We arrived late but check in was a breeze! Staff were always ready and willing to assist when they could. The room was clean, bed was comfortable and pillows were just right for me. We used AC the first couple nights but we're soon used to the climate that we only had the windows open at night. I found the room adequate for our needs, we were only sleeping there. We didn't go to Hawaii spend a lot of time in the room. The location was good, we were close enough to walk to the beach, other hotels to be picked up for our excursions and to all great restaurants. After they found out that we were newly engaged, they sent up champagne and chocolates...that was a really unexpected treat. Breakfast was ok (pancakes, mini donuts, cake, muffins, 2 types of dry cereal, hot oatmeal, cocktail sausages, rice and boiled eggs, white/brown bread to make toast), nothing over the top but filled our hungry tummies in the morning. This was part of our holiday package otherwise I believe it was $6/day. There is a $15/day hospitality fee but this fee is at all hotels and some hotels were more. Free DVD rentals were an added bonus too! We will definately make this our hotel the next time we come! Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki...we will be back!

We stayed at here for 1 week as it was part of a package deal but we won't be returning. The Hotel is tired and needs a makeover. Our room on the seventh floor was small with no overhead lighting and only two bedside lamps. The aircon unit which sits in the window cavity was noisy. There wasn't even a chair in the room. The breakfasts on offer (the same everyday) were disgusting consisting of boiled rice, hard boiled eggs kept warm in a metal warmer, mini sausages the size of my little finger, something that looked like a lumpy porridge, two cheap cereals but only very small bowls to pour it into, bread to toast but no jams or honey etc. Ended up having a boiled egg sandwich on toast. The best on offer were freshly made small pancakes and maple syrup. Oh and small slices of a cake and mini crunchy donuts (which I observed being emptied out of a packet.) The people who have the contract to supply these 'breakfasts' are seriously letting the Hotel down. After two mornings we gave this breakfast a miss and either bought fresh fruit or ate at the Food Pantry around the corner. Several other visitors were doing the same and commented about how disgusting the breakfasts were. You were even expected to and told to if you didn't scrape your scraps into a bin on a trolley and stack your plates and cutlery before leaving. What kind of Hotel asks its patrons to do this????
