What a first! We observed 'the lady' following a departing family and TELLING them to 'go back and clear your table!' It wasn't even them who had left the 'so called mess.' The staff were polite and helpful and I'm sure they are aware of the dissatisfaction of guests re the breakfasts. These same people also had a buffet lunch and dinner on offer but we rarely saw anyone eating there. One couple did try it and said it was the worst meal they can remember. The best compliment I can offer is the location which is just two blocks (a five minute walk) from the beach and plenty of food outlets close by and an ABC Store a few minutes down the street. We discovered the restaurant at Hotel across the road and ate there four nights. Their food, wide menu choices, prices and service were excellent. We saw plenty of guests from our Hotel eating there too! This is where we intend to book into on our next stay in Waikiki.

Our travel agent found us this hotel, but we had googled it as well so had idea of what to expect. We thought the position was quite good, very close to pick up points for different tours eg Pearl Harbour and an easy maybe 15 min walk to Waikiki Beach. All depends at how many shops you stop at as they are everywhere. Especially the ABC stores, no not like the Oz ones by the way, these have everything you need. Back to the Hotel, most staff were pleasant we thought, we were checked in by Douglas who was very helpful and we got an upgraded room, bonus.... Room was nice and clean, bathroom, toilet spotless and large TV. Balcony had chairs...One problem we had was the coffee sachets were split inside the packets and could not be used because of the machine. Very small problem but a little annoying after a while..... would we stay there again?. Yes...... we're 63/ 56 age group

Like you, I did an exhaustive search on Waikiki hotels. I narrowed it down to several and then selected AAS ( Aqua Aloha Surf). The staff is impressive and responsive; what else can I say? The place is super clean. The room (10th floor) was quiet and plenty large for our needs and there was a pull out sofa sleeper. The balcony was comfortable and large with a great view of city or it could be canal on other side. Frig and m/w were most useful. TV was large and rotated for either bed (king) or sofa viewing. The hotel shares a parking lot with THE ONLY supermarket in Waikiki and the Food Pantry has a great bakery; thank you very much. They also provide beach chairs and towels so we spent lots of time on the main beach which is 2 blocks from hotel. They even provide umbrellas for the rainy days and we had several. You are an easy walk from several great restaurants including Moana Beach restaurant $$$$, Tanaka, and a wonderful noodle asian place. The breakfasts in house until 9 am are excellent i.e. oatmal and freshly made to order pancakes are great plus toast, fresh fruit and such. Not a complaint here. We were half block from a major bus stop and used it to go everywhere on island. We also booked a Roberts Circle Island tour on-line for $ 37 for eight hours! Excellent and we brought our own lunch from Food Pantry. We would not hesitate to return. Loved the experience. Rolf

What ever you do don't stay at this place staff was not helpful the rooms were dirty and very small no light in bedroom had to use a lamp my bed had dirty sheets,come and clean the room at 4pm she was not even going to make the beds birds flying around the lobby and the breakfast area and then we had to pay an extra 15 dollars a day for house keeping if I had know all this would have booked somewhere else.

We arrived late at night so went straight to our room which was cramped to say the least. No chairs so had to sit on the bed. We were on the 16th floor and as neither of us is very good with heights we asked the next morning if we could move to a lower floor. The lady at reception was very helpful and got us a room on the fourth floor, which was great - we could sit on the balcony! Both rooms were in need of redecoration and the furniture was old and scuffed and not very good quality. The location of the hotel was good - just turn right out of the hotel and a five minute walk gets you to the beach.There was a restaurant but it never seemed to be open to the hotel guests (we were told it was not run by the hotel) and the "continental breakfast" was served, not in the restaurant but in a very inadequate space near the pool. The choice at breakfast was poor, there were not enough tables and chairs for the number of guests, we had to clear our own tables and put the crockery and cutlery on a trolley! Not what we would expect from a hotel. Meanwhile, the restaurant - where we guests were not allowed to enter - was serving all sort of hot food to people who came from who knows where. I know most people go to the beach when in Waikiki but the pool at this hotel was weeny - half a dozen people and it would be standing room only!So, all in all a mixed experience, a hotel with no restaurant and no bar, but a big thank you to the reception staff who were all very helpful and pleasant.

fantastic rooms serviced daily old but clean forget breakfast its horrible no other word for it centrally located friendly and helpful staff would book this again without breakfast we were there for Halloween there is a free cocktail in lounge every Tuesday it was a great stay convenient to beaches and all shopping

Nice people at the reception but in general the hotel needs painting. Beside that we experienced a lot of noice in the very small room the whole night from the street and a terrible socalled continental breakfast (hard boiled eeg, cooked rice, toast and margarine) - sorry to say!

We stayed at the Aqua Aloha Surf from November 1 - 11, 2015. We enjoyed it very much. Waikiki Beach was just a short walk away. Lots of shopping close by. The pool was small but never was crowded. Our room was small but we were only there to get cleaned up and sleep. The continental breakfast was ok. A bit more variety would of been great. Overall is was great.

The Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki hotel is the hotel I stayed when I visited Hawaii. It is located in the heart of Waikiki. Overall my impression of this hotel is great... but not excellent. For starters, I do not like the food selection that was offer in the hotel restaurant menu but it doesn't really matter because their are a lot of restaurants to choose from nearby. I had a pretty bad experienced on my first night there. There was no power and electricity, so management offered me an upgraded room on the second floor free of charge, which I decline because there was no balcony on that floor. Turns out to be an excellent choice because my room on the 14th floor had some of the most amazing and spectacular views. Very romantic too, if you are staying with an spouse. Continental breakfast is free... but is bland... consists of pancakes, boiled eggs, glazed ham, a variety of fruits, coffee, tea, and juice. Not bad when you wake up and feel hungry. One of the perks that I came to admire is the hotel offers their guests free towels and a beach chair... on the condition that it must be returned when guests are finish with it. Hotel also offer free wi-fi, had an gym, sauna, swimming pool, which I never had a chance to use because I swim in the beach instead. I would recommend this hotel to travelers, especially if they are Canadians and if they are on an budget. Aqua Aloha Surf charged me in Canadian funds, which was very affordable and rate was very reasonable. Hotel also offer shuttle service to mall and airport. I would rate this hotel 'A'.

We stayed at Aqua Aloha between 2-11 NOV and found it excellent.The location was great and the room was very clean and a good size. I found the breakfast perfectly adequate for a complementary breakfast. There was fresh pancakes. eggs, toast, cereal and fruit.I also loved how the manager hold a complementary cocktails on a tuesday they were great.All in all i would recommend this hotel for anyone on a low to medium budget.

Aqua is a chain hotel in Waikiki that offers lots of different properties. This is probably one of their lower scale hotels. That being said, they have an updated lobby, friendly and helpful staff and free wifi. The night before we stayed down the street at a low-budget motel and this hotel felt like a palace compared to where we had stayed previously. It was a nice upgrade for us! The staff is very helpful and attentive. They held our bags and gave us beach towels and we headed out until it was time for us to check in later in the afternoon. Overall we had a nice, very pleasant stay.

I was sent to Hawaii for work for three weeks, a very different proposition than going there on vacation. The Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki proved the perfect home base for me and my team. The rooms are always clean and the staff are top notch. In particular, I want to commend Shane, Kalei, Malakei and Douglas for making me feel right at home. I hope that someday I'm able to come back with family for a vacation. If that happens, The Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki will be our first choice for lodging.

My partner and I stayed here for a week. It was comfortable enough but nothing flash or extravagant about it at all. Breakfast was ordinary and very basic, only go there if you have no money to eat elsewhere else.Staff are pleasant and helpful.

Stayed for 8 nights in October 2015.Room was clean but I dont think the sheets were changed every 3 days as we thought.We weren't impressed with the breakfast and when we went to get the free shuttle to Ala Moana we were told there was only two seat left (there were about 8 people waiting) We voiced all our complaints and were given a partial refund of our fees so that was ok. Staff were friendly and helpful and It had a laundry which was a big plus.

Check in was sort of rough, not being able to find our reservation. Until Kalei came over and helped me find our reservation and breeze through check in. The room was perfect size for all of us for a last minute booking. I loved the bed, and the size of the balcony was perfect for me. I really enjoyed everything about this hotel. No distractions, or disruptions. Only for an overnight stay we try many hotels in Waikiki, because we stay in Waikiki every month. This hotel was our next pick and it's been put to top 4 of the 10 hotels we've stayed at in Waikiki. Close to the ABC store and Burger King, really secluded at the corner of kanekapolei. We will certainly be having a longer weekend stay at this hotel again.

I stayed in room 1203 (a corner room). The room seemed much larger than your average hotel room for the price. The room had all the kitchen amenities, a safe, decent air-con and so on.The view is half decent (see photo), but mostly of other towers next door.The included breakfast is perfectly adequate.Check ahead, as they also include a complimentary airport shuttle ticket, which I was not aware of and subsequently had already booked and paid for a different shuttle.

My son and I recently took a trip to waikiki and stayed at the Aqua Aloha Surf. We loved it! Beds were super comfortable, rooms clean, with coffee pot, refrigerator, microwave and the view was great. we stayed in room 1505 and had a great view of the canal and mountains. Not to mention a huge tree below us that so many different types of birds would gather in and chirp away in the mornings when we drank our coffee on the balcony. The staff was great and very helpful whenever we had questions about anything in the city. Waikiki beach is about a 5 min walk from the hotel and food, entertainment, and shuttles are all right around the corner. EVERYTHING IS just a short walk from this place. We recieved free continental breakfast every morning that consisted of pancakes, fruit, hawaiin sweet bread, oatmeal, toast, eggs and coffee or juice. Also, the hotel supplied beach towels, beach chairs, and boogy boards for our daily adventures on the beach. The price was great for the area and our hotel stay was great. We hated to leave and are already planning our return in February. This is an amazing place and the Aqua aloha surf is a great and afordable way to enjoy your stay while on the island.

This was a great hotel to stay at. We chose the 'middle rate' room from a travel site. The room wad clean, the bed very comfortable. Fridge, Microwave, coffemaker and a Playstation with a free DVD/Game vending machine in the lobby! Walking distance to many restaurants and Waikiki beach. Relatively easy access to H1. No insects at all in the room, shower gels are actually not bad either. Continental breakfast was decent compared to many I've seen. Pool was clean and comfortable. The staff was authentically happy and helpful. Only minor complaint is the room was smaller than it seemed in the picture, but for one couple it was fine. I would also call the room 'romantic' for couples.

This is good for a budget hotel. As other reviewers have mentioned, it is very tired and needs refurbishment. However, the rooms are a reasonable size and clean. Complimentary shampoo and soap is provided along with a coffee maker and coffee. The staff are friendly and helpful. I thought the pool was good and clean. The breakfast is a bit sad and some grape jelly/jam for the toast would have been appreciated.The location is good - very close to bus stops and only a couple of blocks from the beach and restaurants. Unfortunately it is quite noisy but we found that the constant hum of the air conditioner drowned out the traffic noise and we slept well.We stayed 7 nights and would stay here again. It is an excellent hotel for the price we paid.

We had a two day stay in Honollulu on our way to Maui and found this hotel on the Internet. For the price it was okay. Place is clean and staff friendly. Room looks like it dates back to the 70's . Small kitchen with microwave, little frig. Bathroom is tiny and shower just okay. Outside pool, again just okay. Two blocks from Waikiki Brach and many restaurants. Parking is a major problem, not many spaces and always full, plus they charge for it. For two days it worked, a week may have been tough.

The hotel is situated somewhat further from the waterfront, but that is no real issue. There is parking ($22 / day) on site, which is comfortable, but not cheap. The hotel itself is outdated, and needs renovation. It is clean.Rooms are small but ok, wet cell really small and needs restoration.The breakfast is nothing more than some sweet pancakes or dry toast with an egg-not worth it. The pool is just there to make it a three star hotel. Overall it is just reasonable.

got to hotel at 11.30 pm, then told about have to pay over 300.00 for fees and parking. got to room if can call that, no room for suitcases anywhere, no windows just open louvers. noise is terrible from pool area. bed is a 3/4 or maybe a double, jammed against wall. im 6'4' and hang over end of bed. next morning starts at 6.00 a.m. with the pool guy dragging the deck chairs around then hosing the entire area . did i nention there is no sound proofing through the louver windows. then at 6.30 the rubbish goes out to the dumpster with loud bangs /clangs for next 15 minutes. then at 7.00 the rubbish truck comes in to empty with a great reversing beeper and ends with blasts on his air horn, only to go next door to do the same thing. breaky can only get better , was wrong.to continue

Before I went to this hotel, I had sent an email requesting information about how to get to the hotel from the airport, information about the shuttle bus, and whether the hotel provided any shampoo, conditioner, soap, toothbrush and toothpaste or not (as I was not sure as I only went to US once before). I got an email replied telling me how to go to the hotel but did not reply me with other information. I ended up brought a mini shampoo, soap, and conditioner with me. After reading all the reviews about this hotel, we felt that we should have chosen other hotel.The hotel was a bit old from the outside but it was ok for a budget hotel. The checked in time was fast as we arrived at night time. We two were given a room on the 3rd floor with two beds. We tried to request with two beds on a higher floor, but no twin beds were available on the higher floor except for one queen bed on the 9th floor (Standard room). We two took the 9th floor one. After we got the room, the room was not that small compared to what the reviews from other people. Actually, it was bigger if you compared with other budget hotels in Asian countries. We were actually in room 913, but it was not that bad that compared to one of the comment. The room was a bit old, but clean and quite quiet even though it was quite near the evaluator. The other two persons came on the next day, and upgraded to the deluxe room with extra fee. The room was much bigger with a sofa bed. (So, if you want a bigger room, pay a bit extra). Like other reviews said, the air conditioner in the standard room actually next to the bed, but I am ok with that. On the other hand, the air conditioner located far away from the bed in the deluxe room.The location is good, and it took less than 10 minutes walking to the Wakiki beach. There were McDonald’s, Starbucks, and Burger King within 7 minutes walking. Bus stop was about 2 minutes walking from the hotel. You can take bus from the airport if you have a hand carry luggage.There was a $15 fee resort fee charged for each day. It was said that the fee included the following; breakfast, beach towel, DVD rental, and shuttle bus to Ala Moana. The shuttle bus ran every 30 minutes, and it could hold up to 15 or 16 persons. Therefore, it would be better if you go there by bus. However, it actually took less time to arrive to your hotel compared to bus. We tried one departing at 9pm from Ala Moana to the hotel, and it was really fast and comfortable. (However, it was always full during day time).Regarding to the breakfast, like what other traveller’s comment, it was same every day. The breakfast included; pancake, rice, mini sausage, two boiled egg, porridge, cereal, sponge cake (not everyday, or when rice was ran out), one or two types of mini donut (roasted coconut, or chocolate), mini biscuit, white bread, sliced apple, sliced orange, coffee, tea, or a juice in red color (I have no idea what that is, but if Tim Clark, the manager can tell me here). The food could be warm if you went to eat after 7:30am. The porridge was watery on top; therefore, you need to mix it with the bottom first; however, I liked more watery. In my opinion, the breakfast was not bad that was mentioned from other post. I actually ate breakfast at the hotel everyday. I have been to another hotel in Portland, and the breakfast was only white bread, scramble egg, bacon, orange, apple, coffee, and tea. Therefore, as a budget hotel, the breakfast was considerate as good in my opinion, and I cannot complain about it. The only suggest I would say was that it would look nice to put a table clothes, and I think it would look good when picking the food. In addition, I suggest that put all the cutlery (Folk, spoon, and knife) outside instead of next to the pancake. It was convenience to hold the cutlery when I want to have a bowl of porridge, or a cup of coffee.On every Tuesday between 4:30pm to 5:30pm, there is a kind of small party in the lobby. A drink which was in blue color (I don’t know the name, but please tell me the name when you reply to this post), and some chocolates. It was quite fun.In conclusion, as a budget hotel, I think it provides a good value with good location. The staff were good and family, and I felt warm in staying at this hotel. We would actually to stay in this hotel if we go to Hawaii again.(I would also like to thanks Shane and Helen here as they were trying to help us to get two rooms that on the same floor)

Aqua aloha surf is fine if you're only planning to sleep there. The staff are rude and were at times really unhelpful. The breakfast is really awful and isn't technically free because you pay a hospitality fee. The breakfast 'police' who checks your card was incredibly rude and really makes breakfast unpleasant. The facilities are basic but are fine if you're just happy to sleep there and use it as a base. It's cheap for the area and close by. One more thing the free shuttle is a joke. We could never use it because it was always too full... A very flawed system. Take the bus.

The rooms are dingy and what they call " breakfast" is appalling - a self service choice of boiled eggs( cool) or pancakes - very little choice -no bacon, no yoghurt etc - truly awful and overseen by a manager who checks your entitlement card daily - as if anyone would choose to eat there. Hotel is in a great location, only two blocks from beach but pool is very dowdy and not very clean - will not be back!

We stopped at the Aqua surf hotel for 4 nights recently. The location is about as good as youd hope to find away from the front of Waikiki - everything is local and easily walkable.The hotel itself is clean and staff friendly although the room we were in was starting to look tired. No problem though as like many people - we wernt here for the room. Free WiFi was good fast and strong signal and a local corner shop is handy.Breakfast was a let down. It's a strange set up with a supervisor checking on everything you do. One time we didn't bring our ticket down and were sent back to the room to find it before we were allowed breakfast. I'm unsure why they just don't have a list of rooms/people for breakfast like in every other hotel. Breakfas is like a school canteen with a very limited range and plastic cups. You have to scrape your plates clean into a bin once finished. Very odd.The hotel itself though was generally good and worth it for the location. I would recommend to friends. A couple of improvements though - mainly around breakfast would make all the difference though.

My wife and I stayed here two years ago and said when we go back to Waikiki we would stay there again and we did. We liked it that much. The only changes we noticed that mattered to us were the cocktail franks served for breakfast instead of sausage and the coffee was not as good as before. Breakfast is free for most bookings. We will continue to come back because we love this 15 story property and the staff is great. For the money we had a large, by Waikiki standards, room, a good sized bathroom, a refrigerator, micowave, and sink with plates and utensils. There is a kiosk for renting free DVD's. There is a player in each room. We saved money by going to the nearby grocery store many nights. The location is excellent. Right in the heart of Waikiki and about 4-6 minutes walking time to the beach. The pool is small. Seating is limited and the sun shines on the pool for a limited time due to the position of the pool to the nearby buildings so if you are a pool person get down early.To sum up, you get what you pay for. I always get a kick when people complain about this or that when comparing a property to one that is two to three times the cost per room. If you are on a budget like we are I would not look further than this hotel. Clean, comfortable, great staff, and a free happy hour on Tuesday. Who could ask for anything more?

I have been coming here for the past five years, and this year I was just as happy to be back. I was there from 09/05-09/12/2015. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff incredibly helpful and friendly. On the 11th floor, it was quiet with a great view of the Alai Wai Canal and the mountains. As always, I'm a happy repeat customer.

very friendly staff, great service, poor breakfast, good location and better room fares. just 3 blocks away from waikiki, close enough to the main roads restaurants and bars but perfectly quiet to rest at night! I would go back for sure! overall GREAT STAFF!!!

This hotel was booked for me through Dialaflight as a stopover before joining a cruise. I'm glad it was only for two nights! My room was small to say the least, it overlooked another hotel on one side, and a rather shabby looking car park on the other. The curtains didn't draw properly so I felt I was constantly in view of anyone on their balcony, and although clean enough I had giant cockroaches in my bathroom! The staff were friendly and helpful but my one main gripe was at breakfast time. The breakfast was minimal to say the least, and a member of staff would take your breakfast ticket as you arrived, to obviously make sure you weren't taking anything you weren't entitled to, but would then pretty much stay rooted to the spot almost spying on everyone to ensure they didn't go back for too many eggs or seconds!! I didn't feel at all relaxed during breakfast and the worst of it (and I am not a lazy person) was when I went to leave the breakfast table on my first morning, to be called back by this same member of staff and told to scrape my plate into a bin, and place my cutlery into one washing up bowl and my plate/dish into another!! I am on vacation!!!! I am not in the school dining hall!! If I am paying for a service then the least I expect when I'm on holiday IS that service!! So all in all - I won't be back to this hotel again!

Like many hotels in Waikiki, this is an older building that has had minor room refurbishments. The staff were very friendly and made efforts to check me in a little earlier than usual after a very long flight from Sydney, although I opted for the beach instead. The room was on a high floor with spectacular views to the beach and the mountains. The bed was comfortable and I was very relaxed during my stay.The pool was very small and the location near the breakfast tables not terribly inviting, but Waikiki beach is a 5 to 10 minute stroll away.Breakfast wasn't so great but it was complimentary.Wifi was fast and the lifts were quite efficient for an older building.I would stay here again, for the money I paid it's a fair deal.

We stayed on the 15th floor no complaints about the room always cleaned by staff front desk staff always helpful pleasant and ready to answer any questions you may haveThe BREAKFAST staff had no idea how to treat guests even a smile might help ,Then the BREAKFAST !!What a disgrace powdered milk for tea and coffeeAnd butter !! Should say not butter can't even supply a jar of jam for toast, sliced apples & oranges in a bowl cold hard boiled eggs ( only two allowed ) and. Watery porridge I'm sorry not except able we spent fourteen days there only one b/fast . Really that is not acceptable for your hotel which for the price gets quite a few ticks .Always try to upgrade to a superior room

It's a medium category hotel in a good position for the beach and all the attraction in Wikiki. The room was old, the bed was so soft that in the center was lower that in the head and foot; toilet had some problems, and shower too. The magnetic key of the door didn't work everytime, so we had to choose it twice. But all the way it was clean.The breackfast included was poor and everyday had the same things: pancakes, boiled rice, boiled eggs, porridge, spam, some fruits, muffin. But no good quality of ingredients. Also the rice was too boiled or not enough boiled. Coffee was very bad, so we have to take it at ABC store outside. Air conditioned didn't work very well.

Our reservations called for a 'double moderate' room with continental breakfast. The hotel placed us in room 913 which should never be booked in my opinion. The room was about 12 feet square. Two suitcases and two adults were maximum capacity. It was next to elevators and storage room. In the corner was a plastic patio chair for furniture. The air conditioner was located next to the head of the bed so the cold air blew on your head all night. It was too hot and humid, we did not have the choice not to turn it on. The bathroom was so small, equipped with a pedestal sink and no counter space. I looked for the hair dryer and found it in the closet since there was no room in the bathroom for it. In the morning, I went to the front desk to ask for a room change. I was told I would have to pay for an upgrade. I said no to upgrade fee and said I would call my travel company. Suddenly, additional rooms became available at no extra fee. I was grateful for the room change. Our second night and last night was in a decent room. Continental breakfast was terrible and the mini hot dogs weren't at serving temperature. Hotel location is not in the best neighborhood. There is a $15 a day hospitality fee and a $22 a day parking fee if you have a rental car. These fees were not included in our travel package with Tripmasters even though the car was booked with the package. I would never stay here again. The front desk was friendly and the consignerie (Lei, I believe) was very helpful.

Our trip to Oahu, prior to arriving at the hotel was less than great. All that changed once we checked in. We got a great room on the 15th floor, there was no noise. Breakfast wasn't exciting, I still don't know what that "juice" they served was, but all in all it was the best value in Waikiki. Get early for parking. You have to pay for it, and its limited, but so is the parking anywhere in Waikiki, even the more expensive hotels. If I had to stay in Honolulu again (I would prefer any other town in all of Hawaii to visit) I would definitely stay here!

We were joining family at one of the resorts and arrived a couple of days early and spent two nights here. No problems whatsoever. Very clean, very helpful and friendly staff, and within walking distance to the beach, stores and points of interest. The bed was excellent! No view, but we were only there at night anyway. Great place to stay and we would certainly recommend it.

This was our 5th time staying at this little jewel. Really enjoyed the little extras this time including free wifi, access to the free shuttle (usually $28 return trip in cab), plenty of beach towels and my son enjoyed the play station in the room. The room was clean and well maintained - new air conditioners in the room provided adjustable fan speed which added to our comfort. Staff are fabulous and big thank you to Michael for assisting us in finding the last rental car in Hawaii !!! Tuesday welcome cocktails - delicious :). Thanks Tim and Julian for another fabulous holiday !!! We will be back !

With never being in Oahu before it was hard to know where everything was located and where would be a great place to stay. The hotel was located 2 blocks from mainstream Waikiki Beach. It was quiet but still downtown. The breakfast was disappointing. The menu was the same every day that we decided to go out one morning to try something different. The staff was very friendly. Loved having access to a washer and dryer on premises. A small grocery store was right around the corner. For the small amount of time you spend in your romm, the value is worth it. Will stay again if every visiting Oahu.

Over all not bad, only disappointment was the breakfast.Did not know we had to pay for room service, $15 per day.Rooms were cleanLocation was good, not far from town and beachService was ok.I would stay there again

Staff was wonderful and friendly. Room was too small. The air conditioner on side wall blew directly on our faces as we slept. Elevator slow, hot and always crowded. Other rooms might be better. Staff very helpful on suggesting places to go and activities. Could not take advantage of free shuttle because it was always full when it came to our stop.

Stayed here for a few days in August with my family. We had quite a big room but the beds were very small, same for the shower and the toilet hidden in a corner of the room, the limited space made everything a bit uncomfortable. Breakfast was a great disappointment, with extremely limited choice and very bad coffee (the one next to the elevator is actually nicer as other reviewers have noticed). The pool is ridiculously small unless you're under 8 yo. Honestly for the same price you can probably get a better deal in Waikiki.

I only stayed here because it was a quick trip to do with a friend of mine who has cancer and may not live long. The staff here was very friendly and helpful, the beds were very comfortable to sleep in, and the location was the best thing about staying here. The hotel did not have a jacuzzi, and the pool was so small that its not even worth mentioning. To park a car at the hotel overnight was $22 a night. The continental breakfast was so bad I wanted to curse someone out. The windows in the rooms are the old school type that just slant like verticals, so the hot heat came right in the room. The AC unit in the wall did keep the room cool enough while we were sleep. This hotel needs to be totally remodeled. I think hotels in general are low grade if you don't pay $500 a night to stay in the Hyatt. When I go back to Hawaii, I will stay in my WorldMark resort.

Very nice and friendly staff. Our travel agency did not specify what type a room we wanted so they booked a room for a couple (i was travelling with a friend) We arrived very late in the night, so i talked to the supervisor by phone, who was super nice and he completely understood the situation and next day we got a great room with two beds and a balcony. I must recommend this hotel because it is five minutes walking from Waikiki Beach, there is a supermarket near by, they have a laundry room available for guests. Housekeepers are polite and respectful. My experience was great! Thank you so much to the whole staff from the hotel, I will definitely go back because it is cheap, clean and friendly play to stay!

For the price me and my buddy paid to go to Hawaii for 10 days (end of July to beginning of August) we feel like we got our moneys worth from this hotel for the most part. We're not the type of travelers who spend most of our time in the hotel room to begin with so we feel that the standard room fit well into our needs (basically for sleeping), but a balcony would have been nice as we do enjoy our cigars. Our room also came equipped with a fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. That being said, if you are looking for a hotel with a nice big pool, or jacuzzi/hot tub, sauna etc. then it's best to look elsewhere in Waikiki. At the same time the breakfast offered here isn't exactly a home run either, but at least it's something if you look at the other side of the coin. The strange part was that the hotels complimentary coffee in the lobby (near the elevator) was actually much better then what was served in the room with the breakfast.... Not sure if other reviewers noticed that? That aside though the hotel is also very close to Waikiki beach which was great! And you are pretty much walking distance to most attractions in Waikiki. If your also looking to go to the Ala Moana Shopping Center you get a free slip from the hotel which allows you access to a free shuttle bus for the duration of your stay. Closest stop to our hotel by the way is the Aqua Pacific Monarch Hotel (5-10 minute walk from the hotel). The other thing to note is that for each night you stay at the hotel you are charged a $15 (per night) hospitality fee. This is suppose to cover things like the game rentals for the PS3 in your room and movies. I have to say we weren't fans of paying this fee as we don't feel we really got the return back in value, but if every hotel does it in Waikiki then I guess one doesn't have much of a choice. Just be aware when you check-out you'll need to be swiping the Credit Card (as for all other hotels in the Waikiki area).

I only stayed one night as the hotel I wanted to stay in was fully booked for that night. Firstly this place is cheap for Waikiki standards so don't turn up expecting 5 star, this is rated as a 2.5 star hotel. I stayed in the lead in moderate room which if you are just looking for a comfortable bed then this is fine, upgrade to the next room type if you want a little more space and a balcony. Location was fine only 10 minute walk to the beach. Lobby area was nice and open. The free breakfast actually had more choices then I expected, Ive stayed at other Aqua hotels and you only got half of what the Surf offered. There is a resort fee of US$15, this has become a standard across Hawaii with some places charging as much as $35 a night! The Aqua surf did the job and if I was to return and needed a cheap spot again I would stay here.

Close to the beach, only two blocks away. Tour guide that had to pick us up from the hotel knew the place and could pick us up. Close to all the restaurants, so dinning out was easy. Went outside at night often and never had problems. The pool is small, not really big enough for a large party. The room wasn't that big, but fit the two of us just fine. The air conditioner was in excellent shape. Never had to worry about the Hawaii heat in our room

Perfect location, close to everything. Friendly staff ready to assist. Rooms are clean and well maintained.Beds very comfortable. Be aware of the late check in (3pm) not suitable for us Aussie visitors as most flights from Australia arrive early to mid morning. This is standard throughout the island. May even be suitable to book the night before arrival to expedite earlier access to your room. Otherwise, like me go have a sleep on beach till 3pm. However, the hotel does allow you to secure your luggage and free tea/coffee is available at your leisure. The continental breakfast may not be what the average Aussie would expect or like but if you are into pancakes, spam and boiled eggs then this is your dream eventLimit of two eggs per guest! Otherwise, good value, safe and user friendly! Enjoy the Aqua Aloha like we did!

We did like our room even though the entire hotel was kinda old and outdated. Still, the room was clean, you had a fridge, good working wifi...The reason i am only giving 3 stars is for the continental breakfast and the garage price.I mean breakfast really? Pancakes, rice an cupcakes? A toaster from the middelages? Defenitly not worth the price!And the 22$ a night to park your car in the garage?? You already pay well enough forThe outdated hotel. It should be a lot cheaper. The public parking next door was 24$. We parked it there just because we didn't want to give them the money.

Stayed there last week week should hav etaken more notice of trip advisor and not listened to travel agent ! if I wanted to stay in the 70's would have booked avan Breakfast disgusting and the mafia looking man at door not appealing had 1 breakfast fruit looked last week spend and extra $ 100 a night and go somewhere better closer to beach etc

Clean tidy hotel - good value for money, Staff were very helpful. 3 - 5 minute walk to main beach. Quiet location. We had a good size room with double and one single bed.Breakfast was included in the room price.Breakfast was very average, Would have been nice if boiled eggs were not quite so boiled. Also the fruit was only ever apple and oranges would have been good if more local fruit. The hot tea tasted like they used the pot for coffee as well. So I would get my tea from the lobby not the restaurant. However that said it was fresh and quick to get so not having to line up and not waste the day away.Definitely go back and stay.

Was booked by our travel agent as a cheap holiday. Ended up cheap and nasty. Room the size of a large closet, no balcony, wardrobe door could not shut, no space to store our bags, louvre windows did not shut out wind not noise, room not clean, staff didn't care. Spent as MUCH to our of the room as possible. Air con unit one foot from bed at head level - why. Would NEVER stay here again. Complained to our travel agent on returning g to Sydney and given a partial refund. Yes, it was that bad!

The rooms are clean and comfortable, maybe a little on the small side, the pool is nice but not very big, the location is good (two blocks from everything) and the price is very good compared to everything around it.

I spent just one night on this hotel. Located near to the canal and to the kuhio avenue, the hotel has a swimming pool, and lobby with a big area to rest. My room was small but everything was on the right place. It is a good hotel to spend just a few days with friend. I don't recommend it to couples. Aloha
user_name:
Cukelito
Province of Buenos Aires, Argentina

review_body: My husband won a week trip to Hawaii, they put us up at this hotel. It's not the greatest hotel but it's not the worst either, especially for the location. The only reason I gave it four stars was not necessarily for the hotel itself, which could use a bit of updating. However they were renovating one of the elevators during our stay (the other was already completed) so one elevator for 15 floors and thousands of guests wasn't ideal. The room itself was a pretty decent size, we stayed in the superior room with the Lanai (balcony), it has a king bed and a sofa that has a pull out bed. It includes a refrigerator (kept things from spoiling but didn't keep things extremely cold), a microwave, coffee pot with coffee, plates, mugs and silverware. They had a small TV and a PS3 in the room where you could watch movies from the DVD rental box downstairs. Anyway, the four stars, you're two blocks from Waikiki beach. About a 15 minute walk from the zoo and aquarium and various shops/mall. Down the street from the hotel there is also a food pantry (grocery store) that also has a coffee bean and a delicious food place called Hi Steaks. There's an ABC store that is extremely handy (even though they have one on just about every corner). The hotel offers breakfast from 7-9 am. Which consists of pancakes, ham, white rice (soy sauce available), oranges, apples, two or three different types of cakes and donuts, and cereal (with powdered milk). They have tea, orange juice and coffee for drinks. The staff was nice even though upon arrival we had to wait about 15 minutes for someone to check us in even though there were three people behind the main desk. the six nights we were there, house keeping only serviced our room twice. Both days we were out most of the day until late evening. The other days it would be 2:30 or 3pm when we would get back and they would be cleaning the rooms next door, but not ours. We understood with 15 floors and thousands of rooms maybe one or two days but four days? At least when they knocked, they were friendly and asked if we needed anything. There is a laundry room in the parking garage/basement under the hotel. $1.25 for washer and another $1.25 for dryer, it honestly came in handy. The wifi was okay but not great, it got the job done. Overall our stay was pretty good and we would stay here again.

I stayed here with a group for a community service trip. The location is great for the price, it's walking distance to Waikiki beach. But the two elevators were extremely slow and one was then shut down for maintenance. It was inconvenient and we had to use the stairs more often than not because waiting for the one working elevator took too long. Also the one working elevator was small and stopped on every floor. The hotel offers a continental breakfast. It is mediocre at best. Not to mention a cockroach was crawling on table my group was sitting at durning breakfast. The beds were clean though other people in my group did not have clean beds and had to call to get new clean sheets. The shower had ants crawling in it too. The air conditioning did not work all that well and it leaked. The windows were not sound proofed and you could hear the sound from the street from the room. When we arrived at the hotel there were police cars right outside. They also were outside all through out our stay. The pool is very small. The gym is non existent. Don't expect much. Also some members of my group saw hookers. BE WARNED, THIS IS NOT FOR FAMILIES.

booked on short notice. medium price hotel... 2 day stay ... room was comfortable, comfy bedair con was quiet, had microwave, and in-room tea, coffee etc...complimentary breakfast short walk to nearby shops, eateries etc .. good basement carparking . staff: very helpful with all our enquiries about 10 min walk to waikiki beach and the fab shopping, good restaurants and food court there, Recommend this hotel for the budget minded traveller
user_name:
dave w
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: Still one of the best bargains in Waikiki. Clean and comfortable rooms. Continental breakfast has a pretty good variety that makes a great start to the day. The comp shuttle service to Alamoana shopping center is a super addition to the services offered by this hotel. Looking forward to my next stay at Aloha Surf.

Nice place to stay if you're on a budget. I found the staff to be friendly and accommodating and the room was well maintained. Though the complimentary breakfast left a lot to be desired, it's not a deal killer. There are conveniently located mini-markets galore and the prices are reasonable. My room had a wet bar, mini-frig, microwave, complimentary plates and silverware, so buying and storing quick-fix food wasn't an issue.The hotel is centrally located and just 3 blocks away from the beach. And if you're a shopper, you're only two blocks away from Royal Hawaiian Centre.
user_name:
dandrav2015
New York City, New York

review_body: Excellent hotel. Just a few minutes walk from Royal Hawaiian Centre. Great location. Our concierge, Lance was really cool. The breakfast was a little limiting as was the gym (3 pieces of equipment). There is a supermarket next to the hotel for quick food and supplies and is open until 0100 everyday.

Aloha!Aqua Aloha Surf provided nice accomodations with clean and modern rooms with nice appointments like organic shampoo and soap, sheets and towels washed in scent-free detergent for chemically sensitivepeople like me. Guest services employee Shane was especially helpful in every way. Among other nice things, he located a restaurant for me that serves healthy, vegetarian, gluten free food, which was fairly priced, in a sea of over-priced-MSG-laden-unhealthy-food restaurants located on Waikiki Beach.The general manager is very dedicated and takes a lot of pride in his work and was considerate and respectful of my needs.Felt Aloha spirit from all of the hard-working employees.Mahalo!

Stayed her for the 1st time and their location was perfect since they are walking distance to the everything in Waikiki.Their staff was extremely helpful and accommodating. The room was clean and included a mini fridge and the shower was a decent size.We would definitely stay here again due to their location and price.

This hotel is a 10-15 minute walk to Waikiki beach and backs to the canal. Quite convenient. The people are also very friendly and accommodating. I had a chance to meet with Craig Matsuura, the facilities manager, as well as the general manager, . Very nice gentlemen providing very friendly service.
user_name:
Kenneth J
Tampa, Florida, United States

review_body: Took my Wife for a week for our 20th, Hotel staff were very accommodating and even found us a shuttle when we asked for a cab to our helicopter ride.Breakfast is just enough to start a day in Paradise.Just about everything is within 2 blocks of this Awesome and Quiet hotel.

Small but all you need, clean, quiet, buffet breakfast and convenient for downtown Waikiki. No car needed, beack a short walk away. Not terrifically expensive which is why we chose it. Fridge, microwave and coffee machines in the room. Small pool which was secluded and quite adequate.

I was there for pleasure Dec 2014. 1st time in Hawaii and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. I will say there again in Dec 2015. I'm making this an annual trip for my Bday. God is awesome. :)

what can I say, a little disappointed.tidy, fairly clean (but could be better), worn and outdated despite refurbished but still cabinets are falling apart. In great need of TLC.staff are less than enthusiastic, too relaxed. customer service is poor... I enquired about shuttles, as they provided a complimentary one to the big shopping centre. I wanted to use this shuttle to get closer to the cruise terminal. i thought i booked this shuttle, told it would be there in 15 mins, then 20mins later i asked what was the latest update, i was told oh... the shopping centre shuttle stop is not actually at the hotel! they instead booked me a shuttle for the cruiseship that would cost me but they didn't even tell me that! changed my booking, didn't tell me it would cost me, wasted 30mins of mine and husband's time waiting for a shuttle!

Low budget type room. Clean and tidy. Coffee machine made water smell.Forget about their Continental Breakfast. It consists of Corn flakes with watered down milk, Packet mix Pan Cakes with watered down syrup, Maximum of 2 eggs and processed ham.No butter or jam for your toast. Orange cordial in place of Orange Juice.

Photos booked through sunwing.ca does not reflect what the hotel actually looks like.A small tiny pool is added just to barely make the 3 star rating.I am disappointed by the quality of the room. Rusty shower...The free breakfast is worth skipping, your belly will thank you for it.

On arrival we asked to change from a double to a twin room. There wasn't one available but they gave us a double with a pull-out sofa bed. This was fine - the room was large enough to keep the sofabed out for the duration. We had a little balcony - terrible view of the flats opposite but nice to pop out for some fresh air. The room was clean, fairly modern and comfortable (also had a sink/microwave/fridge). The biggest moan about this hotel is the breakfast. It's laid out in a fairly cramped style and the whole area did not look clean. In fact, when the staff brought out a large dirty looking jug full of hot water with only ONE teabag in it to pour into the tea caddy, was when we decided to get our breakfast elsewhere! The pool is one of the smallest I have ever encountered and with only a couple of sun loungers. The plus side is the location of the hotel - it is only a short walk to the main drag/beach but set back far enough to be fairly peaceful. The staff were also very helpful and courteous.
Our stay here was great. The room was adequate & had all our basic needs, the bed was comfortable, customer service gets 2 thumbs up & it is conveniently located to many of Waikiki's shops & sights.

We arrived to find that the photo of the room we booked was "wrong on the website". So thank goodness they upgraded us to a better room for free. The shampoos and shower gel is a nice touch and we had the aircon on all night which was goodDon't be persuaded to stay here for the free buffet breakfast, it is great if you enjoy eating packet mix pancakes served with a choice of margarine and or golden syrup, and a slice of sponge cake with a boiled egg on the side...If you are just looking for a really budget place to stay then come here but I would shop around first.

The hotel is about 10 minutes walk to the beach, while Shops, restaurants and public transport are located nearby. The rooms though small had fridge, microwave, and coffee pots. The beds were comfortable but the bathroom was small. The wi-fi was ok, however the breakfast was not upto the mark, very basic and lacked any variety. They have a free shuttle to the Ala Moana Mall at fixed timings but from a nearby location. Overall Ok..

I really wanted to be able to give this hotel a great review. However, I woke up with bug bites several days into our stay here. I gave it another night and woke up with even more bug bites which are confirmed to be from bed bugs. Bed bug bites were a new experience for me and not one I would ever want to go thru again. I discreetly spoke with the General Manager of the property and explained my concerns about the apparent bugs in our room. I understand that people travel from all over the world and live in quite different circumstances than I am accustomed to. I don't fault the hotel for having bed bugs but I do fault the GM for his lack of concern and communication. As we waited in the lobby, he sent a housekeeping lady to our room. She appeared quite some time later with a push cart full of boxes of trash can liners. I assumed to bag everything up. She went into the GM's office, closed the door and after some time they both walked out. My husband and I approached them and the housekeeper stated that she did not find anything. The GM was on his cell phone and never got off the phone to discuss the situation. Thankfully, we were due to check out later that day! I don't think I could have made it another night! I am very disappointed in the approach or lack thereof taken by management. I am still itching and in a lot of discomfort almost a week later. I had the pleasure of returning home and storing all of my luggage in the garage to kill off any bugs we may have brought home with us. Also, I should mention than upon checking out you pay the $15.00 per night resort fee and $22.00 per night + tax for parking (which you may or may not get a spot). The breakfast menu was the same every day that we were there. It consisted of toast, pancakes, cereal, oatmeal, apples, oranges, small donuts, rice and luncheon ham. The positives to this property is that it is in a decent location (if you don't mind noise). We were on the 12th floor and it was extremely loud by 6 am from street traffic. The water pressure was great and ironically enough the mattress was very comfortable.

Given the ease of finding pretty good deals on quality hotels I would avoid Aqua Aloha Surf at all costs. For the price you pay the rooms are small, dated, and ill-maintained. Plus they tack on an additional $15 each day for a "hospitality fee"

Very convenient location (10min walk to the beach, shopping centre ,etc ..) rooms are quite small ,also the bathroom is very, very small .Single air condition in each room, very noisy when turned on (all guests that we met complained of air condition’s position and level of noise ),one can say unusable air condition . Also windows can’t be opened. slept with the balcony door open - lots of noise from the ground outside (trucks, cars, people yelling) made it hard to sleep through the night .The gym consists of 3 equipments (don't think they should call it a gym) Pool very small .The worst thing was ,that we were charged extra us$ 15.00 per day fee for wifi and breakfast (very basic) which we got to use once, breakfast from 7 to 9 am and you miss out if late, and we never had it last day as we departed at 7 am.but still got charged . The most disappointing is what the hotel advertise as a free Shuttle Bus Service There is NO shuttle bus from the hotel .we had to walk to another hotel to catch it , when we got there we waited for an hour for it and when the bus arrived it was full . It happened to us twice so we gave up on it , Overall I rate it a 2.5 out of 5.

Very pleased with our experience here! The rooms are clean and basic. They offer a continental breakfast (toast,apples,pancakes,hardboiled eggs) and newspapers in the mornings as well as a free guest reception with cocktails on Tuesday nights. WiFi is also included in yoru resort fee (we didn't use it so I don't know how fast it was).The towel service was a great feature - you can get beach towels at the front desk which saves you buying them or having to deal with wet towels!Super friendly staff. He asked us not to mention him by name but the front desk clerk was OUTSTANDING! All the staff was helpful and happy to talk with you about Hawaii.You do have to pay for parking ($22 per night) but it's Waikiki so you have to pay EVERYWHERE! At least here it's convenient and safe. Totally worth it.You can open the windows and enjoy the Tradewinds or close everything up and use your AC - if it's too noisy outside, just use the AC. The hotel is smack in the middle of the action of Waikiki so you can't expect it to be quiet like a country retreat! We had no complaints about the noise level. Loved being so close to everything.

The hotel was sub standard to say the least, charged for services we didn't use, so noisy you couldn't sleep, the room was so small you had to turn side ways to get passed each other no chairs to sit on, no place to put your luggage except on the floor beside the bed and if you needed to go to the loo you had to walk on your luggage to get out,air conditioner was so noisy you had to turn it off to get to sleep, and even then the one in the room above kept you awake, the breakfast was woeful I have never experienced a more pathetic so called continental breakfast

An old hotel but reasonably maintained. We stayed on the 12th floor where the windows are not double glased but consist of louvers which open to allow airflow. Unfortunately this does nothing to stop outside noise. This hotel is on the corner of two major roads and the traffic noise on the 12th floor is horrendous. With vehicles stopping at the lights and starting off again as well as the endless stream of passenger coaches with their beep beep reversing tones as they back into parks near the hotel, this noise goes on all day and well into the night. The open air bar across the road closes about 3am each night and is very noisy as the drunks leave in the wee hours. To top it all off the local delivery trucks start up about 5am so you can forget any sleep from then on. After about 4 to 5 days we were sleeping for a fwe hours in the afternoon to try to catch up. So much for getting out to see the sights, could have stayed home and slept in the afternoon. The room only had one chair for two people and no table, funny arrangement. Hot water was only just if you did not add any cold water to it. After a few nights we thought about asking for a different room but everyone we spoke to was having the same problems.I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Staff efficient however the room was dated but clean. $15 fee for wifi and breakfast (very basic).Noise from traffic was bad periodically through the night - not good if your a light sleeper.12 pm checkout was handy as was free shuttle to the ala Moana mall.

I spent one night in room 204, it was a nightmare. The room was supposed to be air conditioned but there was no ac or fan. I heard the screaming women and men in the paid public lot from 11.00 p.m. till 2.00 a.m. , through the louvers, which speaks for itself - air-conditioned. Then some road construction digging went on till 3.00 a.m. I couldn't sleep until I left at 5.45 a.m.When I complained to the staff, they were so courteous - the room is air-conditioned.Well, cheap things no good ! I should have heeded to the other reviews, which mentioned noise. I would pay the extra $50 and stay at the Hyatt, next time.

Close to the main tourist area, this hotel is a bit old and tired but that's why it is relatively cheap. It offers the usual front end services comprising 24hr reception plus concierge, tour desk and other distractions such as pool and a bit of gym equipment. Off street parking available. The rooms are clean and very well appointed with coffee maker, microwave, fridge, PS3 etc etc. Don't get stuck in a first floor room with no balcony.There is no restaurant but they do offer a buffet breakfast which is absolutely disgusting and wholly out of place in this otherwise quite pleasant hotel. I would stay here again.

Great place to stay, they do nickel and dime you to death. You have to pay for parking and $15 per night for you knows what. Good location and they have a good breakfast that is included. Some of the staff was a little snobby but most where ok. Make sure you listen to all the little extra chargers that there are so you are not supprised at the end.

This was our first trip to Honolulu and we needed a place to stay one night prior to and three nights after our cruise to the islands. We wanted to be close to but not necessarily on the beach and wanted a place that offered a breakfast. Our travel agent arranged this hotel for us saying that others have been happy there. Others may have been happy but we were not.The negatives:Rooms on the front of the building are extremely noisey (we asked for a rear facing room for our additional nights)Bad smell in room and furnitureDirty carpetingOld furnishingsDirty grout in shower areaAntsLouvered windows that would not shut completely due to broken handlesVery strict handling of breakfast access (unfriendly attendant)Breakfast foods limited and not tastySmall TVPositives:Front counter staff was very friendly and accommodatingRefrigerator in roomBeach towels providedOnly two blocks to beachClose to shops and bus stopIf we had the chance to redo our stay we would choose somewhere else. This place is just in need of a major redo, update and cleaning.

Was fun place to stay convenient location, helpful staff and good Breakfast. My wife and myself would rate our experience at this location 5! Had a wonderful time!!!!  With in walking distance for public transportation drivers who where very helpful too.Met many local people and sights you do not get to see other wise.Also there were restaurants and shops with in walking distance of! We can not say enough about this location and the great time we had as part 0f our 34 days in Hawaii!

Aqua Aloha Surf is in a very convenient location and our room provided us with some good ammenities including a fridge, crockery and microwave. It was serviced well daily and I would have to say had the most comfortable super king size bed and great shower pressure, better than many of the flashier hotels we have stayed at. The complimentary wipe out drinks on Tuesday and simple breakfasts were an added bonus. We found the staff helpful and friendly and although the pool area is only small I managed to lie out on a comfy recliner at any time I wished without missing out!

helpful staffs,beautiful smiles,free breakfast,close to the beach,free wifi,free rental beach towel,room was kept tidy...♡thank you for made our stay comfortable♡♡とても親切で素晴らしいホテルでした。よくツインとダブルで揉めている様ですが…日本と違って、アメリカはベッド数ではなく泊まれる人数で予約を受け付けるのが当たり前らしいです。どうしてもベッドを分けたい場合はやはり追加料金を支払って確約してもらうしかありません。この日本人の感覚を理解してもらい、シングルベッド、ツインの部屋を増やして行ければ苦情は減ることでしょう。しかし郷に入りては…で、面白い体験をしてみるのもアリだと思います(*^^*)

The hotel is well located in the centre of the Waikiki area just a few blocks from the beach. There are plenty of shops and restaurants in close proximity, ABC shops, a great Thai restaurant and a 50's type cafe "The Rock Island Cafe", which is worth a visit. The rooms vary in size from just a room to suites, the more space, the higher cost. The rooms are clean but the building is old with louvered windows that whistle in the wind. The windows cannot be closed tight enough to stop the whistle. The air conditioner is the older style, box in the wall, noisey and cannot cope with the Honolulu conditions. Better off opening the windows if you can handle the wind blowing through at the higher levels. The rooms are also noisey from traffic and air-con from other buildings. Free WiFi is available. The tap in the bathroom is very difficult to use to rinse out the mouth after brushing teeth, better off using the tap at the kitchenette. The worst of our stay at the Aqua Aloha Hotel was the breakfast. It was included in the cost but we did note a sign at the front of the hotel, $6 breakfast. My wife and I have eaten in many hotels around the world and this experience would have to be the worst. One would get a better meal at a hostel In detail the pancakes were too thick and gluggy, the breads were too sweet, the boiled eggs were cold, the cereals too sweet and the coffee, even with real milk was awful, with powdered milk which was offered, it was worse. In a word, undrinkable, in a group of 7, none of the coffees were drunk. The only item on the menu that was any good was the slices of orange. (did not try the oatmeal) Then on leaving we were chased out the door and told to clear our plates off the table. That would not normally be an issue if we were advised beforehand that our table had to be cleared on leaving but we not and I do not recall seeing any signs. One wonders, with such service and conditions, what the $15 per day service fee is for. Thus, would I go there again, no likely.

This is a good bargain.When in Hawaii, your not really going to stay in your room, except to sleep.Most of the time is spent out and about.The rooms are small, but adequate.They have a continental breakfast, which was good.There is a pool, very small.The elevators were in working order.I found the staff helpful and friendly.This hotel is just a few short blocks from the main street.It is one block from Keoni's restaurant, good food and friendly staff.

I chose the Aqua Aloha Surf Hotel because of a emergency situaiton that required me to be on Oahu, Hawaii for a few days thus making a last minute reservation. After a grueling 11 hour flight, I attempted to check in but was advised that the Hotel couldn't find my reservation. You can now imagine the frustration I was feeling and the opportunity to vent on the front desk ambassador Douglas Neuner ( i uncovered his name later). But before I was able to "unleash" my frustrations on him, he anticipated my frustration and proceeded to clearly explain the situation to me in a very calming and professional way, After calming me down and getting me to understand it wasn't the fault of the hotel, he then brought out the hotel's Reservation Mgr. Ms. Aimee Noa, who then explained how the booking process worked and educated me again on why this situation occurred. They then quickly provided me with another hotel room, provided a wonderful upgraded guest room and made clear that the problem would be fixed after my departure. Just from this interaction alone, I knew I picked the right hotel as their ability to turn a potentially bad sitauiton into a positive guest experience, thus I'm writing this revew.As for the hotel facility, my guest room came with a mini frdige/frezzer and a microwave which is perfect for storing drinks and my "leftover" food of my dinners. There are many outlets to power up your mobile devices, free wi-fi , comfortable bedding, a private lanai and air conditioning. Great value for the quality of the room.The hotel is also in a great location close to the Food Pantry Grocery Store and "smack dab" in the middle of waikiki for easy access to all your activities. They also provide free shuttle service to one of the world's largest outdoor malls "Ala Moana Shopping Center."Added bonus is the complimentary continental breakfast, free use of beach chairs and towels and a small excerise area that makes do for the few days I was there.Overall, the facility is very good value no doubt. But the added Hospitality and Professionalism of the two employees Douglas and Aimee enhanced my overall guest experience and stay.

Bullet pointed stay:*Check-in staff on arrival was friendly and courteous*Lobby looked clean and well kept*Room appeared fairly clean, however clutteredThis is where the good ends:*Moldy bathroom grout*Two small roaches in the shower (I figured, it's the tropics so I'll just get rid of them since I was just here for an overnight stay after a very long international flight)*Room extremely noisy* Checking out in the morning, two more small roaches on the wall in the hallwayThe worst part and what made me rate you "terrible":*Upon checkout I went to the front desk, no good morning just a "what can I do for you"*I say...I'm checking out thanks....while I have you, I'd like to mention that although last night when I found two small roaches in the moldy shower due to being tired I overlooked it. I would have to tell you there's more roaches in the hallway I just saw, that's clearly a problem here and not isolated.*Clerk responds: "Oh I see, I see". Well, your room and tax is prepaid and you owe us $15 for the resort fee. Should I put that on your card?"This transaction, was very poor and terrible. Your staff is just worried about collecting $15 for something I didn't even use and honestly don't know what the fee gets your guests or what you're using the money for because clearly you are not buying Tylex for the mold in the bathroom nor bug spray for the roach problem.While I wasn't offering feedback fishing for a discount or having the free $15 you charged my card, it would have been nice to at least get an apology and for your staff to show some empathy and care.People like this should not be employed in a hotel and since telling your staff was like talking to a wall and I figured my feedback would end there. I felt this would be a good way to make my feedback heard.

After staying at other hotels in the area, I can only say that for the price this is good solid bet. Close to everything shopping, restaurants, beach etc. Good service at front desk. property is old but well cared for the rooms are clean and comfortable. In room video and PS, frig, coffee pot and microwave Will definitely stay here again. Ma-halo

We arrived from the UK 30hr awake. We were made to feel welcome from the moment we arrived. Breakfast was included and I was surprised but pleased that porridge was on the menu. One night we were sat on the balcony and could watch a firework display taking place on Waikiki beach 2 blocks away! Very friendly staff very helpfull. Very clean room. One night managers cocktails was a great hit. would love to stay here again.

I was forced at checkin to accept an extra cost 15 $ plus tax! a night. You recive absolutly nothing for the ekstra money. The hotel only want to lower the price at first to chatch you attention. They claim that the ekstra cost cover dvd rentals. Following the rentalcard rentals will be charged on you creditcard.The hotel is old and noisy. The room was clean but the lobby was dirty and with birds inside! The parking cost was steep and had incresed. Avoid this hotel at all cost.

Stayed at the hotel from 11th March to 18th March 2015. Only a couple of blocks from the beach. Daily breakfast was included with the booking. Free WiFi was handy. Close to fast food eateries and a supermarket.

This is an older property but very clean and tidy. The front desk staff are very accommodating. We stayed in room 1202 on the 12th floor. It was a bit noisy the first couple of nights but we slept well once used to it. The breakfast is not flash but it is fresh and filling. The managers Happy Hour on a Tuesday is great. Free Wipeout cocktails and a chance to meet other guests. The lobby has free coffee all hours, there is a pool, gym, free DVD rental and now free Wifi in the rooms as well as lobby. The location is great. Only a couple of blocks from Waikiki beach and a few minutes walk to markets, convenience stores and of course, McDonalds, Starbucks and other fast food eateries. We will definitely come back here again due to the service, friendly staff and location. We stayed for 7 nights from 17th March 2015. Thank you Aqua Aloha Surf for a memorable time in Honolulu.

This is not a fancy hotel. Very basic facilities and standards however the staff are very helpful and professional.We stayed here on 2 separate occasions in march 2015. Aside from the minor ant problem we found in both our rooms in was a pleasant stay. Keep in mind they charge a $15 resort fee per day.

Despite other reviews I found this location excellent for the price I paid. Been there March 8, 2015 to March 15 with family, room 504. They are very nice and ready to help starting at the front desk and ending with the room cleaners, have only good to say about this location. I'll be probably looking for this location next year, really enjoyed the time spent there. There is free wifi in every room. Breakfast included (not very common for Hawaii). Towels changed every day, room service every day, beach towels free and other beach equipment for free. In room video entertainment for kids.

I booked this hotel through a package deal. The GOOD:- The room was moderately priced- Decent location- CleanThe BAD:- There are *lots* of hidden fees! Be prepared to pay $15/night per room for "amenities" - towels, DVD, etc. It can quickly add up- Whatever you do, do not park a rented car on the property. It is a whopping $22/day before tax; the parking is in the basement - with extremely narrow spots - and fills up quickly. - The breakfast is terrible at best. "Sunny D", coffee that tastes like used diesel, spam and boiled eggs. Yes - eggs - imported from China which are so stale, that they won't peel!The UGLY:- Albeit some staff members were very friendly and cooperative, I must complain about the manager and one other. They are arrogant and unwilling to work with the customer in case of a dispute or misunderstanding. Have they not heard about "the customer is always right" especially when the latter has just arrived after a long flight?

Our room was clean, but we had no table or chairs to sit at only the bed. You wouldn't want to have to spend time in your room. It was fine to sleep in , the bed was comfortable . The breakfast was adequate but it was the same everyday , no changes in the food selection . We travelled with another family and they stayed at another hotel, so we spent more time at their place.

good location, upon arriving in the early morning it was really nice to be welcomed by name by one of the staff. the next day we slept in and missed breakfast, that was fine. but never saw the friendly staff member again after that, had a different person. we asked about where to hike, he was rude and not interested in helping us. we has issues with coffee machine that leaked all over the microwave (live powerpoints here also tv next to it), left a note for housekeeping-there was still water left, the next day we called reception and they sent someone up to fix it.. one of the lights in the room did not work and both lamps were on the piss (not straight) the room was small and dull but the bed was cumfy, the shower curtain is held up by a bar that extends out, by husband is tall and knocked it when entering and exiting, it came off (the curtain with the bar)..every time, this was really budget. if you take a look at the room everything is really poorly put together and dodgy it looks like its had multiple repairs and never done right, all the trimming the tiles, everything. the clean up of the room was a let own even the one mug we used was still dirty after housekeeping had been through.breakfast.... the $15 a fee for hospitality all i can say is the breakfast is crap so very crap, we had this once, then didnt want to go again. parking isnt cheap but is easily accessible. beach towels were nice to be able to use and get replaced. this place is great walking distance to everywhere tho. if u just want somewhere to sleep thats near everything than this will do. def eat somewhere else. also we can here the room next to us, everytime their lights were on we can see it, everytime the hairdyer was being used there it was incredibly loud in our room too, could hear everything.... (not so nice). noise outside as well will keep you up, its very loud, there is no sound proofing at all you might as well be outside.

It is in a great location. Walking distance from the beach. The street is loud and busy and looks ghetto but we only came in to shower and sleep. Be mindful when booking this hotel they have no parking lot. They charge $22 a day for parking in their garage and the lot next door is $23. We booked online and price was great but they do also charge a $15 a day hospitality fee. This includes breakfast, DVD rentals and beach towels. In addition to this fee keep $100 in your account handy because they "hold" it your entire stay. It'll read pending on your bank statement. Their breakfast is nothing fancy but pancakes are delicious. They only serve from 0700-0900 so I hope you don't plan on sleeping in. The rooms are extremely small, no counter space or bathtub but it is clean and well kept. TV is updated the beds are comfy. Be aware the AC is right next to bed so sleep with extra clothes on if you want it on during the night. Or it gives you the chance to snuggle with your loved one. Overall it's a decent value and it's Hawaii!!

we really enjoyed our stay here. The hotel is well located within easy walking distance of shops and restaurants in Waikiki. The rooms are smaller, but the bed was very comfortable and the staff courteous and helpful. We would definitely consider staying here again. The breakfast was included with the tour package we purchased. I would suggest there are better options for those who don't mind a short walk and prefer a better breakfast.

My husband and I have stayed at this hotel three years in a row. The price is decent, location is great, and staff is always friendly and responsive to our (few) concerns. One thing I'd like to see changed is the new $15/day Hospitality Fee. First, when I made my reservation a footnote in the confirmation email said that "Total charges may include a Hospitality Fee of $15/day plus applicable taxes." This is an unclear statement. As it turned out, the total did not include the charge. We also felt the charge was a bit high since we didn't use beach towels and chairs and didn't eat the breakfast every day. Although these are nice amenities, why not just include the cost in the charge for the room so that we don't have surprises when we are paying our bill? Alternatively, we'd be okay with just having to pay for the breakfast on an as-used basis. But I don't want to overemphasis this one complaint...we really like this hotel!

We stayed for 2 nights in a deluxe, we were on the ninth floor and could just see water through the two towers hotel from our balcony. This was great when they had the fireworks for the Honolulu featival as we could see from our balcony. Room was good, just a standard room but did have a bar fridge/kitchenette area with a microwave and crocery. Was a pretty good location, about 5ish minute walk to Waikiki and lots of little convientant stores close. Staff were friendly and happy to help. Only thing is the 'continental buffet breakfast' isn't worth it. Very basic, pancakes were the only good thing but we ended up buying breakfast after the first visit to the buffet. But overall very nice experience :)

My husband and I stayed here Feb 19th to 23rd, 2015. The price paid for the location (about 4 blocks from Waikiki Beach) and amenities (kitchenette, breakfast, shuttle, wifi, etc.) was great. Don't expect first-rate digs, though. The room, though clean, smelled mildewy (could be that it's a tropical location and the windows were simply slatted plastic open to the outside if you wanted and never really shut tight) and the bathroom was rather old and the shower changed temperature as other rooms around you used their water. The breakfast was a basic continental breakfast with the addition of pancakes. I could've gone with a bit more variety and more healthful choices.Our room (as most rooms, I think) had a kitchenette with refrigerator, microwave, sink, and a full set of dishes, which was nice and appreciated since it's terribly expensive to eat out all the time.Most of the staff was friendly and helpful and it appeared to be a safe location. There was even a set of coin-operated washers and dryers for hotel guests to use. As with many hotels, this one charges an additional $15/day resort fee that we were told covers the breakfast, wifi, shuttle, "free" DVDs, game station, and a few other things I can't remember. While I understand the practice I just wish they would tack it on the price and be done with it - anyone who comes to Hawaii will already have been "fee-ed" to death by the airlines, the extra taxes, and the cost of everything in Hawaii.
