Appalling breakfast, saggy mattress, extremely noisy street, slatted windows don't close fully, air con unit on wall at face level next to bed so unable to tolerate when sleeping.All round poor experience.

I stayed overnight at this hotel on 27 Feb 2015...l haven't got a good word to say about it! Indifferent reception staff verging on the rude received me at midnight after my long and delayed flight from Auckland...then I found that my allocated room was next to the lift so l was disturbed thro the night...worse: dirty and stained sheets were on my bed! Also l was told by reception that I had to pay an extra $15 for breakfast, in spite of having a 'free breakfast' voucher...I refused to pay, after a fight, but then had to suffer a very poor breakfast in cramped conditions.Avoid this hotel at all costs.
user_name:
juliab662015
Brighton and Hove, United Kingdom

review_body: I stayed at the Aqua Aloha Surf Jan 29-Feb 5 and can say that the customer service I received was beyond my expectations. Douglas at the front desk went out of his way to ensure that everything was satisfactory. The view was spectacular from the 14th floor of the canal, diamond head and the ocean. One could not ask for anything more. Previously Douglas had exceeded my expectations and this time he surprised me even more. What an exceptional asset to the hotel you have it was such a pleasure dealing with him. The rooms are clean the staff go the extra mile to ensure you have a pleasurable experience. Looking forward to returning next year.

We as a group spent two different stays here. We occupied the 2 bedroom rooms. Hotel is older but clean and comfortable. Service was great. Good location to the canal and a short walk to the beach. They offer a free shuttle to the Ala moana shopping centre. However you need to take a short walk to another of their hotels to catch the shuttle. Staff was very helpful in providing information.Breakfast was included and it was fine.The hotel offers laundry mats which comes in handy on a long stay.

I ended up with this hotel via Hotwire so I didn't know the hotel I was getting. This reservation was made on a Thursday for the following Monday travel. I got a really good rate. Once receiving the hotel name I did some research and found out guests were generally happy but were critical of the room size.Upon arrival the location is very good. I don't prefer to be in the middle of everything so this was perfect. A five to seven minute walk to Waikiki Beach. The hotel lobby was nice and welcoming. The check in was simple, a lot of extras are included for the $15 resort fee. Parking was also available for a fee. I went to the room and my electronic keys would not work. I returned to the desk and got the keys redone. Again they didn't work.Douglas stepped in and offered me another room and even offered to upgrade me for my trouble as he made yet again another set of keys. Douglas was a superstar. I ended up staying in my original room after receiving a set of keys that worked properly.As advertised the rooms are small. Since I was in for business I would have preferred a room with a table and chair but the room size does not make it possible. Internet I found to be more than adequate speed despite reports of slow service.I would definitely stay here again without a second thought.

If you are looking for a clean affordable hotel in Waikiki that is in a terrific location this may be the hotel for you. It is dated but the staff are friendly and helpful. Most of the people staying here are middle aged retirees or families. The continental breakfast is about what you would expect at any motel but the seating area is very pleasant. We had a one bedroom suite with a large wrap around balcony ( lanai) which was great except that it needed more than two chairs. ( We were on the top floor). All and all this hotel is good value for money spent.

We stayed at this hotel about 4 years ago and it was absolutely brilliant so we stayed there again this feb from 10th till 21 st..although it was good it wasn't great as the first one was .The pick of the staff was the guy on the tour desk who was fantastic and very helpful and the cleaner we had on the 8th floor.the rest of the staff I think need to go on a team building day as they all seemed un helpful and like it was an effort to even answer your questions..the breakfast was nice,room was clan however being put by the lift shaft we had very little sleep.having said all this we would stay again due to the closeness of the hotel to every thing I'm just hoping they do something about the staff moral and helpfulness as some other people we spoke to had the same thoughts.

All the reviews giving this hotel a 1 or 2 rating are correct. Keep in mind this is a budget hotel and that's what you are going to get. It is on the level of a Motel 6 or an old Econo Lodge type of property. The pictures of the rooms on the website a very deceiving. The hotel rooms are old and have had obvious numerous repairs. The views from the rooms are looking at other hotels or apartments. We ate breakfast there one time and that was enough for us. The Sand Bar and Grill across the street has a breakfast buffet but it is not that good either for $12.95 a person. The plus to this hotel is that it is around the corner from a Food Pantry (small grocery store) it has a Coffee Bean coffee house and there are a couple of small restaurants in side as well.  If you are a senior you get a decent discount on the room rate if you are not a Senior I would recommend that you pay the extra money and go to the Marriot, Hyatt or Hilton.  Internet is free and only available in the lobby. Supposedly they are upgrading to wi fi in every room. The outside noise is a bit loud you can here police sirens and other emergency vehicles clearly and at all hours of the night and day. The pool is small but the beach is a couple of blocks away.

Night staff was a little sluggish and our fridge stopped working. I liked the room and ambiance overall but the shower is rather small as well. Very close to Waikiki strip, beach, diamond head and PearlHarbor.
user_name:
April D
Green Bay, Wisconsin, United States

review_body: we went to Hawaii with all anticipation of a wonder experience only to have exceed all our expectations what a wonderful Vacation. Things to see are Polynesian Cultural Centre Tour of the island contintental breakfast and a Quaint pool

This is our favourite Hotel, just 1 block from Waikiki Beach and Dukes Barefoot Bar.The Royal Hawaiian Shopping centre, restaurants and grocery stores are in the immediate area. Bus stop just around the corner on Kuhio.The staff are friendly and really go above and beyond in giving directions or information.WIFI is free in the reception area. Checkout time is 12 noon!

We have Been coming to this hotel for years with my family and it's become a tradition to stay here. Has all the essentials- clean room, friendly staff, free breakfast, and good location. It's not the place for anyone looking for a 5 star resort. This is a family friendly location that is perfect for anyone looking for an inexpensive, safe, clean location.

This hotel is in a great location. It was very close to shops, restaurants and buses. Drinks with the hotel manager was always a great opportunity to meet and chat with other guests. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Rooms were basic but were clean and tidy.

This was the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. Just a bed, TV stand. There was no dresser and not even a chair in the room. On the plus side it was a good location, convenient to beach and restaurants. There was a resort fee, but all that really included was breakfast.

We stayed at the Aqua Aloha for 6 nights in February. The location is good as it's centrally located within a few blocks of the beach & the main shopping strip of Waikiki. Our room was pretty small and in contrast to the pictures rather dated (for example, the safe is key-operated, some of the windows have ancient crank-operated panes that don't close all the way). In addition, there are no screens on the windows or sliding door. The TV size is microscopic. Our room was on the 6th floor facing Kanekapolei St and the street noise is very loud-- keep this in mind if you're a light sleeper. The free continental breakfast was barely palatable-- we decided to forego it after the first day as there are plenty of great breakfast places nearby. On the plus side, the staff is friendly and accommodating, there's a water cooler with hot & cold water, free coffee & tea 24 hrs/day as well as free video rental with an automated DVD dispenser (akin to Red Box). They also give you beach towels. Another caveat: if you have a rental car keep in mind the parking fee is $22/day.

We stayed 2 weeks with them through Air Canada vacations. All of our hotel costs and fees had been paid before leaving Vancouver B.C. Upon arrival, we were told that we had to pay a 15.00 per day extra hospitality fee or we could not get into our room. This was not mentioned at time of booking with Air Canada who should have notified us. When I arrived back in Canada, I emailed Tim for assistance in making our case against air Canada - he refused to help in any way After all he had already got his money and could not have cared less about our situation - what an irresponsible jerk. The beds were way too soft and it was incredibly noisy all night, so getting a nights sleep is quite hard.

Very convenient location. Got upgraded from superior to delux, very spacious, equipped with kitchenette so very handy for self catering. However we had problem when checking in. We requested for early check in at 12. It was not possible and we were told to come back at 2pm . And yet at 2 room was still not ready and needed to wait for another 20mins. However we waited in lobby until time passed 3pm, toom was not ready yet. Finally check in around 3.20pm, wasted our first day of trip. Generally a good place. Some staff were helpful but some were not.

This hotel is in a great location. We were three blocks from the beach and the zoo. We left our rental car at the hotel for most of our stay. We walked to the beach, the Zoo and the restaurants to eat. Bike and scooter rentals are within walking distance also. The staff was very courteous and knowledgeable. Cristal was awesome and very helpful. We enjoyed our stay!

We spent two nights at the Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki before our Hawaii cruise. We had stayed there around 5 years ago as part of a Delta Vacation and were pleased with the accommodations. On the plus side: we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite that was clean and quite large and had two tv's, a comfortable bed, a large balcony from which one could see mountains and the ocean, a small kitchen and ample storage. The breakfast was fairly simple but plentiful, and the staff was friendly and helpful. The beach is a very short walk from the hotel, and there are many restaurants and shops within walking distance. The only minus: an update on the furnishings would be nice. Bottom line is that we were happy with this property and would definitely stay there again.

Stayed here for two nights with my wife, and overall, had a good experience. Staff was friendly and helpful, and we were quickly checked in after arriving late in the evening. Included in the $15 daily hospitality fee, is unlimited beach towels you can pick up at the front desk. You can also borrow dvds and PS3 games to view or play in your room. That was nice and my wife and I got to watch two movies after returning to our room each night. The room was small, but clean and quaint. The only problem we had if any, was the size of the bathroom. It was TINY! The sink did not have a place to put your things, so all of our toiletries needed to be placed in the sleeping area in front of the TV. Shower only was not problem, but it was very small. Besides the bathroom, we didn't have any problems with noise from the street, even though we cojldve hear cars and people coming back from the clubs. Keep in mind that we were on the 11 floor. If you are a light sleeper, that could be an issue. All in all though we had a good experience and will probably be back.

This is the second time I have stayed here over the years it is very clean great value a free breakfast swimming pool the staff are always there to help you so if you are looking for value for money look no further this is the hotel for you and to the manager your staff are a credit to you. Mahalo . Sandra.Kelly

As a base camp the location,friendliness and no frills value Aqua Aloha Surf worked beautifully for our winter getaway. Definitely recommend upgrade to larger room for $10-$20/day and higherfloors get a great view. Honolulu's oldest grocery is next door...a little noisy, but very convenient.Staff excellent, breakfast predictable, pool small and cold, but super deal for the money especially if you know what you want to do on Ohahu and want to do it on the cheap.Really can get away with just using public transportation or their shuttle. Only need to rent a car/scooter for a day or two for North Shore or whatever and you can usually get a free activity or more buy succumbing to an obnoxious timeshare spiel (Don't Buy!)Overall our best yet "resort" find if you just want to hang around in urban paradise.

Our stay at Aqua was overall..great! Kalei and Douglas at the front desk, along with Myra our housekeeper provided excellent service on all levels! We would like to thank them personally, as well as all the staff at the aqua for going out of their way to accommodate any need or concern. the breakfast was a nice touch, however really not the best tasting... However, we will be back on our next trip!! Aloha, and thank you for your warm hospitality!!

Thank you Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki Hotel! They have the best customer service. Friendly people! Very affordable rate with free breakfast!!! I would highly recommend this hotel in town. Clean and neat. It is very close to shopping stores. Mahalo and more Power to the company and to the team.

good value for the price, close to everything, only 3 blocks to the beach.the staff were very friendly and helpful.nice continental breakfast had fresh made pancakes every morning.this is an older hotel but very clean was a bit noisy in the morning from traffic and delivery trucks would stay here again

I'm originally from Oahu and recently went back for a short weekend visit and was pleasantly surprised at how wonderful this hotel was! I can't believe I never knew it was there! My first encounter was with Douglass at the front desk and I have to honestly say, I have never seen anyone embody aloha like him! He was so friendly and enthusiastic at all hours, and over the course of 2 days, I watched him meet and accommodate every guest with the same friendliness and enthusiasm as he did me. The room was also of a much higher quality than I was expecting for the price I was paying. I have stayed at hotels in Waikiki for $200/night that were not as nice as this. And the location was incredibly convenient! This will definitely be the only hotel I will stay at from now on.

Good location - short walk to Beach - understood we would have free wifi in room but was only in lobby - and it was slower than "our own at home" but didn't really need to be on it other than being on "Skype"Had microwave/mini fridge, in room safe - but no cutlery (not a kitchenette) coffee maker and coffee packages"Free" continental breakfast was more than we expected (this was included with your hospitality fee ) - boiled eggs, spam(which I found quite tasty) fresh made pancakes cereal rice donuts toast, some oranges/apples cut up -free coffee and drinking water in lobby was a plus - didn't have to buy water to drink - With hospitality fee being charged now we also had free dvds, beach towels and chairs which was convenient as we didn't have to bring that with us Rooms very small but you don't spend a lot of time in them anyway - beds were clean and comfortable and the pillows, - we faced the back of the hotel so was fairly quiet for Waikiki than other hotels we have stayed in.Staff was pleasant when approached for something.Overall, would stay again - for a short time - Also, remember this is a boutique hotel and a "budget" hotel.

good location is the only advantage of this hotel, which means it only costs you 10mins to reach the wakiki street, hint, there is a shortcut to go to there. staff are nice and sweet, I liked them when I stayed 8nights. However I have to say I chose this hotel at the first time is because they said they have free wifi and offer free breakfast. When we arrived there, the truth is you have to go to the lobby to use wifi and the wifi was sucked, i.e. the speed was slow and lots of people were waiting in the lobby. this disappointed me coz we wanted to use internet to plan the tour for next day and we were exhausted when we were back to hotel and had no patience to wait for the lousy wifi. in terms of the breakfast which was ok, they provided pancake, apple and orange were cut into slices, milk, iced tea, coffee and ham. if you booked standard room which including two twin sized bed, don't expect too much about the bed size! they are fairly small! and I could hear my neighbour FaceTime every night when I was in bathroom. The good thing is you have a tiny fridge in your room that can store fresh fruit cut.

Stayed with another couple in this very centrally located hotel. The staff were amazing as we got scammed by an ad ( re:an apartment in Ala Moana Hotel)in Craig's List so the manager and the staff at reception did their best to give us a good rate & gave us nice rooms on the 14th floor. The hotel is a bit dated but clean.To us the people made this place! Everyone is very friendly & the manager has a cocktail party once a week in the lobby. Very nice gesture!Will definitely return!!

I stayed in this hotel for two days and I had a great experience, the room, the service, the staff and the location were perfect for me, I had all I need. Kudos to the reception personnel, they were helpfully and friendly all the time.

My significant other had a very nice stay at this hotel. The staff was very friendly, & did a very good job in maintaining a clean environment, & attending to our needs. Our only real dissatisfaction was with the poor Internet availability. There was only Ethernet connectivity in our room. We could have lived with that if the Wi-Fi connection in the lobby was stronger. However, that connection was very slow. We would like to stay there again, particularly if the Internet connectivity issue is rectified.
user_name:
Steve C
Fairport, New York, United States

review_body: My Mom and I were booked into a two queen bed room for four nights into this hotel, between Christmas 2014 and New Years Eve. Unfortunately when we arrived, our room was not ready. We waited until late afternoon, early evening only to be told that there were no rooms left except a very ordinary one double bed room. Keilei was very rude and unhelpful to my Mother. Due to no other availability, we stayed in the room one night. I slept on the floor on a blow up mattress in a very small room Room 309. Douglas (the evening manager) was very helpful in getting us into a different room for the next 3 nights of our stay, however, it was a king-size bed (still only one bed) I did not want to sleep with my Mom, so elected to sleep on the floor with the same blow up mattress for the next 3 nights. The room was much better and cleaner and had a view of the Ala Wai canal off the Lanai. (Room 402).

Don't change a thing. I had the perfect experience at this hotel. From the time I checked into this hotel, until the time I left. The front desk was helpful with directions, both walking and driving. The concierge made excellent luau and attraction suggestions. And then made the requested reservations.  My room was always spotlessly cleaned.  The continental breakfast was fresh and plentiful.  In my experience, if something is not broken, you don't fix it. So I would not change anything.

First of all, this is a budget hotel. You can't expect what you didn't pay for. I think this hotel offers really good value. It's very clean, and they provide coffee in the room and a simple continental breakfast every morning. The daily resort fee is one of the lowest. As other users have mentioned, getting the higher floor street-view rooms will ensure you a beautiful view of the canal every morning. We happened to get a room right behind the elevator shaft... if you're a light sleeper, request to be AWAY from it beside you can hear the mechanics of the elevator non-stop. We only got a full size bed in our room, so depends on who you're going with, and how big you are, you might want to request the bigger beds.

When checking in make sure you get the room you reserved. We reserved a superior room... but we were given a small room with a broken TV phone & lights. After a discussion with the front desk they moved us and we finished the week in a superior room...excellent! Great staff, great location. We would stay there again but only if we were guaranteed the superior room.

We called the hotel in advance and were told a price. When we got to the hotel, the price we had discussed was not available. They did give us a discount though. Upon booking for one more night, we had to pay full price. Room: we stayed in a deluxe room with a king and hide-a-bed. The room was very small and simple. There's enough space to turn around, but you will need to move some things if you want to open a suitcase. The balcony is scary on the 14th floor as well as not very clean or well kept. Staff: seemed friendly enoughEnvironment: great location, nice music, open lobby, surrounded by shops. Close to beach and beautiful canal. I won't be staying again and I would not recommend it.

Our room was small, but an adequate size for a 1 week stay. Clean and well appointed, air conditioning worked great. Was pleased about the hangers in the closet and ironing board. The safe however could use an update...bit of a pain to carry a key on us at all times...punching in a code of our choice would have been ideal. Bathroom was only large enough for one person, water pressure in shower was good, found it odd there was no switch for a fan. Was also disappointing there was no counter space to set down toiletries. We always had plenty of towels stocked each day. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful, and we enjoyed the free drinks on Tuesday's Happy Hour. Location was a 7 min walk from the beach, and we enjoyed only being a block from Kings Court which has an awesome 50s Diner and hosts a Farmers Market Mon/Wed/Fri, where we got fresh fruit and other delicious treats. The continental breakfast was a money saver for sure, mostly carbs, the fresh pancakes were yummy, would have liked to see more fresh fruit and yogurt for healthier options.

The Aqua Aloha Waikiki classes itself as a two and a half star hotel - and as far as 2.5 star hotels go, it gets a 5 Tripadvisor dot thing rating from me!Sure, the hotel and room could do with a little updating - so perhaps don't stay there for your honeymoon if you are trying to impress your spouse with luxuriousness (unless you don't really like him/her that much) - BUT, the room has everything you need - a kettle and coffee sachets... air conditioning... a TV and a Playstation 3 to charge USB devices on or to watch DVDs (which are supplied downstairs)... a safe, and a comfortable bed (with a huge mirror behind it... maybe it would be good for a honeymoon??).Wifi is free and works in the lobby - I was on the 2nd floor and managed to connect as well. The continental breakfast was good - highlights were pancakes and mini donuts.The location cannot be beaten, perfect for quick access to both the beach and the main shopping areas. The staff were the best part of my experience there - Douglas at the front desk was extremely helpful and genuinely cared about the guests. The housekeeper was really friendly as well, and did an awesome job too!

If you stay at this hotel, go for the deluxe rooms. We were given 2 superior rooms (because we had requested a king bed and did not get it the first time around). Staff was for the most very pleasant. Both rooms were clean, but the superior rooms are very sparse. We had a bed, a dresser with a microwave and a coffee machine on it and a cabinet with a fridge in it and the TV and a gaming unit on it. That is it. Our suitcases had to stay on the floor because there was nowhere to put them. There was no chair to sit in. When we asked at least for a chair, we got a plastic chair. We were told that all the units are owned by different people and what the unit has is what the people think they need to supply. The deluxe units I think are bigger and have a sofa. Another thing that was something I did not care for is the bathroom sink is in the bedroom. The tub and toilet are in a closed room, but not the sink. Our balcony was very nice with a fantastic view but it was so windy while we were there, we could not sit on it. That is no fault of the hotel, but the season.If you are interested in the gym equipment, that consists of 3 pieces of equipment just outside the lobby in what looks like a 4'x10' lane way. The free breakfast is not bad, pancakes, oatmeal, ham, hard boiled eggs, rice, pastry, toast, coffee, tea and juice.One thing the staff did do for us which we are very happy about, was hold our room for an extra day and did not charge us for the first day because our flight was cancelled on the Monday because of mechanical problems and we could not fly out until Tuesday. We are very thankful for that.

We stayed at the aqua aloha surf for 8 nights during November 2014.The hotel was fantastic value for money, and most staff were very helpful and friendly.The rooms were clean and house keeping ladies were lovely and helpful. A big thank you to Candia- she was great. Malakai and Douglas from the front desk were always willing and able to help us with any queries and also recommend some great restaurants. A few areas where the hotel could improve would be the wifi access, this is unfortunately only available in the lobby- would be great if they could extend this to all the levels.Another area which could be improved was the breakfast, it was extremely basic and I believe US $6 is a little pricy for what is actually included. It seemed to stay the same every day- would be great if they mixed it up a little. We were also a little disappointed when we approached the lady at the concierge one day, she was extremely unhelpful and was more interested in her Facebook.The location was great, it was down a quiet street and about a 5 minute walk to the main strip, beach and very close to the trolleys, public bus and lots of restaurants.We really enjoyed our stay and we would most definitely return, especially if the wifi

My best friend and I (both guys) ask for to beds. we got one room 210. We got in late 12:30 (2:30 our time) .. we open the door and said I thought we got to beds .. walking in it look like a kid bed or military type bed but look ok.. we walk to the a/c we saw aunts 15 to 20 aunts crawling on top of a/c .. I grab toilet paper kill all I saw. They never came back we stay for 5 nights. . The bathroom is beat up a little and dirty .. but not too bad.. this a stain up on the wall look like old jello splatter. One of the days I don't think they clean our beds but still got news towels. . I saw sand on the bed and sea water stain.. I would be giving the stay a 1 however the staff was helpful and nice.. but it's ok for a budget stay. . Hawaii is expensive. . But I wouldn't want to go anywhere Lower then 130 out the door. . Its was my first time in hawaii .. but not first stay in a hotel. . Its (location) really close to the beach another reasond it's got a 2 star.. there food is like camp food .. but all said and down I don't think you can beat the price and location. . But the WiFi only work down in the lobby trying to safe on data good luck. . And every one is usually using it at night

This hotel is I believe over priced but the location is fantastic. Hotel staff were average not overly helpful but we only stayed 2 nights as a stopover before cruising. Breakfast was not worth going too but we were OK with that

I stayed here with 3 other friends on our first trip to Hawaii. We were backpacking around America and this place was a good find! It is walking distance to Waikiki beach & precinct and has a small pool and a few pieces of gym equipment.The staff are friendly and helpful and you can hire beach towels, beach mats & beach chairs for free from reception.Having four of us in one room was a bit tight and the lighting was quite dim, but our stay was comfortable. They don't offer wifi in the rooms but it's free in the lobby (although arduously slow).On Tuesday evenings, they offer free cocktails to hotel guests at a small reception-type thing which is nice. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to travel comfortably on a budget!

We stayed just for one night but it was also a good experience. Nice staff, spacious and cozy rooms in a good location. We can walk to everywhere we need and far enough away from the noise.I stayed here for a week, it was in a great location far enough away from the noise, yet close. Breakfast was also very good.

Stayed here in March 2014 for 10 nights. Booked a double superior room and were given room 612, with a small balcony. The location is excellent- just a few blocks walk to the beach and a myriad of shopping opportunities, and a few minutes from public bus stops to take you round the island. This was my second visit to Oahu (loved it so much I had to return) - my previous budget hotel was a few blocks away- but the deal at the Aqua Aloha was better. Breakfast was basic but tasty - the freshly made pancakes were absolutely delicious. Spam and rice was available too. Coffee in the room tasted weird but there was some available in the lobby during the day which I preferred. Some people were put off by the birds flying over and onto the tables on the outdoor section at breakfast - this didn't worry me but I guess it could be a hygiene issue.Didn't use the outdoor pool as the beach was so near. The lobby area was small but pleasant - enjoyed using the wifi in the evenings to research our trips for the following day.The room itself had a nice partial view over the canal towards the mountains. Shower was very basic (which I expected) but it did the job. The bed was comfy enough but the downside to the room was the noise and lack of privacy. Curtains didn't quite cover the window area enough and you could partially see into windows in apartments opposite. (I ended up using a peg to secure the curtains). Also - the slatted windows, which didn't close fully, meant there was a lot of noise and echo from the street below. The noisy aircon helped to block this out.I've given my rating based on the fact that Waikiki can be a very pricey place to stay- but the Aqua Aloha meets all your basic needs without breaking the bank.

I stayed here for a week, it was in a great location far enough away from the noise, yet close enough to walk everywhere. Great price. Great staff that were also able to help with day trips.The restaurant was yummy, there was a busy club across the road, but i can sleep through anything. Can't wait to come back.

We booked a Double Superior room, on our arrival we were given the keys to our room on the 3rd floor. On checking the website I found that they had in fact put us in a cheaper room not a Double Superior. On making inquires on the second morning they then moved us to the correct room type on the 14th floor. They did apologize for the mistake but I feel that it should not have happened. This was second time we have stayed at this hotel in the last 2 years. The location is great but the hotel does show signs of aging and the bed was not the best. It is value for money, the staff are very helpful, I would recommend this hotel.

Due a mix up by our travel agent we arrived to find we weren't booked but the staff were very helpful and arranged a 3 day stay - prepared to sort it out with our agent. Room ( a superior room) was larger, overlooked other high rises and although older it was clean and well equipped. Had crockery, cutlery and microwave. A short walk to Waikiki beach, bus links, restaurants. Wifi free but only available in foyer. Continental breakfast is included but very poor quality and range. Laundry facilities available at a reasonable price.

My partner and I stayed at Aloha for one week recently. It is close enough to the beach and the main strip of Waikiki (Kalakaua Avenue). There's also plenty of good restaurants within walking distance. The hotel itself is very welcoming and all the staff are all too willing to help in anyway they can. One night they even had free cocktails and music in the lobby with all staff in good spirits. The rooms are a little tired and dated but they are also very clean and accommodating. The rooms contain a safe to store your valuables in whilst exploring Oahu. However, travelers should be aware of few things. The breakfast is rather basic (good if you like pancakes though). There's no Wi-Fi in the rooms, only in the lobby and it's a bit on the slow side. Finally, there's some questionable characters out the front of the hotel but it's hard to blame the hotel for that!Apart from the above negatives we considered this hotel great value for money. We would recommend this hotel to any traveler that is more concerned with spending money on tours and food. The hotel provides everything you need for an enjoyable and comfortable stay.

room was clean. but less than I expected. you pay $20 a day to park. continental brkfast wasn't too bad but I expected better. very small pool. within walking distance to shopping and resturants . not too far from diamond head, pearl harbor and the beach. and not too far from the airport. and since I am a smoker the area for that was pretty nice out on a balcony with chairs and tables. if you are budget minded this is a good place to stay.

I stayed here in May of 2013 and it was booked by my travel agent along with my flight. I ended up with a corner room on the top floor with a spectacular view! It's a few blocks away from the beach, but being on the Southeast corner of the building I had a great view of the mountains and being so high up I could also see some of the water between the ocean front hotels.On the downside, the lock on my balcony sliding door wasn't exactly secure. It was still worth the stay if you want to go but don't want to splurge on an ocean front resort.

I used this hotel as my base for my 2 week stay. I'd booked a superior room and was upgraded so had a lovely room with plenty of space. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is basic but it provides all you need for a breakfast and I found it fine. I would stay here again.

Room was adequate and quite modern, 40 inch TV in the room but no HD. This was all good, but the AC (the window AC) was in the opposite corner of the bed. It was very loud at full capacity, and the temperature of the room never got below 77. In Hawaii they should know the importance of the AC. Not enough for me to sleep comfortably.

Great experience staying at this very reasonably priced hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff. Room was a good size and clean. Super comfy beds! Great location- only a 5 minute walk to the beach and lots of great places to eat nearby. Would recommend a massage at the day spa- pure heaven! Only negatives? No wifi in the rooms, only a fairly slow wifi available in reception and although clean our bathroom could have done with an update. I would stay here again.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel almost 4 weeks. Although the hotel is not a luxury brand, the rooms and grounds were very clean and the location was terrific. It is only about 2 or 3 blocks from Waikiki Beach. Literally every staff member was cheerful, helpful and knowledgeable and that includes housekeeping, to front desk to management. The location was also close to a Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf location, which is inside the next door Food Pantry. And it's only a block from an ever-popular ABC Stores location. As to staff, I know I'm forgetting some folks, but Nikki, Vinh, Douglass, Jasmine, Tim, Kalei, Nolan, and Helene and the bellman, whose name I forgot, were exceptional.

Not flash but who goes on a holiday to sit in their room. The staff were very friendly. Room was clean. House keeping excellent. Breakfast was suitable. A bit noisy on the Friday and Saturday night. Close enough to beach and shopping.

Stayed 4 nights. This is a good budget hotel. We were only staying 4 nights and it served its purpose. It was clean and comfortable. Had coffee maker TV, air con. Breakfast was included. The location was good, near to Waikikii beach. The staff were helpful.Okay so you had to go to the lobby to use Wifi but all in all no complaints. You pay for a budget hotel, you get a budget hotel.I would stay here again for a short break. If I was staying a week or more I would probably shell out more and not look for a budget hotel.

If the course the hotel is great located but everything else was not like it should be. First I changed my room because the first one was on the lower floors and to the street. . Far to loud... Then my TV switched on from itself. .. On the loudest volume level and I couldn't turn the TV off. . They had to replace the TV. .. Then I had ants in my room. .. More or less everywhere. .. They sprayed the room afterwards there where less ants. . And my room card didn't work regularly. . In depends who was at the reception desk you got help in a nice way. But if I see the price that I had to pay. ..it is far too expensive. . Sorry

Arrived at 6pm into Honolulu, did not have a hotel reservation, made one w/ expedia right at an internet cafe, confirmed w/in an hour and the hotel w/ the best price for Honolulu in WAIKIKI was absolutely AMAZING!Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki: First time to this hotel, did not chk-in till 945pm, was grouchy feeling really tired after a 10hr flight. My experience: ABSOLUTELY PHENOMENAL! Customer Service/Hotel room/Cleanliness/Security/Price/Overall Experience: 5 STAR EXCELLENCEA loyal customer for sure! Thank you Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki!To the staff and Gen. Mngr: Mr. Vinh, Mr. Lance, Mr. Malaikai, Mr. Matthew(security guard) and Mr. Tim Clark(Gen.Mngr) Thank you for your staff's upmost professionalism and great customer service, your training and leadership of your staff reflects your 5 star like hotel's commitment to excellent customer service! Thank you Sir. A loyal customer for sure!

This hotel was the worst of my hawaiian trip. There is no in room wifi so you huddle in the lobby with 15 people skyping so the connection is slow. The room has old style a/c that rattles and the windows are glass shutters so forget about quiet AND despite only being there less than 9 hours and NOT disclosing it at reservation time they stuck me with a $15 amenity fee!!!! AVOID this hotel!

Leaves a lot to be desired! Poor location in a fairly run down part of town. Facilities outdated, rooms tired and in need of refurbishment. Very unwelcoming receptionist when we arrived. Food adequate though we only sampled breakfast. Air con didn't work properly and eventually the wall socket began smoking. Reported immediately and another receptionist said 'we'll check it out' no urgency, no offer of a move to a safe room! Insisted on move then we had to move ourselves with no help arriving, despite receptionist assuring us help would be available. Complained to manager who responded with platitudes and hoped we would have a better experience when we stayed there in future - as if! Staff seemed (unsurprisingly) to be apathetic and demotivated, probably taking their lead from their complacent manager.
user_location: Newcastle upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom
user_name:
geordiegirl255
Newcastle upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Did the job for 3 nights. Staff were all very good in particular the girl with black hair. ( sorry I forgot your name) Hotel was very clean and spacious. We had a condo which of you were on a budget is perfect as had a full kitchen. Very old feeling, very noisy, air con pretty rubbish and the lights were all temperamental. Location is a bit far from beach for surfers, but ok for town given the price. Be careful of hidden charges.

We got a killer deal for flight and hotel for two and out baby. This is the hotel our package included and it was worth the price. It's tucked away in a cute area and the hotel itself is clean and cute.There's a small pool outside and gym and has breakfast in the mornings.Breakfast is extra unless you include it in the hotel stay.The rooms were scent sizes not to big and devote was ok, I think the bathrooms need updating.Housekeeping did a great job and front desk was always helpful and there to assist the customers. Not to far from shipping, beach and other places. Perfect place as not to loud. I recommend this hotel worth the money you pay.

This was my fourth visit to Honolulu in the last two years. It twas virtually impossible to find a reasonably priced hotel at short notice. Having read the reviews I was apprehensive checking into the Aqua Aloha Surf. Although small, the room was very clean and had everything needed. The staff was friendly and the location was good. Breakfast was OK. Despite being on a low floor, the room was quiet. The only negative comments: a. No in room wifi b. The Aloha Surf, like so many other hotels in Honolulu started charging a "Resort Charge" of $15 per night. Overall, good value for the price paid ($115 + $15 Resort Charge = $130).

Obviously one of the older hotels, but it is well situated a few blocks back from Waikiki Beach.Reception was good and the staff always friendly. The pool area is small but adequate.the room we had was a studio with an extra couch and kitchenette which was very useful.Pity there was only WiFi in the lobby and pool area.

I stayed here for 5 nights during September. My room was very clean, but being on the front of the building a little noisy, this of course is not the fault of the management. Very well positioned for all attractions and would recommend the hotel for a short stop over in Waikiki.

We stayed here at the beginning of a four island tour. The room was clean, a bit dated but adequate when you are not expecting to spend the day here. Check in was efficient and the staff friendly and helpful. The pool area is small but ok if you want a quick dip after a day out. The central location means you can easily walk to Wakikii bay and the town without having to endure the bustle and noise. Breakfast was again adequate, certainly not fine dining. This hotel fitted the bill for a few nights but would not be one I would choose for a weeks stay. There are many cafes and restaurants nearby.

We stayed here after a flight cancellation for one night. Granted we came from Kauai which is a lot different than Waikiki. The staff was friendly but never answered the phone. We had to wait to arrive in the lobby before ever speaking to an employee. The check in was uneventful, swift. The room is small, very outdated and a little dirty. Views included trash on the rooftop and standing mucky water. The area surrounding looked seedy and gross. We were only here to sleep and it served its purpose but had it been any longer than one night I would have left and found somewhere else. No luggage rack, no storage areas, no counter space. Taxi from airport is around $50, they have shuttle service they will arrange for you for $12 at the front desk. This was definitely a bonus.Breakfast in the morning is overseen by a grumpy guard making sure you are a guest, I guess wanderers must try to get a free meal? Pancakes and toast, orange slices and cereal. We were happy to leave.

This hotel is small and centrally located. It offers breakfast but unless you want pancakes with ham or rice and sweetcakes your choice is limited. The staff are exceedingly helpful and friendly. They went out of their way to make our stay more enjoyable. If you feel the humidity...dont come in September as the lowest their(or any hotel) aircon goes is 60 degrees F.If on a limited budget this is the place to stay....if i come back to Hawaii i would stay here again.

We had a great time here, close to everything within walking distance. The room was small but had all that we required. The pool was great and when we were there was not very busy. The staff were helpful. The Continental Breakfast was very disappointing, we only tried it once and then preferred to go elsewhere. The Rooms are serviced everyday and are nice and clean.

Finding nice hotels close to the Waikiki strip and beach can be very expensive throughout all times of the year so when you are able to find an affordable option in close proximity to the mains points of interest, its a pleasant find. Aqua Aloha fits the bill; terrific location (which is paramount), clean & spacious rooms, accommodating & friendly staff and extra amenities such as beach chairs. This place is a solid choice for anyone coming to Honolulu. Its not luxurious but as a consumer you have to recognize value and Aqua Surf has it!
user_name:
MitchJS
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at this hotel 2 days before and after an inter island cruise in late August. The location relative to Waikiki beach is good and the facilities and size of their “Superior” room as described on their website suited our needs and budget.Travellers should note that the Continental Breakfast is very basic although they do provide hard boiled eggs . The hotel does not provide milk for tea, coffee or breakfast cereals, providing an artificial 'creamer' instead. There are no jugs in the rooms to boil water for tea. Tea bags and hot water are available in the lobby. There was a perculator for making coffee in the rooms.Our experience after the first stay was very positive. The second stay was unfortunately a disappointment. On our first stay we had a room with a fabulously comfortable queen bed and a nice view from our balcony. The room was clean and all the essentials we needed worked. Our check- in and check- out were handled in a friendly and efficient manner and our overall impression was very positive. Unfortunately our experience was quite different for our second stay a week later. Our room only had a double bed and the shower facilities were very old and tired. Our balcony view this time only looked over adjoining apartment blocks. In addition, we also experienced poor staff service when we dared to complain about the hotel running out of basic provisions (tea bags). There were also issues with other provisions in the lobby that weekend. The older male service staff on duty were at best indifferent and certainly not customer service focused. The tea bag saga, and no creamer and cold coffee in the lobby are only small issues per se, but when combined with a room that was anything but 'superior' and unhelpful/ unfriendly front desk staff, the positive experience of our stay the week earlier was 'wiped out'. It's such a pity that small, and easily preventable issues tarnished our memories of this hotel

You just can't goo wrong with this hotel.. We have stayed here twice.. And love it !! The staff goes above and beyond to help. Close to the beach, affordable, comfortable, clean, friendly, continental breakfast. The parking was affordable. Even provide towels for the beach. We can't wait for our next stay at the Aqua Aloha surf.

We stayed at the Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki this past weekend after surfing around the net for places to stay for the night. We spoke with Amanda via phone inquiring about pricing and hotel options. She represented several different hotels in Waikiki and gave her suggestion to stay here...and we couldn't be more glad :)Check in was a breeze, I loved the cute AQUA theme in the lobby. Very boutique-y. Kalei at the Front Desk checked us in, he was very friendly and personable.We were upgraded from a standard room to a deluxe. The room was adequate and the bed was soooo comfortable, I wish I could take it home! It came equipped with a mini fridge, free internet access, microwave and silverware. We would definitely stay again, just wish they had more parking stalls available for hotel guests. But you can always park at the parking lot right around the corner. (We managed to luck out and get the last single stall available.This is a great option for budget minded guests, you have a steal of a deal continental breakfast buffet for $6. This is a good place to stay if you plan to be out and about the days you are here. We'll stay again, thank you!

10- minutes walk to waikiki beach.5-minutes walk to the bus station.very friendly and helpful staff.the breakfast is just soso and it'll be better if there is wifi in rooms.could use towels for free ,and there's wifi at hall.

Not luxurious. Place to rest your head at a better price compared to other hotels. Good location. Free drinks in the lobby on Tuesday afternoons. I wouldn't have the free breakfast though. Gross! ABC store at the corner. Starbucks 5-10 minute walk west on Kuhio Ave. Only about a 10 minute walk to Waikiki Beach. Close to all amenities. Extremely expensive parking rates! You can park at the Aston at Waikiki Banyan at 201 Oahu Ave for a better price. Enter the parkade from Kuhio Ave. It's only about a 10 minute walk from the parkade to Aqua Aloha Surf Hotel.

After much internet searching about hotels in the Waikiki area, this hotel came up as best value and had rooms available. Our criteria were: pool, breakfast and WiFi + reasonable distance to the beach/centre. All hotels in this area are expensive, so we had to accept that, and we paid about $850 dollars for 6 nights. Breakfast was strictly limited to 7-9 am, which meant that we missed it on 2 days due to early starts, but when we had it, it was fine - all the expected continental items plus fresh made pancakes with maple syrup and porridge. Plenty of cut-up oranges for fruit.WiFi was restricted to the foyer area -but this was fine - rather nice to sit in the open foyer and use the internet. Charging socket available near the drinks machine. Free coffee/tea + daily paper in the foyer, too.Pool was small but adequate. Room was great. We paid a little more per night for an upgrade and got more space + two views (including one over the canal, looking towards the mountains). Also, on a quiet corner of the hotel which was good as others did complain about noisy street outside. Our room, on the 4th floor, was OK for noise, apart from the air conditioning - even if we switched ours off, you could hear others' working - but just imagine it is waves!Easy walking distance to the beach, the shops & restaurants and bus stops. The staff were lovely. Especially the concierge who was very knowledgeable and helped us patiently each day to plan our activities. Anything she didn't know, she looked up.Other staff were also nice; no problem about finding change for the bus for example (you have to give exact change of $2.50 per person).Interesting red shrimps displayed in reception - the hotel has a connection with their conservation on the Big Island. A small bookshelf has books available - as a keen member of bookcrossing.com this was a bonus and I left a book on the shelves and found one that I wanted to read.Bed was comfy and king-size. Room was clean and tidied every day. Coffee provided plus nice toiletries. Small balcony did not have much of a view but was useful for drying washing!The canal is close by and worth a walk along - you can clearly see at least two kinds of fish in the water.All in all, we were pleased with our choice and would happily stay at this hotel again.

Perfect location and great value for the price. Close to surfing and shopping. The room was a bit small but clean and tidy. Loved the fact that you can walk right out of the hotel and down the street to anything you might want to see and do!

I have travelled to Hawaii for 3 years straight. This is by far the worst place I have ever stayed in. Dirty rooms. Terrible staff. Rude, did not listen to requests, everything seemed to be too difficult. Only wifi worked in the lobby. The accomodation says it has a gym fitness facility. Excuse me, 1 treadmill a bike and a lat pull down is NOT a gym. This Is also located in the lobby for everyone to see. Pool, was like what's in my backyard. The place is a waste of money! Pathetic!! Very Disappointed!

I must say we were disappointed with our first and only night here, the room was high up but near the lift so we were woken early with this noise behind us. The air conditioning was noisy and not that effective, the room was tiny and we had an " upgrade" which i think was the balcony.The bathroom was tired with paint flaking off the lower side of the shower and a cracked basin.Worst of all was breakfast ( around 8.30/9.00) with everything picked over and nothing healthy on offer except a boiled egg. We didn't want sweet cereals, weak juice or waffles, possible the cheapest worst presented breakfast in 30 years of travelling.The pool is small and insignificant.We wished we had paid a bit more and found something more professional.

This hotel was great! Great location and an affordable price. It was basic and clean. The bed was super comfortable – so that makes me happy. The room itself was small – but enough room for two people. There was a TV and a fridge and all expected toiletries. The windows where those “slat-type” windows that you find all over Hawaii, so you will hear a lot of road noise, including the daily beeping from the garbage trucks at 5am. Ear plugs are a must. If you book directly through the hotel, you will get a free breakfast included. The breakfast is very decent. It includes boiled eggs, ham, rice, fruit and breads. The location of this hotel is about ½ a block to the main road where you will find lots of restaurants and shops and 2 small blocks to the beach and another main road where there are lots more restaurants and shops. You can borrow beach towels and beach chairs from the front desk. If I came back to Waikiki, I would stay at the hotel for sure. Ps. If you don’t mind walking a little bit and want an inexpensive, tasty meal, ask at the front desk for directions to the Rainbow Diner!

I stayed here for 6 days in mid July. Rooms a bit small but then again I was a solo but they were clean. First two days I had a room overlooking the street and yes it was a bit noisy even on the 11th floor but it was the sounds of people at work and I did not mind. The last four days a week later I was in a small room 204 which was at the back of the hotel and no street noise, just noise from kids having a good time in the pool. Breakfasts were perfectly fine despite other people complaining about it on this site. I got to breakfast at 7 am when it opened. Pancakes were hot and freshly cooked. There was also cake, donuts. rice, ham, hardboiled eggs two sorts of cereal... too sweet for my liking, variety of bread for toasting made up juice and tea and coffee. The tea was too weak but it was hot. Of course if you go to breakfast at 8.30 the food might be not so good. If I am ever in Hawaii again I would strongly consider staying here again. One more comment to make, as tea drinker it would have been nice to have a carafe of hot water next to the coffee bar on the ground floor. Mahalo Anne Heath

I booked this room though using Priceline. Traveling alone as a single woman in her 30's, I am very prudent to book a hotel room before I arrive in a new city. I also make sure that the hotel is in a safe area for a single woman. On August 1, I arrived in Honolulu via plane at 10:30 pm at night. As soon as my plane landed, I called the hotel to confirm the room at Aqua Aloha Surf. A woman who answered the phone confirmed my reservation and I informed her that I would be checking in in about an hour. She repeated that my room was confirmed. When I finally arrived at the hotel at midnight, I was informed upon checking in that there was no room available for me as the hotel overbooked. Lance, the man working at the front desk, stated that he had no idea why I was told that the room was confirmed considering that "everyone knew the situation." Rather, Lance informed me that Iwould be relocated to another hotel about 10 minutes away. It was midnight and as as single woman traveler, I was upset and a bit nervous about having to locate to a completely new hotel. When I arrived at the other hotel, it did not have the same amenities as the hotel room Ibooked. I specifically booked Aqua Aloha Surf because of its location to the beach and its wifi. The hotel they moved me to, Pagoda Hotel, was not within walking distance of Waikiki Beach nor did it have wifi internet access. Additionally, the taxi driver that took me to the new hotel told me that Aqua Aloha Surf tends to do this quite often- overbook and then move their guests to another hotel. I wanted to alertpeople. This hotel moved paying guests from the hotel they book to another one. This is a clear safety issue as travelers are forced to go to another area of town that they have no knowledge of.I would really recommend not booking at this hotel or any of its related properties. I would not want this to happen to anyone else.

we stayed here for 7 nights in july. The lobby is open and a pleasant place to sit and relax. The room we was allocated had a 'fusty' smell to it, I went to reception and spoke to Lance who immediately offered us another room which was much better, we also had part view of the canal which was nice, so thank you Lance for dealing with this without question. The rooms are small but comfy and clean, as are the bathrooms but they are in need of updating, the shower was old but good, and the towels were lovely - white and fluffy, also good toiletries. The free breakfast was adequate and the ladies serving were always pleasant to me despite negative comments made. I was concerned when I read complaints regarding the birds as I'm a bit phobic about them but just eat inside if they bother you as I did. This hotel is ideally situated, not far from the beach and the complimentary towels/chairs were an added bonus. All the staff here are pleasant and helpful, the concierge was very informative regarding trips, we booked the shark cage and that was a great experience! A pleasant stay at the Aqua Aloha Surf, it's budget - it's good!

I usually stay here around Christmas time; but I needed a break; what better place than Hawaii?Not to much different than my other reports about this very nice hotel.1) Location! 3 blocks from Waikiki beach, 1 -2 block from the food pantry/ coffee shop and other stores.2) Clean room - I usually get the "moderate" room. Nothing fancy, but very clean.3) Free breakfast - With expenses food prices in Honolulu, it's nice to save some money.4) Outstanding front desk! - As always, they are very helpful and are the corner stone of the hotel.The only negative thing I have to say about the Aqua Aloha Surf is the workout equipment. They have a recumbent bicycle, a small all in one cable machine and treadmill. The machines are functional but have clearly seen better days. As someone who likes to workout in the morning (and loves the convenience of having it available in the hotel) I would like to see management invest in some new equipment. Aside from that....I love this hotel.

Booked this hotel trough Air New Zealand Holidays.Was a bit anxious when we first got into the room, as at face value looked a bit aged and the bed looked small for me and my 6ft2 partner.We were on the 11th floor so had a balcony view of the street.My anxiety soon died down, the room was great for a first time trip to Hawaii.Bed was comfy and more than accommodating.DVD player in room with a movie rent kiosk in the lobby.Breakfast was not worth the hassle.Free wifi in the lobby was a nice perk although high traffic time made it slower than dial up speed (first world problems though)The elevators too, were slow and normally once a day only one would be in service.Again not really a massive deal, but when you are up 11 floors waiting for an elevator it causes impatience.Room was kept clean and tidy, desk staff were helpful and friendly.We booked tours through the tour desk at reception, who came across and uninterested until they realised you were actually booking with them. Great tours none the less.2 blocks away from the main drag and nothing really felt out of the way for walking. ABC shop on the same block- extremely convenient.Noise wasn't too bad, although was definitely worse on week days when delivery trucks etc would come by. Lucky we were up high, I could imagine it being much worse from lower floors.All in all great hotel for 8 day stay and would recommend in future.

I had a wonderful time at the Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki. The rooms were nice, the staff friendly, the breakfasts good. I couldn't have asked for much more! I booked all my activities through the hotel, and I asked staff members many questions about where to eat, what to do etc. They gave me such great advice. I loved the Tuesday night event with drinks and ukelele playing--nice touch! If you are looking for a budget option, this gives you everything you need in the right location. I definitely recommend!

My friend and I stayed here for the first part of our trip in June. The service was fantastic. The staff are always happy to help and have a positive attitude. The beds are bloody amazing. So comfy. The room we had was a little bit small but it did us fine the time we stayed there. The bathroom was a bit dated but it was clean. Overall awesome place to stay as it is close to everything and did I mention how comfortable the beds are?? I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family. We stayed at another Aqua chain hotel that was utterly disgusting but this place was the best.

I just stayed here for 7 nights. Overall this place is very clean. But very small. Did not see a single bug in 7 nights. Regardless of your reason for visiting the Honolulu this hotel is a great budget choice (would be a solid 2 star on the mainland). The hotel is close to restaurants and more shopping then a human needs. 2 Blocks from the beach. The hotel is relatively quite Of course my air conditioner was load so it blocked out most street noise, also blew directly on me and was not comfortable. I found the beds to be OK, but a little hard, complete with small frig & microwave & coffee pot. They just put Play station 3 in all the rooms so U can get free games and movies in the lobby. Had a Mgrs reception on Tuesday for an hour or so with free drinks and live music (nice touch) also had a low dresser.&a small TV (19”) I have a bigger one in my camper, never had one this small in a hotel room!! (see pics) bathroom that gives you NO space lay out your toiletries and with an old fashion step in shower.Definite lack of receptacles to charge your equip.The pool (outside) was nice looking ( I didn't use) free WIFI U in the lobby and I believe if U have an Ethernet cord U can plug in your room. Parking is $22.00 per night. The staff is very friendly & helpful.. Search for the best internet rate and can get and stay here, you won’t regret it. Overall if the price is right I would stay again.

The downstairs lobby is very simple and plain but I found the room itself was well presented, clean and quite a pleasant stay with good air conditioning, and even had mountain views from the balcony (I was staying in one of the superior rooms on the second from top floor, if I recall properly level 12). The bathroom seemed a lot older than the rest of the room, slightly tired perhaps, but was still very clean with no issues. Like most of Waikiki it was only a 5 minute walk to the beach, and there were plenty of places to eat and drink nearby. The public transport bus stops just round the corner, and offers a cheap and quick ride to places such as the Ala Moana mall and is a safe efficient way to travel round. The room does not have wifi but they do provide network cables if needed for free internet, the lobby has free wifi.

Hotel was actually nicer than we expected. It has an open lobby which was very pleasant. The pool is somewhat small with few lounge chairs. Short 5-10 minute walk to beach. Shopping and restraints very close by. The rooms were very nice. We got the larger standard room and it was quite spacious.

This is a great hotel for the amount we spent, although the new room was quite small and so was the bathroom, we had free WiFi in the lobby and a free breakfast. The beds we stayed in were super comfy and the was not a lot of noise from the street. The staff were helpful and always said hello and goodbye in the lobby. I stayed at another aqua chain hotel when we came through Hawaii a few weeks later and it was not up to the same standard as the aloha surf was. I would stay here again.

What they did well: Check-in was easy and quick, and we even received a free box of candy--an unexpected treat. The rate was very affordable ($99/nt booked through Hotwire) compared to other hotels in the Waikiki area, and this included a buffet breakfast (see more on breakfast below). And the location was good--walking distance to the beach, shops and restaurants. Because of this we didn't bother renting a car while we stayed. The room (queen + twin) was clean as was everything else in the hotel. There are a number of restaurants that participate in a delivery service to the hotel (a catalog of menus is in the room), so you could choose to eat in if you like. The concierge was very helpful, and we were able to purchase tickets to a luau through the hotel, a great time saver!What could be done better: The "queen" bed in our room was awfully small, and I suspected it was actually a double bed. My husband is big and tall, so the two of us in a double bed is not comfortable at all. The room was small, comparable to a cabin on a cruise ship, though it did include a small refrigerator, microwave and some dishes and utensils for eating. The breakfast buffet was almost not edible. The hard-boiled eggs were... well, let's just say that they had an unusual texture. (How do you mess up hard-boiled eggs??!) And the multitude of birds were constantly picking at the dirty dishes left by the guests at the tables and in a bin. If a free breakfast weighs heavily in your decision for a hotel, then this will be a disappointment. The decor and fixtures are a bit dated, but when you're spending most of your time at the beach and out-and-about, it probably doesn't matter much unless you want to hang around the hotel. Wi-fi is only available in the lobby with hard-wired ethernet available in the rooms. I can't connect my iPhone via ethernet so I was not pleased with the inconvenience.Overall impression: if you have a limited budget for vacationing in Waikiki, this hotel will suffice. Not bad, but not great.

This was our first trip to Oahu and wish we had stayed longer. The hotel suited our budget ,there wasnt a twin room available for our teenage boys the first night but they were moved to one the next day as promised. The rooms were clean, tidy and well equipped and the beds were very comfortable. Breakfast was included which was a bonus and the water and coffee freely available in reception was very welcome. The staff were friendly and helpful too. Our room was at the front of the hotel and the outside noise did carry at night so was not as quiet as I would have liked but that is not the Hotels fault. Would definately stay again if we are lucky enough to get back to Oahu. Mahalo for a great experience.

We've enjoyed our stay here at the Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki so much that we don't want to leave! :) Two night stay for $177.00 per night. You're literally a crosswalk away from the beach and the zoo!! The hotel is super clean and our double bed room (only one available during the 4th of July) was clean and modern. On the fourth my husband and I sat on the beach and watched the fireworks and it was such a wonderful evening! We've done nothing but walk up and down the strip, tons of shops and restaurants, there is so much to do! We HIGHLY recommend this hotel! The only downside, our view on the balcony was of the hotel beside us but that's because of last minute booking, didn't bother us because you don't go to the beach to sit on your balcony you go to the beach to play in the water! ;)

When we booked in we were exhausted after a long journey from London. The room we were given was on the second floor. It was clean but cramped and being near the street noisy. We asked if we could be upgraded and move room. The staff were very helpful and we moved rooms the next day. It cost us a little extra but we were on the 12th floor in a much bigger room and a lot quieter. We were supposedly able to use the free WiFi in the lobby. Some days it worked reasonably well but the signal was poor.Breakfast was an all you can eat for 6 dollars. All I can say is that you get what you pay for. It amazed us how much some people can get on one plate! The provision of a fridge,microwave and coffee maker meant that we did not have to rely on the feeding frenzy for breakfast.The hotel is in a convenient position. The staff are very nice and helpful.

We are a military family that has been staying here for 6 weeks now. At first, it was a great affordable place to stay with free extra ammenties other hotels didn't offer for free. NOW I wish we never would have stayed here. The ENTIRE point of us choosing to stay here was not only the price/free amenities but also because most other hotels were booked up or wouldn't be able to keep us in the same room for our entire stay. They messed up and booked our room out to someone else TWICE now..so now we get to move ALL our stuff along with our 2 YOUNG kids into another room. If I could go back and choose a different hotel I would.

I just want to THANK all of your staff and most of all Douglas, Nolan, Lai, and Jasmine... OMG THE BEST most friendliest people I've ever met. They’re on top of it all. Their knowledge and Can-do attitude comes natural to them. They truly made mine and my sister in laws vacation special. I left there feeling like family/friends. You have the MOST INCREDIBLE staff. They helped out every step of the way/day etc.. Denice and Ericka Bragg

Last week was my third time at this hotel. The rooms are comfortable, clean and the beds are wonderful. I like the little things they make it feel like home, like the water station, free coffee in the lobby, and free towel and chair rentals. My room had a microwave and a fridge for snacks as well. The staff is incredibly helpful. The location is great because it is quiet at night on the Ala Wai Canal, but close to the beach, restaurants, and shopping. After staying at other hotels in the past, this one has become by favorite.

My family and I spent 9 days at the Aqua Aloha Surf hotel in May 2014. The staff was terrific and very helpful. The room we stayed in -- 1604 -- was clean but somewhat shabby; it could really use some updating. The breakfast was terrible. There were fresh pancakes, but everything else was standard or bad. Ham, toast, cereal, oatmeal -- nothing special. The worst was the fruit -- apples and oranges every day and they were terrible. Hard to believe that we couldn't get a better selection of fruit on a tropical island.

I like this hotel. Even though the wi-fi may not be the best. The hotel is located on canal streel and only a few blocks from anything you could want to do. The rooms are clean, beds are a bit small, but they did just remodel. I enjoy having a room that looks out over the canal, there is often rainbows periodically durring the day.

My friend and I (two 26 yr old females) stayed here for 11 nights. This hotel is awesome for the price, you cannot get better amenities and the staff are wonderful. Great location 3 small blocks to the beach. Close to restaurants (chain and local) as well as well as many shops. They provide beach towels and beach chairs you can take to the beach, shampoo/conditioner, lotion, body wash and bar soap. In the room they have coffee makers as well as 24 hour fresh coffee in the lobby. Aloha also has purified water in the lobby and ice machines, so bring your water bottles. Staff are very helpful and friendly. I stayed down the street the last couple days of my trip (due to availability) and wished I was back at the surf every night! They are also close to free street parking, so if you can parallel park you can save big!

My family and i spent 5 nights at the Aqua Aloha Surf. The room was clean, the staff were very helpful and friendly. We had spent two nights there as a stop over two weeks prior and received a very warm welcome back. the Tuesday night drinks are a nice touch and Tim was a good host and bartender. The only negative was the included breakfast. i can only describe this in one word, Shocking!!! there is no effort to make the breakfast appealing and the choice was appalling. If you don't like pancakes your in trouble. They ran out of strawberry jam (Jelly) for your dry and rock hard thing i thought was a scone and no effort was made to replenish this. i Could go on forever regarding the breakfast and the people that ran it as they were extremely unprofessional which is not what i experienced with the rest of the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel but get your breakfast elsewhere.

I think the "acceptable" review from nvarley pretty much mirrors our own experience of this hotel.Breakfast choice was indeed very poor and seating is limited so you were often waiting to sit down to eat. Pool area (and pool size) was even smaller and you had to get your timing right to be able to spend any time here.We too had faulty card keys though were never actually locked out, just took many attempts to get in at times.But those were the only bad points. Yes, the rooms are a bit small and a bit dated, but it met our needs whilst staying here. We had a view towards the canal and mountains which was nice and worth requesting. Staff were always friendly and helpful too and overall it is a relaxing retreat after the hustle of the beachfront.Waikiki is a busy place. This place is handily located, close to the beach but away from the main strip. Even so, we still found it noisy at night and it's difficult to get much sleep. So yes it's 'adequate' in that it meets your need for a holiday!

I booked my room for the Aqua Aloha Surf for a business trip and as a result selected one of the cheapest options. I was not expecting much at all for the price, but boy was I surprised. From the moment I walked in the front door to the moment I stepped into my cab ride to the airport, I was greeted with friendliness and the 'aloha' spirit. My first impression was from the clean, open lobby and the friendly and helpful front desk. Not only did they greet me warmly and seem very happy to be there, the awesome gentleman at the front desk started up some small talk while he was processing my room and didn't rush me away from the desk as soon as he was done. In almost every other hotel I've been at, the front desk feels more like a 'business first' philosophy, and this is the first time I've walked away from the front desk and still felt like a human being (and not just a room number).For the next 7 days, the hotel continued to impress me. The hotel was close enough to the main area of the city for shopping, eating, night life, etc but far enough away that noise wasn't a huge problem. The room was big enough without feeling like a cave; just the right size to feel comfy. Personally, I don't need too much in a room to be happy and the room I booked was more than good enough. Besides the standard bed/dresser/TV, the room came equipped with clean dishes (including cutlery), a small couch, a coffee table, a sink, an (empty) refrigerator, air conditioning unit, and small balcony.From the location, to the friendly and helpful staff (including the front desk, manager, maintenance crew, and cleaning crew), to the room itself, to the amenities such as the pool and breakfast, everything was just right. Cons: None that I could think of. The only complaints I've seen are over the breakfast menu, free wifi, and pool size, possibly, but you are literally next to the main strip of Waikiki, which is bordering the crystal clear ocean waters. You have Diamond Head Crater and Pearl Harbor nearby, besides all of the attractions and authentic eateries (Pho Thinh, Leonard's Bakery, Rainbow Cafe, and Marukame Udon are all recommended). You shouldn't be at the hotel for these things!Pros: Everything. Next I'm in Honolulu (which will hopefully be soon, whether on business or pleasure) I fully planning on booking a room on at the Aqua Aloha Surf in Waikiki. 10/10, would recommend to anyone looking for a friendly, pleasant stay!

We left our 10 night stay at Aqua Aloha Surf without any feelings either way. Price wise it's very competitive, but that's because of the general condition of the hotel. Good/Bad List:Good: price, location, friendliness of staff, balcony viewsBad: Hotel feels old with tired decor and worn furniture, breakfast is shockingly bad with no variation at all from day to day (despite our breakfast being included we only ate there 3 times in the 10 days), our 'superior' room was tiny so I can't even imagine how small a standard room is, faulty card key system which meant we were locked out of our room at least once every day.If it was refurbished and some effort put into the breakfast menu it could be a fantastic hotel. Until then, it will remain acceptable at best.

Within walking distance to the main drag. Rooms were comfortable and well kept. Noise from the street was a little loud at night- disturbed our sleep some. The breakfast buffet (included in our cost) had quite a few options. Get there early for best selection. People at desk were extremely friendly and helpful.

Our last visit to Hawaii was 26 years ago - whilst a lot of things have changed, the friendliness of the Hawaiian people remains the same.It was our first stay at the Aloha Surf and we would return without hesitation.I think the hotel would benefit with a better choice for meal options.Our room was clean and tidy - with a great view of Waikiki - 11 floors up!All staff were very friendly!

A better than average budget hotel. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. The first room we had was very noisy and they moved us to another room the next day. Both rooms were clean and tidy. The bathroom could do with updating. Breakfast needs to be improved. I felt like I was back at school & eating in the school canteen. The location of the hotel is great. Easy to get to all the shops, restaurants and especially Waikiki beach. We had a lovely time and WHEN I go back to Honolulu I'll stay here again. Only reason I'm not giving a 5 is because of the breakfast experience.

Have stayed many times at this hotel and has never disappointed us. Staff are fantastic and will do anything to make your stay pleasant from your first aloha to see you next time. Hotel is in close all amenities and situated in a quiet area. Rooms are clean and continually updated, new curtains in my room during my stay. A great place to stay in Waikiki.
