Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. Walking distance to all amenities and beach. Room very clean and comfortable. Very quiet and convenient part of Waikiki. No bar and American breakfast available not European continental.

Great budget accommodation with extremely helpful and friendly staff and knowledgeable tour desk operators. All tours booked with ease. 5 min walk to main Waikiki beach, with fantastic shopping and eateries around the corner. It was so close to the "main drag" and city buses to Diamond Head, Ala Moana, Pearl Harbour within easy walking distance. Breakfast could be improved but had all the necessities to start the day. Would stay again. Thank you.

Very friendly and accommodating staff, clean rooms and a nice location close to the canal. Great value! If you like to be walking distance to everything and away from the hub of the "main drag", this is a great location.

My Husband & I stayed here in April for 5nts. Great location, room was great, good size with balcony and very clean. Staff were lovely especially Douglas. Great value for money. Loved it, Would stay again. Thank you

Room was average . Clean and neat , two beds but both on the short side , one sigle one double . Coffee perculator , fridge and washing up sink in room were good .No Bar in hotel . Breakfast was very poor and didnt eat any other meals there Staff were good . Good location . Laundry was fitlthy .WiFI only lobby area

This was the perfect hotel for us. Just two blocks from the beach and away from the noise at night. It was clean and well maintained and the staff were very friendly and helpful. I wish I knew the name of the front desk gentleman, but he was most helpful with any request we had. We would definitely stay there again and recommend it to friends who want a clean, reasonable, convenient option in Waikiki. Great stay!

A good value,friendly and comfortable hotel.Great location too.Only the traffic at night still annoying and a very bad breakfast ( is running by other company).Could be beter if the hotel provide free wifi at room.

My second time to Hawaii and I chose this hotel mostly based on location and price, and I think there is a perfect balance. We stayed for 5 nights and the cost was very reasonable booking 90+ days in advance. The location was great, very close to the beach, the ubiquitous ABC mart, and the Pantry grocery. The room was clean and what I would expect for the price. It's not top of the line, but you're there to go out and enjoy Hawaii, and when you come "home" you're coming back to a clean room with great staff.

great location. 5 min walk to the beach, 2 min to bus stations. room was nice and clean. The best staff we've met. Jasmin and Nolan are so helpfull and kind, helped us with anything we needed. There is parking in the hotel, and just behind it public parking (half price). it was hard to leave.

My wife and I changed hotels from Ohara west to the aloha surf. Smartest move I made. The staff are wonderful, kudos to Helene, vinh, Nolan, Doug to name just a few. We stayed at the aloha surf from March 14 until April 3rd. Rooms are clean, complimentary coffee was always hot. Every day the staff would ask how we are and is there anything they could to make are stay more enjoyable. I would highly recommend this hotel for your next Hawaiian holiday.Darryl C.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel April 20-23. We arrived at the hotel around 7:45 or 8 and when we got to the front desk they already had our room keys and everything else we needed, all we had to do was give them or card. I wish we would have got the lady's name that helped us that night, but we were too tired from flight. The room was a decent size, and provided what we needed while there. There were a few things I wish were different. Our window could not close and there were very strong winds so it caused the door to shake from the draft throughout the nights. Also, the bathroom door wouldn't lock and the bathroom in its entirety was outdated. However, the shower worked out fine. I wish the Internet worked also. We tried the wifi downstairs and the ethernet cord, but they both were not working. The breakfast was not what we expected, but it works for people on a budget. We loved how there were towels always available when we wanted to go to the beach. Overall we loved our experience in Hawaii and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. -Kevin & Fatima Vitto

We just came back from an amazing holiday there.. and I gotta say, the motel was amazing. yes it's an older motel, however, they really strive to give the best service possible, very accommodating and friendly. Our room was super small, so they were more than happy to upgrade us to an amazing room with a view of the canal and the ocean. We got a continental breakfast every morning. We were less than 8 minutes to the beach, all best shopping, the little markets around town and most importantly there were two ABC stores in view of our balcony. The motel is open air in the lobby which makes it very comfy. Our bed was amazing. I didn't like the pillows though myself, but I'm picky about that, but the bed was to die for. Coffee and fridge in our room. For an older hotel, it is def. worth the stay. we are staying there next time for sure.. Great job Aloha Surf Hotel..

Our family is here now ! Front desk staff was hilarious. Room is wonderful for the price. Only downfall about the place is that there is no breakfast offered and parking is very limited ! Definitely would stay here again .

This may not be the Marriott or the Sheraton but it will supply all you need while visiting the island. I have stayed twice in this hotel and enjoyed it: from the helpful front desk, the free breakfast, comfortable beds, and it's only a few blocks from the beach. Shopping and dining are located within easy walking distance of the hotel. On Tuesdays there is a managers social where guests are served the hotel signature drink the "Wipeout" for free. During this time you can also enjoy some island music along with some traditional dancing. For those looking to enjoy all that Waikiki has to offer then this is the place for you. I gladly tell others to stay here and I will be staying here again on my next visit.

We arrived to a weeks holiday at this hotel due to a contra deal with our holiday club. Unfortunately we were very disappointed with our pokey little room, small with no extras at the back of the building and overlooking the carpark. The room didn't even have a chair.As this was our first trip to Hawaii I wasn't looking forward to spending any time in this room, let alone a whole week! My husband mentioned my disappointment to Julian the desk clerk the next day and he kindly offered us a full upgrade to a larger room (with a chair!), higher floor with balcony, fridge, microwave and bath. Thank you, even arranged the transfer of our ample luggage. Sadly the room was very noisy - but then most hotel rooms are in Waikiki - rubbish trucks start their rounds VERY early, sirens and voices.... we left the windows open due to a noisy air conditioner, so couldn't win either way. However the bed was good and comfortable.The location is 4 minutes walk to the beach and convenient to different food options, supermarket very close by. Desk and tour staff pleasant and helpful.The breakfast was very disappointing, hardly anything left the first day with still 20 minutes to go (no eggs) and pigeons and birds need to be looked out for as quick to take off with your breakfast if you aren't looking!

Average hotel the bed was super comfy so that was added bonus, we were on the 15th floor but it was very road noisy and the apartment opposite the hotel a little dog lived on the balcony and barked a lot , great location , being a kiwi the included breakfast was not to our liking so ate out instead . We only need a place to sleep and wash so suited us apart from the internet only being able to connect from the lobby and caused us a little inconvenience as we both run businesses online .

Hotel was in a good location, within walking distance to the beach, shops, and dining. Although this hotel is not the fanciest on the block it is kept neat and tidy, always someone cleaning something. Continental breakfast was available, which I found convenient, and there was always coffee/tea/newspaper in the lobby area.  Douglas, in reception, was cordial and quite helpful as well as the rest of the staff anytime I had a question or required assistance. Would stay here again should I ever come back to Hawaii-Mahalo!

We had a nice stay at this hotel. We were looking to stay in Hawaii on a strict budget. The room was small BUT we weren't looking for anything luxurious, just a CLEAN, SAFE place to stay pretty close to the beach. The room had a refrigerator and microwave which was useful. The best part of staying here was not only for the clean, safe room it was for the hotel staff! They were very accommodating! When we went down to get our complementary beach towels Kalei and Nolan the front desk staff, also offered us free beach mats, beach chairs and boogie boards! Not many hotels (even the high price hotels) offer that! The hotel is an easy safe walk to the beach. We had wonderful service from Nolan, Kalei and Helene, that's who we dealt with while we were there. On Tuesday, late afternoon they even have a special Hawaiian cocktail hour with music and a Hawaiian dancer. They offer parking for $22.00 a day but we were able to find free parking along the canal. (We got lucky with a parking space, they aren't open all the time). There is a small pool which was always clean. I would recommend this hotel for the price, location and the wonderful staff. Again it's not the top of the line but it's clean, safe and close to the beach.

Friendly staff, clean rooms and only a five minute walk to the beach. A great buffet and Hawaiin show is on the next corner. Continental breakfast included is fine considering the price of this hotel compared to others in Waikiki. You can get pancakes, cerial, toast, eggs and ham along with tea and coffee. You get beach towels and can book tours and activities at reception. If you do not want to pay the big bucks you will enjoy your time and stay comfortably here.

First stayed there 3 nights Oct 13 then joined a cruise back to Sydney. Delightful place, close to all amenities, beach & transport. Staff are always eager to help & never aloof.I love the Continental breakfast which was inclusive. I normally eat porridge every morning at home so that was great. I just bought bananas, nuts & other fruits plus a boiled egg from the b'fast & coffee & I was happy! Pancakes are prepared before you, so I don't understand why the other review say they were cold!

My friends and I were in Honolulu for a big birthday bash and needed a place to stay that wasn't going to cost an Alii's fortune. This is the place! Clean, well run, friendly! What more do you want? Go!

Room was clean and comfortable however breakfast was disgraceful! Very little choice, and poor quality! Breakfast staff were arrogant and unfriendly. And if that wasn't enough you had to share your brekky with the birds, with bird poo left on tables! You were expected to clear your own breakfast dishes away which meant the tables weren't wiped between customers. The hotel was only a couple of blocks to restaurant so my suggestion would be to NOT eat at hotel and opt to have breakfast out.

Stayed here while working last week. Five minute walk to beach, four blocks from a Starbucks that opens at 4:30 am! Staff was efficient and cheerful, breakfast includes tasty pancakes, and continental fare. My room had a balcony with partial mountain view, mini fridge and microwave. Many places to eat on Kuhio two blocks away. Concierge booked my luau. WiFi in lobby was good. I would stay again for sure. Great value!
user_name:
Alexis C
Berlin, Maryland, United States

review_body: Very disappointed in this hotel. 2 blocks from any restaurants and 3 blocks from the beach and shops. Their “All you can Eat” Buffet (as advertised) was non-existent. The Spa was closed for the 10 days we were there and their so called “Hawaiian Continental Breakfast” consisted of “cold” hot cakes, porridge or Cheerio’s, sliced up apple and oranges, cold hard boil eggs and toast (with nothing to put on the toast except cream cheese….where was the pineapple and paw paw that Hawaii is well known for?). The rooms weren’t ready when we arrived from a 10 hour flight from Australia and we had to wait another 2 hours before we were given any keys. We had ants in our room and we even paid extra for a balcony which overlooked the apartment building next door. The pool was so small that if you got 3 people in it, it would be crowded.I love Hawaii and I have been lucky enough to visit beautiful Honolulu on 4 previous visits, but this was the worst hotel I have stayed at….believe me…not worth the effort. Would not recommend this hotel to any-one.Very disappointed traveller

Check-in was fast and friendly. Service all-in-all was friendly, efficient and helpful. We arrived the day of the managers reception and enjoyed some drinks and chocolates with other guests. The hotel room (we stayed in a deluxe on the 9th floor) shows some wear and tear (pain peeling in the bathroom) but was clean and we had daily housekeeping. I loved the decor and room colours (mellow beach tones with just the right pops of colour) We enjoyed having a drink or two on the balcony each night. Good water pressure in the shower. Very comfortable bed with modern linens (would have liked some pillow variety and all of the pillows were large and somewhat firm) Also, having a bar sink, dishes, microwave and fridge was extremely helpful for us. The tv is small and the cable reception was not very good...but we weren't in Hawaii to watch tv!The beach is a short walk away, and the Ala Wai Canal is right beside the hotel. It's a great location, as it has the best of both world - a quiet street beside a lovely canal for walking, but quick access to all of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. There is a grocery store right around the corner on Kuhio, and ample restaurants within walking distance. The morning breakfast was very appreciated. The selection is not fantastic as far as healthy choices, but the fresh made pancakes were the best I've ever had (honestly!) The pool area is quite small, but most people make their way to Waikiki Beach if they want to swim. All-in-all, this is a very well-run hotel, and our stay was seamless. We would definitely stay again, especially if they can keep this good thing going at such a fair price (especially in Waikiki, where hotel prices can be adversarial for many travelers)Highly recommend.

The Aqua Aloha Surf is set back a few blocks from the main drag at Waikiki. Our room was light and clean. There is a coffee maker in the room but if you want a cup of tea you will have to grab some tea bags from the supermarket next door and use the microwave to heat your water as there is no kettle. There are some plates and cutlery in the room if you decide to get takeaway from a nearby restaurant. A very basic breakfast is available downstairs but it finishes at 9 am and its a very small area so you may have to share your table with other guests. Overall its great value for money and it was nice to be able to distance ourselves from the main drag on occasions.

I was pleased with the hotel .It was only 15 minute walk from the beach. The hotel facilities were good with free internet access in the lobby and a deckchair ,mat and a towel everyday for the beach-if you wanted it.It was good to have breakfast provided,but I found the drinks disappointing; there was no real juice -only cordial. The tea and coffee were not very nice either. However the service was very good.the room was comfortable and the air conditioning was good.I liked the shampoos and lotions provided in the bathroom ;and plenty of clean towels were provided.I would stay there again.
user_name:
Janet W
Buxton, England, United Kingdom

review_body: My travel companion and I stayed in this hotel for two nights at the end of our Hawaiian holiday visiting other islands! We had already stayed in Waikiki for a week in another location and enjoyed the proximity of this hotel to beach shops and buses! Our room was small but adequate for the price with comfortable beds, which is all we needed, as we were out all day and into the night enjoying all that Waikiki has to offer! No wifi in room however, which I would have liked had we stayed there longer! Staff were efficient and courteous! We did not take advantage of the $6 breakfast as the kitchen had run out of some food items when we arrived in the dining room!

Recently stayed at the Aloha Surf and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there. I was visiting Waikiki for the first time and its within easy walking distance to everything. My room was a bit small but as I was hardly in Waikiki to stay holed up in my room for a week it really wasn't a sore point. The bed was one of the most comfortable Ive ever slept on. Definitely what I imagine it must be like to sleep on a cloud without actually falling through of course. Helene at the front desk is an absolute gem, helping us out with trying to get us as quickly checked in to our rooms as possible even though one of our rooms wasn't quite ready and all this was done well before actual check in time.The restaurant wasn't one of my favourite points though. I would have happily paid more to have seen a bit more variety with the breakfast menu but as it is privately run I really cant fault the hotel for this. If I had ten thumbs I would happily give this hotel all ten thumbs up.

Stayed here for 5 nights in March and here is my opinion;Pros; decent price, only 5 minutes from Waikiki and shopping area and comfortable and spacious rooms. Fridge, coffee maker and other great amenities in the rooms.Cons; outdated rooms, very noisy street at night, no great views from balcony except looking directly in other peoples rooms across the street. Breakfast is also very limited and gets extremely crowded and tightly packed. Hard boiled eggs are ok, but the rest is mostly continental. Pool and backyard is very small and not well maintained. Walls so thin that you can clearly hear other people's conversations next door and their phones ringing at 4 am.Overall, very average in comparison with other hotels in Waikiki.

I go to Oahu often and when I do, I never need more in a hotel than a clean place to sleep at night and prepare for the day ahead. I don't need a resort atmosphere nor amenities. I recommend that travelers who have similar needs for a hotel check out the Aqua Aloha Surf!For around $100 a night I got a big king deluxe room with a bathroom with full-sized shower/tub, small kitchenette area, sofa and balcony. The balcony had great views of the rest of Waikiki, the mountains and a bit of ocean. The room was clean and mostly well-maintained. It had a very good A/C unit with remote control - which wasn't needed because of the room's nice slatted glass windows, which let in a nice breeze and kept the room cool. A generous breakfast was included. The hotel is just a few minutes' walk from Waikiki beach. It is also very near stops for The Bus, which gets you nearly anywhere on Oahu for cheap.This is solidly a 4-star review for a budget hotel. I can't give it 5 stars for the following reasons:1) Bathroom was a little dated and shabby. The tub was clean and fairly new but the walls and sliding door were a little banged up and could use a fresh coat of paint. The bathroom also desperately needed a fan!2) The bathroom had few accessibility aids. There were no grab bars in the tub nor bathroom walls, or a no-slip mat in the tub. I have to point this deficiency out because I stayed with my partner who has limited mobility. He made do with no incident but I caution that those who are more disabled may have problems. I encourage the hotel management to consider installing these critical safety features in each of the rooms, at some point.3) The WiFi was awfully slow and difficult to use. Not too important to me but my partner observed that it was essentially unusable. It was also totally inaccessible from our 10th floor room.Despite this short list of complaints, I love this hotel and I will definitely be back. I feel that nowhere else is as a good value in Waikiki than this place.

We were very happy with the location. Near to everything but quiet street.Very pleased with our deluxe room on the 11th floor which included a couch and coffee table. The balcony had a very nice view of the mountains and on the other side a partial view of the ocean. We felt very comfortable and welcomed.The staff members Doug, Vinh, Mark, Lydia and Jenelle provided us outstanding customer service as did the housekeeping staff.Thank you for making our stay in Waikiki such a great one.

After spending 3 weeks in Maui we planned to end our Hawaii vacation with a few days in Waikiki. We selected Aqua Aloha based on TripAdvisor recommendations and its proximity to the beach. Although this is an older hotel, it is very well maintained. The staff, from check-in to check-out were very helpful and professional. The hotel manager's "Welcome Cocktail" on Tuesday evening was an unexpected surprise.The location is great, about a 5 minute walk to Waikiki Beach. The hotel was built in days when energy conservation was not as great a concern as it is today. The windows are venetian slatted glass and even when closed there is really no seal to the outside. The drawback here is the room air conditioner has a hard time keeping up with the mid-day heat and if there are emergency vehicles traversing close by during the night, you'll hear them for sure. There is a buffet breakfast included but we opted to eat breakfast at Dukes in the Outrigger, overlooking Waikiki Beach. Amazing buffet breakfast for $16; just the view is worth the price.We'll stay here again for sure the next time we're in Honolulu.

My husband and I booked our hotel stay with the Aqua Aloha Surf on 10/6/13 for a stay from 2/28/14-3/7/14. We were very excited about our stay and planned and reserved many activities, restaurants and car rental based on our hotel location. When we arrived at the Aqua Aloha Surf from an over 6 hour flight from Arizona and were told that they did not have a room for us due to over booking, we were in a huge state of shock. For one, we are both seasoned travelers and luckily have never, ever experienced this and secondly, we never received any advance notice of this by either email or phone. The front desk staff and manager did their job and tried be nice, however it left us with a very uneasy feeling to start our vacation off this way. In any case, we were given a box of chocolates and told that they reserved a room for us at the Luana hotel located on Kalakaua. Since neither my husband nor myself have ever been to Honolulu, we had no idea what this meant location wise for everything we had planned. However, at this point based on what the people at the hotel were telling us, we hoped to be fine with all we had planned. They paid for our cab and off we went to the Luana, which we knew nothing about. The front desk staff at the Aqua Aloha Surf told us that the Luana was a better caliber of hotel and we would find it to be an even better stay. So, we arrived at the Luana and were greeted by the front desk. Upon our arrival it became apparent that the staff at the Aqua Aloha Surf only partially notified the front desk at the Luana and so we the displaced travelers, who booked our room almost 5 months before had to go over with the front desk at the Luana our rate, the fact that the Aqua Aloha Surf already charged us for our first night and that they would only be responsible for charging us for 6 nights. We had to review the rate we were going to pay at the Aqua Aloha Surf as it was less than what they were charging at the Luana. We also had to discuss parking fees as we would be renting a car (5 minutes from the Aqua Aloha Surf, now 15 minutes from the Luana) in a few days and we were planning on paying for the parking fees that the Aqua Aloha Surf charged and not what the Luana Charges. We also were going to be given some free breakfast vouchers. This was nice, however, we had not planned to eat there but even that was a fiasco. Initially they showed only one person would be in our room, another error??? So they did not want to give us vouchers for more than 1 person and we would have to check back. We did not need or want them, but if we did, we would then have to waste more time explaining this to the front desk and taking up more of our precious vacation time. When I expressed this to the girl at the front desk, she responded in a condescending manner. Our room was not ready when we arrived but when it was we were fine with the room. It was simple but comfortable and we chose to put all of the aggravation behind us and enjoy our vacation. After returning and speaking to many people in the lodging business, I feel we should have been given a lot more for our inconvenience. The story that the Luana is a much higher scale hotel is all well and good, but they did not offer us anything more than we were going to get at the Aqua Aloha Surf as far as amenities go. I believe we should have been comped a night or upgraded on our room at the very least for this huge inconvenience. In the end I learned a huge lesson, even if you book your hotel well in advance, don’t always expect it to be yours until you arrive. I love to plan our vacations so it won’t stop me from planning them as I do, but at least now I know that this can happen. I am hopeful though it never will again because it started out our vacation in a very unpleasant way.

I am writing this for my 91 year old parents. They have stayed at this hotel every year for the past 8 years. They were here from Jan 20 to March 4th. They are not the only guests that keep coming back. There are many repeaters and lots of new guests. Families are here as well as couples and single people. The guest rooms are clean and comfortable. There is a mini fridge and a microwave. The open air lobby has many chairs to sit on and meet your friends or just relax on. The breakfast has many choices which is nice. The pool area is separate and in the sun. The staff is wonderful. They are very attentive and caring. They know my whole family and every guest that comes they take and interest in. I would especially like to thank Lance, Douglas, Nolan and Helene who take such great care of them.The hotel gives their guests beach chairs and towels to take to the beach. The location in away from the crowds and about three blocks from the beach. The Bus is a block away and there is an ABC store on the corner. It is a really nice place to stay in a great location.

I went with a friend and got a great deal with the flight and hotel combined. We opted for a room with only 2 single beds and no balcony. When we arrived, we were upgraded to one single, one double and a pull out couch plus a balcony. Loved this hotel.We also got breakfast every morning, Try the pancakes, they are great. A little older and not right at the beach, but what is 2 blocks to walk? The staff was great (loved Douglas). Only problem was I had a water bottle go missing from our room. I had bought it especially for this trip. It was collapsible and would fold up when not in use. I had left it with water at the side of the kitchen sink and was going to empty it when I found it was missing. I reported it, but they seemed to think I had lost it, but it did go missing out of my room?I would stay here again, but would lock up my belongings.

We were there in late February. The room is kinda small but its adequate, you are there for the beach not the room. The breakfast was not anything great but its adequate too. No wifi in rooms, they give you a cable to plug into a port. Wifi in the lobby only. Waikiki area is very busy so you do get a fair amount of traffic noise, it didn't bother me though. I will say the staff was very friendly and helpful, exceeded my expectations. Its a basic hotel about 3 blocks from the beach so it fit my needs just fine

I was quite happy with the location, condition and friendly staff. Don't think it can be beat in Waikiki for the price. The hotel seems to have been recently updated. Small room but more than sufficient, wonderful bed and good clean furnishings. I didn't have the breakfast. Only negative is the poor wifi in the lobby. I hope that Tim gives that a boost or else stop calling it an amenity. It's a bargain and it's safe and clean.

We have just returned from our trip 26th Feb and absolutely had a great time!!! We loved the location where we stayed close walk to beach, shops and everything really no need to hire a car. Pick up point for our tours were very close just around the block. Hubby and I were impressed by the cleanliness of our room the cleaners were great! we would sleep in or leave our room late but would always come to find our room had been clean and bed made. My previous experience in hotels that our rooms will not be cleaned if we will still in our rooms before lunch. Staff were very friendly and helpful too.We definitely visit again and recommend this hotel to others.We loved it there that we are already planning our second trip next year early 2016.MahaloAngela & Ulusese :)

We found this hotel clean, safe, and great for being in Waikiki. We were very happy with the complimentary breakfast.....fluffy pancakes, good coffee, hard boiled eggs, oranges, cereal,toast, etc. Being a little further from the beach, it was quieter and we enjoyed our morning walks along the Ala Wai Canal.I feel our room needed updating ........very dated shower stall and bathroom and a chair and small table would be nice.Otherwise, it was fine for us because we wereout for most of the day. We were on the 4th floor and I do believe they are renovating floors from the top down. Another nice feature was complimentary beach chairs and towels available at the front desk. The staff was friendly and helpful. If you travel like us and enjoy the sights, this hotel may be all you want and need.

We arrived at noon. We were met by a nice lady. Very strict and professional. But nice. Waiting for a couple of hours before we got our room.The room was a chock. Very small, no visitor's chair, no balcony, really bad view out of the window. Breakfast next morning was also a chock.Chinese style. Very bad logistic. Very bad coffee. Birds in the restaurant!! Not enough with seats.Free wifi in the lobby.The slowest elevator ever experienced.There were a shop and a bar/restaurant.Both were closed. No, this hotel was really not good

Ditto the review by KimAust.Highly recommend this hotel. Repeat customers is a great recommendation.Beds are very comfortable. Water pressure for showers very good.All staff and help are friendly and helpful.

Considering how expensive Waikiki can be this place is fantastic value. The building isn't new but it is kept very clean and the beds are so comfortable. The staff are so friendly and helpful and lots of guests stay here regularly (a good sign!!).Can't recommend it enough.

Aqua Aloha Surf is located a few steps from Waikiki Beach, with lots of shops around. Our top floor room was very spacious and comfortable, with amazing, 270 degree view over Honolulu. There was no breakfast offered by the hotel, you can buy buffet access in the lobby but this is served by another company. Hotel staff was not amazing, maybe due to the high season and lots of traffic. Overall, good choice in great location.

great staff at this hotel, Kalai was accomodating and friendly. stayed last year well and enjoyed our stay. Great beds and very clean. Location is good. Near to everything but on a quiet street.Lobby nice place to sit and relax. Only problem with the hotel is there is no wi-fi in the rooms. you have to go to lobby.

We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of January.Booking process was a major hassle. We had contacted their Sales team to get a government rate, since this was government travel. Their Sales Manager contacted us and offered us some great rates, but after that it went downhill. It was like pulling teeth to get a confirmation, then it was done wrong, then we never knew if the reservation had been made or not. We ended up booking the room ourselves and cancelling with the Sales Manager, and again, we never received a cancellation confirmation email from her.We ended up booking a package that included breakfast and some drink vouchers. When we checked in, the Front Desk had to be reminded that we had the package. No drink vouchers available. Conflictive information in how to solve the problem.Rooms were pretty nice, modern but rather small. There is no privacy as you have a building right across from you. The room however was clean and the daily housekeeping was excellent. The room also had a refrigerator, microwave and dishes.There is no wi-fi in the room, only high speed internet in the room, but the internet was extremely slow. Wi fi is offered for free in the lobby, but since this is the only place with wi fi, there are tons of people there and the internet is very slow.The hotel offers free coffee, tea and water 24 hours, nice touch.Gym is a joke, as it is part of the lobby and it has 3 work out machines.If you book directly you have breakfast included. Breakfast is served in a restaurant that is in the hotel, but privately operated. The staff there was not extremely friendly and the restaurant can clearly not handle the amount of guests trying to have breakfast.Overall our stay was not bad, the staff was very friendly, specially Helene at check out. Aqua Aloha Surf is perfect for budget conscious travellers, who don't need all the amenities that other hotels offer.Parking is offered in their underground garage at $20 a day. We would probably have a better opinion of this hotel if the reservation process would have been more satisfying and the check in process with the package would have been better resolved.

Spent one night here and the beds are heavenly! Got a small, regular room for $90 on Priceline. The lobby is nice, open and the staff Are friendly. Location: right across from the canal, yet 3 short blocks from the beach, just up from kings crossing. Food: $6 all you can eat buffet downstairs. Home cooked basic food. Had oatmeal, eggs, ham as oranges with coffee for $6. Deal! You have to check out the cool bar across the street at the Surf. They have a continental buffet (a little more upscale)breakfast for $12.00. Only downside is their windows are the old hawaiian style slates, so you can hear all the noise. Bring earplugs.

If you're not looking for luxury but a clean, comfortable, friendly and great location, this is a great place to stay! We were pleasantly surprised to get boogie boards, beach towels and beach chairs that were free. We had a small issue with our room and the staff was more than willing to upgrade our room at no extra cost. We stayed on the top floor with a wrap around lanai and had an amazing view of the mountains and the city.The bed that we slept in was extremely comfortable and I was more than happy to crawl into it nightly after long days of fun on the beach, snorkeling and hiking...with no back ache in the morning. I wish we would have gotten names of the staff that were very helpful, but honestly we were just not thinking about it. We will definitely stay here again!

Keep this short and sweet: -front desk & concierge service was outstanding-upgraded our room for free-breakfast is good if you love pancakes, oranges, toast, and oatmeal, because that is it! -walking distance to everything. The beach was less than a 5 minute walk, there are tons of food and shopping options around you including a vegan restaurant/shop right on the next road.-the bed was ridiculously comfortable. I was shocked by how wonderful it was.-the rooms are small and there is very limited shelf space in the bathroomI would stay here again and am happy to be introduced to the Aqua company!

As students, we searched a well but no so expensive hotel to stay on our Hawaii trip, so with the positive feedback this hotel had, we wanted to try it. Price was OK for Waikiki if you don't want to stay in a Motel. Free breakfast. Free water!!! Free towels for the beach and really friendly service. Room was not as big, but we don't travel to Hawaii to stay at the hotel! :)

This was our second stay at the Aqua Aloha Surf. The staff is very helpful and works hard to make hotel guests feel comfortable and welcome. We want to especially thank Augustina for keeping our 5th floor room tidy, and Lidia for recommending a couple of great bike rides and for recommending Uncle Clay’s House of Pure Aloha for the best shave ice we have had on the island. We enjoy the casual atmosphere (loved the video of Endless Summer and the Hawaiian music in the lobby!), and the Tuesday evening Cocktail “Meet and Greet” where you’ll find Tim, the hotel manager tending bar .We love the location, as the hotel is slightly away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, along the Ala Wai Canal. It’s an easy walk (about a mile) along the Canal to Kapahulu Ave., where there are some great and reasonably priced, local restaurants. There is a farmer’s market 2 blocks away at King’s Village four days a week where you can buy local fruits and snacks. We will definitely stay here again next time.

The Aqua Aloha surf lives up to its name of Aloha. We had a great room with lanaii and a view of waikiki and the Ala Wai canal and mtns. The staff was great and it was a wonderful stay. I would recommend it to anyone and will book another room on our next stay in Waikiki. Mahalo to the Aqua Aloha Surf motel and its staff.

Spent two enjoyable weeks @ Aqua Aloha Surf over the Christmas holiday. Complimentary breakfast daily...beach towel service...onsite parking ($20/night). The lobby area is open air and comfortable (free wifi, TV, filtered drinking water, etc.). Nothing extravagant, but everything was comfortable and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The location was within easy walking distance of beach, shopping, dining and other Waikiki properties. Overall a pleasurable stay...good times.

Pros:-Good location, close to waikiki beach and the main strip-Hotel lobby had TVs and seats and was clean-courteous staff-Microwave and mini-fridge available in room-Great pillowsCons-Strange pathway for pedestrians, you use the driveway to get to the sidewalk from the lobby-slow elevator, staff seems to use the same elevator meaning no service elevator -NO wifi in room, wifi is only available in lobby. In the room, they provide an Ethernet cable for you. Internet via wifi in lobby or Ethernet cable in room is extremely slow! It's like being back on dial up. -rooms are very old. The bathroom needs major renovation. -light sleepers beware, there is noise from the surrounding streets

My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights right before Christmas. First of all, the price was perfect! Very reasonable for Hawaii! Also, the location was great..an easy walk to all shops, restaurants, and of course the beach! When we first arrived, we LOVED the open air concept of the front desk. It felt very tropical and inviting. The front desk was very nice also. The rooms are small but definitely good for two people! It was clean and nice! We really enjoyed our stay here and will be back! We ended up leaving our iPhone and iPad chargers at the hotel and came back through Hawaii for a few days at the end of our trip (unfortunately yall were sold our or else we would have stayed here again!). I wish I could remember the man at the front desk's name, because he was the most helpful person and so nice! We called to tell him we left our stuff and he called us everyday to kept us posted on our things (at first they couldn't find them in their lost and found). He went above and beyond to help us and keep us posted! We did end up getting our things back! Great hotel, location, and staff!!

Hello,My boyfriend and I recently stayed at this hotel and were very surprised and how much we liked it. It is a street away from Waikiki beach and the main hotels, which makes it a lot quieter and still very close to all the main action of Waikiki. The staff were all wonderful and helped answer any questions we had. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again! :)

We visited Waikiki from 12/5 through 12/12 for the Honolulu Marathon, which my husband ran. I chose the Aqua Aloha Surf based on other reviews & a reasonable rate (Avg $149/day). We arrived at the hotel at approximately 5:30 on a Thursday afternoon. The front desk staff were very welcoming, the open air lobby nicely decorated. I had requested a room on a higher floor (there are 16 floors in the Aqua Aloha). They gave us Room 1008, which, they explained was their 'model' room. They are in the process of renovating & they asked us to complete a survey after our stay to rate the room which would help as they plan the rest of their renovations. We loved the room. It was considered a junior suite as it had a king size bed, nice kitchenette, a pull-out loveseat and a good size bathroom. The floor is tile with a nice area rug in front of the loveseat. The 42" flat screen TV was mounted on the wall above the desk/bureau combination unit. It was a great TV, a lot of available channels. The bed was extremely comfortable, lots of pillows, great mattress. There is an air conditioner unit mounted at ceiling level. It's the quietest a/c unit I have ever had in a hotel room. There was absolutely no problem sleeping with the unit on as the quiet hum was actually very soothing. The only problem, even on the 10th floor, was the noise caused by the garbage trucks going by most days, at about 5-5:30. The other problem is each room has a balcony and on the first 2 nights, the people next door were partying. It felt like they were right in our room. I think the reason is that the window is this slat-type and there was no way to close the slats to keep all the noise out. On the 2nd night, I made myself some earplugs out of tissues & that helped a lot. Luckily, it was just the first 2 nights, after that, all was quiet on the balconies. The view from the balcony was okay, there were some mountain views to the right, but it was mostly high rise apartments/condos that we saw. We didn't spend any real time on the balcony. One note, the A/C unit condensation empties out through a tube that runs through the wall out onto the balcony and the water goes into a large plastic waste basket. Once that waste basket fills up, the water slowly runs over the side, onto the balcony floor, and gradually runs off the balcony. I felt the run off from the balcony above ours. It isn't a stream or anything, just kind of a splash from where the water may have hit the railing. But, I think if I was sitting out there, it would have gotten annoying. The bathroom was great. Only a shower, no tub. But the shower was wonderful, very roomy and the shower head was terrific. Great water pressure and the head itself was the kind with colored lights indicating the how hot the water was. The sink was roomy, the counter was granite. Lots of light & storage. The closet area is in the bathroom and is very narrow. Above the closet is a small safe, which came in handy. Each morning there is a breakfast (included in the room charge) downstairs adjacent to the lobby. When you go, you present your breakfast card and they mark off the day. Each day there are always pancakes, sliced apples, orange wedges, hard boiled eggs, white rice, wheat & Italian sliced bread, mini donuts or muffins and oatmeal. The coffee is very weak, with only powdered creamer. There's better coffee out in the lobby. The juice selection is poor, seems like just Hi-C type drinks. But, it's nice to have the breakfast right there every day. Although, by the last day, I had had enough pancakes! The hotel provides beach towels and sand chairs for each guest to carry down to the beach, which is a nice walk of about 3-4 blocks. Hotel is centrally located to a great area; 1/2 block away from an ABC store, which was great. Many restaurant and shopping choices and just a 1/2 block from the bus stops. By the way, getting around by bus is the only way to go; it's a great system. Be sure to get a bus pass on your first or second day; you'll be glad you did. A four day pass is $35 per person and it is so worth it. You can go almost anywhere on the island with this pass. We went to Diamond Head, Pearl Harbor, Hanauma Bay, and other places via the bus system. I will review the different points of interest separately. All in all, I feel for the price, this hotel was a good choice for us.

We enjoyed our stay at aqua aloha over the christmas break. It is in a great location, close to shops, restaurants and the beach, but far away from the noise and crowds. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. The rooms are very dated. Our first room was right next to the elevator and was very noisy and we had to ask for a room change in the middle of the night. Rooms are pretty small, most have balconies. The bathrooms and shower in particular were very small. The room had a coffeemaker and microwave which was convenient. The fitness centre included 3 machines, the one treadmill was very old and barely worked. Overall I would stay here again, because of the location and the low price for a wakiki hotel.

We are a 65+ y.o. retired couple with extensive travel experience, including ten previous visits to the Hawaiian Islands and especially to Waikiki. We travel on a strict budget, which excludes the big name hotels in the area (except for the Ilikai, which was a time share resort exchange). For point of reference, our only other Waikiki hotel room stays were in the Imperial and the Aston at the Waikiki Banyon. The Aqua Aloha Surf compares very favorably to those two. We had a "Deluxe" room with a king size bed (comfortable mattress); it was a little dated but very clean and appropriately supplied and appointed with small fridge, bar type sink, coffee maker and microwave crammed into a very small space. The bathroom (tub, shower and toilet) was average size for an older hotel and given privacy from the "old-style" (separate hot and cold faucets) sink area just outside it. The closet was spacious with plenty of hangars and had a safe in which to secure valuables. The wall-type air conditioner was adequate and placed in the far corner of the room from the bed; that meant running it on high to sleep in comfortable conditions, but it also meant that there was no cold draft blowing on us during the night (as we have experienced in many other hotels). Even though we were on the 14th floor, and the air conditioner was making its steady noise, there was considerable truck noise starting at six in the morning. We found this to be the case at the Imperial and the Aston as well. Because we booked online directly with the hotel, we were rewarded with daily complimentary breakfasts. Billed by the hotel as a "continental breakfast," it was actually something more than that, including hard pancakes, boiled eggs, griddled pressed ham, hot oatmeal, cold cereal, assorted breads for toast, muffins and the usual hot and cold beverages. We did not use the very small ground floor level pool, and, the times that we passed by it, no one else was using it either. The seats in the lobby were not terribly comfortable, but there was free wi-fi for hotel guests in it. Free cable internet service was available in the rooms. We had a car and so availed ourselves of their 35 space self-park facilities for $20 extra per night. The hotel staff was courteous, professional, helpful and, when not otherwise engaged, friendly and willing to chat. In sum, like many older hotels, this one needs room upgrades, but it suited us fine as a "good value."

Not even sure where to begin. Stayed there Dec 11-15th, 2013. Location was both Waikiki Beach (good) and prostitute (bad, corner of Kanekapolei and Kalakaua in front of the sundrys store) adjacent. Lobby is old and dated, parking is dank and really hot (I think they vent the clothes dryers into the underground parking lot!). Room was cramped and smelled like my grandmother's house. They crammed all the furniture into a comically small room, to the point that the double bed was stuffed into a corner and you could only get onto it from one side. Put me on the second floor overlooking the dumpsters and back of a grocery store... BEEEEP BEEEEP BEEEP all night long as trucks backed in. Overlooked a beautiful banyan tree that someone had paved all around, and appears to be used primarily as a meetup spot for folks doing <things> in the middle of the night. Old windows put the lousie in jalousie... never really closed or opened all the way properly. Bathroom was cramped and had broken tiles all over it. Bedsheets had 24 inch rips in them that someone had sewn up (that was a first for me). AC smelled like mold and never really cooled the room. Had what appeared to be a ~22 inch computer monitor for a TV. Gross... just gross.

I travelled a lot during my 40 years as a professional Staff. During that time We visited Hawaii five times and stayed in big name hotels. After retirement and in October and November 2013 we stayed in this hotel; before and after a long cruise. We were really impressed.The Manager, the front Desk staff (including everyone) and the room service were very nice. We were given rooms in higher floors. We enjoyed the views. Being so close to all the attractions and the nice shores, restaurants, buses and places was a welcomed and added advantage. The price is good. We plan to return in 2014 and surely this is our choice. We already recommended this hotel to many friends and yo many of our community members.
Yes I'm back again. This was the 5th year in a row that I have stayed at the Aqua Aloha Surf in Waikiki.... Why? Great prices!Great location!Great staff!Look forward to seeing you all next year....

2 nights, NO sleep. Moved rooms and still no sleep. They have slatted windows throughout so their is no seal to the outside. Very noisy street! I would not recommend staying here. We had to change hotels due to the noise.My one positive is their employees couldn't have been more understanding and accommodating. They moved us rooms, and even understood when we checked out. But I can't give this place anything more than 1 star, cause I don't think anyone should stay here till they get new windows.

We stayed here for one night before going on a cruise. We were surprised how close we were to the beach. We thought for the price we would be further away. The lady on reception was really nice and upgraded us to a top floor suite as we are on our honeymoon which was fab. They also sent us complementary bubbly and chocolates. This was the only hotel we've stayed in that did this. Such a nice touch. The room was clean, had everything we needed with a great view. The beach towels were a nice surprise, wish we hadn't bothered bringing our own! The breakfast was good for us as I wouldn't want a big fry up everyday. The pancakes and fresh fruit were yum and the eggs and toast filled us up. It's going to make leaving the cruise ship tomorrow knowing we've got 9 nights back at the aloha surf!

My wife and I have been to Oahu 4 times now and this was our first time at the 'Surf'. I thought it would be kind of cheesy because of the low price and some of the revues. We were surprised at how nice the room was - everything worked fine and the staff and service were top notch. Parking was very convenient and the breakfast (included) was better than expected. We stayed in a larger room with a king bed which cost a few dollars more but was worth it. Our view from the Lanai was pretty good and there was never any disturbing noise, bugs or bother. Free beach towels, good coffee, filtered water in the lobby to fill our bottles and we were ready for fun at the beach, nearby shopping and great restaurants. As 'Arnold' would say - All Be Back!.

Having recently return from Hawaii we spend 2 nights in this hotel. Great location easy walk to town staff were very friendly and helpful. Did find the rooms rather small but there were four of us in one room. Bathroom was tiny and need to be updated. Was good value for money

We stayed there from Nov-26-13 to Nov-29-13. Pros:1- Less expensive for a hotel on expensive place.2- Easy access to beach,bus,diamond head hiking and Waikiki shopping3- Good house keepingCons:1- Very small room2- No good views from our room at 2nd floor3- Breakfast is average and not recommendedBottom-line:If you are looking for an budget hotel on Waikiki beach on budget then this is the one. Best way to enjoy is spend more time outside :) and don't bother much about hotel.Thanks,RAM

We recently stayed 3 nights and received an upgrade to a junior suite, having booked a superior room. The facilities represent good value for money and were completely satisfactory, especially the AC which was much appreciated. Hotel is well situated for easy access to transport and beach. Staff all very friendly and helpful, particularly the Concierge (whose name has slipped me-apologies) who provided good advice. Street noise is noticeable in the early hours, but suspect that is normal in Honolulu.

My wife and I stayed here for 6 nights which worked out very well. We booked direct and got a "Superior" room. Our room had been resently remodelled and was very comfortable. The staff here is very friendly and accomodating. It's walking distance to the beach and all the great shopping. Besides the price, one of the main reasons we stayed here is the parking garage is in the lower level of the hotel which proved to be priceless for convenience and handicapped guests. We spent most days out enjoying the Hawaiian life and it was very nice coming back to the comfortable airconditioned room. If we ever stay in Honolulu again we'll definitely stay here. Aloha!

This hotel is in a good spot, close enough to the beach and shops. It is clean with good housekeeping, very friendly staff and guest laundry which is great when traveling. The $6.00 breakfast could be better, and the rooms get road noise, but I've heard that about many places there. Overall for the price, a good place to stay.

We got an early check-in because the room was ready when we arrived earlier-always a plus!The room was decent size, had a fridge, coffee maker and balcony. The furniture was a bit old but that did not bother us that much. Would have liked to have a chair in the room(besides the balcony plastic ones) but we managed. Breakfast was the same every day, no variety, and not too much to choose from.The pool is very small and if there are more than 5 people it gets crowded.Please put in WIFI in the rooms!!! The one in the lobby was down for a day or two.The staff was very friendly, helpful and I would say they are above the value of the hotel.All in all it was a good experience, a good value for the money at a property located 2 minutes from Waikiki Beach!

This was my sixt stay at the Aqua Surf, and I love it .We got the deluxe room, nice for the price.Hotel staff are real nice Helene, Douglas, Kevin ,Aimee B and the rest.We will definitely stay again, it is like being with great Family. The location is also great 5 minutes from beach and so much moore.Anna & Willie El-Paso TX

Clean, comfortable hotel. Nice lobby. Friendly, helpful staff. Great Waikiki location. Easy walking distance to the beach, shopping, and restaurants. Hot tip: There are two parking spots in the semi-circular drive in front of the lobby for unrestricted guest parking--but nobody seems to know this. We wouldn't have known if the front desk hadn't told us. So we had our own private parking spot right by the entry for our entire stay! 5 stars for what it is -- a great pied a terre. If you're looking for luxury, keep looking. But if you're like us and plan on spending minimal time at the hotel and would rather spend your money on shopping and activities, then look no further. Our room was small, with two twin beds. Beds were quite comfy and location was quiet. Bathroom was small, but the shower was good. Nice lobby area in which we gathered with friends one evening. Breakfast buffet is included, but again... nothing fancy--adequate sustenance to get you on your way for a great day in Honolulu!

This was my 3rd stay at the Aqua Aloha, I booked 4 mos prior and got a special rate on a deluxe room, which ended up being a corner room on the top (16th) floor with a wrap around lanai. Beautiful view of the Ala Wai Canal, golf course, and on the other side - quite a bit of ocean. Only negative comments: 1) the stucco wall rather than grating on the 16th floor, which makes it tough for a short person to see the view when sitting on the lanai. 2) the paint and grouting in the room's bathroom needed touching up (made the room look standard rather than deluxe). All else was good: the bed area of the room was very nice, with a full-wall mirror. Maid staff was exceptional - I left a note requesting flat/soft pillows (the 4 in the room were so high I eventually pillowcased a sofa throw pillow so I could sleep w/o neck pain) and had 2 good pillows when I returned later in the day. One maid even left me a nice thank you note for the day's cash tip. The lobby and exterior of the hotel looked classy. Front desk staff was helpful in guiding me to Foster Botanical Gardens (probably not requested every day!). Next time I book and have an opportunity for an upper floor, I'll request floor 15 to have the view w/o stucco wall.

The hotel was in a great location within 5 minutes walking distance to beach and tons of shopping. The hotel was clean, staff was very friendly. They had the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in. Would definitely stay there again.

It needs a lot of maintenance, painting, wall repair,cleaning etc. We were on the sixteenth floor on the first day of November., killed roaches in the room. The air conditioner had a funky odor coming from it, and the one in the bedroom had water in it and the blades kept making noises. I will say that the breakfast was ok. Would not stay there again.

This hotel is located 5mins walking distance from Waikiki beach. Staff is very nice. No need to bring beach towels or beach chairs, the hotel can provided them for free. On the down side, the sofa bed is not very confortable.

The location of this hotel was great. We were in walking distance of the beach, shops and restaurants. The staff at the hotel did everything possible to make our stay a great one. Thanks to Helene for working out all our kinks. She is the best. Job well done Helene. Aimee helped us on departure day. The staff at this hotel is amazing. Thanks.

I'd booked this hotel well in advance purely based on it's location. I had read a few reviews and was a little wary of how my room would be, however, I figured for the reasonable price I could grin and bare it.To my pleasant surprise the hotel had a lovely big open reception area. The staff weren't overly friendly but were still happy to accommodate me with my queries.The hotel has two small lifts that housekeeping use also and in our instance the one lift kept constantly breaking down, but that never took long to fix.The room itself had a Queen bed and view of the road where the entrance was. The bathroom was a lot bigger than expected and overall everything was a lot cleaner than expected.The tv was in good condition and was fully functioning for days when we were ready to crash.The room has a cord for your laptop if you need internet in the room, however, if you require wireless then that is available in the lobby for free. Slow, at times, but reliable to book things etc.Housekeeping come through every day and do a thorough job of cleaning.The bed and pillows are comfortable and clean.Concierge can organise activities and are available from certain hours downstairs in the lobby or if you call from your room.This hotel is in a prime location to the main beach strips of Waikiki. It is within a short walking distance to many different sights and locations. An ABC store which is like a large convenience store with just about anything you need, is down the road on the corner, approx a 2.5 min walk. Handy when you want snacks etc!Overall, I was very happy with Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki and would stay there again, should I return the the beautiful islands Hawaii.

I have spent in this hotel one night, in queens bedroom, the room was small but well equipped and what's the most important very clean! In price was included breakfast! We could borrow beach towels and beach chairs:-) the only disadvantaged were thin walls:-/

If you are looking for a five star resort, keep looking. If great customer service, clean rooms and well kept is your priority for a very good value this is the place. A short walk to Waikiki Beach, restaurants and next to a grocery store. Everyone from the front desk to the house keeping staff are friendly and helpful. This hotel is one of the best kept secrets in Hawaii. I spent 5 nights and will return.

I have stayed at the Aloha Surf twice now and can highly recommend this hotel. The location is just a very short walk to the beach. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. The beds are very comfortable and the quality of the sheets are good. The rooms are clean and tidy. Internet available in rooms via cable. This hotel is very affordable and i'm happy to recommend it! i'll be going back there for my next holiday for sure.

I was there 5 nights and had a very pleasurable experience. The staff was wonderful and theroom was clean and I would recommend the hotel anytime. The hotel is centrally located and within walking distance of the beach and many restaurants. Thank you.

Recently just stayed at the Aqua Aloha and will definitely be back the next time I'm in Honolulu! My boyfriend and I felt the room was very comfortable, the AC system is awesome room gets extremely COLD which is great when its SOO SOO HOTT outside during the day. Our flight on the day of departure left late in the evening and the Aqua Aloha staff were very accommodating especially Douglas at the front desk who offered us a half day rate so we could keep the room till our shuttle picked us up. The fee involved was very reasonable. Thank you Douglas for making the last day of our trip smooth and stress free. You were very pleasant to deal with and we can not wait to come back and stay at the Aqua Aloha again. MAHOLO!!!! xoxo

**** Location: It is near Waikiki beach, good connection with bus to airport, Pear Harbor etc.**** Rooms - thin walls, but comfortable bed**** Service - helpful receptionist*** Food - a small selection of food (breakfast, we didnt try all you can eat lunch)We saw a small lizard in room :)

We met family at this particular hotel as a surprise, although it wouldn't have been my first choice the rooms were small but very clean. The view from our room on the 16th floor was incredible. We were facing the canal side with a view of the mountains and city buildings. The location of the hotel was convenient to restaurants, shopping and the beach. One of the best things about this facility was the service of the front desk. They were very friendly and most accommodating.

Stay there for 3 nights on a girl friend trip. Room was on 4th Fl, two beds and more than adeqate as complimentary breakfast was included. The ladies making breakfast were responsive to questions and helpful. Hotel was closed to most and the bus. I would return for the value. Aloha.

Went with our friends for their ruby anniversary and had a wonderful time. Clean and comfortable hotel close to all amenities, very friendly and helpful staff, would recommend this hotel to anyone. The resort of Waikiki is a lovely pretty place to take a holiday

The aqua aloha is fantastic the manager and his staff or so wonderful nothing to much trouble for any of them houser keeper kept our room beautiful loved every minute of our stay thank u so much susan brown

We made last minute reservations and stumbled upon this particular hotel. Originally, we booked it for just 3 nights, as we were unsure if we wanted to spend the 8 night holiday at the Aqua Aloha Surf. After but 2 nights, we decided that we would stay here for the duration of the trip. The reasons for this choice were many: location, cleanliness of room, CNBC on cable. But the clincher was the front desk. All of our encounters there were most helpful. Douglas, in particular, bent over backwards to accommodate our requests. It really made our stay a joy. A home away from home, you could say.The drawbacks of this facility are rather minor. The redundancy and limitations of the breakfast buffet that are included with the room could use some diversification. And there was no shower caddy, which made that essential experience more challenging. Nonetheless, I would come back and recommend this hotel as a fun stay.
user_name:
Andrew H
Albany, New York, United States

review_body: the hotel is only few blocks from the beach, rooms are comfortable (i loved the bed) and clean, shops very close, employees very nice and helpful. i consider it a very good quality for a nice price. i was satisfied.

We stayed 4 nights prior to our cruise back to Sydney. Good location, the hotel presented well and our room was spotless and the bathroom had lovely soft white towels. The airconditioner was old and noisy and we really needed to use it most of the time.We found the staff very helpful and friendly. Now for the nightmare - Breakfast was an insult, run by two ladies with poor english, no uniform and no interest. A dark dingy room with heavy and greasy looking furniture. Food poorly presented, plastic plates did not entice us to eat there.We went around the corner and purchased food each day for our breakfast despite having breakfast vouchers for the hotel. It's a shame about the breakfast as it really is a blot on this hotels copybook.

My husband and I spent our honeymoon here.The staff are a credit to the place, extremely friendly and the most helpful people we encounted on our trip.The happy hour once a week is a great idea and we thoroughly enjoyed it, it gave us a chance to meet other people and get to know the staff better.The housekeeping staff are also a credit to the motel, the lovely lady that cleaned our room was so polite she was lovely, I wanted to bring her home.:-)Close to everything, all in walking distance!Thanks guys I highly recommend Aloha Surf.Greg and Tania St Clair :-)

I stayed here for 12 nights, in an apartment, with my son. The location is really good, close to restaurants, bars and close to the beach. The apartment had everything we needed, although a toaster would have been useful. There was plenty of room as there were only 2 of us staying...the apartment is advertised as been appropriate for 5 guests, but I think that would have been pretty cramped. In saying that, most apartments of this size say they are suitable for 5. The price was reasonable for Hawaii - overall, an enjoyable stay.

The staff were very helpful, friendly and caring. The lady at the front desk went out of her way to make my stay comfortable and accomodating. I commend her. I would like the manager or owner of this hotel to please change the breakfast menu. It is horrible, it is terrible and it is the worst breakfast I have ever had to have in a hotel. The juice is watered down, the fruit is cut up in little pieces and the cut up apples are turning brown. Why cannot one have a whole apple or orange? The eggs are little and hard to peel and they are cold. The assorted pastry is less than desired and served in little pieces. It is the same food each day; I am sure the hotel can afford a better breakfast. It really needs to be changed!!! It is so sad!!!!

We stayed in Aqua Aloha surf Waikiki for one week in april 2013. The hotel is situated on a very good location, just few blocks away from the beach. The rooms vere always really clean and the staff was very nice and helpful. The hotel has also a private parking (garrage), which was not even so expensive. The only bad thing was a breakfast, which was really poor but this didnt bothered us, because only one block away was Wendys breakfast restaurant. The hotel pool is also poor so almost nobady uses it.. For sure I would go back, because I feel really good and had a great time!Thank you Aqua Aloha

My husband and I stayed for 4 nights in oct. Upon check in, I mentioned that we were celebrating our 25 wedding anniversary. The sweet young woman at the desk upgraded our room and had champagne and chocolate covered macadamia nuts sent up to our room. We declined the champagne since we do not drink but the nuts were wonderful. This is an older hotel but our room was very clean. They loan free beach towels and chairs.Breakfast is not wonderful but is plentiful and filled us up. Would have loved to have wifi in the room but was able to access in the lobby.  The hotel is two blocks from the each, in walking distance to many restaurants and a lot of shopping, and served us very nicely.Parking is $20 per day and they have very small and crowded parking areas.I would stay here again but would love to see a few upgrades.The beds were wonderful!
user_name:
Katrina T
Bryson City, North Carolina

review_body: This was my second time in this hotel, and for the same reasons as the first time. Tim, the manager ensures that all guests are treated like family. They even kindly upgraded me to a deluxe room for a small fee at the last minute because my original reserved room was too small. The rooms are quite comfortable with microwave and fridge. The beds are great! There is water and free coffee in the lobby. They also let you borrow a beach towel and a beach chair, which saves your money from renting a chair on the beach. The location is fantastic because it is quiet at night being so close to the Ala Wai canal, but only two blocks from the beach, a bus stop and a grocery store.
user_name:
Ela F
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: right in WaiKiKi super location, staff was very friendly! water dispenser and coffee/tea in lobby. There was some kind of continental type breakfast but i did not cheque into it? The room was comfortable,nice size with a couch and microwave,fridge and sink also coffee pot. Bathroom was fine the room as been updated however I would suggest to update the showerhead! Clean no problems with air con. The only down fall was WIFI not in room only in lobby.

We love it here. we have tried many places and this is the best.The location is great !!!! We especially love being next to Food market as we can make economical purchases there. Quiet location near the canal. Yes it is warm in the room but that is because the hotel is ENERGY CONSCIOUS and turns off the a.c. when you're not in the room -very smart idea!!! No reason to whine about the heat. It cools off before you know it. We didn't do the breakfast deal- we did our own thing. anyway we will definately stay here again. Friendly staff too!!

I stayed at Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki from Sept. 4th to Sept. 10th with my wife and 3 year old daughter. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was clean (with microwaves and fridge) and had a nice balcony. There is a USD 20.00 per day to park the car (I was informed about this as soon as I arrived, so no problems with it at all). I didn´t use the swimming pool and the fitness center, but they seemed to be ok. If your package does not include breakfast, the price is of USD 6,00 per person, but there are a lot of restaurant and marketplaces in the neighborhood. Also, the towels to take to the beach were clean. Finally, this hotel is very well located and I do recommend Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki whether you travel alone or with your family.

I just got back from staying at Aqua Aloha Sure Waikiki.I was very impressed the instant I arrived, at night.Everyone was friendly and helpful, and I loved the way things were decorated in the lobby.My room looked exactly like the one in the photo, no disappointments.Very clean towels, and bathroom.I dont know what type of mattress they have there, but I want one!The breakfast included with the room was delicious, the people serving were friendly.(that means a lot to me)The view from my balcony was stunning when the sun came up every morning.I was on the 10th floor, and could see the canal, and downtown.My walk to the beach was 3 or 4 blocks, with plenty of stores and places to check outthat I may have not seen otherwise.My swim shorts blew off the balcony, and landed 9 floors down, over the entrance gateway, and they were nice enough to get them for me, after I told them I did not need them back!The best thing was the price!.. I used the AAA discount and was very pleased with what it cost!

We stayed at this hotel this year from July 26th-Aug 4th, I did my research beforehand and knew what we could possibly be in for because of the open lobby etc. As long as you keep your food/drinks covered etc they aren't a problem. There were several things that I did not like in the room we stayed in. First our sink became clogged after calling maintenence it was never fixed, there is no actual bathroom door, there is just a pocket door that slides and doesn't lock (not a problem for us as this was a romantic/couple trip) but it might be a little awkward for others who are traveling as friends etc. I also would recommend keeping atleast some of the blinds shut if you are staying on the front side of the hotel as it faces the Sand Villa directly across, we had the misfortune of waking up to see a couple having sex directly across from our room with their blinds wide open......And if we could see them they could see us... (LOL) The pool is very small and there is no hottub which was a big disappointment, as this a boutique hotel they are limited on space but it still was a disappointment. Lastly the daily breakfast buffet that was included in our room was less than desirable, We stayed there for 9 days and we ate the buffet 7/9 days. The only thing that changed on the menu was muffins going to a breakfast type cake and vice versa. After staying here I never wanted to see a pancake again. The daily breakfast menu consists of pancakes, boiled eggs, muffins, donuts or breakfast type cake, (depending on what day it was) white rice, sliced pieces of ham (very salty btw so beware) oatmeal, dry cereal, powdered milk, toast, water and what I thought was orange juice but tastes more like really bad tang. After all has been said I would recommend this hotel and if you aren't partial to the possibility of eating the same breakfast everyday go for it! I would stay here again but I would not partake in the breakfast buffet.

I have upgraded my room Bud the reserved room was to smal for two peoples Cleaning service Not the best reception Fine and GreatThe Swimmingpool Pool is Berry smal Bud is okThe Westjerusalem was Great an all the People ON the Island are Berry Nixe

We stayed here 2 nights and it was the best service and breakfast we had. Helene at the front desk even helped with directions. Other hotels we stayed in were fancier, cost more and gave less value. It was a short walk to the beach but was right beside the canal. If you are looking for value for your $, this is the one.

Simple but comfortable and nice.The service of the receptionists is pretty good. There is even a brazilian guy named Daniel, a very nice and helpful guy. Douglas is the one, always ready to guve you a hand whenever you need. Very good location, only two blocks away from the beach, nice restaurants and stores. A very good tip is about parking. They charge a 20,00 fare for parking, but it's not necessary. If you insist, you can definitely find some places along nearby streets.

After our cruise we spent a couple of night in this hotel. So convenient to everything. The room was great as was the service. When our flight home was cancelled the front desk was so amasing especially the young lady on the tours desk and Kevin who were both helpful and patient as we tried with their help to sort out new flights. We would definately go back again and recommend this hotel very highly

I enjoyed 5 nights at this wonderful hotel! My friend and I checked in Sunday, Sept. 15! Douglas was so wonderful and caring during our check in. Lydia gave us wonderful suggestions for the Pearl Harbor tour and Sunset cruise. Tim, the manager, served a wonderful Manager's special wipe-out special. Alecia made sure the room was clean and we enjoyed the beautiful view from the balcony. Slow Internet in Lobby only was the only negative!

Just returned from spending 5 days at Aqua Aloha Surf. Because the rooms were so reasonably priced (by Waikiki standards), I had low expectations. Boy, was I wrong. The staff works hard to make your stay pleasant. Tim, the manager, was warm and cordial serving delicious complimentary Wipe Out cocktails. Douglas was so nice and pleasant even though he was checking in several parties at the same time. We even received an upgraded room. Lydia, the concierge was helpful with booking Pearl Harbor tour & other suggestions around the island. Our room was very clean..thanks to Allicia. Love you get free towels & beach chairs to use. We didn't have to take our wet, sandy towels back to the room. Just turned them in at the front desk. Only negative...on the last day our shower was very slow draining & the lobby internet is slow. For faster service, I recommend going around the corner to the Coffee Bean at Food Pantry and use theirs. Overall, I would definitely stay here again.

Great location, Amazing value for a "budget" hotel. Looking up from the street I could see that all rooms, except for the 16th floor rooms, had balconies about as large as their sliding glass doors. I was, by luck or chance, upgraded to a suite on the top floor. I was delighted to have a wrap-around patio running the length of the suite, and around the corner the width of the suite. The ocean view was lovely. The city view was spectacular at night. I was above much of the noise, I did hear drumming and singing, and could see Native dancers at a restaurant below me. It added to the charm. I traveled alone and made use of the concierge desk who advised me on outings and tours that gave me the most bang for my buck. Great staff, charming front desk people, house keepers greeted me with smiles and toiletries, and towels to spare. I very much enjoyed my stay and would come back in any time! Especially to room 1601!

We are staying at this hotel at the moment. Hotel is clean and staff very helpfull.we have a room on9th floor which is very good.i don,t know why people dislike this hotel. Pool small but nice water never to cold. I would come back to this hotel any time.

I chose this hotel based on its location and value for money factor and I was satisfied with it.Let's clarify one thing from the beginning: this is NOT a 5 star hotel - so if you are looking for 5 star amenities you will be disappointed. But you do not pay for a 5 star hotel... so you should not expect one!!!We had a room with 2 beds, basic cooking facilities, sofa & coffee table + balcony. The bathroom could do with a bit of refurbishing - you enter in a small room with a sink, a safe and a small wardrobe. From there you can access to another small room with a toilet and a shower.
