The door was half broken - but you could still close it.The shower was a good size but the water would not go down. Surely the bathroom could improve dramatically with some updating.We asked for a quiet room and we were allocated one on a high floor, facing the back. I was very happy about it because Waikiki is noisy. The noise in our room was acceptable - but if would have been much better if the hotel had double-glazing.There is a small pool with 6 or 7 sun loungers, we used it for an hour or so twice during our stay and it was quite nice. There are also a couple of machines (I cannot call it a gym) behind reception - we did not use it but I think it is a nice thought... those who want to keep fit have the opportunity to do so.You can get coffee and tea for free all day at the machine next to the restaurant. if you want special coffee (espresso, etc) you have to pay a small fee. You can get beach towel for free at reception.We had breakfast included and it was ok. The selection offered is a bit limited, but you still manage to find something you like.What I found a bit strange (I have been to many hotels and never seen this before in my life) is that you were only allowed to 2 boiled eggs per person. I obviously do not know if they do it because some people would eat 4 o 5 eggs (I would never dream of it...!!!), but I thought it was strange.Of perhaps eggs in Hawaii are very expensive....now that I think of it, boiled eggs were only available on some days, not every day.As I said, that did not bother me at all - I just found it odd.The breakfast room would transform into a restaurant in the evening, run by a Chinese family. We tried the buffet and it was good value for money.All in all, I was more than happy staying at this hotel. The location is good (those who say it is scary have probably never been to some areas of LA, NY or London!), the room was absolutely fine, the service was good and there are lots of little touches (free tea and coffee, free towels, swimming pool) that put this hotel above other hotels for money conscious travellers,

This was a great hotel choice...would stay again! Located conveniently. Nice rooms with refrigerators, free use of safe in room, dishes and sink area. Free breakfast includes boiled eggs, fresh made pancakes, rice, ham, juice, oatmeal, fruit, and biscuits, etc. updated rooms

We arrived August 22 for 3 nights stay.Moment we arrived we were greeted with a smile .Most of the paper work was ready at the time of check in so check in was too smooth. MR Douglas was extremely helpful It seems he and his team was there to help you We were on the 7 th floor.Our room was in the corner We can see the mountain and green landscape.Room had refrigerator and coffee machine coffee machine came in very handy moment we entered the room. we were little exhausted from the trip from New york .Hot coffee and little snacks brought us back to life.This hotel is also close to FOOD LAND super market. We, being vegetarian ,always visit grocery store to buy and stock up fruits juices and non partishable food like energy bars Hotel is about 5 minutes walk from the waikiki beach It is a great value if you donot care for beach front room If any one is going to honolulu Oahu island and has car this is a good place We woke up in the morning had breakfast ( NO CHARGE) Breakfast was not fancy but more than enough and went for sightseeing came late in the evening never missed a beach.Thank god there was no resort charge, also hotel gave chairs ,towels and board to use when we went to beach.( NO CHARGE)Only we paid for parking.We loved this hotel We returned back Sept 1 for one more night.I will not hesitate to go back again
user_name:
Keniyag
New York City, New York

review_body: I had booked this hotel through United Airline site. When I booked that time it showed the lowest and discounted rate. But later I found from the hotel website the same type of room is available for the cheaper rate. When I contacted Hotel if I can get upgrade or change to lowest rate I was informed that since it was booked through Expedia (didnt know how Expedia came in picture?) so hotel property can not help. Ok I accepted that. The room I got was too small. Hardly you can move around in the room. The location of hotel is good. Staff was cooperative. Service I got was also good.

We stayed here in early September the weather, staff and accommodation were all excellent can highly recommend. The open-air lobby is very relaxing and welcoming on arrival and comfy to chill out before leaving for day trips. Loved the open feeling of large room and balcony most enjoyable

We are kama'aina (locals) who stayed at this hotel for a second time over Labor Day weekend since our first stay a few months ago was a good one. I had originally booked it for 2 nights (Sunday thru Tuesday) because we didn't want to worry about checking out by noon on Monday being that it was a holiday. We didn't mind paying the extra night just for that reason. So we checked out on Monday a little before 2pm. A front desk staff member named Kalei was nice enough to offer to refund the 2nd night since we weren't staying the night and were checking out within the 2 hour time-frame of the usual noon check-out. I was pleasantly surprised that he offered and I gladly accepted. I think some hotels would probably just take advantage and charge for the additional night. I really appreciate the fact that Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki did this for us, and I would gladly recommend this hotel to locals and tourists. The prices are reasonable, the hotel is in good walking distance to many restaurants and stores in Waikiki, and the staff have amazing customer service!

Check their website for specials before you book! I stayed here in late July 2013. I was really impressed with the welcoming, open-air lobby, the friendly staff, the clean, modern, light and comfortable rooms, and the really great location. They served free drinks during happy hour and had a ukelele singer/player in the breezy, blue, modernly-appointed lobby. It was very refreshing to sit in the lobby and watch the world go by outside. The room was very comfortable with a great view of the misty mountain range and city lights. The building itself is, like many in Honolulu, dated, but for the location and price, you can't beat this. It's blocks away from Waikiki Beach and the center of Waikiki. I got a special by checking out the hotel's website - you should check their site before you book, so you can get the best deal.

I can’t wait to go back, I got a great deal and decided to extend it and the staff was nice enough to give me the same deal for 3 xtra days. My suite was nice and w a great view. I agreed w another review that is a lil noisy because the traffic, but, I will go back anyways. Daniel (from Brazil) is very nice and super cute.

Great Value for those who is seeking for a place to stay while exploring Waikiki.I don't spend to much time at the hotel while in Hawaii, so it's the best choice. Room was clean and big enough, price was good too. Not too far from WaikikiLocation:- 5 minutes from Waikiki- Some rooms have a Canal view- A bit loudRoom:- One queen bed, quite big room for two persons- Fridge, microwave are good for those who want to save some money on breakfasts- Bathroom was a bit outdated but cleanOther:- Towels and beach chairs for no charge- No wireless internet at the room, only wired- Wireless internet at the lobby- No resort fees

Good location only a couple of blocks to Waikiki beach, easy walk.Rooms clean and comfortable, good soft bed.A bit of traffics noise due to louvre windows instead of double glazed windows.Great value.

This was our second visit to Aqua Aloha Surf. We were welcomed back by front desk folks who remembered us, as well as by new ones. Douglas, the first one to check us in, was new to us, but was immediately as welcoming and enjoyable as the rest of the crew. Vinh and Nolan (always very helpful) gave us a big smiles upon recognizing us. And a young man who got us two champagne glasses (we didn't get his name) for our room was incredibly kind. The room we had requested turned out to not be available, but Nickie had upgraded us to a beautiful room. We found the top floor to be much quieter for sleeping than the 9th floor had been in the previous year. While Aqua Aloha Surf is in need of renovation, for us, the wonderful people keep us coming back. We did hear that renovations will begin at the end of this year, which is good. Bathrooms are in need of repairs and are out-dated, but they are clean. The bed was great, our view from the top floor was perfect, and, as usual, many folks enjoyed relaxing in the welcoming lobby of the Aloha Surf. This place is perfectly located for walking to Waikiki beach and the shops. And the on-site parking is handy, though spots can sometimes fill up quickly. Our return visits to Waikiki will always include a stay at the Aqua Aloha Surf...at least as long as manager Tim keeps his great employees on staff!

This is the 2nd time we have stayed. The rooms are sizeable enough - breakfast is included. This is great value for money. It is about a 5 minute walk to Waikiki Beach, just around the corner from a major bus stop, the Manager Tim makes complimentary cocktails for patrons every Tuesday night, there is a mini gym close to the lobby, and free wifi in the lobby and the staff are VERY friendly. Some of the furnishings are dated and are about to be upgraded. I recommend a deluxe room which was about US$15-20 extra per night. Perhaps if Aqua Aloha Surf gets more than cable TV channels I would even be prepared to pay a bit extra for the room rate. We really liked our very friendly cleaner (Level 12) Xiu. Helene on Reception is also exceptional - AND it was great seeing the same staff there when we returned our 2nd time. It feels like a family we come back to each time.
user_name:
Jenny W
Auckland Region, New Zealand

review_body: My family and I recently stayed at the Aqua Ahola Surf for 17 nights. We could not have asked for a better stay. The location was great, the rooms were clean and the service was fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, always polite and accomodatiing. Pool was a little small, but who needs a pool with Waikiki Beach 2 blocks away. Mahalo to all the staff especially Douglas who was always a great help at the front desk. Definately hope to be back !

Very good service and good deal for the price. Clean rooms and free breakfast. Will be staying here anytime I need a hotel in the area! The rooms are clean and very nice and cool. It's also right down the street from the beaches and nice shopping center. Bell service is good too they keep bags for 24 hours if u need to leave them there.

Loved this hotel. It all starts with their employees who are top notch. It was my first trip to Oahu and any questions we had there was someone willing to help us out and give us the inside scoop. There concierge is great. I got to get to know their lead bell hop Nolan who was nothing but friendly and welcoming. He provided me with some great spots for surfing and gave me all of the info I needed to know. He treated my girlfriend and me like we were family which is a great feeling when your in a totally new place. I would definitely stay here again if when we come back next.

Just stayed 1 night as an afterthought after checking out of our timeshare. Very decent hotel not exactly facing the main thoroughfare but still gets noisy. My room was on the 3rd floor. Location is great, close to international market , the food pantry , shopping , bus stop and only 3 blocks from the beach. There are ABC stores all around for anything else that you need. Room and bathroom is clean. The breakfast $6.00 is not good. The pancake tastes bad, the orange juice is the cheapest brand one can find, hardboiled eggs. Coffee is okay. There are places to eat all around the hotel. The staff is friendly and professional.

We stay here annually and each time we return it is like "coming back home" - staff are very friendly and helpful. The beds are sooo.. comfortable and the room clean and tidy. The cost for this accomodation is very reasonable which enabled me to do more shopping!!!! We talked to other holiday makers in Waikiki who were paying lots more money and were not satisfied with their accomodation. The quick walk to the Cheesecake Factory is a bonus !!! Thank you again guys for another beautiful holiday with you all!!!! See you next year :) :)

We stayed here last year & found it met all our needs. Delightful, friendly & helpful staff, 5 minute leisurely walk to the beach, close to public transport, close to the Food Pantry (supermarket) & shops. The hotel is supposed to be due for refurbishment at the end of 2013 so I hope the prices don't hike up too much. We will be back.

The hotel has a kind of outdated feel to it. It's not the kind of glamour you'd expect from Waikiki based on what you see on tv. But all in all, the hotel gives you value for your money. We had the double deluxe room with our own little balcony, a kitchenette and a salon. The bathroom needed refreshing: it reminded me of the kind of showers you find on campings. Continental breakfast was included, but there was not much choice. WiFi only in the lobby area and very slow. The hotel staff was friendly and correct.

The staff is warm and inviting, the property is well maintained and the location is ideal. All the reasons why I keep returning to Aqua Surf. I travel to Waikiki every three months or so and look forward to a familiar and trustworthy hotel with no surprises and the Aqua Surf always meets and exceeds my expectations. Mahalo for an excellent stay.

Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights.Good pointsThe staff bend over backwards for you at this place. The place is a 5 minute walk from Waikiki beach. The breakfast is a bit more than u get for a usual continental breakfast.Not so good pointsView from rooms on the west side on lower floor look into neighbouring apartment block. So not walking butt naked with the windows open. Wifi not available in rooms until fall 2013. But still available in lobby.Would recommend for people looking for affordable accommodation near the beach.

This hotel does exaclty what is says on the tin. Its cheapish and cheerfull with helpfull and accommodating staff that are there to help. The room was on the small side but in all fairness the island is so amazing with so much to do that we didn't spend much time in our room anyway. They said that the wi fi was in the reception area only but we were on the second floor and had full signal which helped us plan all of the activities through the week. The location is extremely central with a 5 minute walk to the beach and local abc store for water and snack etc. The only downfall is not spectaular views from our window in fact it was an apartment tower that stared into our window but again with the curtains closed and you skeeping what does it matter?!

My family and I stayed at the Aloha Surf for 2 nights during a recent visit to Honolulu. We found the staff to be extremely nice and accomodating. The room was sufficient (larger than we expected after reading some prior reviews) and clean. The beach chairs and beach towels that they provided us at no charge was unexpected and really nice. We will definitely stay at the Aloha Surf again.

Two blocks from Waikiki Beach and close to various restaurants and shopping centers. Hotel is clean and the staff is very friendly. If I wanted a 5 star resort I would go to the Four Seasons, otherwise this place works perfectly fine for me. Stayed on the 11th floor and was not bothered by any street noise at all.

Great value (especially when breakfast in included when you book on internet), good location because at 2 blocks from waikiki beach, big room ok for 4, great service, pool + sports space, good continental breakfast

The staff at this hotel was nice, but the room they put me in was smaller then my dorm room in college. The was to small barely enough room for two little people. We end up calling priceline to get us out of there. The manager gave us a full refund and as I was walking out the door he asked me if I wanted to stay in a bigger room. I went and checked it out and it was the room I thought I was getting in the first place, but by that time me and guest just wanted to leave. we ended up staying at the Marriott Resort and Spa, great place. We wanted to enjoy our vacation and I'm normally don't care about the hotel I stay in but in Hawaii it is worth sending the extra money to stay a nice place and not just picking somewhere because it is cheap.

We have been visiting Hawaii every year since 2003 and only once did we stay at another hotel and we went back to the Aqual Aloha Surf. The staff are very friendly and accomodating. I like the location as it is near the canal and its a nice short walk to the beach. The rooms have always been clean as well as the hotel itself. I feel very comfortable and safe staying at this hotel. The price was very reasonable and I highly recommended this hotel.

Close to the canal in Waikiki, this simple, yet comfortable hotel will make your vacations in O'ahu less expensive without much trouble. Nicely located (close to Kuhio avenue with all the buses, close to stores, and of course, the beach). Guest services are very good, rooms are quiet, ample and clean. If you don't want to break your wallet while vacationing in Waikiki, and save it for other things, this is the place to be

We stayed here for 12 days, 11 nights in a Jr. Suite (1608). We had a lovely view of the canal and mountain range also could see the beach I enjoyed having my coffee as I watched the sunrise.The staff was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the continental breakfast kids loved the pancakes!! The location was great with everything in walking distance. Having the beach amenities available to us was a plus (beach towels, beach chairs,and boogie boards). We will definitely be back. Thank you!!!! =)

The rooms are extremely small. I booked an alleged "Deluxe Room." When I checked in, I was assigned room 806. The room looked directly across the alley into people's apartments and they could see into my room. The only way to avoid this was to shut the drapes, which would eliminate light into the room all day! I complained and after telling me they were sold out, I told them that I would not stay in that room and they relocated me to room 1207. No real view, but at least above the roof of the apartments across the alley. All night long, doors banged closed and even this high up, you could hear people yelling and partying on the street below and in the apartments across the alley who had their glass sliding balcony doors open. I tend to believe that the hotel hosts long-term residents as a few "guests" came to the front desk while I was there to ask for their mail. It's a very seedy place. I stayed here several years ago and had a beautiful room, but this place has gone downhill. The front desk lady scolded me for booking through Expedia and not the hotel directly if I wanted a better room! Huh? I will not return to this place and unless you want slamming doors all day and night and seedy residents, look elsewhere... I sure will!

Pros: good location, clean rooms, has a fridge and microwave in the room. Overall it's fine but wouldn't want to be staying for more than a couple of nights. Cons: very average, nothing special, small bathroom, air conditioner made an awful racket at night. Pool is really small, you wouldn't want to be using it for more than a brief dip. Hotel is fairly tired overall and has a 'cheap' feel to it.

I've tried many hotels in Waikiki in the past month. This one has been one of the worst. The room is very small. Air conditioner is very noisy. The room has an old look. No wireless internet access in the rooms (only in the lobby). Very small beds in their standard rooms. The last time I've slept in a bed this size was in my childhood! The mattress is very uncomfortable. If you tumble when you are asleep, there's a very good chance that you might fall down! Their Aqua Wave hotel is much better!
user_name:
Kaveh K
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We used this hotel as a stop between Australia and Vancouver. Although a moderate hotel it was satisfied our needs. Everything was in walking distance. The rooms were large and clean. Breakfast was very basic, but having said that it was all that we needed. The staff were very helpful and assisted us with our queries. There is wifi in the lobby. We would stay again.

It was lucky that we had only one night at the hotel . We had meet the most terrible receptionist named Vinh . He acted like we asked for a room , not like customers , without any smile and neccesary guide , didn't give us breakfast vouchers . In the morning , when we asked about br. vouchers, he was rude saying that " let me check " . His act made us think that he himself aranged for us the wost room in the hotel ,numbered 208 . This old room was too small with noisy air conditioner . And the thing called window was inconvenient that we could'nt open it . There was even little cockroaches in the bathroom . We knew that we chose the cheapest price but we were ready to pay more for the room with river view as we susgested in our room booking . We had a very bad impression about hotel because of Vinh . We think the hotel manegement should educate Vinh again by a simply way : let him walk to Aqua Pearl Hotel and see how did these infrond - desk staffs working , talking to customers .

great hotel for the price around $100.00 per night, staff very friendly fast check in and check out, 24 hr reception, Clean hotel and rooms. rooms are small compared to other hotels but we were bearly in the room so doesn't matter, Room safe, Iron and ironing board air con, breakfast good not a big selection but did the job, great location only 2 streets from the beach and restaurants with plenty of things to do and see

We actually rented a studio unit here via the vrbo.com website (unit no. 1006 on the 10th floor). The location is nice and central while being quiet enough in a side street on the Ala Wai canal. The lobby is breezy and lovely and there is a small plunge pool on the ground floor (very deep, not suitable for small children). You are close to everything (bus stop, eateries, beach, supermarket). The property itself is well maintained and the staff are simply superb - all helpful, friendly and cheerful - and this whilst we weren't even staying in a room that the resort manages. Very child friendly too. I saw some rooms while we were there (other guests gave us a peek) and they all looked clean, well maintained and bright. I would highly recommend this place for anyone staying in Waikiki on holidays in this price bracket. I would not necessarily spend a honeymoon there but it is perfectly adequate for any other kind of stay unless you are after a luxury upmarket resort. Our balcony was big enough to hang beach towels and have breakfast/a cup of coffee and watch the sunrises/sunsets. Overall a very enjoyble stay.

This is an older dated property, tiny pool with excellent service. We were checked in by a gentleman named "Douglas" which chipper attitude and efficient demeanor and humor just set the pace for a great visit. rooms are a bit dated but nice clean white linens while not a duvet was the next best thing and without question we got the most comfortable bed in Hawaii.

This is an affordable hotel in a central Waikiki location, booked sight unseen after reading Trip Advisor reviews as a stopover for three nights to break up our journey back to Enzed. The Aqua Aloha is obviously popular with Antipodeans; we met many during our stay all, like us, enjoying the balmy climate and buzz of Waikiki. The room was a good size but filthy around the edges, with a carpet stain embedded with solid matter I didn't care to investigate closely. This was a noisy location with considerable construction or roading activity nearby, but the beach was just a few blocks away, and we loved the locally made food from the nearby farmers market. We didn't take advantage of the continental breakfast as it finishes at nine ... And who gets up that early on a tropical vacation? The lobby is airy and pleasant, with free wifi.

i choose this hotel only because of its location and price. it is located near Waikiki beach and international market. it was very convenient cause there are ABC mart around the corner and many restaurant. Its price is very reasonable and the staffs were very helpful whenever i asked something. i enjoyed staying there, hope go there again.

We stayed here one night before going on a cruise. We had a spacious room with a comfortable bed and lots of storage space. We requested a quiet room and that is what we got, on the 6th floor. The bathroom was quite basic but it had all we needed. Breakfast was included in the room price and very good with enough choice. Hotel staff is very cheerful and, above all, helpful. They really made us feel at home. The hotel is conveniently located, not too far from the beach and the shops. We made a good choice in staying there.

We moved to Hawaii and are staying at this hotel right now. This is a fantastic place! First off,the staff from the front desk to housekeeping is amazing!! Everyone is so friendly and easy going, you feel right at home. The room is very spacious and clean. We have stayed in a lot of hotels and this is by far the cleanest room we've had in a while. The location is a big plus as well, its literally only a 5 min walk to the beach, shops or restaurants. Another cool thing is that they have free cocktail hour on tuesdays, not just one, you can drink as many cocktails in that hour as you can flush down!! Definitely very happy with our choice and would come back here anytime.

Good hotel, helpful staff, clean and friendly. Partial views of the mountain and canal, saw kids training for outrigger races which was cool. Had to walk to the beach but hey, it's Waikiki, it's always interesting. Very good value for money would stay there again.We are a family of 4, pool was a bit small but ok, lobby was very social, 2 TVs in 1 bedroom suite was good too. Air conditioning noisy but we slept ok, ceiling fans would be a good idea.

We live on the Big Island and needed to come to Honolulu just for one night for an immigration interview. This place was a much more reasonable price than most of the prices in Honolulu considering we weren't coming for a vacation. The only other options in that price range were hostels (which wasn't an option for us as a couple). The person who booked us and checked us in, Douglas, was really nice and really helpful. It was great to have breakfast included. The place was reasonably clean. We actually even wound up having a view. The location was perfect. Just an all around really perfect set up for what we needed. The lobby was lovely. Biggest set back was that the hallways really needed to be vacuumed and the elevator smelled a little smoky... but that was the worst part, which is not really that bad. I would particularly recommend this place for other people living in Hawaii who need somewhere to stay in Honolulu for a short period of time.

We stayed here for 8 nights. We were on the 12th floor, which might have minimized the street noise. We slept with the AC on, and found that we never needed earplugs. We had lovely (unexpected!) partial views of both the canal & mountains and the ocean from our little lanai. The breakfast was included in our price, but others still have the option to purchase it for $6. It's a simple spread with hard boiled eggs, great pancakes, (watery) porridge, and a variety of breads, biscuits, muffins and some sliced apples and oranges, but really decent value for the price. The mini fridge was fabulous (there is a Food Pantry around the corner.) Our only minor complaint was that the shower curtain was already very mildewy when we checked in--very likely because of the lack of ventilation in the bathroom. However, our housekeeper was extremely adorable, and every time we told her our room didn't need servicing she seemed so perplexed, and still offered fresh towels and toiletries although we declined. It's a great location, close to the main strip and the beach, and they don't charge amenity fees even though you are entitled to borrow towels to go to the beach. Altogether great value for the money in Waikiki.

My husband and I stayed at Aqua Aloha for one night as a layover on our way to Oahu for our honeymoon. The hotel is a bit outdated, we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite for our honeymoon and we were grateful but not impressed. It was definitely outdated, and the balcony can't really be considered a balcony.. Very cramped. The hotel continental breakfast was great and came with our room stay. It's free so I won't complain. Nice selection and friendly staff. The downfall of the hotel was when my husband woke up to use the bathroom he saw a ROACH!!! This was unacceptable.. After that we were nervous to leave our suitcases in our room or unzip them. Definitely could use some maintenance in the bug area. Not cool.Overall the hotel is in a great location, close to all the restaurants and GREAT shopping! We would probably not stay here again, but it was ok just for a night before our real honeymoon began.

My husband and I stayed in April for 4 days. I found the room rather dingy, scuffed and stained furniture and carpet, just seemed old and outdated to me. The balcony was scary, the birds loved it though! The bathroom was configured poorly with sliding door and pedistal sink with no toiletry storage area. I found it hard to get ready in the morning as all my bathroom products had to lay in the sink as there was not a sink counter top. It was nice to have the microwave and mini frig with dishes so we could eat our restaurant leftovers. The price was affordable, the location good for walking to most stores/restaurants/beach. Wifi only in lobby, that was a downfall. The pool is tiny, the workout area had 4 machines. Continental breakfast was good, nice selection. Considering we didn't stay in the room much, other than to sleep, it was okay.

My husband and I stayed last July. It was our home for two weeks. The location is fantastic for the price. And yes it's a little noisy, it's on a corner of two busy streets, but get a room on the upper floors and it cuts it out a bit. It didn't cause me to lose any sleep, woke up refreshed everyday(unless I had to much fun the night before) we were on the 7th floor. All of the staff that we encountered were really nice and helpful. Our room was really clean and had great views.

This is the 2nd time that I have stayed in this hotel and I just love it. First the location, a quick walk to the beach, restaurants everywhere, International Market just down the street, and other shops. Their prices are great and this stay, I was even upgraded for free! The staff are there ready to help you...Thanks Douglas:) Look no further, stay at this hotel and you won't regret it:) Mahalo!

Myself and my partner spent 2 weeks at the Aloha Surf in Feb/March. We booked through Thomson and had asked for pretty much bog standard accommodation as we were on a budget - we wanted to spend more money exploring Oahu! Check in was painless and all of the staff were friendly and pleasant enough throughout our stay.Our room was decent for the price we had paid. I had noticed a few reviews saying the standard rooms were small but it was plenty big enough for a couple sharing using it as a holiday base. We were literally only in the room to sleep at night then back in the afternoon after a day out for a nap/shower then back out again. Bathroom was spotlessly clean, in fact the whole room was always clean - the only thing that could've done with more attention were the windows (the slats were very dirty) but this was a minor thing. We had the buffet breakfast included in the rate we paid however we probably only used it 4 or 5 days out of the 14 we were there. There wasn't much variation day to day but the food on offer was (mostly) good quality. The pancakes and muffins were delicious but the juice wasn't too good. Could've done with fresh juice rather than cordial type stuff. We chose to eat breakfast out most days, partially to have a bigger breakfast (then not eat again until evening) and partially due to meeting up with friends to have breakfast with. The hotel is in such a good location, just a couple of blocks to the beach and there are tons of restaurants, bars and shops nearby. Hotel is right by the Ala Wai canal which we'd walk down regularly to get to a friend's place, and also to walk up to Diamond Head (long walk but worth it!). The hotel does have a tiny pool however we didn't use this and didn't see anybody using it the whole time we were there - the sea is only 5 minutes away! Reception staff were very helpful with ordering taxi for our return to the airport (early flight!). All in all, the hotel served it's purpose and if we return to Honolulu would definitely contemplate staying there again, mainly due to the great location.

The location of this place was great -blocks from the beach and great shopping. A grocery store nearby let us stock our room with staples like yogurt and bread (yay for cost cutting, we're still poor students.) The rooms were TINY though. We originally rented a "suite" with a few friends that was supposed to house six people, which couldn't possibly have been the case unless we were all about 2.5 feet tall. Advice -if you're thinking of sharing a room with others, either get very friendly or just suck it up and pay more for separate rooms. The breakfast was alright, nothing to write home about, but passable.Overall, great location is a good reason to pick this hotel. The price wasn't terrible either -I believe we payed around $100 per night for our room.
user_name:
Elizabeth E
Spokane, Washington, United States

review_body: The hotel is consistently a great value for the Waikiki area Economical room pricing plus the bonus of a breakfast buffet has now become hard to find but at this hotel. Beds are comfortable and updated. Rooms are spacious and have always found them in good repair although dated but not neglected. Location is great one block walk to The Bus and trolley transportation, three blocks to Waikiki beach. Managers reception on Tuesday evenings is a great touch, keep it up Tim. Looking forward to my next stay at the Aloha Surf.
Good price- wonderful staff- but place needs a sprucing up- management agrees- mediocre breakfast- good location- few blocks away from Waikiki Beach.Good place to stay if only in Oahu for a few days.

The room (1st floor) was dirty, hairs everywhere. Very noisy, I couldn't sleep for a week. No windows to close. Every word of the people in the next room can be heard. The connecting door is bad. The room is much too small for the price. Shower temerature is changing from cold to very hot very quickly. Fitness area is a joke. Pool is a joke. Breakfast is a joke. I never ever would recommend this hotel.

Chose this hotel based on reasonable price and proximity to Convention Center. Everything about our stay exceeded my expectations- very good, hot breakfast each morning, extremely comfortable beds (I wish I had looked what kind of mattress it was, I want to buy one!), almost no street noise (granted, I was on 14th floor), nice balcony, and very clean rooms. Most importantly, the staff was overly accomodating for our every request- including holding our bags after checkout and being willing to split up our bill several ways as requested by our university finance department. No wifi in rooms but the ethernet cord worked fine and provided very fast internet connection. I felt very welcome here and appreciated the hospitality. Would definitely stay here again.

I had a standard room and it was small; really small. I was alone and it was only for one night so I didn't mind. I asked for the wifi passcode and was told no wifi in the rooms. Are you kidding? That's the top priority for a hotel room in 2013 next to "do you have running water?". They did give me an ethernet cord so that helped but, cmon guys, get current. I paid $20 to park in about 15 available spaces but when I left in the morning I had a ticket. I asked the desk clerk what's up with that. She said I didn't have the correct license plate written on the pass that was INSIDE my locked car in the windshield...the one SHE wrote down. So she said forget it. Hotels are extremely high in Honolulu and the major chains are non-existent or way out of my price range so Aqua was within my price range. Would probably stay here again but would have to think about it.

My sister Patsy, and I, Amanda, had an amazing stay at this hotel. The staff was so friendly and helpful. There are a lot of benefits to staying here. It is great value for your money. We were about 5 minutes walking distance from Waikiki beach and complimentary beach towels and chairs were provided for use at the pool or beach. Transportation is available within a very short walking distance, if bus or trolley is needed. There was a healthy breakfast buffet available each morning, and complimentary beverages are also available. Every Tuesday, the general manager personally hosts a meet and greet in the hotel lobby. The rooms are kept clean and tidy. We had comfortable sleep, and liked that the toiletries provided were made from all Hawaiian ingredients, and no animal testing was done. We had a memorable Hawaiian stay, and because of the diligent efforts of this hardworking staff, we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone considering visiting Oahu. We would return to Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki again.

This was our second visit to this hotel and our visit was from the 20th April to the 27th April. We had 4 other members of the family with us so we had three rooms. My wife and I had room 1511 Amy son had 1505. My Daughter and son in law and grandson had suite 1606. The hotel had been redecorated since and was excellant. The staff was as friendly and helpful as ever and the rooms were spotless.the manager Mr Clark was excellant, the only slight problem was the noise from the traffic from the road at night. My whole family were delighted with the hotel and would have no hesitation going back. Brilliant location and great staff.

I stayed on the room 1511 of the Aqua Aloha Surf between 28 of March thru 03 of May. There are many positive aspects to highlight here. The Location is the biggest of them all. In one of of the best streets of Waikiki just two blocks from Kalakaua Ave and the beach. The Rooms are clean, small but clean and we didin't have any problem with smell of any kind, nice flat screen TV, frige, mini kitchen, nice shower, AC...and that's it. If this is enough for you ok! Go for it. What I don't understand why they don't fix small problems as:A- No hanger for the towels above the bathroom sink and on the bathroom itself. You don't have any place to hang your towels.B- Wired Internet??? Come on guys, we're living in the Ipads and Iphones era. They only work with WiFi. Only on the lobby is not good enough.C- My God you got to find a way to get rid of all those birds while we're having breakfast. They fly inside the restaurant area. Did you know that pigeons are also know as "rats with wings"? Google it.D- The staff is OK. Not great. Ok. they don't actually DO anything to deserve the status of GREAT. Just because they exist? Some people are too emotional. The japonese lady that make the pancakes only cares with your punch card so you don't sneak to steal that "continental breakfast" with all the half dozen itens.So there you have it. Small things that can b fix with the proper time. But if you don't care about the things that I'm complaining, this Hotel is good for you.

Excellent location and plenty of parking. In Waikiki but away from the noise and just a few blocks to the beach. Beach towels and chairs available and guest laundry too. Would definitely stay here sgain.

I LOVED everything about the Aqua Aloha Surf hotel! I'm from Hawaii but recently moved to California. I came home for a visit a week ago and wasn't sure which hotel to stay at. The Aqua Aloha Surf had the best rates and even gave a kama'aina discount so I booked with them. I didn't know if I would be getting a below average hotel experience since the prices were so low but the online reviews were all positive so I decided to give them a try. The hotel experience I received GREATLY EXCEEDED my expectations. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated (not that 30-year-old-rattan-furniture-and-hibiscus-print theme that a lot of the other super tourist-y hotels have). The hotel staff was helpful and friendly and informed me of the free breakfast downstairs every morning. Bonus! Good stuff too- fresh pancakes, fruit, boiled eggs, ham, oatmeal, ... Great location in Waikiki. Also, the little soaps and shampoos they give you are wonderful- coconut lime and coconut mango scented!Now whenever I come home for a visit there's no question where I will be staying-the Aqua Aloha Surf =)

This is a good, clean place to stay for the value. And I have to agree with a lot of others and say yes, the staff was very friendly and helpful. Waikiki beach is just a couple of blocks away as well as all the shopping and restaurants. Very conveniently located.

we were greeted by friendly staff 3hrs before our check in, (8am on a Sunday morning). Staff happily secured our bags and gave us information/directions on where the best spot for breakfast was. Staff were always friendly and polite. Would happily stay again

This was our first accommodation in Waikiki and was selected based on price and last minute booking. The lobby was open air which had a nice atmosphere, this is the only area in which to connect to WiFi. Breakfast (free) was a bit odd, catering more towards the very present Asian tourists. As the lobby was updated, the rooms were not. They were simple, clean, with lanai. We planned on using the kitchenette but only opened the mini fridge to keep beer cold. The furnishings were sufficient. The lanai was nice to relax on, our view was of the neighboring concrete hotels. In relation to its location within the City, tolerable. We walked to the CBD more than a few times within a reasonable amount of time. Outside of the beach, there really isn't much to see in downtown, unless you want to score some hookers!

And for the money you are getting a very clean and inviting hotel. They don't charge for more people per room either! We were a group of 4 and the same room was the same price if it was 2 or 4. Really great deal there. Most other places charge more per person and also includes a nice $20 per person per visit. This place didn't. The staff is awesome there too! Really really nice people. Free wifi in the lobby. The room was very clean. A small kitchenette. I liked the beds. The fold out bed wasn't as bad as some people were saying but then again I'm not too picky. Having 4 people with a bunch of luggage makes it hard for the room attendant to clean around your stuff but at least they try! We were on the 14th floor and had a nice breeze flow through the room. We also had to rent a car and it was $20 a night. But traveling with that many people makes it totally worth it. Parking is crazy! They provide one beach towel per person in the room and you can switch them out as often as you want. Along with that, they offer beach chairs for no charge! I thought that was really nice. My only complaint would be our bathroom door. Its a sliding door but it didn't really close all the way. All in all I really had a good experience with them.
user_name:
L2493ACbrucec
San Diego, California, United States

review_body: After carefully searching for an affordable, clean hotel in the Waikiki area, I and found the Aqua Aloha Surf. Clean, affordable, family-friendly hotel. Wifi in the lobby, beach towels and chairs, free coffee, water and a continental breakfast included. The breakfast was average, but sure beats paying for breakfast elsewhere....My 8 year old daughter really enjoyed the pool area. Even though it was small, it was not overly crowded. Was clean, and had nice loungers outside....Walking distance to the beach, the ala wai canal, bus stops, tourist bus pick-up locations, The Food Pantry, Starbucks, Fast-food places, Nice dine-in restaurants and more....
user_name:
Kimberley B
Surrey, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: Staff super friendly and helpful. Building is older but very clean. Location is good...within walking distance to beach, shops and restaurants. Very nice walking/running path by a canal practically right outside the front door if you want to get away from the crowed streets and sidewalks. We stayed in this hotel on Oahu for 5 nights before hopping over to the Big Island. Two specific things that stand out about our experience at this hotel is (1) One our way to breakfast the morning after our first night there we were stopped by a staff at the front desk and offered a larger room with a bigger bed for the rest of our stay. (2) Aaron, the concierge in the hotel was a pleasure to meet and full of information about the island and things to do. I had booked the Hummer "LOST" tour before coming to the island (which I highly recommend with KOS Hummer Tours) and that is where we first met Aaron. He picked us up at the hotel the morning of our tour and during the day we learned that he worked for Expedia at our hotel and offered to help us with any activities that we wanted to do during our vacation. We stopped by his desk the next day. He helped us find a rental car for our arrival on Big Island at a great price and helped us decide to do a helicopter tour on Big Island and the whale watch on Maui. These are things that we knew that we wanted to do while in Hawaii, he is not at all pushy like a salesman but truly wants you to enjoy and get the most out of your stay. He even called after we got on Big Island to make sure we received our rental car without any problems.It is employee's like this that make a business successful. Thanks for everything. Susan & Don

This hotel is located several blocks from the beach and is at least partially away from the masses of visitors. Yet it is easily walkable to the famous beach. The parking is limited and a fee is charged. The nearby parking lot is more expensive than the hotel!The included breakfast is of average quality but is sufficient in quantity.The rooms are above average size with a sofa and coffee table sitting area.

Great property and friendly staff.Great value considering property offers breakfast, free wifi and staff willing to provide great non-expensive suggestions for tours.A special thank you to Mr.Nolan, at the front desk, for all his suggestions on how to tour the whole island and great trackings routes. From check-in to check-out I have always pleasantly surprised with the interactions from all the Hotel's staff. The openness of the lobby and breakfast areas allowing the chirping of the birds to be heard and occasionally flying is definitely relaxing and a great way to start a day in a marvelous nature.I would definitely stay with them again.Thank you all,

Stayed here 2 nights before our cruise and enjoyed it,was very clean,the staff was all friendly.If I ever go back to Hawaii would definetly look into staying there again.The room view over looked a canal and a golf course,ask to stay on the 16th floor.The continental breakfast was good,the food was hot and they cleaned up after guests fast.It is only a 2 1/2 block walk to Waikiki beach.

This hotel is in a great location. The staff was super friendly. The only thing I would have to 'complain' about is that it was a bit loud early in the morning due to street noise, e.g. garbage truck, traffic...

Brilliant little hotel. It is two blocks back from the main stip but only a five minute walk. One block down were all the bus stops so was very easy to get around.Staff are extremely helpful and have a tour desk and they give you excellent advice on the different tours available.Rooms were serviced daily. Rooms are cosy, but come with fridge coffee machine and microwave. All have a balcony and the views are great. Beds are wonderfully soft and are so very comfortable.Street noise can be a little bit loud but not enough to disturb.I would most definately stay there again.

This is a great small hotel just 3 block off of the beach. The hotel staff is very welcoming and makes you feel like family while staying there. The rooms are clean and have in room fridge, coffee maker and safe.

I travel to Waikiki a couple times a year, so I have stayed in larger, resort hotels, as well as in the boutique places. If you are looking for an upscale hotel on the beach, this is not the place for you. I, however, have a preference for smaller, cozy hotels that are more laid back. That said, this place is a gem! The location is great: it's near the Ali Wai Canal; the beach is only a short walk away. There are plenty of restaurants and shops nearby, including a convenient little food market. The staff is very cordial and accommodating. I had a nice room and balcony with a view of both the ocean and the Ali Wai Canal. I really enjoyed myself here and felt right at home. I can't wait to go back!

I spent a lot of time in research to find a affordable Hotel near the beach, before you do that too: ALL the hotels in Waikiki are quite the same bed-castles, also the Aqua Aloha. No matter on what side you get your room, you will have a look onto the balcony of another hotel. The balcony is not equipped very lovingly (two plastic seats, no table, but maybe this is because the balcony is very small) and the room is overall very small. It can also be quite noisy because of the traffic (if your room is next to the public parking, you have the "pieppiep" of the trucks of the suppliers going backwards every morning). But altogether it was a pleasant stay there, very clean and friendly staff. You have to face the price! If you want something really great, you have to pay far a lot more..... There is a coin operated guest laundry and you can park your car for 20,- dollars extra a day on the ground floor (may be the public parking right next door is cheaper, but we were too lazy to find out...) My personal opinion to Waikiki beach (being near to this beach was one of the Pros of the Aqua Aloha Surf): Waikiki beach is far supervalued. Millions of people lying on the beach packed like sardines in the can - but that´s of course nothing the Aqua Aloha Surf is responsible for.... So nothing to complain at the Aqua Aloha Surf!

Fair location, friendly helpful staff, clean but outdated room. Starting to remodel and I think there will be a lot more great things to say about it, but I'm sure the price will go up after that. All that being said, "I definitely got my money's worth". Again the staff made the difference.

I have been going to Hawaii for work ( 4-6 days each time) for 5 years and will be going this May for the 6th time. I have stayed at the Aqua Aloha Surf every time, except once I ended up at another Aqua hotel ( can't remember name ).This place is a true gem ! I travel quite a bit for my business and am not the most picky person to satisfy when it comes to room or amenities.When I first stayed, the room I stayed in had early 80's decor, what did I care ? It was a nice room with a balcony, very clean and close to everything and the staff was great !Every year I go back, there is something else that has been updated or improved upon.In Downtown Honolulu, you can't touch their pricing to be where they are, so convenient for sooo much.I have talked to Tim the manager and he always welcomes me back.I am glad for them, but sad for me that my little secret is out about this place, its getting more business and more expensive, but I can see they are spending money and the place is excellent with excellent staff. If you want to spend big money to stay in a fancy place, then don't stay here. If you want a great place, for a very reasonable price, great staff and a great location, then stay here.

The room was small but very clean. Had wired internet. The best thing was the location. Around the hotel within 3 - 5 or 6 blocks were grocery stores, coffee shops, drug stores, restaurants, International Market for shopping and most important in Hawai'i, Waikiki Beach! While I may not stay there again, for my first trip to Honolulu, it was great!

3+ stars. While the room wasn't modern, it was clean, big enough for me and my luggage, and had wired internet access, which was helpful in figuring out stuff to do. The staff was friendly, and the lobby had a nice open air feel. The room might not wow you, but the access to everything else will.The best thing about this hotel is the fantastic location. You'll pay a very very reasonable price for a hotel that's located less than a 5 minute walk from the beach. On top of that, there's a supermarket around the corner if you ever find that you forgot something and need to stock up (e.g., deodorant, hair gel, etc.). With the beach only a five minute walk away and considering how little time I actually spent in my room what with all the sightseeing and other fun things to do, I knew it was the right decision to save money on the hotel and instead use it for other things on the trip. I didn't feel like I was gipped at all in booking a hotel not directly on the beach.Overall, I'd recommend this hotel; it's a good deal for a great location.

I am writing this review for my 90 year old parents. The stayed for 6 weeks and had a great time. The hotel was absolutely wonderful. The staff is so nice and friendly to them. They helped to make the trip very enjoyable for them. The location is a short walk for from the beach and nice that it is away from the crowds. The hotel is a block from The Bus on Kuhio Street and resturants and stores. Many places are within a short walking distance. The lobby is open and large. It is nice to sit in and relax, especially in the rain when you don't want to walk around. The breakfast is good and it has a wide variety. The rooms are clean and the beds are very comfy. They supply beach towels and chairs for you to take to the beach, which is wonderful. My parents will definitly stay there again next year. It is a very nice and safe environment, wonderful for families, the elderly, and people of any age. I would recommed this hotel to anyone staying in Waikiki.

This hotel was much more than I expected. I had checked it out on Trip Advisor and even gone to another site that photographs a sample room in detail. Yes, the morning breakfast became boring and loaded with carbs. Yes there were a few signs of wear in the room. However... the staff was extremely attentive and the room was very, very practical , clean and pest free. The hotel was situated in the middle of Waikiki and only half a block to busses and trolleys, a block and a quarter to car rentals, a quarter block to a grocery store and also an ABC store with more food and sundries. Round table delivers, Chili's is around the corner. Restaurants of many nationalities are nearby. Shaved ice is about three blocks away. The ocean is a two block walk. Bottled water and soda pop is in a machine in the lobby. There is a daily paper. The room is air conditioned, has a coffee maker, microwave, fridge and ironing board with iron. The secured laundry is fairly new, clean and in the parking garage basement. Parking fees are very reasonable compared with other hotels. The hotel features a person who sits at a table in the lobby and will book tours for you. All my tours picked me up at the hotel. I am somewhat disabled, seventy years young and thus booked a room closer to the elevator (which always worked.) My room key never failed. Corazon, the 11th floor maid kept my room in excellent order and well supplied with towels. The help at the desk converted money, called cabs, fixed any problems and answered all my questions promptly. Negatives? A few. Time warner cable TV is very limiting.The high rises around create a canyon effect and multiplys noise. My room had a coffee table but no eating area, the bath sink area was fine for a single or two very careful people. The trade winds blow at times and rattle the windows and door. Otherwise, for $200 an night including taxes, it was nirvana. I am "stumpy and sassy" by the way.

This hotel was a few short blocks from the world famous Waikki beach. Although it is not the most updated hotel, it is comfortable and accomodating. When we headed for the beach, we checked out both towels and chairs. If forced to rent on the beach, a chair would have been about $35 for the day.I would recommend this property! It's not on the beach, but it also doesn't attack your wallet.

Close to the centre of Waikiki and quite comfortable, especially for the price. The front desk staff were excellent, accommodating our enormous pile of luggage both on our early arrival and late departure. In addition, they went the extra mile and lent us towels for an off-site ocean adventure. Comfortable lobby area with large screen TV, which was a gathering place for guests watching the Academy Awards! Pull-in entrance made it easy to arrange for and catch shuttles to island highlights. The parking lot was small and a bit difficult to navigate, but at least parking for our rental car was an option!

"Green" rooms require key in place for power. Nice sized rooms, clean & modern enough. Great location, minutes from beach by foot & plenty of bus options. Grocery store & parking lot adjacent. Open lobby & eating areas are pleasant, breakfast options are mostly carbs & weak coffee. WiFi available in lobby but rooms only have wired options. Most rooms are rented out by owners & managed by staff.
user_name:
Ivy212
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is not four star by any means nor is it up to date but it's clean and the staff is friendly but most of all the location is great; couple of blocks from the beach and all the great things to do in Waikiki. Beds were comfy, pillows not. Furniture dated but decent; curtains need replacing and windows are old and some are taped shut but the AC works and the towels/sheets are clean. They do offer a "breakfast" across the street at the sister hotel but it's just toast and juice but it does get you something in your tummy and the lady behind the counter is very nice.

Considering the location of this hotel (Central Waikiki) it is great value. It is dated but it does the job. Everything is just "fine" about this hotel - although most of the staff were fantastic. For the price you pay to stay here it is what is expected. We stayed 10 nights so the savings compared to other hotels in the area was considerable.Although one thing that was not expected, which lets the place down was the beds - they are in a terrible state. After three complaints they finally changed our room.. which was only marginally better. At least we managed to get to sleep on it.If you are travelling solo, the mattresses would be fine - you can choose the most comfortable part to sleep on!They explained this was going to be rectified in the renovations but in my mind they should never have got to this state in the first place. That one night before we got moved was the most uncomfortable sleep in my life - camping is a better alternative!Also, I would not waste money prepaying the daily contiental breakfast (you can pay $6 if you want it the odd day out of convenience). It is the most bizaar combination of food I have seen - it is like they haven't thought about how all the options will gel together on a plate.Overall, I wouldn't recommend this place purely because of the standard of the beds. I would consider trying them again after the renovations are complete and I am guaranteed a better mattress.

Aqua Aloha Surf and Spa is not the Hilton, but it is comfortable, clean with a very polite staff and the general manger Tim Clark is a gem. The Hotel is also close to the beach, the International Market Place and Kalakaua Avenue i.e. where the action is. We really enjoyed the breakfast. For the above reasons Aqua Aloha Surf and Spa has been our hotel for the past 3 years in a row without any complaints. EN Toronto, Canada

Stay at the hotel back in Nov 2011. It was a bit of a walk to the main beach as it was along the channel. My legs got a little tired walking back and forth but i'm just a little lazy that way. The room was on the smaller side. We requested a room closer to the pool which was on the main floor. Ask and you shall receive! The only downside I had was that we were on the thrid floor and you could hear the noise from the street especially the noisy dump trucks that come everyday at 6am! The room was clean with normal hotel amenities. There was a cockroach in our hotel room and we called down to the front desk and the came and removed it. This is my pet peeve when people right reviews. You are in a tropical place you will get tropical pest!!! They had a nice pool, a bit on the smaller side with free wifi in the rooms and lobby. They had a great hotel reception on the Tuesday with free drinks a magic show, and a massage and free character drawings! That was pretty memorable. Room was cleaned daily and they did a great job.

My husband and I visited this hotel in April of 2012. When booking our flight we checked the reviews on this hotel and loved the fact that the general manager would address the problems that his customers had encountered. Wanting to save money for our excursions we chose this hotel and was pleased. The staff was wonderful changing out our beach towels and super friendly helping us find things. A special thanks to Charles (security) for all his help and friendship. The room was comfortable and clean. The bathroom was clean, however small with only a shower. But the comfortable bed more than made up for it. Great view of the canal with the mountains in the back ground. 3 to 5 min walk to the beach and market. Have been to Oahu 3 times now and would stay again. Aloha, til next time !!

This hotel was a part of a vacation package so we really did not get to review or choose it much before our trip. We stayed there two nights before hopping on our cruise ship. Overall, I would say the hotel was OK and not special in any way. I really did not price out many Waikiki hotels so I hope if you book this hotel, you are getting a very good rate. It's a couple of blocks off of the beach which is not the worse thing if you're getting a break. But overall it is not in the best shape either. If I was rating the hotel, I would give it 2.5 stars. Upon arrival, a large cockroach ran across our feet but I suppose that can be expected in an open air lobby in Hawaii? The desk staff was consistently OK but never overly friendly or helpful but not nasty either. The concierge gal is great! The rooms are on the smallish side and need an uplift. We had a corner room with good views of the canal and mountain and the ocean way to the right. Temp is hard to moderate as it is only on when your key is left in the room. If you don't mind a little walking, location is central to the beach. The continental breakfast is probably not worth the effort. Overall, I guess I'd pay a little more to be in Hawaii and experience the beautiful island feel.

My husband and I stayed for 2 nights and it exceeded my expectations. The rooms are clean and had everything we needed. Rooms a little smaller than most hotels but the quality of the room made up for this. Walked a few blocks and in the heart of Waikiki Beach. Staff were all very nice. The breakfast had a wide selection of hot foods.

We stayed three nights at the Aqua Aloha Surf and were impressed with the friendliness of the staff, the quality of the room and the quiet location near attractions such as Waikiki Beach and one block from The Bus line. It was easy to get around without a car and the hotel was secure and convienent place to return to in the evening. The microwave and refrigerator in the room came in handy. The free breakfast had something for everyone. The one problem was Internet connection. We brought our IPad which would only connect in the lobby and then intermittently. We would definately stay here again.

Was referred to Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki by a friend when I put the call out for recommendations in Waikiki that wouldnt break the bank but still offered the luxuries I look for - comfy bed, not a shoe box a clean bathroom and a central location. Overall very happy with my stay there in November 2012 - 5 minute walk to Waikiki beach or the rear entrance of the internatonal markets. Staff very friendly and housekeeping kept the room spic & span and didnt mind when I asked for additional coffee as opposed to the one satchet (decaf doesnt count) that they left a day.Wifi in the lobby was an epic failure as I could not connect at all, but then again I didn't go to Waikiki to sit on line day and night. Breakfast was included in my stay but it didnt look that appealing - making me glad that I tend to start the day with just coffee. The complimentary beach towels and beach chairs are a nice touch - that way you dont have to weigh your luggage down with extras. Slight hick up when the bathroom door came off the railings but housekeeping responded almost immediately. Plan on staying there next time!

Stayed here for one night. Booked the speedishuttle from the airport, great service.Staff were very friendly and helpful and allowed an earlier check in. Short walk to the beach and local shops etc.Rooms were well furnished and decorated, very clean. Toiletries provided. Small balcony too. Wifi available in lobby and wired internet in bedrooms. Breakfast provided consisted of fruit, boiled eggs, toast and jams etc, wasn't bad but wasn't great - quite cramped and average quality.

We have stayed at this hotel twice now - just a little (very little) off the beaten path this is a nice hotel that is decent priced for those watching their money in Waikiki.5 minute walk to Waikiki beach, and a 3-4 minute walk to the back of the International Marketplace. Waikikis only grocery store just around the corner. We like this because its clean and comfortable, decent location and instead of paying big money to stay at the big name hotels/resorts we can spend our money on seeing things in Hawaii. City bus stop is just around the corner as well.

Start with the good. Staff was super friendly, beds were clean and comfortable. For the price a nice stay. The not so good. Run down, dirty carpets. Breakfast was overcrowded and pretty nasty. The plates seemed dirty. I picked up one with grease and a piece of ham stuck to the bottom. I'd stay again because it is cheap and the beds are comfortable...definitely skip breakfast!

My vacation started off bad in hawilli due to what was supposed to be friendly and inviting but when I ran into a little problem with the Cando being dirty and very unfriendly to me and my spouse due to us being gay and very proud..after that I walked up the block and found the aqua resort in wikii my trip then had an amazing turn around the staff members had excellent customer service team players all the way on Thursdays nite everyone gets together down stairs to meet the employees and have some cocktails my stay was amazing at the aqua resort..anytime I travel and there's an aqua resort that's where me and my family will be staying..I also would like to say thank you very much to an employee there Dougie you where one of the most friendly people with excellent excellent customer service skills. Heads up to your manager
user_location: Staten Island, New York, United States
user_name:
Plis L
Staten Island, New York, United States

review_body: We arrived late and our room was available. The room was kept very clean throughout the whole stay. The water was always hot for showers. Everyone was friendly. The hotel was the perfect location for us. We ran or walked along the channel and was only a few blocks from the beach.It is excellent value for your moneyl Yes it is an older hotel, but that is what we expected.

We heard about this hotel through internet searches. Due to the low cost of the hotel compared to the other hotels located in the area, we didn't have high expectations. We selected it due to its low cost and the fact that we really don't spend much time in the room anyway. Let me just say that we were very pleasantly surprised. The hotel is very nice and the staff are absolutely wonderful. The location is really perfect being centrally located in Waikiki providing a short walk to nearly everything. There are many other little perks that other hotels including the luxury hotels don't provide. We were surprised that the hotel provided complimentary beach chairs where nearly all the other hotels would charge a hefty fee for theirs. This really adds up and is just one of the many nice little details that really adds to the overall experience.I would absolutely stay at this property again without hesitation or question. On a final note, the staff really top off the experience being incredibly accommodating, friendly and making you feel at home.

The hotel room is small, but we did not mind it. If you are in Hawaii, you will spend most of the time outside anyway. Windows of the hotel is small, so do not expect to get a large panoramic view if you are not near the window. The hotel also provides complimentary breakfast. The location is walking distance to the beach and ocean. There are many shops/restaurants around. Parking is available in the garage

My cousin and I stayed here in late Nov./early Dec. for 2 days. We had booked the hotel through an agent as a package with our flight. When we arrived (which was very late for us on eastern standard time) we were told there were no rooms with two beds. When we booked we specifically were told it would be a "two bed" room. They did upgrade us to a balcony room but there was still just one bed. We were then given a roll away bed. The room was very small even before the extra bed was in it. The continental breakfast was better than expected and the staff were helpful so that is why I gave it an average rating.

Stayed here end of December 2012, we arrived to the hotel early morning after a 10 hour flight to be told our room wasn't ready but the hotel staff stored our luggage for us as we walked around and shopped in Waikiki. Returned to the hotel hours later to be told our room was still not ready, so we sat in the hotel lobby for another two hours! after complaining twice we were given a room but it was horrible, small, dark and depressing, certainly not big enough for four adults to stay in for a week. After complaining once more at the front desk we were given a different room which was much better and pleasant to stay in.despite the first day, the hotel is nice and in a good location only a couple of minutes away from Waikiki beach and shops, has a lovely lobby/pool area. There is wi fi but only available in the lobby which was a bit annoying, also the lifts were very slow. The hotel also offers beach towels and chairs which was great. The staff were very friendly! the manager and staff have a cocktail party every tuesday for the guests in the lobby which was really nice, makes guests feel very welcome and the cocktail they serve 'wipeout!' is delicious. we were there for the Christmas Eve cocktail party which was a lot of fun.Overall, we had a pleasant stay at this hotel and it was what we expected.Family of four, young adult children

This hotel has a good location only a couple of blocks from Waikiki beach, which is a plus assuming you enjoy the zoo that is Waikiki. Maid service was good and employees were friendly. The concierge was helpful. Unfortunately, the negatives outweighed the positives. The beds felt like sleeping on marshmallows--no support (we had two rooms and the same problem in both). Rooms are small and plain, bathrooms are miniscule. The free breakfast was unappetizing--to indicate how much so, know that we ate at Denny's (which my 12-year-old grandson likes--but then he's 12) as an alternative. There are only 2 small elevators for 200 rooms, so the wait can be quite long when guests are trying to get to breakfast between 7-9 am. (In my experience, even cheaper motels on the mainland have at least a 3-hour breakfast window.) The lounge furniture in the lobby was cheap and uncomfortable. The Wi-Fi connection was too slow for my grandson to download a movie on his Kindle. The small TV in the lobby hangs above the elevator doors (really). Parking space in the garage is a joke, plus they charge an extra $20 a night for parking. When we first arrived in our room, I stepped out onto the balcony and noticed the air conditioner had large holes in the grill, lots of rust, and what I think were salt deposits clogging much of the vent. I assumed it wouldn't work, although it actually did (and was needed at night even in December, because there is no air flow through the room). There is no restaurant in the hotel (other than the poor breakfast bar) and it was a hassle seeking out places to eat and waiting in line. Overall, I was disappointed with this room, especially as we were paying $200/night for it. Would not return (but in fairness, I would not return to Waikiki either--overhyped, expensive, crowded. Based on my driving around the island, most anyplace else on Oahu would probably be a more enjoyable alternative.)

The hotel is in a good location. It's around a 10 minute walk to Waikiki. It's also located near a kind of boyou with sidewalks where you can go running. I had a single with a queen sized bed. The room size was average. Everything is old but clean. The staff is very nice and very helpful. The breakfast comes free with the room and is adequate. It consisted of pancakes, biscuits, fruit, tea and coffee. Not 5 star dining but hey, it's free. Bottom line, if you are expecting the Hilton or Sheraton, this is not it, but do you go to Hawaii to sit in your hotel room? You can do that for much cheaper at home. It's a clean older hotel and resonably priced. I would definitely stay here again.

The hotel has a good location, the staff is very friendly and the hotel lobby is really cozy. The hotel breakfast is bad, but you get what you pay for. The breakfast is only 5 USD if I remember it correctly. The rooms are quite large, and we got a room with great view. The rooms are clean, but you can see that they are getting quite old and worn down, especially the bathroom. There isn't wifi in the room, but there is a LAN cable so I recommend that you bring a portable router if you have devices that require wifi. There is otherwise free wifi in the lobby. The internet connection went down a couple of times during our stay, but it was usually only gone for 10-15 minutes.I often woke up at night due to sirens from ambulances/police cars.I booked Aqua Waikiki Wave for my second stay (went to Big Island and Maui for a couple of days and then went back to Honolulu). Aqua Waikiki Wave has a better location, larger rooms, looks to be a bit newer and has wifi. The view is however not as good as from Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki.

We stayed in a deluxe room where the 'deluxe' seemed to mean 'on a corner' but looking at the fire escape plan, it seemed our room was actually much smaller than the one beside it so we were left pondering what made our room the deluxe room. It was certainly a functional room with a mini-fridge, microwave and coffee maker, and the bed was comfortable.The shower was not the best shower in the world - a weak stream of water - compared to other hotels, and lacked an exhaust fan so it got quite warm and steamy in the confined space.Wifi was only available in the lobby - something I find a bit frustrating these days. The Waikiki Sand Villa directly across the road has wifi for guests in all rooms (we'd previously stayed there) so it's possible to deliver and this hotel ought to consider it.Self-parking is available for $20 in the small underground carpark but there are < 20 parking spaces for guests, which isn't nearly enough for the hotel. The first night we were able to park underground, but the next night we needed to park in the less-protected parking lot beside the hotel. That only fits another 8-10 cars and the tight maneuvering required meant some people parked across two carparks, further reducing the available parking spots. We got the last park on the second night and I'm not sure what the plan would have been if that had not been available - find your own street park and move the car all day?Overall, the room was functional but the chances of securing a carpark are risky. Given my choice between the deluxe room at this hotel and the deluxe room literally across the street at the Waikiki Sand Villa for the same price (+/- $10), I would choose the latter.

Great location - two blocks to the beach and great shopping. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Free continental breakfast was available but I don't believe the restaurant is managed by the hotel because the service and quality of the food didn't match our hotel experience. When you go to Waikiki, you would expect some fresh fruit and juice but that wasn't offered. Instead we got Tang, jam only every other day and eggs only every other day. I think the hotel is missing a great opportunity to impress with breakfast.

The hotel is in a great location, staff friendly and usually helpful, very basic breakfast provided but cold coffee. The price was okay for a basic boutique hotel in Hawaii. However, the hotel needs to give you the room you pay for not an inferior old room. I booked deluxe room what I initially got was not a deluxe room or if it was as they claimed it was awful. We got the run around to get the room we booked,it wasn't cheap to begin with which made the trip initially quite stressful. Just be careful to not accept less if you paid top dollar. Once this was sorted out we enjoyed the new room and the hotel. The Manager Douglas was fantastic in how he helped us out in the end. After a long flight this is not what we wanted to have to sort out.

We loved the location of the Aqua Aloha Surf, but the rooms are so tiny and shabby. We stayed for a couple of nights in December and the trade winds almost blew out the windows! It was so noisy. We were on the 14th floor and we could hear lots of street noise throughout the night.

You really can't beat the location and the price. Rooms are clean, staff friendly, free breakfast. Also you have a frig, microwave and dishes. If you want to eat in, you can pick up a roasted chicken at the Food Pantry and microwaveable veggies and have dinner. Helps you save on some expenses. Very reasonable cost for Hawaii and especially Waikiki. You're in the heart of Waikiki, a short couple of blocks to the beach, Duke's statue and shopping. There's an Alamo/Enterprise only a block and a half away.
user_name:
Satchie C
Ashton, Maryland, United States

review_body: This is the 4th year in a row I have stayed at this hotel during my winter get away. As usually the staff is what makes this hotel a stand out. I will confess that it is starting to show a little bit of wear a tear; my a/c unit was so loud (grinding noise) when I went to my room that I immediately requested a new room. They took care of it right away and even gave me a free upgrade, (which I do appreciate).The rooms are fine, basic and clean.
