Breakfast was included with my room (a Continental breakfast; pancakes, oatmeal, juice, coffee, fruit, juice and muffins). Considering the cost in Waikiki for food, this really does help keep the cost down.It is located only a couple blocks from Waikiki beach, easy to get to from the airport, via bus or shuttle. Free wifi (only in the lobby) and of course their superstar front desk people.

Great place as far as location and price. Rooms are decent size and very clean upon arrival. Maids also were very kind and accommodating. On my day off, when i wanted to sleep in they came back several hours later to clean the room. My only complaint being that i recieved a phone call from the lobby that they had recieved several complaints of smoking in my room. I don't smoke, however i did throw a coworkers empty cigarette box in my trash so it wouldn't be left in our rental car. The hotel staff was apologetic and said he must have the wrong room, but it just rubbed me the wrong way.

The service is average at best. I called to ask for a certain type of room, and they said they cannot guarantee anything - which is kind of funny if you can't even tell what room is available one day in advance. Sometimes no one answer the phone for service but when they do staffs are mostly friendly.The room is rather tiny and expensive. The hotel is old and not very well maintained. The air conditioner sucks and cannot keep the room cool in November, which make sleep terrible. It has wired internet but no WIFI, which seems to be backward in the age of smartphone and tablet.It is in a good location, 5 minute walk to the strip.

We stayed 4 nights at this hotel and found the staff welcoming, the hotel rooms are comfortable and clean. The front desk was helpful time after time answering dunb questions from two aussie tourists. We appreciated all that they have done for us and would recommend them to anybody looking for reasonable accommodation in waikiki.

Second trip to Honolulu. Arrived a day early from Fiji and were accomodated no problem. 15th floor, junior suite. Queen + double hideabed both good. Furnishings definitely look tired and should be replaced. Patio furniture minimalistic. Bathroom average. Everything working fine. A/C good altho' the unit was pretty rusty on exterior. Service good. Front desk helpful, tour staff on site. Free WiFi in lobby and wired in suite. Continental breakfast next to front desk in a very tired establishment. Not sure what the relationship is between hotel and restaurant, whatever, they need to spruce this place up to 2012 standards. We tried the dinner buffet in same place and it was poor. Thirty mins after opening, the food was tepid at best. I told the server who shrugged it off. I understand the hotel is actually a mixture of time share and units with out of town owners whose units are rented out in their absence. In practical terms it made no difference. Lots of Canadian guests and owners. Price was the main attraction. ABC store 50 yards. Bus to Pearl Harbor, Ala Moana shopping, Diamond Head 100 yards. Definitely convenient. Car rental not required here.

This is our 3rd stay (3 years in a row) at the Aqua Aloha Surf, Waikiki and we cannot fault this accommodation. We usually stay between 10 to 12 days but this year we extended our stay to 16 days!! The staff are always very pleasant and helpful. The rooms are very clean and tidy, room service is excellent. The location is great, just a short walk to the beach, shops, restaurants, bars etc. We always upgrade to a larger room (a little extra cost) for a bit more space. There is a good sized balcony with this room. It does get noisy but that is Waikiki! We enjoy the breakfast as we are not big breakfast eaters. The Aloha Tours & Activities which is located in the restaurant is excellent. Joyce who organises our trips does a fantastic job. Nothing is any trouble for her and her advice on what trips to do is fantastic. Many thanks again to all the staff at the hotel and Joyce for everything. See you next November.Regards Bronwen & David. Sydney, Australia

We spent a few nights here on our trip to Oahu. The hotel is well located. Come out the front door and walk 2 blocks (big blocks) to the Waikiki beach. 1 block and your on Kuhio which is a great street to find food a bit less expensive than the beach restaurants. The rooms are a bit small but they are pretty typical of Oahu hotels. There was a nice mini refrigerator in the room and a micro wave. The balcony is good size and you share it with the rooms air conditioner. We wanted to sleep with the slider and windows open but the noise on the street makes that impossible. I have stayed at several hotels along Kuhio and the noise just echoes. It's like a big canyon. The way to get a good night sleep is to turn on the air conditioner and close the windows. It's nothing the hotels are doing its just the way Waikiki is. We found the breakfast not so great. If your picking this room because of the free breakfast don't. Pancakes and mini muffins. No fruit and no meat. I would stay here again as it was clean, very well located, and enjoyable. The staff was very nice and helpful. I have read reviews discussing the hookers around the hotel and think that people are mistaking today's girls dress for hookers. Girls today particularly in beach destinations dress with short shorts and high heels. I have been up and down Waikiki and Kuhio and those girls aren't working girls. Those are your 20 something's.

First, I have read reviews from other bloggers and want to mention the fact that although we all have different lifestyles and opinions I diagree with how this Hotel has been rated. I am an International traveler who flies 100,000 miles every year and stay in Hotels all over the World. I prefer and choose smaller boutique style Hotels because they are less crowded and offer better quality of servie. This Hotel is not the Taj Mahal but the staff is over the top accomodating, the rooms are clean, and the extra amenities they provide with your rate is acceptable. If you have ever stayed in Manhattan (New York) than you "should" be use to the fact that the Hotel is sandwiched between two narrow streets. If your facing the back side your view is of local residences, and the front, another proerty. So no matter which side your on you hear traffic...day...and night. Let's not forget this is Honolulu! Anyway, this is my new home in Oahu and I have been there at least a dozen times. If you want to live the fabulous life than pay for it and stay at the Resorts.

This was your first visit to Hawaii. The person that check in and out was nice. We had great time at hotel. The breakfast and room service was great. We stay in Nov. 2012. Everything was great. We would love to come back and stay there again.

It was november but the air conditioning wasn't strong enough to put the temperature down, maybe because it's located under a corner table. The room I got was just above the small swimming pool so I could hear all the noise. The worst thing about it though were the giant windows that couldn't be covered by the curtains even when I tied some of them. So, there wasn't complete privacy (my room was facing other buildings and a parking lot) and there were a lot of clarity all the time. No wi-fii in the room also and the gym and the breakfast are usuless. I can't say there is a gym. On the brigh side, the room was clean and the people who work there are nice, but try to get a better room than the one on the back at the second floor.

First night we arrived at 9pm (had contacted the hotel prior to let them know of our late arrival) and was put in a tiny, cramped room with 2 twin sized beds (imagine a dorm room from college). We'd reserved a higher rate room with a queen sized bed, but this was all that was left. The room felt dirty and our view was into someone's apartment. The next day we were moved to a larger queen room which seemed to have newer furnishings and felt cleaner, and the view was better (tops of buildings rather than straight into someone's apartment). The breakfast food is disgusting -- gross looking oatmeal, hard boiled egg, and cereal. The pool is tiny and we didn't use it. The location is ok -- about a 3 block walk to Waikiki beach and shops. But next time we'll spend another $20/night to get a nicer hotel.

This hotel treated us so well that I asked on checkout what the best way was to help them out. They recommended writing this review on Trip Advisor. The service was excellent and they were all too willing to cater to your every need. House keeping is particularly alert to your needs and noticed that we were travelling with a 3 month old so on the second day gave us an extra set of towels and a bed sheet for his portable cot (without us mentioning anything about it). All of the staff were very friendly and helpful on any matter you wished to bring up, from locations of places to getting the Internet to work in your room. All around, an amazingly pleasant experience and the hotel of my choice on any future visits!I can see others have mentioned the continental breakfast - it was average but it was included with my room so I didn't feel like I got less than I paid for. I'm happy with some toast, cereal, juice, oatmeal, muffins, donuts and fresh pancakes in the morning - if I expected more than this for a continental breakfast, I would have planned to go down the street as this isn't what the hotel needs to supply when located so close to other restaurants!
user_name:
Seth384
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Room with a lanai and partial city view -modern decor, clean and equipped with a mini frig, sink, microwave coffee maker, free internet connection and nice lanai but facing other large buildings no view . Bed had a saggy mattress. Located near Ali Wai Canal, central to Waikiki. Helpful staff. Free drinks on Tuesday night in the lobby.

We stayed there from October 23-30, 2012 and had a wonderful experience. The staff were excellent - always friendly and helpful, especially JT and Douglas as they were always friendly and willing to suggest new adventures for us. The rooms were clean, quaint and provided with internet connections and free wifi (in the lobby). The rooms also had a microwave, coffee maker, fridge and dishes. They also provide fresh beach towels (as often as you needed) and beach chairs. The cleaning staff were wonderful, always making sure everything was clean (including our dishes -- which was not expected but a nice treat.) We were close to all amenities and within walking distance to the beach, car rentals, stores, restaurants and bars. Great value for the money. If you book directly with the hotel you would also receive free breakfast, as we had booked with Expedia - we didn't receive this deal. The balconies do face other high rises but we knew that although we may be in paradise, we are still a large city!! There is going to be noise from traffic and such, but we didn't find it to be to excessive.(If you want quietness --- don't go to a city!!)We truly would stay there again in a heart beat. Thanks Aqua Aloha for a great Hawaiian experience.

If you stay at this hotel don't bother paying for the continental breakfast. It is the worst, I couldn't believe what they were serving and the coffee looks and tastes like dish water. Plenty of other places close by offering breakfasts at a reasonable cost.

aloha surf is a clean neat , tidy & reasonably priced hotel to stay in Honolulu, with all conveniences close by, ie transport, grocery shops & Luxury row. Rooms are good & clean. there is wifi in the lobby, drinks with the manager & staff onTuesdays & the new management of the evening restaurant proved good chinese.

I am very happy my condo. It look tiny ,but the price we can afford .We have a nice view , near by the beach we can walk to the beach, the transportation is convenience,near by all kind restaurants & the shopping& we can go to China Town eat Chinese & Vietnamese food& all kind tropical fruits .We like the weather all way hot& warm beach.I am appreciated what we have & all the people work at Hotel . They are very kind& polite & friendly with every body& we feel safe to leave there.

The big seller about this hotel is the reasonably priced rooms that are within easy walking distance to Waikiki Beach and all the shopping and restaurants in the area. Our room was tiny, not even room for a regular bathroom door, but a pocket door instead. The bed was very comfortable and we appreciated the in-room safe and the dorm-size refrigerator. The room did have a/c, but with windows that don't fully close, the room never seemed to get to a completely comfortable temperature for me. And with windows that don't fully close, that makes for waking to all the morning noises that you find in a city, too. The free breakfast was ok. We were disappointed that the pool was closed for maintenance the 3 days we were there, but when we saw the pool, it wouldn't have mattered anyway - it was about the size of a large hot tub. (When you can walk 2 blocks and be at the ocean, why would you need a pool? It would have been nice to take a dip the evening we got there because it was dark and too late to head for the ocean, but a refreshing swim would have been great.) The staff were nice, the room was clean. My only major complaint is parking. In a 16 story building (I think) there were 24 ... yes, that is right, 24 parking spots in the garage. We got the last spot and didn't go anywhere that we had to drive until we checked out, fearing we wouldn't get another spot. The desk staff told us there was parking lot parking available at the end of the building if it was needed, but the neighborhood isn't great-I'm pretty sure we saw people 'casing' cars there, and I'm glad we were able to park in at least somewhat protected area. (Even that 'parking lot' appeared to hold no more that a few cars.) I guess most people take taxis there or something?? Back to the neighborhood ... always felt safe in the day time. Wouldn't have felt safe walking alone at night up to the hotel from the beach and shopping area, but I wasn't alone and felt fine. Overall, if we were staying in the area for a night or two, we'd go back to this property - inexpensive, clean, friendly staff, and close to Waikiki without the enormous pricetag of other "name-brand" hotels in the area. However, if we were staying longer than a couple nights, I think we'd find something else ... ok for short stays, but too small and too confining (rooms and parking) for an extended stay for us.

I'm very conflicted about this hotel. If I had to rate it for the service of the hotel employees, I would have given it 5 stars, A+, no reservations. The man at the concierge desk always greeted me by name whenever I came down the elevator, the staff was extremely helpful and very friendly, and any questions I had were immediately addressed. The service was absolutely stellar. The hotel is located almost on Ala Wai, although it is still within easy walking distance to the beach.But the room itself? I'm not sure how old the Aqua Aloha is, but my friend and I requested a double room for our stay, and I couldn't believe how tiny it was. And it had two TWIN beds. I didn't think hotels even came with twin beds anymore. The shower was kind of on the scary side and I didn't want to go in without slippers; it wasn't dirty per se, it just looked very very old. Also, nothing annoys me more than bathrooms with standalone sinks and no countertops. Ladies, I think you know what I mean. The lights wouldn't come on at least once while we stayed there, but as soon as we called the front desk someone came up immediately to fix the problem. We drove to Waikiki, so we needed parking at the hotel and I have to say, RENT A SMALL CAR. The parking lot is extremely tiny and cramped, and if they had a valet service I didn't see it. We also had a lower-level room, with a view of nothing except the roof of the next building. There was also some sort of construction going on in the street out front while we were staying there, although I can't blame the hotel for that.So in the end it was very hard for me to rate this hotel, perhaps it was just the choice of room, if we had splurged it might have been much nicer. In the end I would probably not stay here again, I would go for a more updated hotel closer to the beachfront.

Had two stays prior and after cruise around islands. First stay we were upgraded to a room with a sofa and small kitchenette. Small but comfortable for our needs. On our return our accommodation was smaller and quite dilapidated. Our travel agent had told us it had been renovated but the bathroom needed a lot of attention - nowhere to store toiletries (had to put towel on floor to do so), many cracks in the basin (not overly hygienic); noisy airconditioner.... But with our late transfer to airport the staff were very accommodating in that after a late check out we stored our luggage for the day and were able to "freshen up" before our departure. The photos on the web site do not do accurately show the standard of rooms, if so I would liked to have seen one!

I just returned from the hotel a few days ago. For the money, it is a great little hotel. The room was actually better than I expeted. And it's obvious that the hotel still needs some work since the bathroom obviously needs renovation, but was clean. The location is fantastic being two blocks from the beach and a grocery store right around the corner. Also close to restaurants and shopping if you want to do that as well. I loved that the hotel provided beach chairs and towels for use for free since their pool was under renovation. The only thing that bugged me was that I was ignored several times when I approached the front desk by the attending staff. Then I received a surprised look by them when they realized that I was standing right in front of them. Also, I only had the breakfast only once. I would suggest the hotel keep it simple. Just coffee, real orange juice (not Tang), and pastries. Their current breakfast combination with Tang, boiled eggs, old sliced apples, cereal, pastries and pancakes just wasn't very appetizing.
user_name:
Ela F
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: It's not a five star hotel, but for a safe, cheap option this place is outstanding. I arrived in Honolulu horribly ill and the staff were most helpful and did what they could. As I was forced to spend three days in the hotel in bed, I can attest to the bed being most comfortable. The cleaning staff were helpful and got the job done, the room was clean and of a comfortable size. We were a short walk from all the action of Waikiki. I would stay there again.

We have just returned from 4 days at this hotel. We checked the reviews on Trip Advisor before leaving and decided it sounded like a perfect spot for us. We had stayed in Honolulu 30 years ago in a hotel on the Ala Wai Canal, and mentioned this to Douglas at check in. We were upgraded to a Superior corner room on the 9th floor with views of the Canal, the mountains and the city. Great location. We are budget travelers and found everything very satisfactory. The breakfast was filling, the staff was very helpful, and the open air lobby really gave us the Hawaiian feeling we will remember for a long time.

The location of the hotel is absolutely perfect, 2 blocks back from the beach, very easy walking distance to everything. ABC stores on the corner with a really decent supermarket on the other corner. This hotel had everything, beach towel to borrow, free luggage storage, Wifi.., friendly staff who were very welcoming! The maid left us a note once which was nice!What I couldn't cope with was the traffic noise. The hotel is quite close to the canal and that road sure take traffic! OMG! Fire sirens blaring, you name it! We were 5 stories up and boy! We heard everything! The other thing is their breakfasts. Seriously poor effort team! However, what I will say is that the lady who makes the little pancakes fresh should be paid more! Lovely pancakes!!! But we only did it once as the selection of other things was too basic.

Summary: All in all, if you expect a decent budget hotel, you will be pleasantly surprised. Just don't expect it to be a Westin or a W!Strengths: There are lots of things to recommend this hotel. 1. The room was nice. The room we got was well equipped - there was a sofa, a center coffee table, and kitchen amenities such as a microwave and a fridge.2. The hotel is quite centrally located. It is <5 minutes from the Waikiki Beach. Tour buses also stop at this location.3. Free beach towels and free beach chairs are a very nice perk. I have stayed at other beach hotels too in Hawaii and elsewhere but I have not found any hotel to offer free beach chairs. But given that those folks did offer free beach chairs, we could take those with us to the beach and use them.4. A filling continental breakfast was offered with our reservations and that was nice and filling. The person making pancakes was really fast and the pancakes were simple but very good!5. There was a person from Expedia (Bianca) right next to the front desk who really helped us get reservations for a Circle Island Tour and a Snorkeling Trip the next day at very short notice. If she is available, you could certainly speak with her and have her help you in your trip planning.6. The check-out process was also smooth.Room for improvement: Not much for the price that they offer. But since I am a nitpicker, I will point something out: While they are located close to the Waikiki Beach, the particular street on which they are located is dark and a little shady. The hotels/ hostels right next to it also look a little shady. I asked my wife about it as we were headed back to our hotel one night about whether she would have been comfortable walking by herself and she said that she wouldn't. But then again, it is nothing to be seriously concerned about.

Accommodation cheap and located close to beach, restaurants and shops. My only complaint was the noisy air conditioner and street noise. I would also suggest perhaps wifi in rooms, as there is not much privacy when Skype or vibe, and it is more comfy in your room. So if this does not bother you a good choice. Breakfast included made it easier, it was basic but good. The staff were friendly and prompt to answer any questions or attend to anything needed.

Notwithstanding the physical challenges of this property, including a much needed upgrade of the rooms and common areas, the entire staff should be commended on their fantastic attitudes and desire to be helpful and pleasant. At every turn, the staff was actually excited about helping the guests and making up for all of the property's shortfalls by their genuine professionalism.

Very nice location, just 5-7 walk from Waikiki beach, close to shopping, restaurants and bus stop. Clean rooms with all necessary conveniences and accessories. Staff is friendly and helpful. There's free wired interned access in the room and wi-fi in the lobby; the luggage storage room; beach towels on request. Pictures on the hotel web-site correspond to the facts; our expectations were more than justified. The only minus was breakfast - rather poor. But in general, we liked staying here and could recommend this hotel to our friends)

For the price, we weren't expecting luxury accommodations. This hotel is clean, well kept but dated commensurate with the other buildings in the area. It is convenient - easy walking to shopping and dining. The front desk and other staff were friendly, courteous and over the top helpful. We spent three nights there and other guests were there with families and all seem to be very content will the facilities.

•Room - just good enough if you just want to stay in the Cbd without expecting too much. •Toilet - got clogged x2 and is small so be warned•Bed - comfortable • Location - very good because it's very close to shops and is not too noisy •Pool - small•Internet - just Down to lobby so I suggest buying a portable wi-fiOverall - good enough stay but would not come back

We have stayed here more than once because the hotel, while not fancy, is convenient to restaurants, shopping (including International Market Place), TheBus, and Waikiki Beach. The refrigerator, microwave, and safe are a plus. The staff was helpful. I did have problems with the wi-fi. It is NOT wireless which I wasn't aware of til the last day. The only negative is street noise.

We stayed here for 6 nights for our 20th anniversary, and were very pleased. The rooms are nice (with fridge and microwave), quiet (which was unexpected in Waikiki), nicely decorated, and clean. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel is close to Waikiki beach, shops, and restaurants. The hotel staff ensured we had a lovely stay. We enjoyed the manager's reception with free drinks, music and magic. The room was somewhat small, as was the pool, but the price more than made up for it. The internet cafe in the lobby was always closed, but the room had free wired internet, and wifi in the lobby.

This place is great! Stayed here for 4 nights to visit my boyfriend and his family. We upgraded to a king bed/balcony room. Although, we rarely used the balcony, it was nice to have although ours was in the back of the hotel which faced apartments on the other street and you could see through the windows of the apts. Tons of great lighting and enough space. The a/c is on the lower part of the wall below a window and is near the loveseat, so it was hard to get the room cool. Bathrooms were clean, no mold on tile! Got this room for a steal for $114/night at my AAA discount. Hotel is closer to Ala Wai than Kuhio but it was quiet and closer to apt buildings which we liked. Everything is within great walking distance, we walked often to Queens Beach and "Walls" (near the zoo) with ease (10-15 min) Saturday night on the strip is jumping with live FREE entertainment as there are many street performers out. Bus stop is around the corner on Kuhio so purchase a visitor pass if you plan on site seeing normally $2.50 per ride/1 free transfer (4 days unlimited use visitor pass for $25) and make sure to hit up Magic Island (across the street from Ala Moana Center) around 7pm for the fireworks display. And HNL has the best bus transit system! Download (iPhone users) DaBus app for searching routes/bus arrival times. And hit up thebus.org for real time GPS for arrivals, bus stop locations and routes. Safe travels! -Hillary

Great location! It is located on a quiet side street, but only a small block from shopping and eating places. My wife and I have no complaints. Everything in our room was in working order. Wifi on lobby floor and cable internet in our room. Room was not large, thus not much room for a sofa or desk, but since we were there just for leisure, we found it sufficient. The free breakfast choices were satisfactory enough. We have stayed in more luxurious and expensive hotels, but the friendly, attentive, and accommodating staff (front desk) at Aloha Surf makes up for the minor short-comings.

very friendly staff at the aqua. they made my 2 week holiday very special. loved the hotel and the staff. its a short wal from waikiki beach, and shops. very well located. will be back. Sergio and Cecilia. from JERSEY, UK.

We had a family of three in our group. We stayed in two rooms, since the first room was not satisfactory. The first room had the following problems: non-functioning air conditioner, dirty conditions. The hotel staff was accommodating in helping us move to another room, which was cleaner and had a good a/c. Overall, we were surprised by the smallness of the rooms, considering what we had seen in pictures posted on the Internet. We were also surprised by the hotel's request that we turn the a/c off if we would be out of the room for the day. We would not recommend this hotel for those considering lodging in Waikiki.

This hotel is small but clean. It has very friendly and helpful staff and is in a fantastic location. It is only a 5-10min walk from the beach and near plenty of shopping and restaurants. Despite the fact the room is small it has everything you need with a mini bar fridge and a microwave. The main thing I look for in a hotel room is cleanliness and comfortable in which this hotel ticks both of those boxes. If you are looking for a luxury hotel with good ocean views and a penthouse suit then this hotel isn't for you but if you are just looking for a family safe hotel just to sleep in and leave your bags while you explore then it is certainly worth a look.

I live on and outer island and always stay at one of the Aqua Hotels....they cater to locals with Kamaaina rates and great service....the Aloha Surf is my favorite on account of its close proximity to UH Manoa and everyone is always sooo kind....on my most recent stay the manager Timothy Clark was extremely accomodating...coming from Kauai'i and trying to get my daughter all set at UH Manoa is always a financial challange.....Tim helped get me a Kamaaina rate...and was really gracious about my last minute accomodations...he treated me as a real person with a request instead of just another visitor.....the rooms are always clean, cute and all who work there are competent and friendly.....for all you locals I highly recommend Aloha Surf or any of the Aqua hotels.....Kamaainas matter to them....mahalo Tim Clark.....you da bes!..D WoodsWilson

This hotel is first, in a okay location. It is walking distance from the main stretch of Waikiki BUT beware; when the sun goes down it gets scary. Not the type of location I would want to bring children to after dark. The lobby is nice (the only place where there is Wifi) and the front desk workers are very nice and helpful. The hotel's polices are a little stingy and stingy extends to the hotel room. We stayed in a double deluxe room. It had a pull out couch, a twin bed, and a full bed (a little odd). Im not going to complain about the beds being uncomfortable or small but I have to say the room was small and dirty. The bathroom was extremely small and an adult man could not fit in the shower (which did not work properly). The toilet did not flush right, I didn't want to touch anything in the bathroom, and the weirdest thing was the card key- electricity. To get the power to work in the room you had to leave your card key in the door (get an extra key). I understand they are trying to conserve energy but give an extra key... The hotel may be okay for one person, a couple, or maybe 2-3 close friends, but not a family of four. Bottom line, don't book if you have 3 or more people (and you better be close buddies)The only reason I gave it poor is because the front desk staff was nice and helpful

In a great location, 5 min walk to beach; close to shops, cafes, restaurants. The staff were friendly & helpful. Started off our 2 week stay in a budget room which, although clean, was a bit tired. Paid for an upgrade & had a lovely room.My only complaint would be the very noisy air conditioning - told the management who advise these are being upgraded.

For the first time I with my friend traveled to Howaii and we stayed here six night. We made grilled beef and enjoyed in swimming pool, dishes in the restaurant was wery tasty and fresh.Staff are helpful and friendly. Clean lobby and rooms, w/free wi-fi in the lobby.Hotel was in really great location near to the Waikiki beach and also to the shopping ,entertainment and town centres.We will never forget ours holiday journey and definitely would return thereand stay again !

Living on the other side of the island I decide to find a hotel that fits my budget and near all the shopping and dining... Good hotel friendly staff.. Breakfast was okay. Loved my stay met a nice lady who actually lives in the hotel... I would love to come back next get away from home..!

My husband and I celebrated our 2nd-year anniversary in Hawaii this past May (I completely forgot to write a review on our return!) and stayed at the Aqua Aloha for 4 nights. We were deciding between paying much more for a fancier hotel or going the budget route - because we wanted to explore the Island and not stay indoors, we chose the latter and are very glad we did. Upon booking, and based on previous reviews to book on a higher level, I requested that we be placed in a room on levels 4 and above - on check-in, lovely Helene who also speaks French gave us a room on the 15th floor with unbeatable views of the coast, the city and the mountains. Our room was quite small but I think that was mainly because they stuffed a king bed in there - not that it mattered since we weren't inside much except to sleep! The bed was slightly soft for my liking but after a day of snorkelling, surfing and driving around, I can fall asleep on anything! The room was clean, air con not even necessary since the nights were so cool. My only qualm is that our toilet sink would spray every which way if you cranked it on - not too fussed though, we just had to let it trickle. The location is also great because you're close to all the action but far away enough for it not to be too busy.All in all, it was a great stay despite the fact that we didn't really spend much time in our room - I suppose that is the way you want it to be when in Hawaii. When on a budget, I would definitely recommend this place.

We stay here whenever we are on O'ahu. Very affordable hotel. Staff are friendly and helpful. Comfortable, clean rooms w/free wi-fi .Great location - easily walk to shopping, entertainment and Waikiki beach. If you don't want to drive, the bus is right around the corner. We enjoyed the Thursday afternoon management's client appreciation event - live entertainment and free drinks!

We stayed here on our trip around America. Hawaii was the highlight. The room was great, nice friendly staff, always ready to help you. We liked the breakfast, pancakes and coffee. It was in such a great location, so close to town and also the beach, we rented mopeds, will never forget it, and definitely would stay again.

Great hotel, stayed here for 16 nights. They were doing a few renovations in the lobby and repairs on the lift when we were there but everyone was notified and the staff made sure things ran as smoothly as possible. Delightful pancakes and the travel agent located in the lobby was extremely helpful and knowledgable. Got a great massage too. Close to everything without being on the main strip and having to deal with the noise. House keeping was exceptional. Very friendly hotel with a great atmosphere, would certainly stay here again!

We had the opportunity to fly for free to Hawaii so we took it. No reservations no idea where to go or what to do. Made arrangements from the airport baggage claim area. What a great affordable hotel with great service. The only thing I’d like to have them update is the breakfast service. It’s complimentary but not very appetizing. We will go back to this hotel and refer to any of our friends that are thinking of going.
user_location: Beale Air Force Base, California, United States
user_name:
Gustavo M
Beale Air Force Base, California, United States

review_body: This was a wonderful experience from check-in to check-out. We had a group of 10 adults and 2 children, 1 and 3 yrs. old. All our rooms were close to each other for our convenience. Hotel Staff were all completely helpful and courteous, and went out of their way to be of assistance on several ocassions. Any problems in the rooms were attended to and corrected immediately. They were all very knowledgeable about nearby attractions, transportation, restaurants, etc.Housekeeping was quite adequate, but not exceptional.The Hotel was very clean and pest free throughout.Free Continental Breakfast is offered, but did not serve protien foods except boiled eggs. The kids loved it, and we all found it adequate on our schedule. I was surprised that Hot Tea was available without being requested, and it was very good.Hotel is located within walking distance to many attractions, e.i. Waikiki Beach, Honolulu Zoo, shopping and public transportation.I will absolutely refer others to this HotelThanks for the great stay at the Aqua Aloha Surf Hotel..This is where I will stay when I go to Honolulu again.Rita A. Hurst
user_name:
Rita H
Magnolia, Texas, United States

review_body: Nice hotel which is close to Waikiki Beach. The room is clean and big enough for two people. On walking distance you can find everything. The lady who sells trips knows her stuff! We made a daytrip with a minivan and saw lots of beautifull places of Oahu.

I made my reservation at the last minute and was very pleased with the result! Room was a great size - large enough for a couch and two beds - one a semi-double and the other a twin! Staff was VERY helpful and friendly. Was a great location - close enough to the beach to easily walk, yet just far enough away to avoid the noise which continues on the main streets late into the night. I lucked out by arriving during the weekly manager's reception - free drinks!

We liked our experience overall. The staff is terrific, the rooms are clean and the bed was very comfortable. We upgraded to a balcony and were glad we did as our room was pretty small. The beach was close but far enough away to avoid a lot of noise. Included breakfast was okay but not a lot of choices. However as it is included, you can't beat the price!

I was pleasantly surprised. Hotel had helpful concierge, decent continental breakfast, some work out equipment, pool was too small to be bothered with, it's a five minute walk to the beach. You are near everything in Waikiki. http://foralltravelssake.blogspot.com/

Slightly outdated with small beds. Small bathroom. The room was clean & always maintained. Pool was on the small side, but when you are that close to the beach why do you need a large pool. We had free continental breakfast which was nice. Very friendly & helpful staff. walking distance to the zoo & aquarium (With room key kids are free at aquarium). I would definately go back again.

Very convenient to shopping, restaurants and Waikiki Beach! They serve a nice breakfast of pancakes, egg bread, fresh fruit, hard boiled eggs and different pastries every day. The lobby is a beautiful open air space with a big TV. The guest rooms are clean and ample with great views of the city and the ocean. You have to keep an eye on your breakfast or the birds will help themselves! The staff was friendly and very helpful, making this a great place to stay!

Do you want a clean, comfortable,reasonable cost, safe and friendly place to stay - this is the hotel. This is the 4th time we have stayed at Aqua Aloha Surf and we have always been very satisfied with our home away from home. Perfect location to beach, restaurants (Cheesecake Factory especially:) ) and shopping. All the staff are very friendly - thanks again!!!! Tuesday cocktails are excellent not to mention the entertainment - especially the magician with those amazing tricks. We enjoyed the upgraded pool chairs, beach chairs and beach towels. Thanks Tim and Julian - see you next year!!!

This is a smaller hotel in Waikiki that ticks all the important boxes and misses out on some of the minor ones. Important ones are its great location, a quick walk to the main strip and beach, but close by to some additional food outlets and a supermarket. Also it's a little out of the way, so it is in a quieter area than other hotels.The rooms are clean and well maintained by the staff, and importantly the beds are excellent. We stayed in the hotel with 4 other families who all said that the main beds were probably the best they have slept in. The pool is a bit small, but well looked after and the pool area is very nice. Breakfast is a bit ordinary, but is free so i really can't complain. In any case, there are plenty of alternatives close by. The staff were really friendly and helpful and Tim and his offsider did a great job bartending with the free "Wipeouts" on Tuesday! We had an issue with an air conditioner and a sofa bed, and these were fixed promptly. Some things that could be improved upon are that the hotel rooms and corridors are a bit tired and need some minor cosmetic TLC. Unlike the excellent king sized beds, the sofa beds and mattresses are fairly poor and should be renewed, as the kids who slept on them said they were uncomfortable and had even collapsed. Nevertheless the hotel offers extremely good value with its reasonable tariiff and we had a great time staying there. We'll be back.

Small, clean, comfortable hotel close to Canal, shopping and close enough to Beach; thoroughly enjoyed the stay. Can be noisy if teens/families are booked adjacent, pleasantly quiet if not. Clean but definitely small, be sure to get room with balcony. Some staff a little stiff, others warmer and helpful. Tiny pool, sun hits for a couple of hours a day; not many other facilities, restaurant is poor. But great value for location, $108/nt, and who wants to eat here anyway. Overall nice feeling, recently upgraded entrance and elevators, and Tuesdays Manager's reception in lobby an added bonus. I'd stay here again, for sure.

General Manager Tim Clark and the crew here at the Aloha Surf are amazing !!! Great service and tips about where to go/eat/do in the Waikiki area ... very knowledgeable! Centrally located, great people, very good accommodations! Definitely staying again!!! Thanks for the "wipe outs" at the manager's reception ... complimentary cocktails every tuesday afternoon !!

Alittle dissapointed. Hotel did not make a good 1st impression. When you 1st walk in the oval carpet where the reception area is was dirty. Don't know when it was last cleaned. The elevators smell so bad and never get vacuummed or cleaned. The free breakfast is the same everyday. Pancakes,oatmeal, toast, muffins,koolaid for drinking it down. Every other day you get hard boiled eggs and fruit thats not that apeitinzing to look at. The ladies who serve breakfast can be rude. Maybe if they spent less money on toiletries(they had both bars of soap and bottled toiletries they could spend more on their free breakfast. Maybe change it up a bit. The shower was never cleaned while we were there. A piece of soap broke. and I left it there to see if they picked it up. They never did. It stayed in the same place until I bought some cleanser and a sponge to clean the shower. But you get what you pay for I guess. Although we've stayed in other hotels for the same price and they were great!

My family arrived in the airy and spacious lobby, for a quick check-in. Our rooms were big enough and had 2 beds and a couch. The flat screen TV could have been larger, but who wastes time watching TV, while in Honolulu!. The desk clerk gave my grand-daughter the cables for her computer. She was so happy to have wi-fi in the room.The free breakfast is better than nothing. The pancakes are good, however there is no variety to breakfast. We never had trouble finding a table & seats.Getting the towels and returning them were quick and easy. It is a long walk to the beach.Parking spaces are limited and one night, we got the last parking space.The employees and security staff are very helpful. My daughter misplaced her wrist watch and security took it very seriously. They searched the room immediately. The next morning, my daughter found the watch, which had fallen into a crevice. The bathroom is old and the hotel is in the process of renovating the building. It is very clean and well kept.The hotel is around the corner from a large super market and close to everything. Very short walk to the main strip.The pool was small but we never even used it. We had a good sized balcony, which we never used.The price of this hotel is perfect. You don't really need a high priced hotel for a fun and memorable vacation. This hotel is friendly, clean and perfect.
user_name:
brudda
New York City, New York

review_body: If you are one of those 5-Star hotel type of guest who likes their pillows fluffed and their bathroom floors as clean as their sheets, you should probably check in at the Hilton and stay in your hotel room the whole entire trip.I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights and it is good for what it is. A place to sleep, hold our belongings and rest. It has a comfortable bed, cable and tv, toilet, sink and a shower. Clean towels daily, your bed is made every day. There's a pool which can fit about 6 people comfortably. A nice airy lobby with wi-fi. Has a patio, a buffet, a travel agency and a massage place-- which I recommend. Free ice cold drinking water in the lobby. You can even fill up your own water bottle from the water dispenser. Some rooms has a balcony, ours didn't. The manager even has an open bar every Tuesdays from 6 to 7pm. Good staff and the housekeeping staff are friendly and trustworthy. They might knock on your door a couple of times but only to provide service. If you're looking to enjoy the island, this would be a reasonable place to stay, since you'll be spending time in it only to sleep and rest.CONS ARE WINDOWS & PARKING:If you're a light sleeper, you would probably hate sleeping here. The windows are old glass shutters so it doesn't keep the noise out at night if you're trying to get some peace and quiet. You can definitely hear everything outside. Also, their parking lot is limited and very small. You might want to park elsewhere or rent scooters as an alternative. Parking fee is $20/Night.

My wife and I just completed the most wonderful Hawaiian holiday including a 7 night cruise on the Pride of America. The only downer of the whole trip was the very poor standard of accommodation at the Aqua Aloha Surf hotel in Honolulu. Although reasonably central, the property is old, noisy and in urgent need of a makeover. Our room faced the main drag and because the windows were some sort of old style glass "hoppers" it was impossible to shut out the considerable traffic noise as well as the goings on of party revellers into the wee small hours. The plumbing in our room failed twice causing distressing rumbling and bubbling noises from the toilet and a discharge of dirty water and sludge into the shower recess. We were moved to the rear of the hotel for the third night which was better until the garbage trucks began their cacophony next door banging and crashing at 5am!  Ok, it wasn't the most expensive property in town but even for $130/night it was way over priced! Breakfast was ok if you're partial to a high cholesterol diet, orange cordial and the wave of a single teabag over a litre of water. Not good.

I can not say enough about the Hotel and their staff, Check in was quick and easy, location is perfect and you cannot beat free breakfast. Rooms were quiet and having a safe and fridge are great extras that are included and not an extra charge. Three blocks to Waikiki beach and walking distance to everything, but far enough away that it is pretty quiet. For the money this Hotel cannot be beat!

Just came back from Hawaii, we stayed here for 5 nights. Hey, it's not the most modern place but certainly the quietest hotel I have ever stayed at. The room was fine, bathroom a bit dated but CLEAN so for the money I would highly recommend. We checked out those fancy $800 night hotels and let me tell you something, they are noisy with their music playing till wee hours of night and lots of loud families to boot. The Aqua Surf was just a short 5 min walk to beach and we used our savings to splurge and sightsee and buy whatever we wanted!!!!!

This hotel is listed among the mid-range hotels in the Lonely Planet guidebook and together with other Aqua boutique hotels on their website. The prices (~$150+) also reflect this categorization. However, this seemed to me rather as a very good budget option than midrange. The rooms are outdated with stains on the carpet, couch, and walls; the beds are not very comfortable, the rooms are rather small and feel cramped. The AC is a loud old box in the wall which makes sleeping difficult and instead opening windows at night is even louder since Waikiki is a rather busy place.The lobby looks way more modern and renovated than the rooms. But the service is very friendly and the hotel is in excellent location, just two blocks from the touristy street and beach. Rooms are also equipped with dishes, microwave, fridge, and a coffee maker, which is nice. Our room was on the 15th floor, maybe there are other rooms that are recently renovated, but I am not aware of that.Overall, I recommend this hotel but for the price it is an average option but again in a great location.

A very quaint place to stay for my first time in Waikiki. Extremely friendly and helpful staff, especially Douglas. Included breakfast was handy-great pancakes! Room was nice enough and housekeeping did an excellent job everyday-thank you :) Would be better if you could get wifi on your phone in the room, but other than that no problems whatsoever. I'll be back next RIMPAC.

The hotel was just ok. It was a place to sleep. We were not too happy with the place, but since it was part of our package we had no choice of where to stay. Next time for sure we will be sure to stay at the Sheraton or the Hilton.

Old and dated rooms. Was travelling with my mother and booked 6 months in advance. Requested twin beds. They were unable to provide this even with 6 months notice! So yes, I had to sleep on the sofa bed. Lumpy. Rooms were very small, but that is common to this area. Biggest problem is the noise very early EVERY morning from the supermarket on the beach side. The noise of trucks delivering and forklifts and rubbish trucks wakes you rudely very early each day. Very small pool. Reception staff were not overly helpful at all, but the cleaning staff were wonderful. Pool is very small. Would not want to try to use the pool in peak season. Could never get a seat downstairs to eat breakfast either. So far from anything being back on the canal. Should have gone closer to the beach.

Needed a last minute reservation for a week until our apartment was ready to move in to. The price was definitely right. The room was pretty small, but clean, and had a refrigerator and microwave- very helpful for a week's stay! The hotel is within walking distance of everything. Parking is $20 a day, what we expected. Here's what makes this hotel THE place to stay: the staff. A special thank-you to Douglas, who cheerfully printed a fax for us, and faxed it back when we needed. Can't say how much time and stress this saved us. Also, we had to have documents mailed to us during our stay, and the front desk staff was extremely friendly and accommodating with all our needs.

I wouldn't recommend this hotel without first getting a tetanus shot. The shower was rusty, and there was hair on the sink when we arrived. I stepped on something sharp on the carpet, which made me wonder just how well they had cleaned the room.The concierge was incredibly rude. When asked for directions, he treated us as if we were stupid and the answers were obvious. If we knew where to go, we wouldn't be tourists. As for the continental breakfast, be prepared to clean and bus your table before and after you eat. When I mentioned a dirty table, I was handed a filthy cloth from a nearby dish bin and expected to clean it myself. After we were finished eating, the staff YELLED at us from across the hotel lobby to come back and clean up our mess.

Though the lobby area is pleasing, the rooms and dining areas are in desperate need for a revamp, though it is a budget hotel. It meets the needs of what travelers require; clean and soft bed, a locking door, in-room safe, etc. The employees however are so friendly, always willing to do anything to help the guests, and the housekeepers are friendly as well. It's located about two blocks in from the beach, but being off the main strip has been beneficial, being away from the hustle and bustle of the main tourist drag makes it quieter, and closer to the cheap, hole-in-the-wall eateries that are so much better than the priced-through-the-nose joints on the tourist drag. For what I needed, it's perfect.

We arrived early in middle of the week. The gentleman was very polite, allowed us to check-in one of two rooms reserved. We dropped off our luggage and headed for the beach. Receive one card for one towel, so ask for two. What's nice is drop them off at laundry basket and get card back for new. We received our second room at 3 as promised. This hotel is old school but so is the rest of downtown. Both one bedroom suites were on 16th floor at each end. We got the ocean view while the other was mountain view. Our side was noisier (not too bad though) and they got the sunsets. Our frig was attached to energy saving key card so we had to leave the key in to keep our food from spoiling. Yes we called the office. The rooms was clean and roomy, good shower pressure, comfortable king bed. We enjoyed the Managers Special Wipeout drinks, listen to Ukelele, and decided to eat at the Buffet (homemade egg rolls) that evening. Perfect romantic setting. I read reviews that the pool is small, it's very small. We were to busy to use it anyhow. Breakfast was good with options of oatmeal, boiled eggs, pancakes, and fresh air. We ate at Hula Dogs near International Market, Jimmy Buffet Margaritaville nearby, Long Beach Pub near Disney Lagoon towards west shore. There was a busy steakhouse that we couldn't get in. So happy we didn't need to drive, crazy roads n drivers. ABC store is nearby for extra snacks n water. So glad we went on to Maui though, Honolulu was too city for us.

All employees of this place are soo nice! One day for some reason our hot water wasn't working in the morning these people gave me another room to take a shower in so I could be ready when I needed to leave! They were very considerate of my needs! They also have microwaves and fridges in every room which made it nice because food is sooo expensive in Hawaii!

I did a lot of research and decided to stay here for 7 nights. No regrets. Upon arrival received the upgrade I requested for a nominal fee, early check in, as well as complimentary continental breakfasts while we were waiting. Never seemed crowded. Lifts always empty. Used the pool almost every day. I booked directly with the hotel. Deluxe room was fantastic and more than exceeded my expectations. Free coffee in the foyer. Use of beach towels and beach chairs. Ocean views to the right. Misty mountain tops to the left. Immaculately clean. Small boutique style hotel. I will definitely always use the Aqua hotel chain again. G & N - Australia.

This property is old and out dated. The room was clean but just okay for the money. The location is decent and only a few steps to shopping and restaurants. The breakfast is a joke. Pancakes are good but that's it. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Due to a medical emergency we needed to stay one extra night in Waikiki, and decided on the Aqua Aloha Surf. Only 4 blocks from Waikiki beach, it looks like an older hotel but has been completely refurbished with funky new decor. When we arrived there was a guy playing tunes on a ukelele in the foyer, and the manager was handing out free margharitas (I believe it only happens on Tuesdays). Instantly we felt this was a fun, relaxed place. Service at reception was friendly and efficient. The room (for myself and my son) was smallish, but adequate for our one night stay. The shower and toilet were separate which was useful. Unfortunately we didn't get a chance to use the pool or sample the breakfast. For $128 (on Wotif.com) this was great value for money. If I was coming back to Hawaii I would definitely consider staying here again.

We have recently returned from another stay at this lovely Hotel. Tim, Julian & all the staff are so wonderful to deal with & absolutely nothing is a bother - they treat you like "Ohana" (family). The room was always clean, the breakfast is good with lovely fresh food & the informal weekly get together is always enjoyable, We have always found this hotel to be comfortable & centrally located with a nice view - the city lights are amazing. The room has good facilities including a very comfortable bed, fridge, microwave, crockery/cutlery, tv, iron, hairdryer & a/c- which you don't really need as there is a nice breeze that comes through the room. Just arriving into the foyer makes you feel like you are on holidays - very welcoming & relaxing. We will certainly be returning on a regular basis & look forward to seeing the friendly staff again. Mahalo to all at Aqua Aloha Surf Kim & Leon, Australia

If you are looking for a budget and clean accommodation with comfortable bed, free continental breakfast and value for money that provides extraordinary service – I would highly recommend this hotel!Our stay at this hotel for 10 days has made the celebration of our 30th wedding anniversary extra special. The chilled bottles of wine and a box of chocolates that they delivered to our room was a nice surprise when they found out it was our anniversary. I must thank my daughter for recommending this hotel to us, as it meets our accommodation needs at a budget price – a clean room with a comfortable bed, 24 hrs internet access, tv, iron and hair dryer. The room is of good size and there is no need to turn the A/C on if you prefer the fresh air. In the kitchen area there are bar fridge, microwave, coffee maker, plates and cutleries. The front desk staff, the housekeeper and the people who serve breakfast are so helpful and friendly. The relaxed ambience of the reception area makes it so welcoming for guests when they arrive to the hotel. It’s a nice place to hang out too. The hotel is two blocks away from the beach and a walking distance to the shops, restaurants and Kalakaua Street. This is a good location if you prefer a quieter area, away from the crowd, away from the traffic and noise.I would definitely stay at this hotel again when in Waikiki and would gladly recommend this hotel to my friends and relatives.

The location is centerally located about 5 minute walk to the famed WAIKIKI Beach. The first room we got was a single queen with absolutely no space the shower was worse than a camp shower in size there was no place to put tolietries either. Thankfully we were able to be upgraded to a larger room with a king bed, balcony, and sitting area. and a very spacious bathroom in comparison to the first. The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. The complementary breakfast was better than I had thought it would be. There is an onsite bar however it was never open during the time we stayed there.

I found the Aqua Aloh Surf Waikiki Hotel very adequate for what I needed. Highlights for me were: inexpensive, clean, comfortable, walking distance to beach, microwave, fridge, and 4 cup coffee maker. The hotel provides a place to fill up water bottles for those of us who carry our own. My room had just enough attention from the maids, and I received extra attention at the front desk when faced with a late shuttle pick-up. I also had a surprise room upgrade which had a balcony where I was able to sit in the morning sun! The city lights and sunrises were awesome!I was nervous about picking a place to stay at Waikiki but I made a good choice.

Great value, excellent location and an accomodating and friendly staff make for an excellent vacation or business destination. In fact this is the fourth Aqua property I have stayed at and they are all equally great, depending on your needs. The rooms are fairly compact, but fine for your needs and the beds and linens are of high quality. There is also a small pool, AND free breakfast!Aqua Surf is within walking distance of all major Waikiki attractions, yet it is tucked away on a quiet street. Check their web site since they usually have special discounts running all the time.

this is certainly a good buy if you are not looking for amenities. It is walking distance to the beach. However, it is right at the corner of 2 very busy streets, and I didn't have any windows to close, just adjustable window slats, so there was alot of traffic noise ( buses, delivery trucks, motorcycles). Also, when I checked in the front desk person was very frazzled and short with me, didn't explain anything to me about the continental breakfast or beach towels, and didn't let me know that the lights in the room are powered by the room key. I would pay the difference to stay at another hotel

Stayed at Aqua Aloha Surf for 2 weeks got a delux room which can have a king bed or double and a single which is what we had also had a sofa lounge that could be converted to a bed. The room was plenty big enough for 2 of us had a shower and toilet in together which was a wee bit of a problem but its something easily overcome. The vanity was plenty big enough to house our toileteries and there was two drawers and cupboard for the toiletrie bags. The staff were very helpful and answered all our questions. Had what I thought was a problem with the fridge rang the front desk and staff was there within 5 mintues very prompt. The breakfast was good also staff in there so very helpful and the pancakes were awesome so light and fluffy and freshly cooked. Pool although small was clean and I never had a problem getting a sun lounge. Booked all our tours here also no trouble with getting the days we wanted for our tours.Would definately stay here again, my son is getting married in March next year and he will be staying here for his honeymoon.Thanks so very much for making our stay a enjoyable experience.

My husband and I stayed at the Aloha Surf for 7 nights. We thought the value (budget friendly hotel) for what we got was excellent, and the bed was extremely comfortable. It was also in a good location, we could walk pretty much everywhere within Waikiki beach. The two downsides for us was that it did not have a hot tub, and while continental breakfast was included in our package, the food selection was the same every day. By the 4th day, we couldn't stomach any more pancakes, toast, or cereal. We got a room upgrade upon check-in (great surprise) which allowed us a small kitchenette. Otherwise, I think our standard room might have been a bit small. However, the staff was friendly, the room was clean, and we didn't have any major issues.

stayed 7 night room o.k. but could do with a up grade,under bed not seen a hoover for weeks,shower rusty plug hole,few cracked tiles,stayed on the 15th floor but you could still hear the street noise,main reception is large,clean,free coffee,paper's,only stayed here because of the price,guess you pay for what you get,would stay here again if we visited,so guess not that bad

We stayed@ aqua aloha surf for 10 days. When they say rooms  renovated, I could not agree with that statement! Our room 1402 smelled bad, missing pieces of trim, the ugliest musty smallest bathroom I have ever seen. Never saw roaches, but smelled bug spray in elevators& in room. There were 2 decent front desk people but most were rude& un- helpful. We also have not got our $100 deposit back. I will not ever stay here again, I've had cleaner hotels in 3rd world countries! We loved Hawaii, but not this hotel, it's a dump!

Walking distance from Waikiki beach, restaurants, shops. Comfortable and clean room, we had an amazing view of Honolulu from the balcony (12th floor).Breakfast was OK.Con:Tiny pool, no Wi-fi in room (only in lobby), a bit noisy for light sleepers.

Last year my wife and I were at the hotel for 10 days. All the things written about the hotel staff and service being excellent were true. We had only 1 major problem which we were get fixed after a week. Noise levels outside the hotel. We were on the 6th floor on the south end of the hotel. There is a public parking lot next door under a huge banyon tree. The parking lot is in the back of a grocery store called 'The Pantry'. All night long there was all manner of constant noise!! People would be in the public parking lot at all hours and would be drunk. They would be yelling and screaming as if they left a party or a restaurant . The trucks would come in all hours to make delivery's and pick up the trash so we would hear the constant banging and clanging from dumpsters etc. It just never stopped!!! We were going crazy!!We finally had had a enough and and asked to be moved to the other side of the hotel on the north end. Problem solved!! Very nice and quiet! We got our sleep!So if you book a room here just be sure and stay away from that side of the hotel and you will enjoy your stay.

My wife and i came here because we had a wedding up in Turtle bay. First the good stuff. The room was solid. The bed was very comfortable. The room was decent size. comfortable for a weeks stay. It had microwave, fridge, a kitchen sink. Really helped to save money on stuff. also 2 blocks from a supermarket. The hotel was really close to the beach-3 blocks and all sorts of what waikiki has to offer. Definitely dont need a car from here for everything in waikiki. The continental breakfast I have read by others wasn`t very good, is totally WRONG. It was excellent!!! Pancakes everyday. So light and fluffy. i ate them everyday and I hadn`t had any in a year. Yum. muffins rolls hot cereal, frosted mini wheats, toast, orange slices , apples. This is a wonderful breakfast and should not be missed. Everyone on staff is friendly. The maids, the maintance people , even the desk. all very happy .On the downside. We were on the 4th floor at the end of the hall. The room was very close to a building that had trucks backing in starting every morning at about 6:30. This never stopped and was everyday. Lots of beep beep beep. My wife woke up everyday because of it. Also the front desk was quite frankly horrible. We arrived and asked directions to Diamond head. one of the biggest tourist attractions on the island. We got there and it was closed for the week for parking lot maintance. We were shocked that it was closed and the desk didnt know it. We figured ok , maybe it started today. Figured they should have told us but ok, whatever. Then on sunday. We wanted directions to the restaurant ONO's. We drove there from the north side of the island days earlier. It was awesome hawaiin food. Now we were without the car and wanted to be sure how to get there on foot. They gave us directions and we started walking the 3/4 of a mile . When we got there. Closed. Closed all sundays!! Just like every restaurant in this area. We were pissed. Why didnt they mention this. 2nd time. BS!! when we got back. I talked to the guy who did this. He said he didn`t know. He clearly sucks at his job if he doesnt know whats opened and whats not in his area. He was working as concierge. Its there job to know. He told me i should have googled it. I said thats why I came to you. I turned to leave and started walking away. He then says to his coworker , it was closed, and starts laughing. I turned and said , you think its funny?? Gives you an idea of how the front desk operates. Still i would recomend this hotel. Its a nice place, amenities good, and close and clean . Just take what said at the desk at your own risk.

I was a little apprehensive staying another day in this hotel in the beginning. I stayed with my sister for 2 days and 1 nite in this hotel and I was very disappointed that the room is so tiny and the one bed it has appears to be only a full bed and not a King size. The batbroom is another disappointment as it has only a sink basin and no place to put all your toiletries. Although they volunteer to switch us to a different room, my sister decided not to be bothered...which was a big mistake! I tried calling other hotels nearby for another nite stay since my sister is leaving one day ahead but all of them cost too much for my budget. I decided to go downstairs at the front desk to find out how much it would be to stay another nite. They quoted me $79 per nite ...which was ridiculous since I know that room we were staying is only worth $59 thru discounthotelshawaii.com (i think this is the website). But at $79 that's the cheapest i could find that day! I went ahead and got it anyway but continue to complain about how tiny the room was and that there' s no vanity table in the bathroom for toiletries. The front desk guy suggested that we check out first and then he will find me a better room later on as they are pretty full that day. My sister and I toured the city and when i returned later on that day I was pleasantly surprised that he upgraded me to a much better room....bigger one with bigger bed, with a balcony overseeing a beautiful view, a bathroom with vanity table and a lot more....I was a happy camper then and very appreciative for a GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE.. Becoz of that...I would definitely return to this hotel....but will never get that tiny STD room tho!

Stayed for 5 nights in Nov. Room(partial city view 8th floor) was a little dated but overall clean & welcoming. service daily.Bed was comfy, staff were courteous & the room was reasonably quiet at night. location says it all- walking distance to everything worth seeing. would definitely stay here again & would highly recommend to anyone wanting clean cheap accommodation.Tuesdays managers night special was a bonus!

My boyfriend and I looked for weeks for a hotel we liked and we finally decided on this ONE!!! We loved the location, the beach is only few minutes away, great restaurants, they provide you with beach towels, they have a pool, its basically close to everything and we even had an amazing couples massage. This hotel is a hidden gem!! Ooh....not to mention the room.....comfortable bed, we had a great view of diamond head & a ocean view, we had stayed on the 15th floor! do not over look this hotel. Don't let the negative reviews mislead you.

Stayed May 2012 for 3 nights prior to a cruise. Arrived in the afternoon around 3. 2 parties ahead checking in. I agree with others that said the front staff were not friendly, however they were efficient. Our room was small and that is fine as we were not there to spend time in a hotel. It was a bed!Location to us was great, 5 minute walk to the beach and all the shops/restaurants were around the same!I would not hesitate to stay there again!

When we arrived we got there about 1:30pm and the lobby was crowded as a lot of tourists had just came off a cruise ship and it was chaos in the lobby, obviously our room wasn't ready my only complaint is we where told we would be called and it was pretty obvious this wouldn't happen due to the fact staff started dealing with customers who arrived after 3pm, so I had to get in line again and had to complain as quite a few older customers thought their age excused them the need to queue, we got in our room a little after 4pm we got room 1509 and it had a great view of the mountains, overall our checkin experience was not great but not actual staff's fault as their was no way this hotel seemed prepared for such a large influx of guests, also if we hadn't already stayed at hotel we wouldn't have been aware of the free internet or the free coffee as it wasn't mentioned at checkinWe used the laundry room in our 10 day stay and it was okay the staff where helpful, we never ate at hotel although breakfast buffet was still $4.95 each and dinner buffet was $13.95, we did get a couple of hot dogs one day they where huge for only $1.50 and the bread was fresh, Edwards Cafe on site opened rarely despite the sign showing their hours, don't really see why the hotel allow a tenant that doesn't enhance the hotel at all, on our arrival they would have done a roaring trade as the lobby was full of people waiting but it remained close, we also used the pool area it is small but clean and nice to relax in, the internet went down once in our 10 days for a few hours so it was pretty reliable,house keeping was good and reliable and also said hello,we attended the Tuesday Reception it was nice and the staff where friendly, wipeout cocktail was plentiful, and the entertainment was nice as well, we did have someone try to get into our room 1 night due to fact they had been given wrong room number by check in staff we did get a call to apologize for this incident, at check out I was disappointed that the girl at the desk never asked if we enjoyed our stay or even hoped we would return, overall we had a great room,a good stay and would return my only complaint be a little more personal with the guests who don't complain

The Aqua Aloha Surf was just what we were looking for in a Waikiki hotel. It was centrally located so we were able to walk every evening all over Waikiki. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was just right. We upgraded to a Superior with a King bed and got a corner room with a lanai. For staying eight days, we never felt cramped in our room. There is always city noise in Waikiki, so don't expect quiet. We were on the 9th floor which gave us a glimpse of the ocean and a view of a lot of buildings, but that was fine for us. Our bed was comfortable, and we appreciated having the mini-refrigerator and microwave for our use. Manager's Welcome Party on Tuesday evening was a treat. We loved the ukelele player and enjoyed the hosted "Blue Wave" drinks as we met other travellers in our hotel. Parking for our rental car was $20 a night, which we hadn't anticipated. We learned to get back to our hotel by 5:30 - 6:00 pm in order to secure a parking spot at the hotel, and then we walked in the evenings. They, unfortunately, only have about 30 or so parking spots available, so if it's full, you have to find parking somewhere else in the area. The continental breakfast is served by an independent business in the morning and is mostly just carbs (pancakes, oatmeal, toast, pastries) with hard-boiled eggs being served every third day, but it filled the spot for a while. We appreciated the hotel's coffee and tea machine that is available 24 hours. The rate we got for our room was excellent, everything was clean and nice, and we definitely will stay with Aloha Surf again when we return to Waikiki.

The Aqua Aloha Surf is an older property on a quiet side street. The solid construction means quiet rooms, and the location puts you a convenient couple of blocks from the main part of what's left of Waikiki Beach and its mayhem, without forcing you to be part of it. There are quieter walks and jogs available along the Canal, down to Kapiolani Park.Rooms are compact but functional, with good beds and bathrooms. There are decent views from the small upper-story balconies, and the fridge, microwave, coffee maker and dishes provided allow you to eat in if you care to. The included breakfast is very weak, but it's a start. The pool is also insignificant, but there's always the beach if you want to get wet.Staff and management make a solid and generally very successful effort to provide plenty of Aloha, with one glaring exception, a desk guy named Lance. When we checked in late at night after a long flight, he was busily screwing up two other parties, even though the solution to their problems was obvious to me after a minute of listening. When his victims took time out to confer with each other, I showed him my voucher, and asked for a registration form. He snapped back that he was helping these other people, which was the opposite of the truth, so I turned to one couple, asked if I'd understood the problem, and suggested the obvious solution, which was adopted. Then someone in an upper room called, obviously repeating a complaint about noisy neighbors, and Lance snapped at him. Finally, he managed to check us in.When we were checking out to catch an early flight to Asia a few days later, there was Lance again. We had prearranged a shuttle with the concierge, and I asked him to confirm which company's shuttle we were booked on, so we could watch for it. He gave us the wrong information, and when a shuttle driver came to the lobby shouting "Airport", my wife went and checked with Lance, who snapped that it wasn't the right company. When our supposed shuttle was 15 minutes late, the real concierge arrived, and it turned out that Lance had given us the wrong info, and sent our shuttle away. Fortunately, it was still making its rounds, and picked us up in time to catch our flight to Taipei.A desk clerk should be able to reason and multitask without turning snippy and snarly, but Lance couldn't even task, and he was surly as well as incompetent. I'd gladly stay at the Aloha Surf again based on its reasonable rates and good location, but I'd be way happier if Lance was removing gum from the sidewalk or cleaning bathrooms rather than screwing up reception.

This hotel is a great value for the budget-conscious traveller. The location is close to everything, the room was clean and the bed was very comfortable, which is exactly what we were looking for. Bonuses that we appreciated were: WiFi, a water dispenser and free coffee in the lobby, plus the coffee for our coffee machine in the room. No - it's not the Ritz and yes, perhaps the bathroom was dated. But it was comfortable and clean, which is all we hoped for (and we didn't fly to gorgeous Hawaii to spend our time in a hotel room and to adore a granite five-star bathroom!). For the price, this hotel met, if not exceeded, our expectation and we will definitely book here again.
Good location (not the best), free internet, close to the Waikiki Beach, shops, restaurants and bars. Breakfast could be better.

This hotel is older but clean and charming, comfortable beds. There was also a microwave, frig and coffee pot with coffee included in the room. It does offer free breakfast but we were only able to take advantage of it one out of three mornings as we had to leave the hotel before 7:00 for various excursions. It's located about two blocks from Waikiki beach and the International Market. I felt it was on a fairly quiet street as compared to the hotels right on the beach. Easy walking to many restaurants and shopping. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you're just looking for nice, inexpensive place to sleep while you explore Oahu.

Clean, neat and friendly. Free daily breakfast -- but you won't want to eat there more than once. Pool is tiny, it really should be a hot tub. WiFi does not reach the rooms, have to go to the lobby.Close to beach, corner grocery, great coffee shops and island shopping. Parking fee is $20 per day but if you want to stay in in the area you don't need a car. You can always rent one for a day or two nearby.

I've been to Oahu twice in two years. It's a great place to visit, but narrowing down just WHERE you'll stay can be very difficult. There's so much to choose from! Do you stay that the expensive all inclusive hotels and waste half your money on amenities, or do a little more research to find out what you'll REALLY need for your stay? I've stayed in Hiltons and Marriotts in the past and they're great, but not really worth the money you pay. I will NEVER stay at a ritzy wine & dine hotel in Oahu. If that's what you're looking for then this isn't the place for you. However, if you're looking for a comfortable clean bed to sleep in.... you can't pass this place up! Seriously one of the most comfortable beds I've slept in. The room was clean and had updated furnishings/decor. Fridge, sink, microwave and eating utensils all included. As far as a hotel ROOM is concerned, this is exactly all you need for your stay in Oahu. There's so much to do in Waikiki alone that you won't be in your room much anyway.
