The lobby is modern and clean with a full staff 24/7 for your every need. Work-Out equipment is just off the lobby in an indoor/outdoor setting. Small clean pool (I've worked in the hot tub/sauna industry for a few years so pool standards are pretty high) just enough room to cool off and feel comfortable if a couple others happen to join you. The location is absolutely perfect! It's in the middle of Waikiki so you can walk anywhere you need to go. A grocery store (not ABC their prices are ridiculous) is just through the parking lot. They have fresh everything and the best prices I've come across. The ONLY hole in the wall sports pub is not too far away, LEGENDS.... the owner is a very nice man and he keeps polite friendly staff to make you feel at home. If/when I go back to Waikiki I will only stay at Aqua Aloha Surf, it was the right decision for me, and ANYONE looking for a great place to stay without wasting all your spending money on a top dollar hotel. Other than the rooms, amenities, aesthetics of this boutique hotel, the STAFF was absolutely wonderful to us. Couldn't be happier with our stay there.

Great location, short walk to beach. Friendly staff, room was comfortable. Bed was very comfy. Only problem was it gets very light early morning, curtains aren't great. Quite noisy at times as our room was on a busy street. Wouldnt bother with breakfast or dinner buffet. Good value and had everything we needed.

I've been going to Ohau for the past 6 years and have always stayed down the road at the Wyland (now Marriott Courtyard) but decided to change it up a bit this year. Based on the reviews of the Aqua Aloha, I thought I couldn't go wrong...but I was.Pros: Excellent location in terms of being able to walk to any place in Waikiki (the beach, bars, shops and restaurants). ABC store on the corner which was very convienent to grab snacks/beverages to take back to the room. The bed was a decent size and was probably one of the best hotel beds I've ever slept in - very comfortable. Cons: We upgraded to a superior room which was fine but our room (#403) faced a parking lot and, without fail, every morning woke up about 5-5:30am to the sound of garbage trucks or delivery trucks. Our lanai faced an apartment building which was so close, I could see the couple across from us doing their morning exercises. The bathroom is in need of a desperate upgrade. And finally, we were greeted every morning or evening by a cockroach. I realize we're in the tropics and things like this happen but a) this never happened at the Marriott and b) one of them showed up every day on cue. I'm not a picky traveler but this is a bit much to have to deal with when on vacation (in my opinion anyway).
Great location, great staff, nice facility, and reasonably priced. I've stayed there before and will stay there again.

Stayed here about 2 years ago. Just now getting into the whole TripAdvisor thing. This was a nice little hotel. Friendly staff. Didn't go in the pool as it was small and usually full of kids. This was not a big deal as the ocean is but a few blocks away, as are all the shopping areas. (dont be afraid to haggle for a better price at the street market). Easy to get lost in the area around the hotel as alot of the roads/buildings look similar. The hotel across the street has a nice little open air bar that was a nice place to have a night cap. The only downside was the size of the room. But the weather is so nice and so much to do there you don't want to be in your room much so no big deal
user_name:
Chris P
Mansfield, Ohio, United States

review_body: The apartment that we stayed in was very pleasant and had plenty of facilities in the room, such as a refrigerator and a microwave oven. The room was definitely a good size and price for the convenient location. It is ideal if you'd like to stay in the centre of Waikiki without paying exorbitant prices. Our room however faced a nearby apartment block so you didn't feel like you were getting any real privacy (sometimes the curtains didn't close quite fully). As it was only on the fourth floor, noise could sometimes be an issue. Also, our particular rooms was actually rented out by the hotel across the street, so you needed to cross the road whenever you wanted to ask reception anything! The included breakfast was definitely not worth it, as it is just toast, pineapple, coffee/tea and pineapple juice, but this is quite a common thing in Hawaiian hotels.

It was a nice place ,nothing really outstanding just a nice place. It's location ( just a short walk to the beach, International Market Place,restaurants& "The Bus") and price were the best things going for it.  We had probably the smallest hotel room I've ever seen(5th floor front near the elevator). If we go there again we'd get a room on the back side away from the street. The noise from the bar across the street was terrible every night, as was the sound (at 4am-8am) of the garbage trucks & other maintance vehicles.  Breakfast was OK, seating was a little tight, very friendly lady serving hot pancakes. Actually all of the staff were very friendly and helpful.  We didn't use the pool(small, cold & in the shade).

I went to Hawaii to be on the beach and see the sights (not to stay in my room!), so this hotel is exactly what we were looking for: good location, not expensive, and decent. Sure, the breakfast could be a little better, the bathroom was a little smaller than we thought it would be, and plugging my blow dryer into an outlet in the room caused the air conditioner to stop working, but the hotel has a friendly, helpful staff and they fixed my problem as quickly as they could! From the hotel, we had a five minute walk to the beach, an ABC store at the end of our block, and could easily walk to shopping areas and restaurants. I wouldn’t choose this hotel for my honeymoon (unless I was really on a budget), but I would consider coming back to this hotel if I revisited Oahu.

We stayed at the Aqua Aloha Surf from March 20th-March 26th for a vacation to get away from our real life! The hotel was super close to everything. An abc store (their convenient store) is right on the corner, Burger King, KFC, and Denny's are only a block away. The beach is only 2 short blocks away. Parking is $20 a day at the hotel. I couldn't find free parking but their is 2 hour free parking on the street to the right of the hotel and a parking lot next door for about $15 a day I believe. Our room was a moderate room and was small but was perfect for us because we didn't spend much down time in the room. The room definitely need some major TLC. In the rooms, they ask on a little fish notecard about what you thought about the room and any improvements it needed. I left it at the front desk with Helene and I hope that they take what I said into consideration for the room. It had paint chipping in the bathroom, small black mold spots in the shower, uneven spackle jobs in bathroom, paint missing off in chunks on the closet bi fold doors,etc. Overall, glad we picked this hotel. It was perfect for us.

This was the second time we have stayed at this hotel. This time was as good as the last time, Staff are friendly and very helpful. The hotel is clean and quite. Close to everthing in Waikiki. Beaches minutes away. Will be back.Thanks for the great service
There is nothing terribly outstanding here but it was clean, the staff was very friendly and it was close to shopping and Waikiki.

Staff is super friendly and the price is great for the location. It is centrally located and is next door to the only real grocery store in Waikiki. You are only a couple of blocks from the main attractions. Quiet and clean. I've stayed there a couple of time and have been very happy on ever visit. We had a late flight departure and the hotel gave us a late check out and held our baggage until we left.

Staff is very friendly and helpful: we stayed at this hotel both before and after going to Kauaii island, but we reserved just for the first part. The staff helped us finding a room for the second half of our stay at the same conditions of the first one (it was a deluxe room).The hotel is very well located, just 2 blocks from the beach and not directly on the main streets, so it is quiet and silent. It is very modern and rooms are clean and nice.We had found a good discount for the hotel thanx to ckeckin in in foursquare, so I think that overall price for quality rate was really good!The only think I did not like too much was breakfast: not a lot of choice and in a very small and stinky room. Anyways, Starbucks and alikes are just around the corner, and as I said, the price for the room was really good (90 USD for a double room), so I will not lower my rating for that!
Friendly, very clean, a nice size room, steps away from the center of Waikiki, but just enough distance not to be noisy. We loved our stay here and will definitely return. Mike & Kawita

Great staff, very friendly and helpful. We arrived at 9am after a red-eye fro Fiji, and they had all 3 of our rooms ready by 10am (check-in is officially 3). We checked out the next morning, and they held our bags no charge all day (and charged up our phones at the front desk) until we picked everything up for our next red-eye. Since we arrived early, they also gave us two free breakfasts for staying one night. Outstanding! Food was good, coffee good, mattresses comfortable, showers hot, a/c worked, lobby WI-FI fast, no complaints. After unrelated very stressful travel upsets, this hotel was a welcome relief. Thank you Aqua Aloha!
user_name:
Blake J
Surrey, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: Aqua Aloha Surf is a very nicely updated older hotel just a few blocks from the beach at Waikiki. We got a "deluxe" room, which was a corner room on the 9th floor. Our balcony looked out over other hotel/apartment balconies, but the front window had a nice city view with a wedge of ocean thrown in. There was a micro/fridge/bar sink, king size bed and sofa in a fair sized room. The room also has a safe and a decent bathtub. On the down side it was very noisy. With the windows and door open you got a nice breeze and the room was comfortable, but the city sounds came right in. You could cut the noise about in half by shutting the door and windows but the air conditioner was even worse than the city noise. The free breakfast had few healthy options - pancakes, sweet dessert things, sugared cereals, very limited fruit selection and the slowest toaster on the planet. That being said, we enjoyed our stay and definately got our money's worth in Waikiki.
We had a great stay here! Staff was very friendly, and the rooms were nice and very clean. Nolin at the front desk was awesome! I would recommend it to anyone.
user_name:
Kelli L
Green Bay, Wisconsin, United States

review_body: We picked this hotel because it was one of the most cost effective that included breakfast daily. While the hotel was really nice and the staff were accommodating the breakfast definately was not a reason to stay there. They only charge about $4 a day if ppl want the breakfast and arent in the hotel so that gives u an idea of what it was like.The rooms were clean and comfortable though the tvs small. The location was excellent for walking to the centre of town and Waikiki beach.

Went for our honeymoon; special package was bubbly wine and stale chocolates. We got a room upgrade which is only a bit more square footage than what we had paid foor.had a cockroach in our room, but this comes with the climate. the carpets and sofa were stained. The curtain was ripped and did not fully close. The lanai was nice, but the view not so much. The area is quiet. The gym only has three pieces of equipment, outdoors (no air con). The breakfast is NOT good. If you like waffles, you can have them everyday because it's pretty much the only thing being served.the massage at the spa was very good.

Nice hotel, conveniently located, very helpful and friendly staff who sort out everything for you. Clean room, microwave, coffemaker, refrigerator, TV, telefone and safe in the room, beach towels are provided.

Want a relaxing comfortable, convenient localized hotel in the HEART of WAIKIKI, "THEN I SUGGEST AQUA ALOHA SURF WAIKIKI." Checking in was hassel free (big plus) our room was on the 10th floor city view. The view was beautiful, the room was a **** (4 star) @ a good price. It was clean, the amenities included mini refrigerator, microwave, small flat screen tv, very comfortable bed and a lanai facing KANEKAPOLI STREET, to the left is the ALAWAI. CANAL. YES! I would definitely reccomend this hotel. The spirit of ALOHA! Is given very freely by the manager, front desk clerks, bell man, housekeepers, continental breakfast crew & maintenance. "We are locals and were so pleased to see that even in one of OAHU's most busiest tourist attraction of WAIKIKI there is still "ALOHA which doesn't cost anything "IT's FREE!!!!" "MAHALO NUI LOA, AQUA ALOHA SURF WAIKIKI HOTEL." A HUI HOU!! Till the next time.

we stayed for 11 nights and were glad we chose to stay here.... it wasn't the fanciest place we could have stayed in but it was clean, quiet and the staff were friendly.our room was on the small side but surprisingly quiet given it was next to the elevators, we were on the 10th floor so far enough up to not notice the street noise. The bed was comfortable and the shower was good. When we mentioned how small it was we were offered a change but we ended up staying put. the aircon was in an odd location but we had no problem with the room temperature. The staff at the front desk we very friendly and nothing was too much trouble - especially when our travel agent had short booked us with 10 instead of 11 nights, they were cool about listening to our adventures for the day as well so a big Thank you Kalei, JT, Vinh & the others.The breakfast was ok for a quick snack in the morning. As far as location goes - it was a nice spot - easy walk to everything without all the noise. We would stay here again.

The room was spotless and I was given a free upgrade to a room with a balconyBalcony had a palm tree in front and a view of the canal.There was fridge, microwave and lots of coffee. Free coffee all day in the lobby, free breakfast - eggs every other day, free newspaper,free towels.Location was excellent - At the end of the street was the bus line and trolley line.Grocery store around the corner.Staff very helpful and so well mannered.I would recomment this also to single travellers - very safe

Aloha and Mahalo to Tim and all his excellent staff! (esp Kazumi, Kalei and many others).We had the opportunity to stay and celebrate our 35th wedding anniversary with them and will definitely visit again. A small, quaint hotel that really treats you like family!Aloha and Mahalo!B and DCanada

We would never ever stay here again! very old fashioned, needs a lot of updating, we were on the 12th floor, Room was very small, room was very Noisy, windows were like glass vertical blinds, they didn't close tight, there was a gap in them that stayed open, that was the reason for all the noise! nothing could be used to close them, air conditioner was located right at the head of the bed, it was warm and needed to be used, woke up with a headache from cold air blowing right on me, refrigerator was not plugged in when we got there, we opened it up and it smelled so bad, would not even wanted to use it, location was good for walking to the beach and shops, we were very glad to be leaving after a 2 night stay.

We enjoyed our stay at the Aqua Surf. The price was reasonable. We had a partial view of the ocean as well as a partial view of Diamond Head from our balcony on the 12th floor. We can't say enough about the staff. Everyone was friendly and helpful. We were surprised that they provided beach chairs and towels, That was great because we forgot to pack beach towels. The pool area was small,but clean and the chairs were comfy. Overall we enjoyed our stay there and would definately stay there again

Close to just about everything in Waikiki. Probably wouldnt stay again, unless I got a good deal on a room upgrade. The room is so small it makes even getting dressed difficult. In all fairness, the room was very clean and housekeeping was excellent.

after reading negative reviews re aloha surf i was more than a little worried, however this hotel was just great----- the staff were friendly, the room clean and the bed was the most comfty i have ever slept in----i am already booking my next trip and will most certaintainly be booking to stay here again----special mention to both Edward and Sam at the on site cafe, both were welcoming and friendly---good luck with the book Sam, cant wait to have a read!!!! a great hotel!!!
user_name:
Angela M
Grays Thurrock, United Kingdom

review_body: I only stayed one night cause I needed a separate, quiet room when I was sick. I took the smallest room, and it really WAS small, but that didn't bother me at all cause it was cozy and very comfy. had the best sleep of my entire stay in hawaii! Room was very clean and I felt like home. staff was friendly. for me it fitted perfectly. Thanks!

This hotel is just okay at best as we've stayed in hostels that were better.Pros:-Awesome awesome location! Two blocks away from the beach, King's Village and Shopping-Clean and quiet (requested to have room to be higher level, away from elevators)-Free breakfast that's pretty decent-Good, quick and nice service-If you are renting a car, its nice because there's free parking half a block away along the canal (or else its 20 bucks to park underground)-The plates/microwave/utensils/fridge etc is huge help! Load up on the water and reheating cheesecake factory leftovers is great.-The beds were comfortable for me as it is soft and sinks in really nicely; however, beware, this can also be a con as my SO found the beds uncomfortable as he likes firmer beds. Cons:-The bathroom was a bit awkward as there was no actual door... it was more of an open-ish sliding door that didn't hide any unpleasant sounds. The tv was constantly cranked up high to provide privacy for my significant other (there were stomach problems)-Our card key did not work several times. We had to change it 4-5 times within a few days-The AC was not cold enough despite blasting it all night-The blowdryer did not work in our room either. It took several phone calls and 3 days to have this replaced -The elevators take a bit long (but really that can't be helped)I think with some maintenance, this hotel can definitely be better! If you don't mind the cons listed, then this hotel is definitely for you.

My husband, myself and adult son stayed 10 nights Feb. 2012. Our one bedroom suite on the top (16th) floor was clean, airy and roomy with great views (canal, golf course, and even some ocean in the distance). We never used the a/c. The breeze through the open windows made for a very comfortable temperature. There was definitely traffic noise, but afterall, this is Honolulu! Perhaps closing the windows and turning on the a/c would block out most noise. Breakfast (a nice bonus!) was sufficient and selection varied slightly daily. All staff were friendly, courteous and helpful. Check-in and out was a prompt. We really enjoyed the 24 hour complimentary coffee and ice water in the lovely open lobby/pool area. No wifi in the rooms but the cable plug-in worked just fine. The king bed was super comfy! Our only complaint would be.. the sofa-bed :( It was dirty and worn. We requested a cot, which was delivered promptly, but it wasn't much better. A new sofa bed or futon is much needed here. We would recommend this hotel based on price, convenience and services it offers and would not hesitate to return. Mahalo!

Once again the Aqua Aloha Surf get a get review. Just a few blocks from the best beach in the world, this little jem offers all you need to have a great holiday. The front end staff are remarkable. The maid service looked after our room, down to the last detail. The managers reception on Tuesday evenings is a great way to meet others staying at your hotel. This is the third time staying at this hotel and the staff have upgraded our room on each stay, when space was available. My hat goes off to all the staff at this hotel. And a special thank you to Nicki at the front desk, Your friendly smile and love of your Island go a long way to making peoples holiday on the Island unforgetable.Aloha from Glen and Gene

If you're looking for plush accommodations go somewhere else but if you are looking for clean comfortable accommodations this is the place. The staff are awesome the beds are comfy the rooms remind me of a beach motel on the east coast. It was super clean the pool was small but clean and it's located right in the middle of Waikiki. I have stayed everywhere from the Marriott to Hilton but from now on this is my new favorite hotel!

My boyfriend and I stayed her for 6 nights. There were no major issues during our stay and the front desk was helpful and quick to respond to any requests. We jokingly named this the "Mini Hotel" because everything is small, but still gets the job done (see full review below).Breakfast - Our room came with the free breakfast which was adequate. It is mostly a variety of breakfast type breads, pancakes and cereal. They do have cut up fresh fruit which was nice and one day they had hard boiled eggs. The lady making the pancakes is super nice and the pancakes are good. The only problem is that they only give you little tiny bread plates which makes it hard to handle - just make multiple trips.Lobby/Pool - The lobby is nice and open air. There is a vending machine that sells beverages at a somewhat reasonable price and a machine that has free regular coffee or $1 fancy coffee drinks. Just off the lobby is an internet cafe and tour company. We didn't use etiher of these, so I can't comment. The pool is tiny and only has a few lounge chairs, so just plan on heading to the beach - you are in Hawaii.Room - Our room was small, which I expected, but had enough space for what we needed. The bed was very comfortable and king sized. The curtains were wearing thin in a few places and didn't slide very well open and closed, but still got the job done. The windows were very clean and our view was great, but they are the crank open slatted windows so they don't block out much noise. There is an air conditioner in the room, but we never needed to turn it on. If you opened the windows there was enough of a breeze to keep things comfortable. The room had a balcony, but it was only large enough for two patio chairs. There is a mini-fridge and a tiny microwave. There is also a safe, but it was too small to fit a regular size laptop. The room overall was clean, but looks like it could use a floor to ceiling cleaning because many of the walls had dirt spots on them. In regards to the noise issue mentioned in other reviews, it is loud. Even on the higher floors away from Ala Wai, it is still loud. So, if you have sensitivity to noise when sleeping, bring ear plugs. The noise bothered me the first night, but I got used to it after that. My boyfriend, on the other hand, never adjusted and needed his earplugs.Location - The location was perfect for our needs which was visiting friends who live in the area. If you are looking for a place very close to the water, then you will be disappointed. It is about a 5-10 minute walk to the Kalakaua Ave which is the main street along the beach. It then takes another 3 minutes or so to actually get through the hotels and out to the beach. It isn't too bad, but it isn't a quick trip down to the beach. There a a number of restaurants of varying price and type nearby, a Food Pantry grocery store a block away, and, of course, a number of ABC Stores.

I visited this hotel for 10 nights at the start of February - my boyfriend and I (both in our early 30s) were first time visitors to Waikiki and managed to get this hotel for a reasonable rate so we weren't sure what to expect.The hotel is situated a short walk from the beach and several shops and restaurants. We were also close to the bus stop, which was perfect for us. the room was very clean and was cleaned well throughout our stay. We had a balcony but it looked out onto an ugly building opposite and it was extremely noisy so not really very useful! The room was small by US standards but we were happy with it for what we paid. We had complimentary beach towels and a free safe and the shower worked fine. The pool area is tiny and so is the fitness suite so don't stay here if these things are important to you!I would have given an extra star but the day before we checked out I asked the receptionist if they could find out what time our transfer with Roberts was booked for as I hadn't received an email confirming the time. However, rather than just calling them up (which would have taken 2 minutes max) I was given a phone number and pointed to the pay phone. I've stayed at a lot of hotels of varying quality and would expect it to be no trouble for the hotel to check something as basic as this for us!

Where to begin! I have been to Waikiki 7 times and in all my trips have stayed at an Aqua Resort, including the Aloha Surf. The first time I stayed there was great, so much so I talked the rest of my family into staying there on our return trip. I was offered a good rate for being a returning customer, however if they would have told me that I would be treated so poorly, I probably wouldn't have taken the offer. The first problem was a combination of miscommunication on both my part and theirs. We had got the dates of our arrival mixed up, and we turned up a day before they were expecting us and they had no rooms. I had called the hotel twice prior to arriving to confirm and not once anyone mentioned that they had a different date for us. Because of this, my mother, grandmother, sister in law and brother in law, my partner and my 5 month old baby and myself (6 adults and a baby) had to stay in one room for the first night. No one was overly apologetic for this, however at least we had somewhere to sleep. The next issue we had was our airconditioner was extremely loud, as well as our toilet, as they had maintenance issues with it, so we could not flush at night as it would wake our baby, it was that loud. I was also called at 10pm at night to go down to reception to sign a form in regards to beach towels etc, which they forgot to ask me to sign on check in. When I asked if I could come down in the morning as I was trying to get my baby to sleep, they said no and that I had to go down once the baby was asleep, nevermind I was in my PJ's and dead tired. This was my 2nd night so its not like they couldn't get me to sign it in the next 10 days we were there! It is in a loud location, so I wouldn't recommend anyone with a baby to stay there. However, it is close to the supermarket and not far from the beach.They take $100 bond on check in, which is fine, but we then realised they had not only taken $100 for a bond but $1000 on top of this. When we asked them about this they said it was hotel policy, so too bad if we wanted to access that money while we were there and to pay by another form of payment. They didn't mention this to us either on check-in, only discovered it when checking our account. This also caused problems on checkout as the money had been frozen (because of them) and then when we went to check out they couldn't unfreeze it and then asked for another credit card to finalised payment. We ended up walking out to catch our flight and leaving it with them to sort out as it was 5.30am and they wanted us to call our bank (in another country) to get the money unfrozen, which again, they froze in the first place without our permission. For the entire stay I felt like I was a pain, even though we asked for nothing from them and didn't complain about anything while we were there. I'm not sure what has happened with the Aqua chain over the last couple of years but it wasn't what I have remembered and would not recommend anyone staying there again.

This hotel would rate a 21/2 stars in my book. It definitely "grew on us" as our stay went on. Location (just a couple of blocks from Waikiki Beach and shopping and restaurants) made it a good find forus. The staff is friendly and helpful. We would return, but yo need to be aware that it is not on the beach and the rooms are small. We were not in Honolulu to spend time in our hotel room, so the cost and location made this a perfect find for us...clean room...nice staff...decently quiet and good price.

Hotel was close to everything, the beach, the shops and the restaurants all were within 1 to 3 blocks of hotel. Front Desk personal were very helpful and we were checked in and out very quickly. We also received a free breakfast everyday. The hotel room was clean and it came with a refrigerator, microwave and a safe all included for no extra charge. The room was also equipped an internet cable to connect to the web for free and free Wi-Fi in lobby. Overall a great value.

My family and I stayed here on our first trip to Oahu last year. When we arrived, their were two employees behind the desk. One was helping another customer the other seemed to be avoiding helping us. She walked away from the desk a few times, then unhappily asked us if we needed help. When she looked up our reservations (made 6 months in advance) they were nowhere to be found. She then told us they didn't have any rooms available. After a 10 minute wait, she was able to find a room for us. The room was tiny. The couch in the room was covered with stains it was disgusting.The bathroom was also tiny, it will only accomodate one person at a time. Their was no tub for my children to bathe in. The bathroom didn't even have a normal door. It was a sliding wooden door without a lock that didn't even shut completley. The balcony is no place for children! I piled up all the luggage infront of the door to make sure the kids didn't make their way out there. During our stay, people were running up and down the halls, yelling, and slamming doors well into the wee hours of the morning. Thankfully the kids never woke up but I didn't get much sleep. The area the hotel is located in can be a little scary at night. Paking is minimal and expensive. Elevators were slow. This is not the place to stay if you have kids. Perhaps young adults on a budget would find this hotel adequate.

I traveled alone from Japan, so I was anxious about staying.But once I checked in, hospitality of this hotel really moved me!1)Japanese female staff was quite considerate; she speaks Japanese very well and gave me a lot of information about staying. When I asked her to change the room because of noise from the next room, she was quick to take the procedure. 2)Every staff on the front desk was kind. When I asked them to do something, they always smiled and dealt with me warmly. 3)Even after I checked out, female staff supported me. Although I kept my swim suits and other gears in my suit case for departure and left the case in the hotel, I wanted to swim again. I asked her to give me help with my poor English and she patiently heard me out and lent me beach towel! Thanks for this hotel, my stay in Hawaii was so superb!!! I will recommend Aqua aloha and surf to every friend of mine in Japan!

This was my 18th stay at the Aloha Surf. It must be a good hotel since I keep returning every year.The staff are friendly, efficient knowlegible and helpful.I've always been welcomed and upon arrival this year I found a Huge basket of "goodies" in my room, compliments of the hotel.The room was bright and spacious with all the amenities one would wish in a hotel. TV, air conditioner, room safe,queen size bed, sofa, microwave and fridge.Many rooms have a view of the golf course, canal or the ocean.The hotel provides a hearty breakfast and coffee off the lobby 24/7. For the athletic types there are several exercise machines and a secluded outdoor pool. Every Tuesday the hotel has a Happy Hour where hotel patrons and staff can mingle and get to know each other with the GM mixing and pouring his secret exotic drinks.The hotel is located on a quiet street but close to the beach, shopping, International Market, entertainment places and bus routes. With the welcoming anf friendly staff and first class accommodation I will be coming back again next year for my 19th visit.

Very freindly staff, tuesday is free drinks in lobby (manager's evening to meet hotel guests). Free breakfast every morning, smoking area with table & chairs , big screen tv just outside the building. Fridge,microwave & coffee maker in room. Nice little sandwich/snack shop on site. Coffee machine in lobby 24/7 that actually grinds the coffee beans (good coffee), it is free & it actually tastes very good. Laundry facility available. Hotel room was nice & spacious with a balcony. Also don't tell anyone, but we recieved a free complimentary bottle of wine during our stay there. Excellant stay. Thank you Aloha Surf, we shall return.

My husband and I stayed here a while ago. The location is great. It's within walking distance of cool waikiki shops (pretty much the only reason we'd hang out in waikiki), close to the beach and other nicer beachfront hotels that have lovely bars you can easily walk down to and get a cocktail at sunset.Our first room was ridiculous. It was so small I don' t know how they got the furniture in. For a small fee we upgraded to a nicer (larger) room on an upper floor (actually the one TripAdvisor uses for the hotel's profile pic). WELL WORTH the minimal fee. There's an ABC store downt the street - there's an ABC store down every street come to think of it - and you can walk down and get snacks and frosty beverages and take them back to your room to save some extra $$. I love getting their tuna roll & other triangle shaped hand rolls for breakfast.This hotel is totally cute too. They have a free cocktail mixer on one of the nights and they don't make you feel very welcome and not like a cheapskate for drinking a few (10) cups of the delicious drink the manager made.Most of the time you're out and about in Honolulu but we slept like kittens while here.It felt clean and not creepy. The staff was polite as well. I would fully stay here again. Great little hotel for when you need somewhere to lay your head in between your explorations.

We booked this hotel and stayed last week. The room is on 2nd floor with no views at all.There's a fee for parking but we are lucky to find free spot on street. In room wired internet access for free. But the room itself is too tiny, bathroom could only fit in one person.It has microwave, fridge, etc. Location is good tho.I won't recommend this hotel.

I have been to Oahu approximately 17 times and have stayed at the Aqua Aloha Surf 7 times. My last visit was the week of 1/10-1/17/2012. I was extremely surprised at the poor service. The rooms were not cleaned properly, there were dishes left in the sink, complimentary coffee was not provided daily, and the shower area smelled like mildew. When I called the desk to ask for coffee, I was told that I had to go downstairs and get it myself. The personnel at the front desk were rude and unwilling to help. The people at the continental buffet were rude and unfriendly. I mentioned that the pancakes were cold and the lady touched it with her fingers and then put it back on the grill to serve it to someone else. There were no bowls to put the cream of wheat into, so I was given a syrofoam cup to use. I have always recommended your hotel to all my friends and family because it was clean, friendly and convenient. I am very disappointed with the service and cleanliness of your hotel.

You get what you pay for. This is a 3 star hotel and it basically provides what a 3 star hotel would provide. The lobby is open and spacious. Free wifi down there. The room was fine. We "upgraded" to a supreme room which provided us with a bit more room and a eastern king bed. We also had a balcony facing to the street/canal. The building itself is very old, so the room was obviously old (popcorn ceiling, sliding door to the bathroom that didn't really stay in place, no vent in the bathroom=moldy smell). The room was kept clean.Their continental breakfast was fine. As mentioned by others, plenty of pancakes, toast, some random sweet cakes and a fruit. It's very standard.The hotel provides you with beach towels and beach chairs. Pretty cool deal. Located 3 blocks from the beach, easy walk to it and to the strip.Parking is $20 a day. I found it sort of outrageous, but parking in general in Waikiki is outrageous. So, be aware of that.Overall, it was an ok place to stay at. We were only there at night to sleep, so it pretty much met our needs.

The room I stayed in was dirty, the bathroom had hair all over the place, the toilet paper holder was full of rust and to complete it all While i was sleeping I smelled something horrible I eventually fell asleep when I woke up I noticed that the bed linen was stained and smelled so bad, it look to be like a throw up stain or something. The room was so small and the bed was small also. I would not reccomend this hotel

Stayed here for 3 days on April 2007. Rooms are spic and span, very cosy, the rooms facinf Kanekapolei Street have a great ocean and Diamond Head crater view. Surely would refer this for a stay at the heart of Waikiki just a block away from the world famous beach.

The best part about this hotel is its location. It's on a quiet street, just 2 blocks from Waikiki beach! This is a 2.5 or 3 star hotel, so don't expect 4 or 5 star amenities. I chose this hotel because I wanted an affordable, safe place to stay while I was on the island for a week. I stayed in a "Moderate" room, and I only have 2 gripes:1) There was no chair in the room. I had nowhere to sit but on the bed. 2) There was no wifi in the room, just in the lobby. And the connection there can be patchy. Other than these 2 things, I'd come here again if I wanted to stay in Waikiki. But I'd probably upgrade to a better room.
Hotel was clean and staff was very helpful its not a 5 star but was sufficient considering ur not in ur room a lot . It was close to everything if u dont mind a short walk to the beach.

I stayed in a superior room on the 15th floor. "Superior" is somewhat exalted for what is a simple tourist hotel, but a rather good budget choice in Waikiki.Pro:The half block around the corner from Kuhio Avenue makes a world of difference in peacef and quiet. There's little noise or sleaze for almost no loss of location.Rooms are clean and pleasant. Each room has a small terrace.Staff is friendlyExtremely reasonable rates available directly from the hotel (search online for promo codes!)Free wired internet.Minor cons:Hotel decor is faded and the design looks cheap and modular - but this is a budget hotel.There is a very small exercise area on the ground floor; I did not bother with it.Breakfast is free, but uninspired. Boxed cakes and pastries, sliced apples and oranges. Someone also makes fresh pancakes. Not worth making a special effort to eat.No major problems.All in all, a good choice for families or budget travelers.
user_name:
FlyBalletGuy
New York City, New York

review_body: If you're looking for an affordable hotel with great service in Waikiki, Aqua Aloha Surf is the perfect place. The hotel is not an ocean front, but everything is within walking distance. The beach is just a couple of blocks away. Shops, restaurants, and covenients stores are just around the corner. The hotel rooms are not a five-star rooms, but they're cleaned and spacious. Maid service is excellent. The hotel front desk clerks are awesome! The minute you walk in to hotel lobby, it's like you never left home because the clerks make you feel like home. Most hotels charges for internet connection, but at this hotel, internet is complimentary. In addition, breakfast is also complimentary. This might be a 2 or 3 star hotel, but the service that i've received, to me is a 5-star!

This was the second hotel I stayed at in Waikiki. Both of these had a similar feel to them and I understood why when I found out that the Aqua-hotels also run the Best Western I stayed at earlier. The location is pretty good (a few blocks from the beach, close to major bus lines) being both fairly central and still quiet.The check-in experience was not exactly the best. The guy at the front desk seemed less than happy having people disturb him. We arrived at around two and were told the room was not ready yet. In a sense it was fine since check-in time was at three but usually they can provide one clean room an hour before check-in (especially when they had a sign with vacancy outside the entire time we stayed there) but service did not appear to be at the top of the agenda. No offer to take care of our bags so asked if they could store and then was told it would be possible. Returned at three and the room was ready then, it was however now a lady at the front desk and had to go through showing passport (ID-card was not accepted and) providing credit card details again. The pace that she worked at was probably the slowest I ever seen - took around 10 minutes for her to just check passport, get the credit card details and then just hand us the key.The room was on a high floor and it was a pleasant surprise. The room was larger than expected with room for a sofa and table in addition to the bed. The view from the balcony was also better than expected,could see both the ocean and the river. The room also had a sink where they also placed a microwave oven, kitchen utensils, coffee maker and a fridge. The decor was however a bit worn but must admit that it was not without charm. What we could however done without was the paper thin doors. In combination with a very loud cleaning lady (she was constantly screaming, talking etc in the corridor) did not make it easy to sleep in.In the bathroom there was only a shower with not the best water pressure and it was fairly small but still sufficient. The main negative about the room was the fact that there was no WiFi - I was surprised that any hotel these days do not offer WiFi in the room. Wired internet was acceptable 10 years ago now but these days it is just not good enough to only have WiFi in the lobby. The breakfast that was provided was not good - poor selection and quality and the breakfast was only open from 7 to 9 and when we showed up at 8.50 one day there was almost no food left - asked for some additional things but was just told that this was what they had. Was then rushed to finish before 9 - not that difficult since there was almost no food.There is a pool that is fairly ok in size but it was a bit cold and also almost no sun so not the best place to hang out but I would imagine most people prefer the beach. There is also a tiny fitness center (three machines and one of these, the treadmill, was broken). Nice added benefit was however they provide beach towels free of charge.Price-wise the hotel is still a decent deal but I do believe that there are better options in the same price range (for example I would rather stay at the Best Western Coconut that I stayed at earlier). Would probably not repeat the stay here next time mainly due to the lack of service attitude among the personnel, poor breakfast and lack of WiFi in the rooms.
Not a bad spot near downtown Waikiki. Walking distance to downtown and the top floors have a nice big lanai.

I stayed at the Aqua Aloha Surf hotel last year at the same time. This time I was here 12/21 and left 12/25. Great room service, a good continental breakfast, only a couple blocks from the International Market place and about 3 1/2 blocks from Waikiki beach and I got a GREAT deal on my room. They are only 1 block away from ABC stores (similar to 7-11 stores), a grocery store and a bunch of restaurants and bar. You just can't beat if for the price and service!

Loved staying here - staff were friendly and helpful. This is a no frills hotel, great central location. We had 4 in the room and it was fine, its not like you spend a lot of time in your room. Breakfast was ok and good free wifi access in foyer! if you want to save your money for the fun things stay here! I will be back for sure!

My daughter and I stayed twice at the Aloha Surf hotel on our trip last year in november 2010.the first time when we first got to Hawaii for a few days before we left for Maui , and then for 3 days before we flew out. I picked the hotel initially based on the reviews on trip advisor. And boy were the reviews right- great room for great price, great location and great atmosphere. Warm and friendly staff and free brekky! The only issues really 1. Would prefer a kettle instead of a coffee machine that way could have tea or coffee option. 2. It wolud great if free internet was avaible in rooms wireless - it was hard as there were not too many power outlets to plug in your laptop. We had no qualms staying there on our return to Waikiki. I have been slow to Put in a review, but from the recent reviews , it sounds like the standards are being maintained. Hawaii was such a lovely surprise experience for us, in that I didn't really have any expectations. mainly as I am not really a beach goer (plus we have great beaches here in Sydney). but was so blown away by the wonderful people and thewonderful place it is. This hotel was definitely a true indicator of what we would continue to experience during our stay in the Hawaiian islands. We are definitely returning there.

This is my 2nd time to this place. A lot has changed in a decade since I was last here. The hotel had been sold and renovated. Its a bit more modern and tried to look trendy but theres nothing fancy about it. Its a 2 star, barely, and I didnt expect much. I got what I expected for $80. Booked on line thru expedia and stayed in late November.I had a single room with a queen bed. My room was 200 square feet. Yes thats right 200 sq ft including the bath room. For those who arent good with math a queen size bed takes up about a third of that area and the bath room the other third. Also crammed in there was a desk a night stand and a mini fridge with microwave. It was cozy to say the least. Im glad it was just me. There would have been no room for a wife any way. The bed was comfy with good linnen. The bathroom had only a shower, no tub. Thats the way it was a decade ago. My room was on the 2nd floor with a scenic view of the top of the lobby canopy and air conditioning units. The pool was ice cold. I dont understand why on Oahu other than expensive energy costs, they dont heat the pools. Its like they dont want people to use them. All the pools on Maui are heated. Wifi in the lobby. Internet in the room is free but requires cat 5 cord which they will loan from the front desk. They also loaned nice beach towels out too.On Wed night the manager has a blue hawiian cocktail party that was a nice touch. Staff were friendly and helpful. Theres a full grocery store at the end of the block. The beach is 2 and a half blocks away.One thing they need is a courtesy room or poolside change room with showers for guests to freshen up at if they have a late flight out. I cant believe Mexico is ahead of Hawaii on this.This is a cheap, clean basic hotel. Dont expect much and if the price were right I might even stay here again, but I'd pay to get a bigger room if I wasnt solo.

I was very impressed with this hotel, based on previous reviews i was expecting a pretty basic place, however the very first night i was their they had a manager's reception, which happens every tuesday and provided free drinks and massages to guests as well as a amgician for entertainment. I thoughly enjoyed this, in addition they where very accomadating. I had a very late flight, and left my luggage at the hotel, with out problems, in addition they let me take a towl for the day, charged me and made a note on my file that i was to be credited back the funds upon return of the towel, usually this sort of thing causes problems as to many different people are involved, however here they credit back the amount charged for the towel with our issue. I would highly recommend anyone to stay here, however it is not supper fancy just a good hotel wiht great service

I'm a frequent neighbor island traveler and I've stayed at many hotels in Waikiki. I found this gem last summer and have stayed there ever since. The staff is so friendly and helpful and always make me feel welcome. The rooms, bed, showers and decor are nice and well appointed. It is also located close to everything, with the beach, grocery stores, restaurants and the main bus lines just steps away. While maybe not the most luxurious hotel in Waikiki, it is the friendliest and gives great value. I recommend it to all my friends!

My co worker and I just returned from a 10 day stay at this hotel. I will have to say EVERYTHING was great!!! ALL of the staff were very helpful, the beds were amazingly comfortable, the breakfast was tasty, room was clean, hot showers every time, Managers party on Tuesday night was lots of fun, just minutes from the beach, the pool was a bit small, but who cares, we were at the beach!! Thank you all so much!!! Will be returning!!! I give it a 10 out of 10!!!!! K Hazel NS

well I wasnt going to write a review this early but Im forced. Right now am waiting for my room since I arrived at 2pm and the fd agent vinno(not sure) said my room is not ready. For real an hour bfre check in time at 3pm? I let it pass however what annoyed me is that he didnt even tell me anything abt the hotel jst told me the bell will store my bags. He was on the phone also which annoyed me also. I also work in the hotel industry and I teach my team not to so all the things that this fd agent did. Thank god I work in a hotel so I was able to squeeze some info from him. I calles the reaort many times to request early check in and they all tols me its in my res and its ok but I guess it is not.I will update how.my stay since I will be hers for 4 days.

Great Location, Friendly staff, Excellent wired internet, Clean rooms,. Quick check-in/out, Hassle free. If you want something simple for breakfast, this is it. No bacon,ham or eggs, loads of freshly made pancakes. Be punctual. Great value for money. Minutes to the beach and supermarket (Food Pantry) or the many ABC stores. Staff extremely helpful... had a problem with the TV audio system, it was rectified immediately. Who needs a TV when you have a balcony to relax and chill. Only one ICE machine at the lobby level. Laundry at basement, get key from reception. I recommend this hotel for a safe and clean stay. Did I mention the great location...

We stayed in aloha surf hotel, for 15 nights, nice hotel whit a small pool you´ll never use, because you have waikiki beach just 2 minutes walk, restaurants and shops they are all arround, better if you choose a room whit a balcony nice to sit in the night and see the views. We didn´t like the breakfast sistem, not much table and some times you have to have your breakfast in the lobby. it´s not the best hotel in the city but isn´t the worst.

this is a budget place to stay, rooms dated but clean, wi-fi in room is wired, pretty slow, but works. Free wi-fi in lobby areas but few outlets. Go over to area near fitness machines and vending. Complimentary breakfast is from 7-8:30 I think, we never actually ate there, made it one morning but signs all over continental buffet saying no take outs. coffee, microwave and refrigerator set up in room worked well for snacks and drinks, TV in room is what my husbands calls one eye ball TV, fairly small but then we didn't spend much time watching it anyway. Did rent DVD one evening and had some trouble getting DVD player to work sent help up right away and helped figure it out, Very Nice. Staff was really great and very helpful, explained hotel policies clearly and helpfully. It was really nice being so central in Waikiki, beach is just blocks away. Not sure we'd stay here again but will try one of the chains more upscale hotels nearby for sure.

My wife an I spent only one night in Honolulu and we chose Aqua Aloha. The lobby is open air and very beautiful. The room was partial ocean view on the tenth floor and the view was not bad at all. The room was clean and the balcony was nice. Very comfortable bed. Views are limited due to the towers all being crammed into a small space. The lobby was beautiful and the staff was very helpful in our travel needs. A three block walk and we were in the water. If you want clean, safe, and affordable, I recommend this hotel.

the best hotel I ever stayed. very good location, friendly staff, excellent value. our room was clean and all beds in the room very comfortable. there is no restaurant, but many places to eat you will find around.

This is the second Aqua resort we have stayed at. We stayed at the Aqua Bamboo and Spa in 2010 and loved it but the prices went up for 2011 and it wasn't as affordable. We decided to try the Aqua Aloha because it still served a continental breakfast but was still quite affordable. The Aqua Aloha Surf and Spa is clean, comfortable, and close to everything. If you are looking for a five star resort, this is not it but if you are looking for Waikiki on a budget but do not want to suffer in your lodging definitely consider this place. It is a five minute walk to the beach. I found it a bit quieter than the Bamboo because it is on a side street as well. There is a pool but no hot tub which I was disappointed about and every Wednesday (I think) they serve drinks and chocolates and have entertainment. The breakfast is okay, a bit more than the Bamboo, pancakes, toast, bagels, fruit, porridge, juice, and coffee. I am celiac so there was not much offered for me for breakfast and instead of pancakes being cooked on a griddle it would be nice if a non carbohydrate was offered such as eggs as there is already toast and such. The rooms are large, they gave us a free room upgrade without even having to ask for one. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. There is no wireless internet in the rooms you have to ask for a internet cable for the rooms. There is wireless in the lobby. They offer water and coffee in the lobby. There is also a little cafe attached to the hotel were they serve breakfast and lunch. We are going back January 2012 to the Aloha and cannot wait to be back in Hawaii.

Super location, free hi-speed internet and free breakfast as well. We had a deluxe room with king bed and it came with a microwave, mini-fridge and real dishes and utensils as well. Yes, the bathroom is small, but worked well enough. The small balcony provided a view of the city and peek-a-boo ocean view. Yes, it is noisy, as the windows are not insulated. So, if you have a problem with sleeping, be sure to bring ear plugs. We were on the 12th floor but there was still plenty of street noise. The breakfast was not that bad, we had freshly made pancakes every morning. If you have to pay extra for it, then you can do better somewhere else. For what we paid, we really had no complaints.

g,day,spent a week in your hotel,found the room to be quite spacious and very clean,& well appointed.the 60,s style appointments in your hotel is great to stay in.will recomend to any one who visits honolulu,the three star rating is about right for this hotel.again many thanks for your service,ed. in 402.

I stayed here for 10 days and couldn't have asked for better. The room I had was so nice and comfortable, the frig, microwave and extra sink were a real bonus as was the lanai ( I got GREAT views on the corner room!) There is a great grocery store on the same block with very reasonable prices, easy walk to virtually all that Waikaki has to offer, and friendly service. I did quite a bit of research before booking this room and found it to be a fantastic deal. There is no need for a car if you are willing to walk or take a bus - a definate plus. I'm looking forward to staying here again soon.

My 14 yr old daughter and I stayed here in May 2011 for 2 nites. The room was clean and very comfortable, and roomy. The beds were comfortable. No complaints here. The lobby was very nice and the comp breakfast was okay too! We did not use the pool, as we went to the beach. The zoo was about a 15 -20 min walk which was a nice walk to "see" a less crowded and hustle bustle Waikiki! The ABC stores VERY close to buy my bottles of beer and pop- NOT overpriced there like a grocery store at home, cheaper than gas stationprices!!! One block away or so from Intl Marketplace. Would definitely stay here again!

We stayed at the Aloha Surf for 7 nights in October. STAFF:The hotel staff are very friendly and accomodating. The manager was especially helpful.LOCATION: Less then 3 blocks from the beach, close to resturants, ABC stores, anything you need. Being a few blocks off the main road also means less noise!ROOMS: Clean, very comfortable beds! Rooms equipped with small refrigerator, coffee maker. A bit small but how much time do you spend in the room anyway?VALUE: can't go wrong for the price!
Aqua Aloha Surf Hotel was a very nice hotel. The room was super cute. I highly recommend it!!

Hotel close to the beach, and amazingly quiet. Room was very clean, the continental breakfast was good, and the staff very helpful and accomidating. We upgraded and essentially got a free massage, which my wife said was wonderful. The room was somewhat smaller than we had envisioned, but we were gone from daylight to late night every day, so it wasn't a problem at all. If we ever return to Hawaii (we hope!!!!) it will be the first place we check out. Would recommend it highly to family and friends.

I had a small room at the 5th floor first, clean and very neat. But I could not close the window, so I asked for another room - it is very loud in Waikiki! And I got a new one immidiatly - this time at the 7th floor with lanai and a bit bigger.The rooms are very clean, you have a coffeemachine, a microwave and of course, a TV. Unfortunately Wi-Fi is just available in the lobby.The breakfast is free of charge, but not recommendable. Eating in the lobby is not enjoying at all and the food was bad as well.If noise is not a problem for you, this hotel is definitly recommendable. But I´m going to spent my next stay somewhere else, outside Waikiki - because I coulnd´t sleep for 2 nights - too noisy there.So, the sleep quality is affected by traffic noise and party people though the beds were great - so I just rate it as average

This hotel is located two blocks from the beach and is very clean and accomodating. They offer a free cooked breakfast each morning, as well as beach towels for your use. Rooms also have a refrigerator which is great for keeping bottled water cool for each day's outings, microwave, coffee maker and an in-room safe. Our room had a king sized bed which was very comfortable. We stayed for our anniversary and on arrival they had a box of chocolate macadamia nuts waiting on our bed. All the major shuttle services provide service to the hotel. The pictures on their website are very accurate of the rooms and lobby. Wonderful open lobby and every Tuesday was Manager's night in the lobby with free drinks and macadamia nuts. There is an ABC on the very next corner towards the beach which offers bus schedules, great price on bottled water and probably anything you need in a pinch.

Aqua Aloha Surf was a great hotel. Friendly staff that were willing to help was a huge bonus I didn't expect. Rooms were very clean and not near as noisy as other reviews claimed. The beach is seriously 3 blocks away and the walk is easy. Shuttles to Pearl Harbor, the airport, etc. are easily accessible and there are plenty of trails/sidewalks to run on around the hotel. Area can be dark at night (as far as walking alone goes,) so it's important to walk with a friend. Great hotel for the price--I will definately stay here again!!

The pictures on the website are quite accurate of the hotel, and I think that 3-star is an accurate rating. The rooms are quite dated, but I found that it was comfortable and big enough that I did not feel cramped (on my own). I was on the 5th floor, with a balcony. The room was equipped with a great mini-fridge, a small microwave and a small coffee maker. There was only a shower (no bath) but plentiful hot water.There was a good deal of noise from the hallway and Ala Wai Blvd, and from the hallway, both of which I could sleep through. The noise that I found most bothersome was from the previously adjoining room. While it was closed off, it was off-putting to hear someone coughing in the next room.I did not go for the included breakfast because it was only available for short times (7am-8:30am I believe), and that didn't work for my schedule.I was pleased with the hotel service - they extended my checkout time by an hour so that I could spend my last morning at the beach, and stored my luggage until it was time for me to leave for the airport.Tips:This hotel is an extra block away from the beach if you're comparing to the Kuhio Avenue hotels. There's a Foodland one block over for some reasonably priced meals and supplies.There was slow but reliable WiFi in the lobby.Bring plates/cutlery if you'll need them in the room. Only two spoons provided with mugs for coffee.

We booked into this hotel twice (before and after) our trip to Kona (Big Island) from Australia to partake in an outrigger canoe competition in early September. The hotel is somewhat dated (but has been revamped in recent years). It is centrally located (near many shops and transport modes) and not far from the main beach. The hotel's lobby area is spacious, comfortable, welcoming. The rooms are clean, tidy, comfortable, adequately equipped with the essential utilities. Staff are genuinely friendly, polite, competent, efficient, accommodating. The hotel Manager (Tim Clark) is an excellent manager who is very friendly and genuinely listens to his hotel customers. I personally know of very few managers who seem to constantly monitor customer feedback (on sites such as Trip Advisor) and genuinely make the effort to address negative feedback. One such example is the hotel's internet availability: Earlier in the year I (whilst I was planning our Hawaii itinerary) I had noticed (through TripAdvisor) that there had been some criticism of internet unavailability in the hotel's rooms; this matter was certainly resolved by the time of our stay. Regarding noise, many of the hotel rooms seem to be equipped with louvres (rather than glazed windows); when these louvers are not (or do not) shut properly, the room air conditioners are forced to work constantly and give rise to elevated (but tolerable) noise levels. For those who happen to be spending Tuesday night at the hotel, take the opportunity to enjoy the Manager's Happy Hour- free cocktails accompanied by a free sideshow of entertainers including musicians, magicians and masseurs! (quite a spectacle, particularly for kids!). In summary: This hotel is quite comfortable, enjoyable, good-value for the standard of accommodation it provides (and particularly suited for visitors of all ages on average travel budgets). Hotel staff are friendly and the hotel Manager (Tim Clark) is a genuinely caring Manager to deal with. Highly recommended. Tim, we hope to see you again on our next Hawaiian trip!

Stayed here for five nights in March 2011. Room was a pretty good size, but my only complaint was the bed. WAY too soft; there was some sort of mattress cover on it under the sheets that made everything kind of bunch up in the middle. Other than that, the continental breakfast was a good deal, included in our stay.

We stayed in Waikiki for 5 nights at another Aqua Hotel and could only rave about the Hotel. After a 7 night cruise we made our next stop at this location. We arrived in the morning from our cruise - about 10:40 AM and we were told that our room was not ready and would not be ready until at least 12:30 PM. We kind of expected that and I knew this hotel has laundry facility so we asked if we could go do that first. Our front desk check in person appeared to be quiet, soft spoken and not the most helpful. He did tell us we could leave our suitcases safely with them - but did not tell us where laundry was, or that we needed a key, nor how to find the laundry room itself! We eventually found the basement location - a small room tucked away back in a corner - locked for safety - with 2 washers and dryers. Now although the cost of the machines was good - one washer leaked and there was a puddle of water in the corner and the room smelled musty. Someone had a wash on and a drying on and the washers run quickly and the dryer goes for a long time so we spent all of our time there waiting for the drying person to come back and take out their stuff so we could finish our washing! The room iyself was very hot and the vent came out right outside the door so it was a sauna around the area - no place to sit and I had no faith to go and leave our stuff unattended! Also the dryer vent screen was loose and so a lot of lint stuff flying around - in fact some bikes parked outside the door were covered in lint. A little care could be given to this area!Once we were done laundry, our room was ready. We only had a double bed and a single bed and after having had 2 queens at the last hotel - this was a little disappointing. The room itself was adequate and did have a couch which was a nice change and much more comfy to sit on. We also had dishes which previous hotel did not - we were able to purchase food items we bought from the Food Pantry - a block away - and save ourselves some money and provide convenience. The small fridge was inside a cupboard and seemed to be running quite hot when the door was closed - we left the cupboard door ajar and it seemed to work better.The Air conditioner was located in the far corner, beside the couch and down by the floor. It was extrememly difficult to get the whole room down to a bearable temp as the air does not circulate like it should. We never did feel comfortable unless stting right beside couch and I found myself getting up in the night and sleeping on the couch for awhile to cool down. Previous location had central air - much better!Pool area was small - but ok area and a BBQ for customer use as well as nice wicker loungers and cushions. We actually enjoyed the pool several times. There is also a nice seating area - open air - with table and chairs - all part of the lobby area that was quite nice. Large TV in lobby, water to drink etc. No view from our room what so ever, not that it was a huge deal and although it was up one block off of Kuhio - was no where near as convenient as previous Aqua Hotel. The room cleaner - we asked only for clean towels and more coffee on the 2nd day so she got off lightly. On the next day we were out - but she left no coffee, no spare Toilet Paper but left extra towels. To be fair - we could have gone and asked for it - but it was annoying just the same.We did have occasion to ask other questions of the front desk staff and found everyone else to be completely friendly and helpful. I had no problem booking a spa appt, getting directions or getting my boarding passes printed. I took advantage of the Early Bird Spa Special on the day my son went golfing and highly recommend it! The gal was very good and I felt wonderful - money well spent!

Thanks to previous tripadvisor posts regarding this property for helping me make the decision about where to stay in Waikiki on a budget. The staff is courteous, the public areas are comfortable and welcoming. The room (a Deluxe-Queen facing front of bldg.) was large and well appointed: mini-fridge, coffee maker, microwave, sink, dishes and silverware, sofa & coffee table. The bed was soooo comfortable. There was a shower but no tub. In-room safe, flat-screen tv, air conditioner w/remote control and a comfy balcony with partial views of both the ocean to the right and the canal & mountains to the left. Housekeeping was wonderful and thorough. Location is good, although the hotel sits on the corner of two very busy streets and it is noisy. A big plus -there is a large grocery store right around the corner. No bar/No restaurant but plenty nearby. Spa is small - but staff is friendly and massage was one of the best I've ever had. Booked a tour thru the on-site tour desk. Minuses: the Cont. Breakfast is not worth visiting, the furniture is dated but not worn, the black-out drapes need replacing...the lining was cracked and torn. I would stay here again and would recommend it to others. Felt safe, even as a female travelling solo.
user_name:
gogoddess
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We had a room on the upper corner of the hotel, it was very clean, reasonably quiet, and comfortable. Bed was very comfortable indeed. The A/C was a little noisy at night, but this is really a minor issue. The staff were all very efficient and friendly, especially Joyce, in the tour booking area. Loved the Tuesday evening Managers happy hour,his "wipe out" cocktail was great. The breakfast is not something to get excited over. We chose to have it only the once during our 10day stay. Overall, I would reccomend this hotel to anyone who wanted to have value for money, be central to all things, and experience the "Aloha spirit" that the staff all seem to demonstrate. Thank you to management and staff for making our stay memorable.
user_name:
Rae B
South Island, New Zealand

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights in Sept, we arrived a little after 10pm very tired after nearly 24 hours travelling, the staff where great at checking us in and offered me a cable for the internet at check in as he saw the laptop bag,we had the breakfast incl and my only complaint is that its on for a very short time, but I liked the coffee and pancakes, the room was basic but suited our needs, fridge was very useful and the in room coffee was good as well, house keeping cleaned the room daily, my only complaint would be the window not closing fully to keep out street noise, the hotel is a 2 min walk to nearest ABC store, just over 6 mins to beach, bus stops only 2 mins away and the food pantry (supermarket) 5 mins away, we have booked the hotel with a balcony this time for next May for 10 nights as we are going to Honolulu for my birthday yeah,( got a better price on Ebookers though than direct with hotel so no breakfast incl this time)

Stayed here for 13 nights and is a good base for exploring the island and just a 5 minute stroll to the beach . Rooms are not overbig but are adequate, tv coffee maker and fridge all in room. Cleaned daily and to a good standard. All the staff were very helpfull nothing was to much trouble for anyone.Dont miss the managers cocktail evening he certainly makes a good wipeout.
Clean adequate hotel nothing fancy, Decor is a little dated. Street facing rooms are quite noisy. Don't pay extra for breakfast buffet unless you love pancakes and toast that is all they have..

Several positives about this hotel, but not for the picky. I stayed 4 nights (Tues. - Fri.) in Oct. '11. Staff was friendly. All inquiries were handled smoothly & immediately. Room was very clean, bed was incredibly comfy, excellent water pressure in shower & all room amenities were new and in good working order. No problems with noise from other guests or staff - very quiet in that respect. Location can't really be beat especially for the price, but the trade off is you should expect noise. I was on the 12th floor (street side) and had street noise until about 11 pm. Slept soundly. Woke up to garbage trucks at 6 am but easily went back to sleep once they moved on. Despite upgrades, hotel shows its age & is a no-frills type of place. Only vending area was in the lobby. No valet & apparently no bellhops (not a big deal to me), but they did have a friendly security guy who wasn't bashful about doing his job. Parking is $20/night self-parking in area below lobby & lot next to hotel. (Tip: If you think you might rent a car, reserve it before your trip on a daily basis but be aware of return times. Easier to cancel a reservation than to try to get a car on a walk-in basis.) Room was on the small side - roughly 12'x14' and had no seating, simply the bed or the floor. Other rooms might offer more, but because I was traveling alone I was simply looking for an inexpensive place to sleep & shower, with a few specific amenities. No bathtub, only small shower stall, but again, had excellent pressure so no complaints. TV had your typical ABC, NBC, CBS fare. No premium channels. Overall, rough around the edges, but tries & was more than satisfactory for what I needed/wanted. Must say I know people who would NOT have stayed there and if I'd been traveling with a companion, might have upgraded a bit (something nicer in the same hotel?) but was fine for just me. Would recommend to certain personalities, but not for everyone. Again, solid 3+, but not a place if you're looking for luxury.

Can't go wrong here. I've stayed here two times now.A nice central location that lets you easily walk to everything in Waikiki and a few blocks away from the beach.The included breakfast isn't too bad, pancakes, toast, fresh fruit and the usual other stuff.No wifi but the connected internet isn't too bad (1.5 down) and you can borrow an ethernet cable that reaches pretty far.

Stayed here for 3 nights while in Oahu. We booked this vacation through discounthawaiicarrental.com. We had originally booked the standard room but called ahead of time to upgrade the room to a superior room based on the reviews here. At check in the front desk seemed a little stressed from being busy, probably could have used another person but was nice to us, this seemed to be the same each time we needed the front desk. I parked the car after check in which is $20 per day under the hotel. There’s not much parking under there, although we did find a spot each day, there’s also additional parking nearby if it’s full.Our room was on the 14th floor which had a nice view of the city and balcony which we enjoyed. The room was still very small. Which made us glad we upgraded, can’t imagine how small the standard room would have been. Room had a fridge, small TV, we did have a king bed which was very comfortable. The bathroom was ok, very small vanity separated from the business side of the bathroom.The continental breakfast was included with our room, which we had 2 of the 3 mornings. It was good considering other continental breakfasts hotel try to serve you. Other things: The lobby was very nice and open air as is much of Waikiki. We arrived on a Tuesday which had the manager’s reception which was nice. Free drinks, free 5 min chair massages (sign up early cause the line gets long). There’s a small pool which you would probably only use for a quick refresher, not really for lounging. They offer towels for use at the beach at the front desk.Overall: It’s an above average budget hotel, rooms are really all that, but the location is good as well as the amenities and price. Would consider again if visiting Waikiki on a budget.

We got in after 6pm in the evening. Front desk Vinh checked me in so efficiently and courteous. Got to the room on the 7th floor and got ready to hit Waikiki. I thought because we checked in late, that there wouldn't be parking, but that wasn't a problem. Had a great nights rest, because the bed was surprisingly very comfortable. Front desk Kevin was also very friendly and gracious to give us a later check out. Only option we missed was the continental breakfast in the lobby. Great staying at this superb location right in the heart of Waikiki, close to beach front, International market place, grocery store, restaurant, transportation, and night life clubs. I would recommend this Aqua property based on our short stay and the conveniences.

We have stayed here 3 times before this and we will keep staying here. The hotel is very clean, close to everything and the people are so friendly and helpful. We had such a great time there and highly recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in Waikiki. Local people check it out! You can't beat the rates and the free breakfast.

The room was on the 15th floor. The room was over 90 degrees when we arrived (at night). They had no fans to lend.The bathroom had a sliding door, and the toilet paper roll hung on the sliding door. It looked funny.The front desk person was not friendly. Finally, the parking lot was over sold. Very often there were no available spots. The breakfast had no protein.We won't stay here again.

I stayed here for a few nights and thought it was pretty excellent given its location and price. The rooms are fairly small, but have balconies, but everything in them looks clean and new - nice bed linen, lots of towels, etc. There's a swimming pool downstairs, and you're given a free beach towel to use in it, good amenities in the rooms, and most of all, the staff are really friendly and efficient. I stayed at the Queen Kapiolani for the same price on the same trip, and really regretted not having been at the Aqua Aloha the whole time. All in all, a great budget choice.
user_name:
goldenlorikeet
New York City, New York

review_body: This was my fourth time to stay at the Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki and I was very pleased withmy stay at the hotel. Just one block to the bus stop and as a medicare holder adult you can travel on the bus any where you need to go for $1.00. The hotel was clean and verycomfortable. I found everyone at the front desk to be very friendly and helpful.
Great hotel for the price, with great location and clean rooms. Hotel is a short walk from the best you can find at Waikiki Beach.

We were staying in overnight and I wanted to be sure of a good nights sleep so I upgraded to one of the superior rooms despite comments here about the tatty rooms and poor condition of the furnishings. The management had respoonded to these comments by saying they were working on them - we couldn't see any evidence of it. The room was tatty, the carpet was torn, marks on the walls, the a/c was excessively noisy.We weren't given breakfast vouchers and had to pay - it should have been included.However, the breakfast was hopeless and tired.I cancelled my return booking and went elsewhere for a better experience at a lower price.Don't go there.

We really enjoyed our stay on Oahu at the Aqua Aloha Surf Hotel. They are a few blocks away from the beach, located near the Ala Wai Canel. The rooms are fresh and clean. They include free continetal breakfast, newspaper, high-speed internet, mini refrigerator, coffeemaker and a 20" LCD tv. We walked to resturants, shopping, the beach and a grocery store. The staff is very helpful and friendly. There is a small pool and a few exercise machines. This was our second visit staying at this hotel. We have recommended the hotel to our friends.

I chose this hotel based on good reviews and the location. I was not disappointed with the location which was very close to the beach and close to shopping and food.The outside street noise was a little loud, but did not keep us awake. The service was great and staff very friendly. We had a small maintenance problem which was taken care of very quickly. Unfortunately I was told at the time I booked a few weeks before that we would have a room with 3 beds and found they only had a queen with sofa bed available to us.
