It seems that if you reserve a room (with payment) you should get what you request, especially if you are told you will, but hotels have the practice of giving preference to walk-up customers to make sure they get the business. However, after I reminded them of being promised the extra bed, they did put us in a room like we wanted the next night.  I did feel the quality of one of the rooms was a little lacking--the curtains were broken and had holes in them, and the air conditioner did not work very well. But both rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable.  We enjoyed the breakfast- it was limited to the usual continental breakfast fare- but was a nice bonus.  All in all, we enjoyed our stay here, and I give kudos to the staff for being very helpful and friendly which makes a big difference, and I would stay here again.

Great spot. Employees are very nice, and serviable. Hotel is very clean and pleasant.Room was cool and clean (micro wave, coffee machine, Tv, great bed).Hotel is near the beach, restaurants, and food stores 24/7 if you need something in the middle of the night ;-).Great place. Next time, if we return to waikiki, we return at the AQUA SURF ! no doubt !
just 2 blocks from the beach. Included breakfast. Friendly staff. I would stay here again.

Listen, this is a cheap hotel that is bundled with a lot of packages. You can stay at the Sheraton for the same price sometimes but you won't get airfare for half price. If you are looking at this it's because it fits your budget. Don't expect a fancy hotel and you'll be fine. Also don't expect to be treated sweetly if you come in with a hot temper. No one likes to be treated badly, including people who work in hotels.That said, our room was very clean and the staff are all very nice. I never went in the pool but I sat there a couple of times and it's okay for a tiny pool. Little kids seemed to have a good time there. We were upgraded upon arrival and got a room on 15th floor. One major bonus to this hotel is the balconies. We ate out there every morning and sipped drinks in the evening. Location is nice too. We went to the grocery store every day for fresh fruit and snacks. I'm only giving 3 stars because the room decor is dated, the beds are queen, parking is $20 (when available - so call ahead if you are driving in from the airport) and it's not on the water. We didn't eat breakfast there but if you love carbs in the morning this is your place. Pancakes, muffins, toast...oh my!

We were staying in Honolulu for two nights and didn't want to go crazy in terms of splurging for a hotel roo. After some research, I decided to go with the Aloha Surf and Spa Hotel as I had read good things about it. The price was low and the service was fantastic. On Tuesdays, they have a complimentary happy hour in which they serve a cocktail they make (the name slips my mind), and my friends and I loved it. Craig and Ofelia were so nice, and they just seemed so happy to go around the lobby, giving out chocolates and pouring their signature cocktails into empty glasses. Our room was great, and much to our surprise came with a microwave, coffee pot, and fridge. The location of the hotel is wonderful as well - just a few blocks from the main shopping streets, and a half a block from a beautiful canal that is perfect for jogging along. Everything is near by, which is what I look for in a hotel. Combine it with the price, and you've got a winner. The only minor setback is the breakfast - it is $4.95 for some pancakes, muffins, toast, and oatmeal. Personally, I dont think it's worth the price. If it was complimentary, then that would have been great. But given the small selection, I'd go elsewhere for breakfast.But regardless of that set back, I still gave it an excellent rating - I think the hotel is absolutely wonderful and I recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in Honolulu. Thanks Aloha Surf and Spa!

Overall I enjoyed my stay at the Aqua Aloha Surf. It's a good budget hotel, but I would stress that it is definitely a budget hotel. My interactions with the front desk staff was limited but they all seemed very nice. The Tuesday happy hour hosted by the manager was delicious. The location is very convenient right off of the two main-drags of Waikiki. The room was ok sized and the bed was comfy. However, the sofa was clearly stained and the curtains were pretty shabby and had cuts in them. The vanity area was very fine. The bath/shower was ok but it clearly needed to be updated. I know some people would have not accepted the minor stains under the tub faucet. I like the power saving feature I've seen a lot in Europe with the door key but it was frustrating to have to reset the time on the clock every night b/c it lost power every time I took my keycard out of the slot. The window a/c unit had a nifty remote but unfortunately the a/c is poorly positioned. It blows the cool air right onto the side of the sofa, which prevents it from getting across the room to the bed. The flat screen tv was fine but having a paper channel listing would have been nice.As other reviews have mentioned, the breakfast is pretty bad. I've seen a lot of continental breakfasts and other than the freshly made pancakes, it is the worst I've ever seen. Besides the pancakes, you have the choice of sliced apples and oranges, small grocery store bought muffins, some bread to toast and what looked like angel food cake. Plus some punch type drink. It was included in the price of my room but if not you can purchase it for $5. I'd go to IHOP instead. Overall, though, considering how much time I spent in my room, which wasn't much, I'd give this place a 3 out of 5.
Even though it was old building, because of price I thought of giving it 5 stars.But it was not at all kept clean.Also, my curtains were cut.But the location is great. So I would give it 3.

Looked at going to hawaii in 2010. we are last minuite bargain hunters but prices were more than we wanted to pay. in march contacted kirstin hart at travel bag with a budget not much more than our vacation to barbados the previous year.to our suprise she came up on budget with this hotel with we thought good flights. I most probably read every reiew on the hotel till we went. I will not bore you with details of location pool service staff etc needless to say the hotel did not let us down. we booked a basic room but asked for a quiet room but i would guess that basic rooms are on ground floors.noise is a issue in the area biggest culprits being garbage trucks and harleys which do not seem to have exhausts! however this is a observation not a complaint and after getting over the long journey to get there i slept as well as i did at home. if noise bothers you go high if you can it will help. aircon packed up on last day new unit fitted within hours.did 3 managers receptions one being their 10th birthday is this a record in 2 week stay! nice birthday cake we are on facebook photos.we had always wanted to go to hawaii without breaking the bank kirstin and this hotel helped us do it.noleen( i think thats her name)was the person i went to for all information. any way if you want to visit hawaii from uk prehaps its more possible than you think.

We flown in from the Big Island and was used to the 'aloha' nature of hotel staff. The reception desk and lounge looked pretty impressive at Aqua Aloha Surf and Spa. Unfortunately, the staff looked harassed and this showed when we were checked in and any questions asked were responded in a defensive manner. Perhaps life in Oahu is less laid-back? Coming from overseas, we didn't have a useable mobile phone so were pleased that local calls made at the hotel was free. We stayed here for 5 nights and on day 2 reported that the phone was not working. We alerted this to the reception staff the next day (again). He said that he had sent somebody over (yet the phone was still not working). Finally on day 4, the phone was fixed (yay) and we could make whatever local reservations required....We got charged incorrectly for parking (so check your invoices)- the reception staff was quite rude about this (no apologies) and when I tried clarifying a couple of things, she was condescending. On the other hand, cleaning staff were helpful and did a great job. Personally, I wouldn't come back here....

The Aqua Aloha Surf is a great boutique hotel located a few blocks from waikiki beach; it's far enough away to escape the loud throngs of tourists but close enough to walk to all of the shopping, restaurants, and bars around the beach. My wife and I have stayed at the Aqua Aloha Surf twice now. We liked it so much the first time that we booked it again for our wedding last year.We upgraded to their best suite, which is on the top floor in the corner, facing the beach and the front road. There is a great wrap-around porch that is roomy enough to have a few of your friends over to have a drink and watch the sun set.There is a separate bedroom with a king bed, a living room with a wet bar containing a microwave, fridge, sink, and basic servingware. The bathroom is basic, clean, and functional. Our friends and family had booked a few other rooms in the Aqua, and our suite quickly became the hangout. Free breakfast is served in the lobby each day, again fairly basic, but exactly what we were looking for; a good selection of breads, eggs, fruits, juices, and coffee. There is a small pool out back, but as many others have commented, with the beach so close, why go to the pool?The underground parking garage is small, and on our first trip to the Aloha Surf, we found ourselves having to park in the lot next to the hotel; no extra charge, but just something to keep in mind, be sure to request your spot early. The day after our wedding we made use of the small, yet affordably priced spa to book a few last minute massages. The therapists were great, and made every effort to accommodate us, even though our booking very last minute. Throughout our stay the entire staff were gracious and helpful, always working hard to make sure that we were taken care of. It's worth noting because it's the staff that can make or break a stay, and every time we've been to this hotel all of the staff have made us feel welcome.In short, it was a great stay, and the Aloha Surf is a great place, we enjoyed our time there, and we're looking forward to visiting again soon.

I have stayed here on several occasions. It is a great little boutique hotel away from the Waikiki crowds. It is a very easy walk to the Waikiki area. The rooms are a little small, but you spend very little time in the room. Because I have stayed there several times, I had a free upgrade on my last stay to a larger room. It was fantastic. King bed, couch, fridge, microwave and utensils and dishes. It is only a short four blocks to the beach. Staff is outstanding and very helpful. Rates are very reasonable for this area. Parking is limited, but available. The pool is extremely small, but you go to Hawaii for the beaches, not the pool. I would highly recommend this hotel.

The hotel to gives want you NEED: bed, breakfast, some tv and internet here and there. The island itself should do the rest. Room can seem small, but for those who will be out in the sun instead of suck in a room, shouldn't be a problem. It has a clean floor, bed and shower. And AC, which helped me mask with any outside noises. I also used them for my first trip to Hawaii in 2009; the free breakfast was the bonus! Sure it's just toast/pancakes, bagels, cereal (hot or cold), coffee, juice and lots of fresh fruit, but it's enough to start the day!The front desk was always courtesy and helpful, making sure your tour guide got to the correct place at the correct time and checking up on your airport shuttle. The less time I spend figuring out what went wrong or what needs to be done, the more enjoyable the stay. And since nothing went wrong, more time for fun and relaxation. Thanks!!!

My girlfriend and I stayed here for 7 nights. The staff was extremly friendly and helpful. It's about a 5min walk to Waikiki Beach. The hotel itself is located in to such a great area; at night time there are some people up to no good but just mind your own business and you'll be fine. Overall, we enjoyed staying here and we would stay here again. The price is very affortable and the rooms were clean. The bed was very comfortable. Parking costs $20/night. The lobby is pretty nice, the elevators moved pretty quickly too. There is a pool but it's nothing great but why swim in a pool when the beach is right there.

The room decoration was as shown on the website, and the beds were comfortable. The accommodations were good for the price. What truly impressed me was the customer service. Every member of the Aqua Aloha staff I interacted with went out of their way to ensure that my colleagues and I had an excellent trip, even after we had checked out.

We stayed a couple of days in Oahu, and we found the Aqua Aloha Surf and Spa to be an excellent value for the money. We did the Snooze-n-Cruise promotion and got the room, the car rental, on-site parking and the daily breakfast for one low price. We even got an upgrade by putting out a Tweet at the time of booking that we were staying at the hotel for our upcoming vacation. The room was a bit beat up but clean, and the bed was very, very comfortable. The staff were terrific. Overall, we were very pleased.

The hotel was great. Centrally located within walking distance in Waikiki Beach. The tour bus didn't stop at our hotel but was only a short 2-3 minute walk - made for less congestion at the front of our hotel anyway.Continental Breakfast is not the greatest - good snack to tie you over. Better breakfast options up the road. I would highly recommend the Spa. We enjoyed the Early Bird (before 12 noon) Special $69 for 50 min Massage and Foot Treatment - well worth it!I would definitely stay at this hotel again!Anne B.

I went to Hawaii for 2 weeks and stayed on 4 different islands. I was only in Honolulu for 3 nights, and this was the only time we didn't have a rental car. We mainly went to the island to see the typical tourist attractions Pearl Harbor, Polynesian Cultural Center, State Capitol and more. I booked this hotel as part of a package that included my air to the islands, and all inter-island flights, in addition to package tours on this island. I had other arrangements for lodging and transportation on the 3 other islands we visited.The hotel was clean and provided a continental breakfast every morning. This is very nice and can save you lots of money in a place where everything is expensive. They also have free copies of the local newspaper available to help you keep up with the rest of the world. This is sometimes difficult to do because of the time difference. I landed on the island right after the news broke about the death of Osama bin Laden. I read all about it the next morning in the free paper.The hotel is just a few blocks from Waikiki beach and all the "fancy" hotels, yet costs just a fraction of what they charge. The hotel will "loan" you beach towels to take to the beach. Our room was on the 11th floor near the top and we had a small, but nice balcony. Depending on the time of year, you can open all the windows and get a great breeze through the room. A unique thing about the room is that there is a master control switch for all the electricity in the room. You insert your card key into a slot on the wall to activate the entire room. If you don't have the card, then you don't have any power. This is kind of strange, but I think it is a great way to conserve power! How many of us leave our rooms for the day, with the A/C cranked and every light on? There is a small refrigerator and a FREE safe in each room as well. We went to the ABC store on the corner and purchased a bottle of rum and had a few cocktails in the room. We took the remainder of the rum (in my wife's purse) on our trip to the Polynesian Cultural Center. It is a great place, but (since it is run by the Mormons) there is no alcohol on the premises. During the Luau there, we added the rum to our punch for a little extra kick. We were close to the pickup locations for our charter tours, and close to lots of shopping and dining. I would stay here again. There is also a city bus stop a few blocks away which we utilized as well. The rooms are not big by any stretch. The bathroom is tiny and has a pocket door. We did not use the small pool onsite, but it looked clean and inviting. While this place is not fancy, it is clean, affordable and convenient. Save your money for a helicopter ride over the volcanoes!

This was my Fifth stay at this hotel in just over three years. Comp continental breakfast is a great way to start the day. Tuesday manager's reception a nice touch. I recomend staying in a room on the back side of the hotel, nice and quiet there and still a good view of the mountains from higher floors.

I tagged along for a few segments of my hubby's business trip to Hawaii, including Oahu, where we stayed here. We like to stay at clean, comfortable hotels with good locations, and the Aqua Aloha Surf & Spa met these requirements.We stayed in a junior suite for two nights, with a free upgrade to a one-bedroom for three nights. The one-bedroom worked better since he was getting up early each morning. Both rooms were clean and comfortable. The location was good - just two long blocks to get to Kalakaua Street where there was plenty of good restaurants, shopping, and of course the beach. In-room wi-fi was a nice feature since I was also teleworking for several hours each day. The one-bedroom had a small desk, but it wasn't very convenient so I used the sofa and coffee table. A bit uncomfortable but manageable for 2-3 hours per day.Continental breakfast was average, and was included in our room rate. I was surprised that they didn't offer fresh pineapple. But the did have pancakes (very good), muffins or doughnuts, oatmeal, toast, wedges of apple and orange, coffee, tea, and juice. A good start for the day. But beware - they stop serving at 8:30 AM.I only had a couple of occasions to deal with the front desk, but they were helpful. Provided me with information for The Bus, so I could use public transportation to visit the attractions that I wanted to see. Note - public transportation is very easy to use, and I found the local residents to be helpful.Room note: Traffic on Kanekapolei Street is noisy, so request a room in the "rear." The views at any hotel are limited unless you are on an upper-level room, so you might as well get a good nights sleep!!

Sure I could use the "Higher end" places on the company dime but this place is just fine. Off the path of the hustle and bustle of waikiki beach yet only a 3 min walk to Waikiki beach. Clean rooms, slow elevators staff is friendly, breakfast ... go somewhere like Denny's. Overall I like it and keep coming back. A/c has never failed me. Call ahead to reserve your parking spot or get there at the earliest check in. there are only about 10 spots. Last time they actually opened up the under ground parking structure normally reserved for employees.

We travel a lot and relocated to Hawaii recently. A friend referred us to Aqua Aloha Surf and Spa and we only planned to stay a few days and ended up staying a few weeks due to not being able to move into our new apartment. The hotel was accommodating even when they were full and took good care of us. The prices were reasonable and the rooms and lobby are nice. The reception on Tuesday gave us an opportunity to meet newcomers to Hawaii as well as visitors. If you want to stay at a reasonably nice but upscale hotel you should book here! Kudos especially to Helene, Julian, Tim, Sina, the nice guy who is currently on vacation and we forgot his name and the rest of the team!

I don't know what all the negativity on some of the other reviews was for. Yes this is a value hotel but the staff is super friendly and very accommodating. The room was simple but was clean. The location can't be beat, it was a short walk to the beach-walk/ international marketplace but you didn't have to deal with all the annoying traffic and noise. The lobby was tastefully decorated and comfortable, so when we went downstairs to use the wifi, it didn't feel awkward. We weren't expecting a luxury hotel. We wanted a clean and inexpensive room, in a good location and that is exactly what we got. Our only complaint was that the room air conditioner could have been a little more effective. The hotel manager was very nice and we really enjoyed the manager's reception for the guests our first night there.

Stayed 6 days at the Aqua Aloha. The Room was excellent. location was excellent and the front desk service was the best I've ever seen. Lance, the main front desk person was knowledgeable, courteous, professional and always went out of his way to help the guest. Location...10 minute walk to Diamond Head was perfect, reasonable restaurants and ABC stores everywhere....chocolate covered macadamia nuts were good too. Breakfast buffet every morning gets you off to a great start....AGAIN...this is the Hotel to stay at while in Honolulu!

This is a nice clean hotel that has basic amenities. The regular rooms are clean and small, with a microwave and a refrigerator. We were able to fit leftovers in the fridge and microwave them for lunch the next day. If you get a good price and are on a budget, this is a good option. The beach is a short five to ten minute walk away and the hotel will give you beach towels. The staff are nice. By saving money here, you could also splurge on a nice meal at one of the beachfront hotel restaurants. We did not eat at any, but a few came highly recommended by the hotel staff and some of the O'ahu guidebooks. Plan on spending a bit though for these. Avoid Jimmy Buffet's and the Surfboard Museum, unless you like over-priced drinks and food at a "touristy" place. Spend your money at the nicer beachfront restaurants or at one of the local bars. I would not recommend for a long stay unless you fully vette out the suites. It may be comfortable, but for the single rooms they are small and have no kitchenette. The continental breakfast is so-so. Five bucks gets you pancakes, donuts, and oatmeal. There is a restaurant one or two blocks toward the ocean that will give you a nice full plate and coffee for about eight dollars. I'd recommend that. Tuesdays be sure to go to the manager's reception from 5 to 6 pm where the hotel serves it's free specialty mixed drink and provides entertainment (live music, massage table, and magician). General O'ahu tip: no need to rent a car. While it may seem that taking the buses and shuttles come out to about the same price as a rental, don't forget about paying for overnight parking at the hotels. This can run you up to $40 a night. You might be able to find a deal, but check it out. We found that the buses were clean and safe and the shuttles took you wherever you want, including Pearl Harbor.
Room service was excellent. Clean sheets, towels and tidy room everyday.Staff are friendly and helpful including the manager which throws out a welcomingfree cocktail night. Good on you!!!!

We took alot of time to choose our hotel in Honolulu. We were not disappointed. We were cheerfully greeted by hotel staff, and without asking were given an upgrade on our room. Our room was wonderful-clean, and spacious, and quiet. The caring manager Tim sent up champagne and chocolates within 5 minutes of hearing it was our 25th Anniversary. The Tuesday night Manager's get together was fun-delish drinks and sweet live music. Special Kudos to PATRICK the Security Officer who cheerfully showed us where the laundry room was AND was bright and attentive. It made us feel extra safe knowing he was watching over the hotel. From aloha hospitality by staff, to filtered water for our water bottles, to beach towels and chairs, clean laundry room, fresh kona coffee packet daily,quality Hawaiian shampoo, conditioner, shower gel and body lotion, delicious pancakes and fresh fruit at every breakfast, to good location-the Aqua Aloha Surf and Spa was an EXTRA special hotel!! Mahalo and we'll be back again.

This was the second time we stayed at this hotel and we enjoyed it.Pros:Good ratesClean roomsMicrowave, fridge, and coffe maker in roomsFriendly staffFast free internet connectionComplimentary beach chairs and towelsGreat location in Waikiki: close to the Ala Wai canal, beach, shops, and transportationCons:Awful breakfast and the cafeteria closes at 8:30Small pool if you consider the hotel has 16 floorsLimited parkingThe moderate rooms are very small: they don't have a desk, the only place to sit inside the room is on the bed (it's usually too windy in the balcony). The superior rooms are much more spacious.Tip: avoid rooms behind the elevators, too noisy

This was at least our fourth stay here and we don't plan to go back. The property seems to go down hill a little each year - small things that add up to a poor visit. Desk service to begin with was poor. They couldn't find our reservation when we arrived so asked to see our confirmation. The next morning at breakfast they asked for our tickets, which we hadn't been given so back we went to the front desk. He checked our reservation and said "you're checking out today" and we responded no -four more days. At that point we had to go up to the room for the confirmation again. That's just the beginning but explains why we didn't go back to complain about the variety of small things that continued during our stay - clearly customer service is not a strength here any longer!. Small problems included no lock on balcony door, missing bedside light bulb, no faucet water pressure (clogged screen), small room although we'd paid extra for upgrade, and the list goes on. The are too many options in the area at the price range so we'll look elsewhere on our next trip!

The Aqua Aloha Surf & Spa is a nice hotel with a great location. Just blocks from the beach and an affordable price. The room was small but well equipped with TV, microwave and refrigerator. The hotel provides and ethernet cable for internet access although wireless would be a better option. The internet access was probably the only drawback since you have no where to comfortable sit if you need to use your computer. Putting a small chair in the rooms would be a simple remedy. I'd also like to mention how helpful and friendly one particular person at the front desk was to us. I believe her name was Helene. Having her be so courteous made our brief stay all the better.

The hotel has a very nice lobby. The rooms could use some updating and cleaning. The lamp shades were torn, The sofa was coming apart at the seems. A few stains here and there. It was nice for a one day stay. I would not stay longer as I like to walk barefoot and I was not comfortable taking my shoes off in the room due to not feeling like it was was clean enough for me. I would stay again, but it would not be my first of second choice. I'll be staying at the Aqua Wave next. It has better reviews.

My husband and I stayed here based on the reviews on tripadvisor.com. We ended up only staying maybe 2 nights. Upon check in, we were 30 minutes early and they claimed our room wasnt ready (seriously?!?!) . We went to eat and came back. Checked us in and went to the elevator. It smelled of a mechanics shop! Super greasy smell and sounded unsafe. We got to our room and the carpet was wet.....really? Because the place is so nasty they just hose off the rooms? Fancy shampoo and condition....I will give it credit for that! Haha. Mirrors everywhere! If we were still in the honeymoon phase, Im sure we would enjoy that a lot more, but the room was like one you would see in a hooker house....oh wait, yes, lots of hookers close by! Just follow the clear shoes! Across the street are some apartments. Seemed very ghetto and unsafe. We ended up calling expedia and upgrading to the Sheratan Princess right up the street....much better!PS. Do not attempt to drink the tap water....it taste like the elevator smells if that makes sense!

I LOVE the Aqua Aloha Surf & Spa! I have stayed in luxury hotels all over the world and none have had service and staff that compares. Every personal interaction I experienced was positive, cheerful, welcoming, helpful. The rooms are clean and comfortable. I had possibly the best massage of my life at the spa, for an amazing price. It is a short walk to the beach and all the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, but I liked being off "the strip". The hotel is conveniently located right next door to the only real grocery store in Waikiki. It was great having a small kitchenette space/refrigerator in the room.They haven't much parking on site but have arranged with the hotel across the street to provide valet parking at the going rate - again they really have thought of everything to welcome you and ensure you enjoy your stay. I will definitely look to stay at Aqua properties in future. Congratulations to Manager Tim for creating an atmosphere where his staff obviously enjoys coming to work every day. Special kudos to Helene at reception and the girls at the spa (sorry I don't remember their names)

This is the second time I stayed in the hotel. This time there were seven of us who had three rooms. This hotel is clean, comfortable and priced well. It's nothing fancy, for Honolulu it is very reasonable. The one bedroom suite we stayed in was tight as were the other two regular single rooms, they were clean, tidy, friendly housekeeping. Who's going to stay inside the hotel room while you're in Hawaii. For the budget minded traveler, this is a very good hotel and I will most likely stay here a third time.

If you are a traveler who would rather spend your money on seeing things in the area than on your hotel room this hotel is a good choice. Our room was small for 4 (double bed, twin bed, pull out couch) but sufficient for us. The room included a micro and a fridge. We ate some of our evening meals in our room - peanut butter & jelly sandwiches, carrot sticks, bananas, etc that we purchased from an ABC store about a half a block away. Milk is very expensive in Hawaii so did not purchase milk. The hotel has a sufficient breakfast - pancakes, toast, muffins, cake, oranges & apples & oatmeal. The meal is served 7-8:30 am. (Room rate is breakfast for 2 people - additional people in room are $2 per person). The attendant is "timely" on opening and closing! We were within a few blocks of the beach and a block from the bus. We rented a car and parked it at the Banyan Hotel which was about 5 blocks away. Parking was $10 a night or 7 nights for $60. This parking was open to the public. (Aqua Aloha charges $20 per night). This hotel offers the basics - not one if you want to spend much time in your room. It worked well for us.

when we first entered our room.. we were a bit taken back. the windows don't close and unfortunately when we were there, there were thunderstorms and our carpet was soaked. the room was tiny - the bathroom.. it was pretty much a toilet and a bathtub shoved into a little closet. the ethernet cord that they provide to you because there's only wifi in the lobby - did not reach from the box to the bed, you'd have to sit on the floor. pictures are deceiving, let's just leave it at that!

Staff was friendly and helpful. Clean but there is an odor in the bathroom area...musty. Pool is miniscule. Continental breakfast is not complimentary. Parking is $20/day and there are only 30 spots. If you get in too late, there is no parking available. We parked at another hotel's garage (Public Parking) for the first night - 4 blocks away. There is a lot of traffic noise (cars, buses) from the street. Overall decent price and clean for a couple of nights. Beach is several blocks away. Would recommend for only a couple of nights.

My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon in August of 2010. We chose this hotel because of the reasonable price, decent Tripadvisor rating, and the continental breakfast. We decided that we would rather have a longer trip at a cheaper hotel, then shorter at somewhere more expensive... in hindsight, I probably wouldn't do that again. Lobby: the lobby looks pretty good when you first arrive, but the front desk service was a little slow. Not a big deal, I mean you're on vacation so where do you have to go? But for what it's worth, it was slow.Room: So the room was pretty pathetic. I mean I understand that it's Waikiki so there isn't a lot of space but the room was TEENY TINY! I have never ever been in a smaller hotel room. The bathroom had a pocket door because there wouldn't be any room for a real door, and although there was a full size closet, you couldn't get to half of it because the bed/nightstand completely covered it. The TV was pretty small and wasn't centered with the bed, so that was kind of weird. I've read a lot of reviews that have said "the room is small, but how much time do you spend in there anyway." But I'm telling you this room was itsy-bitsy no matter how much or how little time you spend. I would definitely not recommend the room for more than 2 people and that's pushing it. Breakfast: My husband and I aren't very picky about food so we thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast... especially since it was free. But as many people have said, the selection is pretty limited. They made pancakes every morning and then had 2 mini donut options and 2 fruit options. They also had oatmeal, coffee and hot water. There's just something different about the pineapple in Hawaii so I filled up on that every day! Our main issue was breakfast was the limited serving hours. It was pretty early for us, so we missed it a couple times, and more than once we ran down in our PJs just to catch it in time. But like a said, free is free, and we enjoyed that.Fitness equipment: was pretty much a joke. I never once saw anyone use it. It was pretty much right in the lobby and it's so hot outside I don't know who would. I think they have the equipment just to say they have it, but everyone knows it's just there for decoration. If I remember correctly it was like 1 treadmill and 1 stationary bike...Pool: Like the room - teeny tiny - but nice enough. A lot of hotels in Waikiki don't even have pools so I appreciated this. We were a little annoyed because they spent about 2 hours cleaning it one day and kept saying they would open in half an hour, but that kept extending. It wouldn't have been a big deal but because they only had 6 lounge chairs, I didn't want to go back up to the room and then get out there and not get a chair. We spent most days at the beach though, so the pool wasn't too much of an issue.Parking: a lot of people have complained about the parking, but it's pretty clear on their website you'll be charged. We just factored it into our budget for the trip so we weren't upset. We always parked in the outside lot instead of underground and never had trouble getting one spot. Overall this hotel was OK. The room was cleaned every day, we had plenty of towels, the front desk was helpful enough and ultimately... you're 3 blocks from the world famous Waikiki beach and within walking distance of tons of shopping and hotels. So it's good enough. Would we stay here again? No probably not. I would recommend it to my low maintenance friends who live on a budget, but I would not recommend it to anyone who is even slightly picky and has a little bit more money.

Im from Hawai'i moved away like many of us do to survive, I come home every year for graduations etc., we ALWAYS stay 2 or more days in Waikiki just to get away, we get there to check in, the entrance is pretty ritzy, we go to check in & find out that parking is around $20! WOW! I've NEVER paid that much to park somewhere which didnt even matter because the parking was full, & the guy recommended a parking structure about a block away when theres another pay lot next to them for the same price as the hotel, the room was smaller than my closet, there is NO room to walk if you have 2 people without crawling on the bed to get around, you get off the front of the bed, boom your in the bathroom (which still had trash in it when we checked in)......the ac was blowing towards the tv which is all located on the SIDE of the bed, I don't know about you but I like to enjoy the ac but Im sure the tv enjoyed it!, Maintenance doesn't work at night so if you clog the toilet or something your S.O.L., the ONE thing that I did LOVE was the saving on electricity card in the wall thing, that was pretty neat! I read reviews on the hotel & so I decided to book, my mistake!!! the price was NOT worth the room!, I think I'll stick with the OHANA chain, atleast its a step up!!!

Stayed here for a week. The hotel is dated, and needs refurbishment, but that's probably why the rates are what they are. With the Ala Wai canal on one side, and just 3 blocks from the Waikiki beach on the other, it's close to everything. Has a tour company who operates out of an office just off the lobby and breakfast area. Free continental breakfast, but the selection is terrible. It's the same thing everyday. This really hurts their review. "Cable only" High speed internet is available in the rooms, while WiFi access can be had in the lobby. Guest laundry is available @ $1.25/load until 10pm. Has a spa but didn't use it. A couple of exercise machines off the lobby as well.

I read a number of the reviews here on TripAdvisor before selecting the Aqua Aloha, that said it was a great deal for the price. We went into it not expecting "elite" service, and actually came away feeling that we were well taken care of. And so with eyes wide open, our stay was actually very enjoyable, and we felt the staff really exceeded our expectations.Reservation: I actually was looking at a couple of Aqua properties, but I asked the lady on the phone, and she was able to tell me which hotels were under renovation during my stay. That helped in selecting the right hotel. I even called multiple times in the same day to ask more questions, and she (was the same lady each time) was really friendly and helpful.Location: Really, 5 minutes from the beach. We brought our 8-month old, and it was never a problem walking with her. I asked at the Front Desk for overnight hotel parking (rented a car for 2 days), but there wasn't a space available. There's a few metered parking spots on the street, and I was always able to find parking (you can park for free on Ala Moana near the canal (if you can get a spot) or at the metered spots after 6pm (but you have to move it again before 7am). Same or 1 block distance to the bus/trolley stops. I even walked to The Rainbow Drive-in with no problems. For the price, you're really getting good access to Waikiki.Room: Great view! (we stayed on the top 16th floor) Again, for the price, this couldn't be beat. With the A/C on, I couldn't hear any of the street noise, and we slept soundly. With it off, I could hear the car honks, even someone yelling (but nothing to the point of having to bring ear plugs, like I read other hotels GIVING to their guests to block out the noise). The room was always clean. Now that I think of it, the deadbolt doesn't actually work, but I never felt unsafe. Everything worked, ample plugs throughout the room for my electronics. Bathroom is decent (ours had a basin sink and slate floors).Breakfast: It's 7a-8:30a. Pancakes, oatmeal, a couple of fresh fruit selections, and some type of small baked good (mini-muffins or doughnuts). OJ, milk, coffee, water. The restaurant it's served in has maybe 8-10 tables seating 4 people each, so it's not BIG -- but again, don't expect a banquet and it won't disappoint. Think of a Starbucks-sized vending machine with pancakes. Just enough to wake you up -- we only ate there half the time, to be honest, because we wanted to try other places in Hawaii. But if you're on a budget, you could fill up on what they had to offer and it would tide you over to lunch.Staff: Very friendly. Funny too. Again, go into this expecting to get what you're paying for. You're not paying for someone to carry you to your room via piggyback or rose petals; you're paying for a room to relax in, in between the things you do in Hawaii. I asked for suggestions, and I got them. I joked around with the staff, and we all had a good time. One lady came in almost like she was expecting to be greeted at the threshold of the hotel and waited on hand and foot, as if she was paying for service by the minute. My wife and I came in as if we were renting a room from a college friend, and we always felt welcome. One staff member, Nolan, was really helpful to us; we learned midway in our trip that he was leaving for the Disney place, which was a shame, but he lives closer to Aulani and it was a better opportunity for him. But Vinh and the rest of the staff were just as friendly. OVERALL, just "hang loose", don't be uptight, and everything's gonna be alright. :) If you prefer to be pampered by servants instead of helped out by friends, this probably isn't your cup of tea. Book the place knowing you can save and still feel safe.PROS: Location, price, serviceCONS: Limited hotel parking

I researched hotels for 12 hours on Expedia, Travelocity and hotel websites. I read a few poor reviews for this hotel, but decided that what the individuals were complaining about, even if true, would not necessarily affect my stay. Small rooms...well, you are in Hawaii....hello...GO OUTSIDE!!! However, upon reading that I looked and saw I could upgrade to a superior room that offered 340 sq. feet compared to 220 sq. ft. I did that and found the room to be a very nice size (large if you compare to European hotels) with couch, coffee table, dresser, mini fridge, dishware, microwave, small kitchen sink and balcony with 2 chairs. I saved money by being able to save my leftovers and reheat them! I read the staff was unfriendly....WHAT? The review writer must be some nasty person because every member of the staff was helpful, kind and went above and beyond trying to help us. A maintenance staff member even went out on the back roof after I dropped my hair clip (I know...but I got it in Italy) from the 15th floor and retrieved it for me!The managers reception (every Tuesday) was a treat. Free "Wipeout" cocktails, chair massages (get there on time...only 12 lucky people get a 5 minute massage!) and staff circulating with chocolate covered macadamia nuts. Bathrooms were a tiny bit outdated, but not a hint of mold or mildew anywhere...very clean and stand up shower was a very good size. A/C worked fantastic. My friends were staying down the road and paying $30 more a night and transferred over to our hotel when they saw our room and the value of it! I promise I won't even research again...when I am back in Oahu I will be booking here.

I have mixed feelings on this hotel. It is a medium quality hotel. Some parts of the hotel have been updated and trendy, but the bathrooms are very old, and don't even have locks on the doors. But, it is inexpensive and you get what you pay for in Waikiki. It's next to the Canal, which is a pretty view in the daytime. You can barely see the Beach, but it's only a few blocks away. It's near the International Market which has great pineapple non-alchololic drinks. The rooms felt a little small in space, but everything does in Waikiki. The most confusing thing was trying to determine what the room you were ordering online was going to be like (in terms of how many beds and what type of beds). The staff was friendly, but the police department was there everyday for something (which the staff would not tell you what)......Breakfast was simple but free. As always, its right next to an ABC store! The pool was small but good. Parking price was $15 to $20 but at least they had parking.

This hotel has a lot of good reason to be choosen:- the people working in this hotel are customer oriented, always smiling and trying to do their best to help you.- the rooms are very nice. My room was equipped with a microwave and refrigerator and coffee maker and dishes, forks etc. I did not use them because I like to go to restaurant for dinner, but in case you need to eat in the room you can do it. Also an important feature is the safety box.. with no extra charge and the internet in the room with no extra charge.- My room was very big, the bathroom equipped with all you may need.- The breakfast was included in my room rate and it was good (I suggest only to add some proteins like eggs or cheese..)- the swimming pool is small but very nice.- They organize shuttle to and from the airport. I suggest you to take advantage of this because of the convenient rate.- They also have a Spa (I have used it the day after my arrival to relax my mind after a 26 hours trip.... (I suggest you to take advantage of their offer.. If you have a massage before noon if I am not wrong - you have a special price..) The spa is small but clean and confortable. The massage was very good....This is my second time in Honolulu, the first time I have choosen another Aqua Hotel (not anymore Aqua now), that hotel was directly on Waikiki... But If I will return to Honolulu I will surely stay in the Aqua Aloha surf because in my opinion is the best for all the reasons I have listed... I will return there in few days for my last day of vacation.. I will bring with me good memories of this place and the people working in this property.... Thank you!!

I stayed at the Aqua Aloha with my daughters -it was a girls only trip -and we had a great time. The hotel is situated in a great location -a block away from the bus stop and just two blocks from the beach. The hotel staff was fantastic. Nolan and Aimee were so helpful, looking up directions for us and getting the schedule for TheBus (which by the way was a great way to get around the city). Tim Clark was a helpful, friendly manager -and the whole staff seemed like family. It's so reasonably priced -the rooms were great, the breakfast was yummy (pancakes, hot oatmeal, fruit, etc.) but one of the best amenities is the beach towel service. Mahalo, Aqua Aloha! We will be back!

Must let you know that there is a VERY small window unit that really doesn't put out cold air. That is a common thing on Hawaii, but this hotel is on a busy street so bring your ear plugs to drown out the nightly noise when you open the windows to get a breeze. We stayed here for 2 nights, just to see Pearl Harbor. Our final stop was Kaui. With that said, the front desk staff is friendly and ready to help you with all your transportation needs and questions. Room has a small fridge to hold your drinks and snacks. It was a $35 ride from the airport to hotel, but we took a shuttle in the am that cost $10 each. It cost $16 each person for the ride over to Pearl Harbor. The hotel is a good location to walk to Waikkiki Beach and you pass several good breakfast places and plenty of ABC stores for all your shopping needs. If you are staying in the area for a longer period of time, I would get a hotel on the beach. They seem to be alittle nicer and much closer to the water.

I only needed a hotel for one evening (was meeting son's naval ship returning from deployment), but I still wanted a clean, decent hotel close to the beach. I had narrowed my choices of hotels to three - all within same price range as the Aqua Aloha Surf & Spa Hotel. When I telephone Aqua Aloha first, I was greeted by a very friendly receptionist ("Nikki"), who immediately made me feel welcomed. She offered an upgrade to superior room for same price as standard room (superior has balcony); she was also excited to hear that I was coming to Honolulu to go on a 'Tiger Cruise' - I was glad to hear that a hotel staff member even knew what a 'Tiger Cruise' was. Upon my arrival, another receptionist ("Aimee") greeted me pleasantly, as well. My room was on 14th floor, decent size and clean. Although, balcony in my room faced the city streets and I could hear some of the noises, and the room's A/C was a bit noisey, the bed was so comfortable that I had no trouble sleeping. The hotel is only 2 blocks walking distance from the beach and there are plenty of shops and restaurants around the area (walking distance, as well). I would definitely stay here again next time I come to Honolulu...and I do plan on returning.

I was extremely concerned about this hotel. Fortunately, through TripAdvisor, I was able to contact a couple that had stayed here who countered the unpleasant reviews with a glowing review. After all, some of the reviews I read spoke about bedbugs. Upon check in I was pleasantly surprised and happy. The front desk personnel were friendly and nice. The room, although small, sufficed for two adults. It was clean and well kept. Very nice comfortable room with plush mattresses. Yes, it is an older hotel but we were in Ohau to visit not to stay inside a resort. The hotel met our purposes very well. Additionally, they have a travel agent (Joyce) who is out of sight-utterly fantastic. Every tour we were on was the best.Very good value.

The room was a single room, with ensuite. The bathroom was sub-standard. There was nearly no water pressure in the shower. There was barely any room to move in the room. That said, the room was clean, the cleaners did a good job, and the staff jumped to help.Other issue... The air conditioner wasn't very effective. At floor level, blowing onto the side of the bed... and on my last night, it stopped working completely.Also, my room deposit that was supposed to be returned wasn't and still hasn't. It's been 2 weeks, and the money still hasn't been refunded to my card...So, for people who just want a bed for a few hours, go for it, this isn't a bad place to be. If you want a really great experience, stay somewhere else...

We decided to stay this hotel since all the hotels in the military base were fully booked. I am so glad we did. It is far more than what we expected. The price is way cheaper relative to the location of the hotel, cleanliness and hospitality. Location: The hotel is like 2 blocks away from the beach. It is very accessible to restaurants and shops. I feel very safe walking back to the hotel even at 1AM. Cleanliness; We stayed in the 10th floor. they clean the room, change the towels, refill the toiletries everyday. And if you need extra assistance, Merlinda the housekeeper is always willing to help. Hospitality: The front desk staff are always helpful. The people that serve breakfast are all nice. They have the Managers Special every Tuesday. Mr. Tim is amazing. I did not have a chance to talk with him personally and made a comment in the survey that i wish I was able to ask him about the secret mix of his cocktail and I was surprised that i got an email from him on how to make it. That is so sweet!We will definitely come back in this hotel and next time we will bring the kids.

The Hotel is a couple of blocks off the beach, but is close enough that you can walk to everything. It borders on the edge of the residential part of Waikiki, so sometimes walking at night can be a little sketchy.Pros -Fairly quiet (the only noise we had was from another room partying, but after a call to the front desk they shut them down 5 minutes later)Beds are fairly comfortableRooms with a fridge anf microwave are availableClose to beach, restaurants, and shoppingFriendly staff and front deskCoin Washer/Dryer available Free hot breakfastCons -No Wifi (available in small restaurant in lobby for a fee)Pay parkingSmall roomsBathrooms need renovating Not much of a viewOverall when I go to Hawaii I'm not going for the room, I'm going to explore the island.For a place to stay that is very affordable, with clean comfy beds, this would be a b great pick

If you're looking for a good deal you can't go wrong here. We stayed for just one night before going to our rented home. It is clean and very accommodating. Breakfast in the morning is adequate - pancakes, toast and small pastries. Lots of carbohydrates. Location is good. An easy walk to where everything is happening.

I stayed over one night while I was in town. This hotel could use some serious renovations. The room very small but was clean and it had a nice television with cable. The bed was clean and pretty comfortable and the bathroom was clean. You can use the internet but they don't have wireless and you have to borrow a cable from the lobby or bring your own. The room was very old and had a lot of holes in the walls (not from fists but from stuff that had one time been hanging). It could use some paint. The floors were carpetted but really old and dingy. The bathroom only had a shower... no bathtub. The windows were really thin so you could hear the street noise. I was on the 15th floor so I was able to still sleep through the noise.The curtains were probably the original and had stains all over. Very dingy. I found the mirror hung on the entire wall behind the bed pretty tacky. I did not use the pool but did walk past it. It was brownish but I think that was from the bottom of the pool and hopefully not just the water. I didn't fully inpsect the situation. The hotel has breakfast which starts at 0700. I didn't try it because I checked out prior to it starting. I think if you book through the hotel, breakfast is included but if you book through another website it is not. The location was nice and right next to the canal. Great little path along the canal to ride, roller blade, or walk/run.

I found this hotel to be extremely clean - a top priority these days. While the lobby is unpretentious, my room was spacious and provided a view of both the canal and (between the buildings at a distance) the ocean; microwave and refrigerator in the room are also pluses. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful; free breakfast included pancakes and fruit - not your usual Continental breakfast of bagel and coffee. Cut across the hotel parking lot and you are at the door of The Food Pantry, apparently the only food store in Waikiki. Everything is within walking distance - even for me, age 69 and using a cane. If I'm ever able to return to Hawaii, this is definitely where I'd stay again.

This trendy hotel is a great value. The rooms are small but the view from the balcony is huge. With a fridge, Microwave, coffee maker,cable TV and excellent bed you have it all. The buffet breakfast was pancakes, fruit, bread, coffee and juice is enough to fuel you to explore Honolulu. The location is excellent just 5 min walk to the beach. The staff is friendly and helpful. The pool and gym is small but we were out the whole time running around. Enjoy!
user_name:
MichaelBarb
New York City, New York

review_body: Absolutely LOVE Aqua Hotels! Especially this one! It was very moderately priced, near the beach, near the International Marketplace, ABC store nearby (of course these are everywhere, but still!). The room was great and the staff was extremely friendly. The free breakfast was great too - only suggestion I have (actually it's my husband's) would be to rotate waffles in for the pancakes every other day. :) Thanks to everyone there - we will be back soon.

The whole place would need a face lift.It is not terrible, but if you are going to Hawaii, you might want to pick something else.We had a room on a high floor, so we had a nice view from our balcony, but it was quite windy so we didn’t really use it.The feeling of the room is old, ok but very basic.So, if you are looking for something cheap, and you don’t expect much, then it might be ok.My general recommendation would be to skip Waikiki and head to North Shore instead.Waikiki is nice for the restaurants and the shopping, but there are much nicer beaches around the island.

+ Price+ Location (near the beach and bus stops)-------------- The room, I stayed in, looked dirty (dirty floor, old carpetand wardrobe)- The entire hotel smells oddPeople at the desk were helpful. I did not like breakfasts.

Great location, superb value for money, good amenities! Had a lovely stay. It's cheap and cheerful with really comfy beds. Has everything you need but be up early for breakfast as it finishes at 830. If you miss it, don't worry, Denny's is a two minute walk away!

Stayed at the Aqua Aloha Surf for 2 nights in late May, arrived after a long flight back from Australia, by the time we landed in Honolulu we were awake over 23 hours and very tired. We arrived at Hotel around Noon and the front desk was able to get us in a room right away and did not make us wait till 4:00 PM check-in time. The Hotel is three blocks from Waikiki Beach and walking distance to everything. They also include a free breakfast in the hotel every day and a free Mangers reception with drinks on Tuesday afternoon. The room was clean and having a small fridge to hold drinks was great, there is also free internet in the rooms and free wireless in lobby and pool area. The staff was very helpful and friendly as they always are. We have stayed at the hotel quite a few times and have never had a bad visit; this is a great hotel with a great price which makes for a really good value.

The room we stayed in was a reasonable size for our one-night stay, and had:king size bed; kitchenette with mini refrigerator, microwave, stoneware dishes and metal flatware; hand wash area with separate toilet and bathtub; closet.The building is from the Hawaii Five-O era, but the owners appear to try to keep it up-to-date, and the reception desk was well-staffed while we were there.The included breakfast was apple and orange slices, cold cereal and oatmeal, juices, pancakes, bacon, sausage, and maybe a couple things I can't recall anymore.The hotel is very convenient to Waikiki Beach, other hotels, the King's Village shopping center, and a few blocks away from the main road through Honolulu and Waikiki, so you're close to transit, but you don't directly hear its noise.Unfortunately, the top half of the exterior walls of the room are all louvered windows, which welcomed warmly most of the outside noises into the room. My wife slept fine, but I was woken up quite a few times.

The hotel is only two blocks away from the beach. We were next to a food store. within walking to chilies and Denny's and KFC and Burger king. The service was fast and friendly great water presser. Pool small but so close to the ocean.

We only stayed 2 nights in Waikiki at the Aqua Aloha Surf & Spa before moving up to the the north shore. Stayed in the deluxe room for $75/night, we requested 1 queen/king bed instead got a room with 1 double/1 twin and the front desk said they were booked so we couldn't switch. The double bed was fine for us bc me and the bf are both smaller people but still...and the bed linens were kinda of damp at the bottom of the bed. Don't really know what that was about!? The bathrooms are def. older and the couch in the room was on the dirtier side. And don't expect much from the view, we knew we were getting a "city view" however all we got to view was other people's balconies. Kind of felt like were in a NYC apartment! Good location to everything in Waikiki, walkable distance to most things in the neighborhood. Staff was friendly just don't expect much in terms of amenities. If you are looking for a room to sleep and don't care much about anything else, this place would be a good value. Oh, and the continental breakfast is basic, with a lot of carbs!
user_name:
beachdreamer3
New York City, New York

review_body: $75/nite, no extra person fee including breakfast is a good price.Beds are ok comfortable.Decent cleanShampoo, conditioner, body lotion, body wash provided. Free toothpaste razor, shaving cream provided if you ask.Plates and utensils including detergent provided. Microwave and fridge in room.Location location. 5 minutes to beachPancakes and oatmeal for breakfast goodBeach towels availableFriendly serviceCons: run down/budget accomodation. Don't expect a 4 star hotelParking $20/nite or you will have to find street parking on Ala Wai or some metered parking outsideNot the safest area @ night. A few homeless people on the streetsOld/flat pillowsThey don't changed the sheetsAir conditioning very noisyLeaky faucetsShower temp not constant, you get a blast of hot or cold suddenlyWifi only in lobby, not in room. For internet you will have to borrow a cable from front desk.

Having been to Waikiki before, we selected this hotel because of it's location - a couple of blocks back from the beach with shops, restaurants, bars etc only a few steps away.We were woken up at 5 am on the first morning by noise from the street that went on for ages. We were told that this was a delivery to a nearby supermarket and that it happened every day. We asked if we could be moved and the hotel management were very good - they put us on a higher floor on the opposite side of the building - that solved the problem nicely.Our main problem was with parking. On our arrival the car park was full and we had to park in a nearby public car park which cost $18 overnight. We had to move the car before 7 am in order to avoid an additional full day's parking fee. We complained to the hotel about the parking and they issued us with a parking permit and assured us that we wouldn't have a problem again - we didn't, for the next two days as we arrived back between 5 and 6 pm. On the next day we returned at 10.30 and there were no spaces so we were next door again, having to move the car by 7 am. We complained again and the staff did what they could to try to resolve the situation. The problem is though that there simply are not enough spaces, even for people with permits. It was explained to us that some people use the car park illegally and that reduces the spaces for guests. We did get a full refund for the nights that we had to park next door.If you don't have a car, you will have a much better stay!Breakfast was very basic unless you like unlimited pancakes!

We stayed for 12 days at this hotel. Staff were great, location is fantastic. It is an older hotel and could do with an upgrade but it is always clean. We attended the managers reception on Tuesday night I think and the manager serves free cocktails, there is live hawaiin music and had a great feel. If your going to be out all day doing things this hotel is for you!

Had a great quick trip at the Aloha Surf! Stayed only 2 nites in Waikiki before moving over to Turtle Bay on the North Shore. The hotel is a located on the canal side of Waikiki and I do have to say, I did miss the direct ocean views. However, our view from Deluxe Room 1402 on the corner of the 14th floor did privide a peek-a-boo ocean view which was a pleasant suprise. The location of the hotel was great, central enough to all that Waikiki has to offer. We didnt spend much time at the hotel other than for sleeping and showering....and the bed was sooo comfy! Just wanted to roll up that mattress and take it home with me! Decent room size (we had a corner room) and never had any problems with water tempature as noted by other guests. One negative is the price for parking! 20$ a day is a bit of a buzzkill.....and its very hard to find street parking in the evening. We decided just to pay for the two days that we were there since we didnt have to worry about paying for parking on the other side of the island. But, parking would have ran us 160$ if we had stayed in Waikiki the length of our vacation and that would have been a major negative with us. Maybe the hotel should consider discounting parking rates depending on the length of your stay? Wandered over to the lil bar and grill accross the way at the Sand Villa.....open late for pupus and cocktails....great prices, decent food. All in all, had a great stay, would definatley stay again if we were in Waikiki.....would definatley suggest this hotel for budget minded travelers or those who like a nice comfy home base who plan on using the amenties of nature to spend the day.....not the infinity pool and tennis courts of thier hotel. Mahalo!

I recently stayed at this resort and I must say that it surpassed my expect ion. The staff is very friendly and courteous. Breakfast (included in the price) is ok but nothing special. What the heck, breakfast will cost you easily $20 and more per person elsewhere.The rooms are out fitted with a microwave, a small fridge to prepare a quick meal and to chill the drinks. There is also, for free, high speed internet access. No resort fees are charged. The hotel is in overall clean condition.I would definitely recommend this hotel.

We had a great time... we didn't spend much time at the hotel... we rent a car and drive the whole island... so many things to do.... from hiking, beaches, hula shows, etc... also we walked from the hotel to waikiki beach, stores, bars... we had a little problem with the internet but they fix it right away... their staff is very helpful and nice... if you are looking for a fancy/ocean view hotel I wouldn't recommend it... but if you want location, a nice, clean, welcoming place to stay I would recommend it! and also super economic

we thought we had booked the aqua aloha surf and spa through trip advisr websites. but then when we arrived, the reception was over the road at another hotel and then the rooms were within the aqua aloha surf and spa hotel and accessed through their reception area and lifts, but were apparently not really linked to that hotel and operated seprately through the hotel over the road. It was quite confusing and inconvenient having the reception over the road and there were signs in the room saying not to phone aqua aloha for assistance, but it was uncertain who we were supposed to phone. we felt like the rooms were were given were not as nice as the photos of the hotel we thought we had booked from the websites. so be quite careful about this.

couldn't have picked a better .deal in all of the city! We were in a Junior suite and were extremely comfortable. If I had any complaint, it would be that it was too difficult to get out of your bed in the morning! Usually, after a couple of weeks in a strange bed, I am looking forward to getting back to my own bed, but not this time! I would have gladly taken your mattress home with me as my souvenir from Hawaii. Tim could you please tell me what brand of mattress that is? I am seriously considering getting one for us. In reviews that I had read before booking our stay at your hotel, you had mentioned what they were and said you had even gotten one for your own home. Now we want one, too!Loved the hotel, loved the pancakes, LOVED the bed and very sorry we had to leave before the manager,s cocktail party, but we'll make sure to hit it next time! Thanks for a great stay!

I chose to stay at this hotel based on the comments and management responses that I read in TripAdvisor. I was drawnt o one travlers comments about the comfortable beds. I also loved the fact that management responded to both positive and negative comments. I am in the service industry and it means so much to receive quality service when you are used to providing it to others. This property did NOT disappoint! Once we got settled into our room (thanks for the upgrade!! :)), we called housekeeping and requested that they remove a decorative banner hanging between the sofa and A/C unit as we felt is was limiting the circulation of the cool air. He arrived within minutes and removed the item as requested. What service!Only recommendation - the bathroom could use a fresh coat of paint.We are looking forward to a return visit.

Rooms are small, bathroom smaller. Parking is expensive at $20 a day. No breakfast included like what was stated when made reservation. Bed is comfy and tight. Some stains on carpets and furniture. Ate at local restaurant, more cheaper and better. Overall, adequate for two nights until we changed over to Hilton Hawaiin Village.

The rooms are old but they are very clean. The staff is very helpful and friendly. I really enjoyed the free breakfast in the mornings and the free beach towel service. This place exceeded my expectations.

This has a great location close to the beach, public transit, food stores, restaurants, sports activities and attractions. The hotel is clean and comfortable, the staff are friendly and helpful, and the price is very reasonable.The hotel is located on a side street that runs between busy Kuhio Ave and Ala Wai Blvd, so you’re away from the worst of the traffic. That’s not to say you won’t hear sirens or other noises – this is a major city, after all – but if you ask for a room at the back of the hotel rather than facing Kanekapolei St, you should enjoy relative peace and quiet. Rooms can be very small. The most basic, the moderate, is tiny and has no balcony. Not a problem if you’re staying just a night or two and plan to use the room only for sleeping and showering, but if you’re staying longer, you’ll be more comfortable in something larger. We had a deluxe with balcony, which is considerably more spacious and includes a sofa as well as dishes and cutlery.This was our second stay at the Aqua Aloha in two years. The beds have been replaced since our last visit and are really comfortable. Breakfasts are pretty much as before – basics like pancakes, oatmeal, toast and sliced fruit, which you may want to augment with yogurt, milk and real fruit juice from the ABC Store down the street – but they may no longer be included in the room rate. Breakfast was part of our vacation package and is, I believe, included if you book directly with the hotel, but if you go through a third party, you may have to pay. Another minor change is that you now need cards, issued at check-in, to get beach towels from the front desk. Internet access is available throughout the hotel – wireless in the lobby, via Ethernet cable in your room, though we were actually able to get wireless connection there too. The in-room safe is big enough for a laptop. The hotel is a two-minute walk to the beach. If you’re a jogger, the sidewalk along Ala Wai Canal, right beside the hotel, is a popular spot. There’s a city-owned 18-hole golf course on the other side of the canal and public tennis courts an easy walk away at Kapiolani Park and Diamond Head Tennis Centre. The zoo and aquarium are also within easy walking distance. TheBus, O’ahu’s great public transit system, will get you to many other places of interest without the hassle of renting and parking a car. The nearest stop, which serves many routes, is just a moment from the hotel. This time we rode TheBus to Hanauma Bay, Hawaii’s Plantation Village, the Lyon Arboretum, Manoa Falls and the Honolulu Academy of Arts. On our previous visit TheBus took us on a circle tour around the island, to Senator Fong’s Plantation and Garden, Makapuu Point and Lighthouse, Pearl Harbour, the Bishop Museum and Kailua Bay, among other destinations.The Aqua chain has a number of hotels in Waikiki. I haven’t stayed in any others so can’t comment on their facilities or service, but we walked past several and on that basis I’d say the Aloha Surf and Spa wins hands down for the quietest location (least road traffic) and biggest lobby (nice setting for weekly manager’s cocktail party). Definitely recommended, provided you're looking for comfort rather than luxury.

We stayed at the Aloha Surf for a few nights over thanksgiving break 2010 and thoroughly enjoyed it. The hotel is handy for Waikiki beach, being only a five minute walk, but located by the Ala Wai canal which means it is a little quieter than some hotels on the main road.The staff are very friendly, the breakfast is basic but welcome, the hotel is very clean, the pool is small but nice if you can get in early and reserve a space and some of the views from the higher floors are great. Also has free internet, which is not always a given in some larger, chain hotels.We booked through priceline so got a really good deal but would recommend this hotel to anyone.We heard that the canal could be dangerous at night but saw no evidence of this being true. The canal is in fact quite a nice walk during the day time, particularly if you're going to Bailey's for some vintage Hawaiian shirts.One problem - when you get the bus from the airport, the Aloha Surf can be quite far down the drop-off order. It is literally a one minute walk from the regular bus stop though, so do consider saving a bit of money and just taking the scheduled bus rather than the airport express.There is also a one way system in operation on some streets for those who are driving.

Okay, right off the bat, let's get one thing straight: This is not a four- or five-star hotel on the beach at Waikiki. It is a small, boutique hotel with clean rooms, good service, great personnel, and an outstanding value for the price we paid. We took a deluxe room with a large king-size bed, a couch, a small refrigerator, coffee-maker, and a microwave oven, which is a rarity in almost all other hotels. The microwave was extremely useful in heating muffins, biscuits, and leftover food that we brought back from restaurants (we stayed for a week). The room had plates, bowls, coffee cups, and silverware too. It was nice to sit on the balcony with our morning coffee, watching the sun come up. True, we could not see the beach from the hotel, but we could look the other way and have a magnificent view of the Koolau Mountains, Palolo Valley, the Kaimuki district, and Manoa Valley (home of the University of Hawaii). We could also see early morning canoe paddlers and kayakers in the Ala Wai Canal, as well as golfers across the canal, and walkers and joggers along the canal.The hotel also provided free coffee or hot tea in the lobby in addition to a free copy of the daily, local newspaper. On Tuesday afternoons, there is a Manager's Reception during which there was musical entertainment, free massages, chocolate-covered macadamia nut candies, and the hotel's signature drink called a Wipeout. According to Manager/"Bartender", Tim Clark, the drink consisted of vodka, blue curacao, pineapple juice, and coconut cream. Yes, they were delicious, and you could have all you wanted!The location of the hotel is very nice too. It is a short two-block walk to the beach and what would be considered the Heart of Waikiki. Walk straight down Kanekapolei Street and you'll come right to Kalakaua Avenue (the main artery of Waikiki) and the Moana Surfrider Hotel, which was the first hotel ever built in Waikiki. The beach is just to the left of the hotel. Walk to the right along the avenue, and you will come to all the shops and restaurants you could possibly want in Waikiki. By the way, around the corner on Kuhio Avenue (and a short two-minute walk from the hotel) is the Food Pantry. It is the ONLY full-service supermarket in Waikiki. We picked up all our snacks and "goodies" from this market. And, in case you don't have a rental car, the excellent city bus service runs on both Kuhio and Kalakaua Avenues.My wife and I live most of the year in Maine. We were in Honolulu to celebrate our birthdays, and staying in a nice, clean hotel certainly helped to make our vacation a great one! I don't know what else to say except that if you want the most "bang for your buck" and have a clean, inexpensive hotel with a friendly staff to help you ENJOY your Waikiki stay, then this hotel is the place for you!

Thank you so much for making my stay in your hotel such a memorable one. The location of your property is by far tops in my category. Aimee at the Front Desk also provided valuable location information that made my touring great. My room was very clean and the bed was fantastic. Thank you Mr. Clark for a great time at the Tuesday Happy Hour, it's the first one I've been to in all my years of traveling. Will definitely go back there again.

My girlfriend and I stayed in Waikiki at the Aqua Aloha and overall had a incredible time. As many others have mentioned, the location is great; it's two blocks from the beach and close to a Food Pantry (shares the same parking lot) and the bus stop. As a disclaimer, this hotel is definitely not "honey-moon" material, but if you are like us and not planning on spending a whole lot of time in the room anyway the Aqua Aloha is a great value. In addtion to the great location & value, we really enjoyed the friendly front desk folks and the Tuesday night free Wipeout drinks and reception. The rooms have a mini fridge and microwave which was a nice bonus for us as we purchased groceries for our breakfast and lunches. There was a small pool, we went to it once or twice and enjoyed it.The room was definitely small and a bit outdated, and unfortunately we did get a room on the street side of the hotel... I was so excited to get to the room I totally forgot to ask for one on the Lagoon side at check-in. We planned on asking to move but once all of our stuff was unpacked and had spent a night we thought we could handle the road noise (we're both heavy sleepers). I would say our biggest complaint was probably the shower... I imagine it was not just our room, but it would just not hold a constant temperature. It would literally go from normal to scalding then straight to freezing within a few seconds multiple times during a 10-15 minute shower! I literally am not exaggerating, this definitely needs to be fixed.I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family... as long as you go with the right attitude, you cannot go wrong with the location and value.

Stay was ok. Serves purpose of relatively cheap stay in hub of town. Rooms are smallish with small beds. My bed was 6' for my 6' frame. CleanOn the day of checkout housekeeping started banging on door at 8-8.30 am till I woke up asking when will I check out. Checkout time is noon. She then proceeded to bang at other doors of the floor. This ensured that my plan to sleep in late before my long overnight flight was ruined. Front desk was unapologetically unafazed. "Will look into it" without a single "sorry".

Checked in a week ago, stayed for 3 nights and absolutely loved our stay there. We went to Hawaii on a short trip for my husband's birthday and the guy at the check-in (can't remember his name, but it starts with a 'K') offered to send Champagne for us! I told them to deliver it at midnight and they were right on time and even got a box of chocolates! Aaaahh how I loved the stay there and of course Hawaii is heaven on earth! If you book directly with the hotel, you get free breakfast - Breakfast included fresh pancakes, breads, oatmeal, and a good variety of cakes with of course the regular tea and coffee. Parking was a bit expensive, $20/24 hours - but you pay for the location and after getting the Free Upgrade on the room we didn't really mind paying the parking charges. I can keep raving about this hotel..the staff is so friendly and make you feel welcome! I would ANY DAY recommend this hotel to whoever is looking for a good value, friendly hotel to stay in Waikiki area.

My husband and I, both in our fifties, have thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Upon arrival we were informed that an update that we had requested had been granted and we were upgraded for free to the tenth floor with a World Class BeautyRest queensize bed. These beds are SO comfortable and despite the city noise, we slept like babies (sometimes 9 - 10 hours!)This hotel is very busy and appeared to be packed the entire time we were there. Service is excellent - these people are definitely trying to make an impression on their customers. There are people from all over the world that stay here and I heard nothing but great comments.
