We appreciated the great room service we received from Merlinda. Our room was spotless and she was so polite and helpful. We had problems setting up our laptop and upon requesting assistance from the front desk, a gentleman arrived at our room and within a few minutes he had diagnosed and fixed our problem. There is free internet here so bring your laptops. Frontend employees were professional, courteous and helpful. This hotel has an authentic "Hawaii" feel to it, with glass slats for windows that open to allow warm tradewinds to flow through your room. There is a huge acquarium filled with tropical fish located in the breakfast room. A large glass cistern filled with ice and water is available in the open lobby and welcomes thirsty patrons returning from their outings at the beach and city. The lobby has an inviting decor that beckons one to sit and enjoy the cool breeze that flows through the entire lower level. A stack of daily newspapers are free to patrons and I found this to be the added touch that made me feel like it was home. Beach towels were also available for visits to the beach. Our plane leaves at eight oclock this evening and the front desk said that we could store our luggage in their luggage room until it is convenient to pick it up.There is no reason to stay anywhere else in Waikiki unless you are in to the Los Angelos hotel style, but then why are you in Hawaii anyways? We stayed 12 days in the Aqua Aloha Surf and would definitely come back.

This was our first trip to Hawaii and also our honeymoon, we are an active couple who likes to run around and explore as much as we can during the day, then come back to a clean and comfortable room to relax in for the evening. Aqua Aloha Surf and Spa was perfect for us! The location is about 3 blocks from the beach which makes it close enough to walk around all the action but get away from it once back at the hotel. I should mention that we were staying on the 11th floor and being up so high reduces much of the city noise. There is an ABC convenience store and main bus stop at the end of the block in case you want to grab a snack or hop the bus to Chinatown or the airport. The room we stayed in was a Deluxe, the bed was comfortable, the water pressure and temperature consistency great, the city view awesome, and housekeeping did a fantastic and consistent job of keeping our room clean and stocked with fresh towels. There was no charge to park our rented motorcycle in the parking garage, but it is on a first come first serve basis. The staff was very friendly and helpful when checking in and out, and directing us on what buses to take. We would highly recommend this hotel for the active person/ couple who want a clean,comfortable room at a reasonable price to rest and relax in after a full day of exploring.

Great hotel. Located a couple blocks from the hustle and bustle of the beach. Beautiful views of Mountains and/or Ocean through the downtown area. downstairs area is great for work or bring in your own dinners. Spa services are excellent. Staff can give you lots of tips for things to do. Rooms are sunny and roomy. very comfortable furniture/beds. Across the street from a totally cool bar/restaurant/internet cafe.

The staff was friendly and very helpful plus remember us and our names. Our price include breakfast which we found to be very good but could have started earlier in the morning. Our room were a good size and even had a little kitchen. There was parking which we paid extra for per day for a good price for the area. Just a few short blocks from Waikiki and all that going on. For the price you can go wrong but remember it's not a 5 star big name hotel.

Excellent location, only about 2 blocks from Waikiki beach. Located near everything; shopping, food, entertainment, etc. What else can you ask for? The staff is wonderful, always friendly and so willing to help. Our family went there during the last week of October 2010. Yes, it is an older hotel that has been upgraded. Overall it is good, but some things can be better. Showers turn hot or cold so suddenly you get caught by surprise all the time! The curtains in our room was torn and nobody seemed to care. The TV was really small and my kids had a hard time watching their cartoons in the morning. There are only 1 full size and 1 twin size bed rooms, too small for my family of 4. I had to sleep in the twin bed with my 2 year old while my husband slept with our 4 year old. Not comfortable at all. There was the sofa bed but it looked so dirty (stains all over) I did not even think to sleep there. There was an incident when a drunk man fell asleep outside the door opposite to ours and we had to call security to come get him up and out. I really do like the location and price of this hotel and will stay here again...be prepared to pay for overnight parking at the hotel, not cheap. And free breakfast is bad, they do not serve real milk or juice. But it is FREE, right?

I stayed on the 3rd floor in a studio condo.The unit itself was very small with all the amenities including fridge,air conditioner,flatscreen t.v.,a comfortable bed and a shower in the bathroom (no tub).Also a room safe which came in handy. I enjoyed my stay in this condo hotel for the most part ,because it was a nice room,although very small.A few things were annoying like the slow elevators,and the disappointing breakfast in the lobby area.The pool is tiny.There was alot of outside noise(sirens) as this building is right beside the Ala Wai Canal, and the ambulances and fire trucks use the road to get around Waikiki. I

First impressions are seriously everything aren't they? Arrived at the hotel at around 12pm and was greeted by a very friendly member of staff (sorry can't remember her name!). She advised us that we were staying in a standard room which was only 220 square metres. Then she told us that she was able to upgrade us to a one bedroom of 360 square feet for no extra charge for our entire 6 night stay. Also we were able to check in then and there 3 hours earlier. Was very relieved to be able to go upstairs and have a shower after a long 10 hour overnight flight!The room was great, a huge king bed, balcony, microwave, small fridge and couch. Was extremely comfortable for our 6 night stay. The only critisisms I have are that the staff I didn't find were very comforting over the tsunami drama that unfolded when we were there. We were told don't worry it won't happen and they didn't seem concerned at all. We were obviously freaking out at this stage as it was our 2nd night in Waikiki. It's a small thing and it was only one staff member. I wouldn't not stay there because of that, just saying they could be a bit more helpful in a situation like this in future.The other is that like a lot of people have said, request a room on the canal side. We were in a room that directly faced the street right underneath the Food Panty. Every morning we heard trucks reversing at a very early hour which woke us up. I must also comment on the beds, wow so comfortable! Loved the pillows and want to buy myself one of those! Even with all the noise we did have comfortable sleeps that's for sure. The shower also was excellent, water pressure was really good! All in all a hotel I wouldn't hesitate to stay at again. Only a short walk to the beach and restaurants without the hefty price tag of other hotels.

Only a couple blocks from Waikiki's main drag of shops, kukui nut lei and sarong vendors, restaurants, bars, and surfer-beach-tourist crowds, the Aqua Aloha Surf & Spa is a relaxing, peaceful, & quiet hotel....just what this jet-lagged traveler needed.The hotel's partnership with Speedishuttle is a bargain. And efficient. I used their free WiFi in the lobby while sipping cool water and feeling a breeze blow through. My room was small but the bed was super-cozy. And if you're in Hawaii, why would you want to stay much in your room anyway?! I wasn't keen on having to bus my own table after breakfast but eh, it's free food.
user_name:
The_Big_Karuna
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Since some people seem to expect everything for a low dollar, I just had to write a review myself. This hotel has staff that can't be beat....always helpful, smiling and right there with the answer to any question or problem. Not that we had any problems. Sure the room was smaller than we expected, but since we aren't 'divas' and we weren't planning to spend much time in our room anyway so it was okay. The bed was so comfortable! And I certainly did not see anything dirty or torn in our room. Noise wasn't terrible and we were on street side, sure there's always people coming in late from bars, but it's a holiday destination! All the other bonuses outweighed the small room by far. Walking all over Waikiki looking at everything and shopping some was such a pleasure, on top of a daily short jaunt to the beach to see the activities there....always something! This was the best holiday we've had in years, but of course it's Hawaii! Even the tsunami scare the last night we were there, was handled very calmly and professionally by the staff and we felt unafraid....just paid attention to the information coming to us. Thanks for such a lovely holiday, we hope to be back one day.

We have stayed at this hotel on two other occasions and had a pleasurable experience. The hotel is reasonably priced, in a convenient location, and the rooms and service were satisfactory. Also, the free continental breakfast was an added bonus.However, during our stay March 16 - 22, we had a much smaller room that faced the street and was extremely noisy. We were also unaware that the free continental breakfast was no longer being provided to guests who do not book their rooms directly with the hotel. When I was informed about this by the front desk person, she stated I could speak to the manager.The manager, Tim Clark was arrogant, smug and was not the least bit interested in guest relations. He stated it was Travelocity's responsbility to notify us and that the change occurred in August 2010. He advised us to book directly with the hotel instead of with Travelocity if we want the breakfast included. He also commented that we got a very good deal on our package and what were we complaining about. Obviously, he is uninterested in ensuring guests return to his property. We definitely will not return to this hotel since there are so many other options available in Waikiki.

We stayed at the Aqua 6 nights in January. We wished it could have been more. Very beautiful hotel, perfect location to walk or take the buses. The rooms are very clean, roomy and so many windows with views!! The lanai was very big and again the views were spectacular. The staff was excellent. The managers party was so much fun. Also a full breakfast incl. each morning-that was terrific. Couldnt ask for more. We'll be back next year-but for a longer stay!!. Thanks Aqua for a wonderful time. Rich & Carol Mastantuono, New York

You will go a long way to beat this for a great value hotel in the heart of Honolulu. Rooms are clean and comfortable with a/c, nice beds etc. Serviced daily, free internet in room (bring laptop) even freelocal phone calls. Continental breakfast is pretty average but the hotel is 300 metres walk to main beach and just out of the real busy area. Staff are wonderful and it is a gem if you would rather spend your cash on tours, trips and attractions than overpriced hotels.

My husband and I spent 5 nights at the Aqua Aloha Surf and Spa in late Feb 2011. I booked the hotel after reading lots of reviews and forum posts here on TA, and overall was attracted to the price, location, and relatively good reviews. This is definitely a hotel for budget-conscious travelers who want a clean, safe and comfortable place to stay, but aren't adamant about having a vast array of amenities and services, or really updated luxuries. My husband and I are really active travelers who spend every moment of the day out and doing things - so we really just needed a place to crash at night and get some good sleep to energize ourselves for the next day's adventures. This hotel served that purpose. We checked into the hotel at around 5 pm on a Tuesday, which meant we walked right into the manager's weekly happy hour - a nice touch. Free cocktails, live music and socializing. The lobby is modern and chic, with friendly and efficient staff. There is exercise equipment around and a very small pool (we never used either). We did sit in the lobby for a few minutes one day to use the free wi-fi. When I booked the room, my reservation had included complimentary breakfast each day but upon check-in I noticed that we'd be charged $4.95 per day per person for breakfast. We decided not to have breakfast at the hotel if we had to pay for it, but in my experience $4.95 isn't too bad for breakfast in the Waikiki area, so maybe others would prefer to go for it. We're not huge breakfast people.I had booked a standard city-view room, and had seen photos here on TA and didn't expect much space. I was pleasantly surprised at the amount of room we had. A 6 drawer dresser, 2 night stands, a flat screen TV. Queen sized bed, a keyed safe. The most dated part of the room was the bathroom/shower stall, which is cramped and if you're over 5'8" you may find that it isn't much room - fortunately we're both pretty short, so it wasn't a problem for us. But on the whole, the room was clean and appointed with everything we needed. It wasn't pindrop quiet at night - in fact, I could here drunk partiers outside coming home each night/early morning around 3 am to nearby hotels, singing loudly and carrying on - but whatever. Waikiki is kind of a vacation party zone, so I imagine that goes with the territory. I had read about the noise and brought foam earplugs with me, but in the end I didn't really care about the noise and never used them. The hotel is located an EASY 3-block walk to Waikiki Beach and all the tourist areas. On your way you'll pass at least 3 ABC stores, a Burger King, a Subway, tons of other local restaurants and cafes and tourist shops, etc. There is every chain restaurant, fast food joint, etc. that you might care to visit, not to mention other local places. And tons of shopping - I had no idea what a shopping mecca Waikiki is. If you enjoy walking and don't mind the few blocks or not waking up to an ocean view, you can save yourself some money by staying here and taking in sights as you stroll to the beach, to lunch/dinner or other activities.One of the big concerns in the Waikiki area is parking. The Aqua Aloha has limited underground parking for an additional $20 a day, and I'd heard that the Aston Waikiki Banyan about 3 blocks away will let you park for $10 a day - but to our delight we were able to find street parking on Ala Wai Blvd. everyday except once for free, within 3-4 blocks of the hotel. We never had to circle more than twice, and you can park there anytime except Fridays 8:30-11:30 am for street cleaning (we were out anyway, so no problem). That being said, we live in a huge East Coast mainland city where we parallel park on the street every single day of our lives, and negotiating the street cleaning days, etc., so this was no biggie to us. If you're used to having garage parking at your home and hate jostling for street parking, maybe you should spring for the garage pass. But I was happy that we saved a few bucks doing this - and it was easy.The Aqua Aloha also has coin-operated washers and dryers in the basement/parking level, which we used - nice to be able to wash a load and pack light for your trip. The front desk provided me quarters for change, which was easy enough.If you're a runner, you'll be happy to know that the Aqua Aloha is located conveniently to several pleasant running routes, including a paved path around the Ala Wai Canal, and then routes that take you along the Queen's Park and then to Waikiki Beach and Diamondhead. You'll really like it. Overall, I'd definitely stay here again. At $119 a night and no extra for parking, we saved a ton of money that we could use to do other fun activities and eat some awesome meals out.

This hotel is cheap, and you get what you pay for! It is very old, located on an old rundown low end block. Old windows that do not close/lock all the way allowing lots of noise and air in all day and night. Old grose curtaines with holes, tears and tape on them. Noisy neighborhood - lots of sirens day and night as fire station located just down the street. All night, every night, lots of noise from local authorites, drunks on sidewalks, locals shouting and fighting with domestic disputes, druggies walking the streets at night. A scary and very noisey nieghborhood. Rooms are very small and old. Bathrooms old with paint peeling on walls and old tile showers with missing/cracked tiles and 1950's faucettes. Also not a very clean facility - mold and mildew and smells too. Window air conditioners inadequate and no fans for air circulation in room. Poor security. Small pool and no hot tub. Insecure lobby - completely open (no walls) from street. Poor security. We got no sleep, felt insecure, dirty, and did not feel comfortable walking through the neighborhood (especially at night). Very little parking available at $20/day. WE DO NOT RECOMMED THIS HOTEL! - You should pay more for a better place - it will definitely be worth it and make for a better trip!

This was our first time at the Aloha Surf, and it lived up to the 'Aqua' properties we've come to know and trust. We make two trips per year to Hawai'i and Aqua makes it more affordable. Come for the price, stay for the value.The staff is exceptional at the Aloha Surf as it is at the other Aqua Hotels we've stayed at. Always attentive, always serving. The hotel is a little older, has smaller rooms but plenty of room for two of us comfortably. And CLEAN. Even in the tropical climate we've never seen a single bug, and always have a sparkling clean room. Security and cleanliness are uppermost for us, and we are not let down. We feel safe and secure here which makes for a much better vacation. The manager, Tim, is very accommodating and accessible, even hosting a cocktail party for guests. It makes a very friendly atmosphere. The continental breakfast is nicely done, and saves us money over other Waikiki breakfast costs. It is obvious that Tim and his staff take the Aqua advertising seriously, it's not just words. They are that good. We will be back!

Aloha Surf & Spa's front desk personel are all very accommodating and efficient-they do not look like they are burdened with guest request and questions. Having a microwave and refrigerator and the ice maker downstairs was also a very big help. I stayed a duration of 11 days from February 11th thru the 21st with no problems. Even their housekeeping staff are very nice and accommodating. Having the Food Pantry next to the hotel was also very convenient and having a Redbox rental. There is no DVD player in the room, but I brought a portable one. The only problem is the water temperature while showering would change from hot to cold all the time. I also used the free internet access in the room.

I'm a bit late in putting up my review, but better late then never!!My husband and I stayed here back in April 2010 for our honeymoon, we stayed in the middle of the range room and it was perfect for our needs. The bed was very comfy and the room always spotless. Its a great location, only a short walk to numerous restaurants and convenience stores, there's even a small supermarket not far. The beach is an easy walk away and the pool area was great!The only down side for us was that the breakfast buffet was way to early for us! We made it down a couple of times, though we weren't too fussed, we normally just grabbed something on travels.All the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful.We absolutely loved Hawaii and really hope to come back again one day soon. We will definitely be staying at Aqua Aloha Surf & Spa again.

Rooms are small but adequate, with everything you need for a comfortable stay. Refrigerator, microwave, sink, coffee maker and dishes in room. Free breakfast in the mornings and free internet. Helpful and friendly staff. Later in the week we stayed at one of the "nicer" hotels that had none of the perks of this one for double the price.

We picked the Aloha Surf because of the positive feedback on Trip Advisor and because Tim (the manager) took the time to answer posts (good and bad). We were not disappointed. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is a short walk to the beach. The "budget" room where we stayed was very basic but we didn't find it uncomfortable (like some other reviews seemed to indicate and....there's a difference between "needs upgrading" and dirty. The Aloha Surf is not dirty). After all, we were there to enjoy Waikiki, not stay in our room. The managers reception on Tuesday night was fun with free drinks, music and massages. The continental breakfast was a big plus (wasn't nearly as sparse and some reviews indicate). The wireless internet in the lobby worked well as did the wired internet in the room (I suggest bringing your own 15 foot network cord). If you want a little more space in the room, I would suggest upgrading to one of the upper floors (we peeked). So, if you want to spend a lot of money and be pampered and stumble out of bed to buy $12 Mai-Tai's at the beach bar, please book at one of the "foo-foo" hotels. If all you want a place to hang your hat and sleep at night so you can enjoy time on the beach and sightseeing, the Aloha Surf is your place.

good for the price. but you get what you pay for. stay at the ilikai or hilton hawaiian village for peace and quiet... not this place. but pool area and staff were great here. and the beds are awesome.very small rooms! free internet was nice though.

We arrived at the hotel after long travel experience to find our room was not what we had reserved. We were told there was not any other room to be transferred to. Our room was furnished with old, dirty furniture. The sheets had spots on them. It was just a poor start to our vacation. The management was kind but said there was nothing to be done. We were not expecting a 5 star resort but we were expecting a 3 star with clean facilities. The breakfast, too, was mediocre at best. There was limited offerings and if you have dietary restrictions it would be difficult to eat it. Spend the extra $$ and stay at a better resort. Also, it is a block or so from the ocean. If you make the wrong turn, the street that runs parallel is filled with prostitutes and a very rough crowd in the evening.

My husbadn and I stayed here last year and are going back again this year for our Hawaii vacation. The hotel is at a prime location (right by the International Marketplace) and there are lots of stores and shops where you can pick up all of the necessities that you may have forgot! :) It's only about three blocks from the beach and there are also a lot of bus stops nearby. We didn't need a car rental last time we went because of the location. I thought that the staff were super freindly and extremely responsive to any inquiries that we had. This id definatley one of the best hotels to stay in while visiting Waikiki. I can't wait for our trip in May this year.

We stayed at the Aqua Aloha Surf & Spa hotel in January for 2 nights for our annual office retreat. This was actually our second time we spent our retreat at this hotel. The first time was great, so we decided to come again this year. The staff is very welcoming and helpful, and the service was excellent. The location is great, it's conveniently in Waikiki near all the shops and restaurants. The price on the rooms were very reasonable. We will definitely have our next office retreat here again next year.

Overall, we were happy with this hotel. You get what you pay for, so we weren't expecting a five star, beach front hotel. The hotel was clean and well kept. The lobby was very nice, but the rest of the hotel wasn't nearly as updated. The first night, our room was terrible. We were in a standard room (very small) on the second floor above the entrance way. I could barely sleep because it was so loud and the bed was very lumpy. Luckily, we were assured at check-in that we would be transferred to another room for the rest of our stay. The second room was perfect. It was a deluxe room on the eight floor facing the opposite direction. The room had a couch, coffee table, lanai, and was more roomy. We were much happier this room. The bed was also very comfortable, it was considerably quieter, and the extra space was very nice. Our biggest complaint would have to be the breakfast. We do not eat a big breakfast, so we thought that the complimentary breakfast would be a great bonus for us. We went the first morning and did not return. The breakfast selection was terrible. I have stayed a dozens of hotels with complimentary breakfasts and this was the worst. With that said, If the price was right for a deluxe room we would still stay again!

This is a very average hotel. The room was comfortable but had some definite wear and tear (cracked walls, etc). It could use some improvements. It is very close to the main walk/ beach which is a plus, just a few short blocks from Duke’s/ the main beach. The staff was friendly. We did have one major problem. We booked through Travelocity and on the website it states that there is free breakfast. When we arrived we asked what time breakfast was served and the hotel would not honor it. It took countless negotiating to get breakfast/ countless phone calls. The hotel ended-up offering it to us, which was nice, but very frustrating. We went down the next morning and were very disappointed. I don’t know why I fought so hard to get it. It consisted of some brown apple slices a few orange slices, some poor tasting bread and some pancakces. It was not worth the price! I would stay at this hotel if you are looking for an affordable price, you are not going to spend that much time in your room, and you want a great location. Also, I would NOT pay for breakfast.

I have stayed at the Aloha Surf about 12 times in the last 20 years, best bang for your buck in Waikiki. Convenient location to International Market and beach.- 5 min walk. Next to large food mart. Staff helpful, kind and courteous, always! Rooms comfortable and clean. I have checked many other facilitiies and talked to other guests, all feel this is the best place in its category.

It's a great place to stay if you don't plan on spending much time in your room and don't mind the noise at street level. After 7am, it's constant. If none of those things bother you and you're just looking for a bed or two 10 minutes from Waikiki Beach, your expectations will be met. The room was tiny, almost dormitory style, think 2.5-3*, but functional. I almost never stay in this type of hotel, but this is one place where the weather is so great, you don't need to be inside. It's fine if you get a great price!

My fiancee and I stayed here during our 10 day trip to Hawaii, and enjoyed every minute of it. I've been reading some of the previous negative reviews and I think they are uncalled for. The hotel staff is friendly, welcoming, and quick to resolve any issues. When we first got to our room, we could not get the AC to start. So we called the front desk, and in less than 5 minutes, the maintenance guy showed up and fixed the AC. YES, the rooms are tiny. But what do you expect? This is Waikiki, my darlings. Space is limited as it is, and I certainly do not blame the hotel for tiny rooms. If you are looking for large luxurious spaces, pick a more expensive hotel! We had no problems with the size of the room. The bed was exceptionally comfortable, and everything was clean. YES, it is noisy. MOST hotels located smack in the middle of the city are going to be noisy. Again, it's common sense. We were not bothered by the noise, in fact, it helped us to wake up earlier so we could get out and experience the things Hawaii has to offer. If you want a quieter hotel, pick one that's far from the city, or pick a higher floor. What we loved most was how amazingly good the housekeeping staff was. Rosalie did a wonderful job of keeping the room clean for us and making sure we were always stocked with necessities. In fact, one morning we overslept and did not leave the hotel until around noon, and when we returned that night the room had been cleaned! We had thought for sure that housekeeping would skip us since we ran so late, and were expecting to return to a messy room. But she must have returned to clean up well after finishing her rounds. The effort was definitely appreciated :) YES, the bathroom is a little older than other newer hotels, but so what?? It's kept clean, well stocked, there's hot water when you need it, and a shower stall. It's COZY, not run-down or falling apart. If you are looking to spend your vacation locked up in the hotel room and staring at a pretty bathroom with a bathtub, don't bother going to Hawaii in the first place! ;) Our room was equipped with a mini refrigerator and a microwave, and also a coffeemaker. We were also given a cord for internet access, which worked fine with us. We only had to use our laptop a couple of times to check on certain things. Overall, this was a nice cozy, clean atmosphere with a friendly ambiance. I would stay here again, especially since it is also reasonably priced.

This is basically a budget hotel. We were first given a tiny room with a really loud noise coming from an exhaust fan outside. We were moved to a more normal sized room, but the noise from outside was still incredibly loud. It felt like we were still on the plane, but it was after midnight and we were exhausted so I slept with earplugs. (Later we discovered one source of noise was large refrigeration fans at the Food Pantry which is right behind the hotel.) The problem is that the windows are louvered glass and can't keep out very much noise. The next day the clerk told us there was nothing else available, but then gave us a key to a room on the 8th floor with a sliding door that was somewhat quieter, but we could hear the elevator clanking up from below and stopping with a thud right behind the bed.This is Waikiki so of course we didn't expect total peace and quiet and our only other experience was at the Princess Kaiulani which was silent in comparison, but it's not very restful to have to turn on the TV just to drown out noise from the street. In response to the previous reviewer, we were in the back of the 3rd floor so I don't think it would have made a difference for you to move.We booked this hotel based the on the startlingly positive reviews here and the fact that it was only $100 a night during Christmas week compared to $200 at the Kaiulani. The location was good, but everything else was average including the staff, some of whom seemed inconvenienced by any disturbance. Maybe this is the best you can get in Waikiki at this price, but next time we won't mind paying a little more.Note: We had a completely different experience at another Aqua hotel on Kaua'i.

We are a couple ages 49 and 59 and travelled all over the world. Our expectations are very low and and will give you i hope a fair and honest opinion. This is our sixth time in Oahu and previously stayed at the Aston Resorts, Embassy, and Ocean Resort.The Good:Great open and inviting lobbyBed is really nice and comfortableOffer continental breakfast which is rare in Waikiki. Although the selection is limited it was a nice package.Free newspaper and Cold water always available in the lobby.Centrally located, close to all restaurants, bus stops, international market and few blocks away from the beach. The Bad:Our room # is 400 facing the street and the worst ever. The hotel is on the corner of Ala Wai Blvd. and you can hear everything. The window and sliding door are not sound proof. If my room is on the back I would have had an enjoyable sleep. I assume the higher the floor the lower the level of noise but I don't really know. By the way the first night I did ask for a room in the back but was told none available. After two nights I went to the front desk again and mentioned I am willing to pay but again none available. We were there for five nights and I didn't want to ruin my time there anymore. We were gone all day everyday and only came back to get ready for the dinner then bedtime. No matter how tired I am I can't get over hearing all the noises outside, ambulance, buses, even garbage truck at 4:30am.Bathroom is horrible. It is outdated that the plumbing system failed for us. The shower is so tiny and good for one person. The water pressure is so low and the temperature keeps on switching from hot to cold then back. Even this part I was not able to enjoy. I mentioned this to the front desk and was told they will fixed it. After two days I figured this is a plumbing problem so if you have this room be prepared.Hope this helps you. I certainly will try another Aqua resorts and pick a good location next time but not this one.

We stayed at the hotel with our two daughters (in their twenties), from Christmas Day until New Year's Eve Day. The four of us found the hotel very clean and an excellent location (far enough from the hussle and bussle of the beach and main drag, but yet plenty close to the hussle and bussle that it took only a few minutes to be on the main street and shopping, etc.) We couldn't imagine trying to get any sleep in any hotels closer to the beach. The front desk staff were very friendly and kind. No question was left unanswered; if they didn't know the answer, they would find it for you. We demagnetized our room keys many times and they reissued them with a smile every time. The towel system was great and there were always towels available when you were ready for a fresh one.When we arrived we had only booked one room, then decided to get a second room and were lucky enough to have rooms next door to each other. The rooms were quiet. Other than hearing a room door close, we never heard noise in the hall or from other rooms. The rooms were quite comfortable and cute and very clean. The fridge/microwave/dishes and kitchen sink were very handy to have and use.The continental breakfast was great - complete with fresh fruit, muffins, coffee/tea and even freshly made pancakes!The manager held happy hour one evening while we were there, complete with an interesting blue drink, music, massage chairs to try out and a sketch artist. What a nice touch! Made the hotel feel like a home away from home.We had parking for our rental car underground and the fee was very reasonable.The pool was a good size to cool off/relax in at the end of a busy day.There wasn't any Wifi in the rooms, but we were given a cable to use for internet hook-up, so that was just as easy.On our checkout day we were able to leave our luggage with the front desk for pick up later in the day - a service travellers really appreciate.Anyone looking for a reasonably priced vacation would certainly enjoy this hotel. This vacation was our 25th wedding anniversary and we were thrilled our daughter found us such a great hotel.

I really enjoyed staying at the Aqua Aloha Surf & Spa hotel. The staff was always very professional, helpful, and exited to help me have the best vacation ever! The rooms were comfortabIe and clean. I would stay there again and enjoyed the area it was located, as well. Because it was nestled into a residential neighborhood, you felt like you were really experiencing local Waikiki living. I also liked being close to the canal. I did some awesome morning walks and the walk to Waikiki Beach was convienient too. Shopping and transportation was all around so I felt you got the best of all that Waikiki has to offer!

We used this location for our yearly office retreat. It was a close walk to many shops and restaurants. It has a fun beach feel. As a local, I would visit this establishment again, just for a weekend getaway....great value!

Unless you plan to spend your entire vacation in the room....they are fine. Everything was clean and maid service was very good. Ofelia (the housekeeping manager) will see that you get everything you need. The breakfast in the morning is very good. Everyone is very friendly and always ready to help. The pool is small but nice and clean. The location is very good. Close to the beach and a lot of other places to visit. Close to bus and shuttles. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone. Especially if you are on a budget. Everything you would want at a good price.

Pros:-- Great location-- Friendly staff-- Nice lobby-- Paid on-site parkingCons:-- We had a tiny room with no balcony; space was almost too tight to walk between furniture-- Room was also uncomfortably warm, and street was too noisy to open windows-- Mediocre breakfast buffet

Not only was the Aloha Surf close to the action of Waikiki, it was also clean and comfortable. But the best part was the staff who were all courteous and profession. Any request we had was met with a smile and a quick response. Thanks for a great 13 days!

From just getting off a plane and having our cab driver pick a place to stay for us, he sure did choose a great one! Wish I would of remember his name to send him a thank you note! We really enjoyed our stay! It was real clean and everyone was super friendly and very helpful!!! The bed was so comfortable! It was the only comfortable bed we had the whole trip. Its really close to the beach, shops and resturants. I would so recommend this to anyone looking for a place to stay!!!! We will be definately staying there again!!!!!!

This hotel was reasonably priced and well within walking distance to Waikiki beach. We had a room at the front of the hotel though and found it very noisy throughout the whole of the night. The breakfast offered is also pretty poor, very basic and the breakfast room too small for the size of the hotel and its guests.

We rented three rooms for nine people total, one with the king bed and two with the double/ twin bed layout. It was one of the very few hotels in the area that we found that didn't charge extra for more than two people to a room. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated, and all in our party agreed that the beds were very comfortable. Even the hide-a-bed that my wife and I slept in wasn't half bad. Location is also a great, Waikiki, International Market and good restaurants for all tastes/budgets within 2 to 3 blocks. The only nit was no Wi-Fi in the room (it is available in the lobby), but they do supply an Ethernet cable for your room at no charge and are looking at putting in a Wi-Fi system for the rooms.

I was pleasantly suprised by Aqua Aloha! For the price I wasn't expecting much, but I assumed wrongly.Aqua Aloha is bright and welcoming. The staff friendly and happy to help. The room was wonderful- spacious, clean and fresh. My room was on the 14th floor at the back - I didn't experience any noise from the street- and water pressure was a little lacking. The location is neat too- seconds away from the shops and buses and a 5minute walk to the beach. I forgot about the free breakfast! I should have been staying another night but my family were snowed in in Europe so needed to cancel the reservation, the staff were kind and understanding, I wasn't expecting a refund but the manger very kindly gave me a full refund. MahaloI will definately recommend this others and hope to stay there again.

My wife and I visited Hawaii for the first time in early December and had a wonderful experience at the Aloha Surf. There was a bit of confusion with our reservation when we arrived but the staff, even though it was late at night when we arrived, treated us very considerately, got us the room type we had booked and were very comforting. The problem was resolved the next morning and once again everyone on staff was very professional and polite. The room was at the top of the hotel on the street side, which made it somewhat noisy - especially when some of the delivery trucks came by early in the morning! The room was clean, had everything needed - very comfortable Queen bed, LCD TV, fridge, microwave, A/C, free phone and I believe there was highspeed Internet (saw the cable but didn't try it out as they had free wireless in the lobby), also included was a free room safe. There was a roomy bathroom, with a standard modern shower stall. A few things could have been fixed up a bit, like one of the window cranks and the sliding door curtain-lining which was torn. Overall a comfortable relaxing room.In the morning there is a free Continental style breakfast with fresh-made pancakes, toast, muffins, cake, oatmeal porridge, fresh fruit and a variety of beverages. There is a free coffee machine that brews good, fresh, individual cups in the lobby next to the breakfast room, all day.We attended the Manager's Reception on the Tuesday and had a lovely time drinking a few "Wipe Outs" that were expertly mixed by Tim the hotel manager. We spoke a little and I mentioned that we were visiting in part to celebrate my wife's birthday the next day. Imagine our surprise when the next day in the lobby Tim came by and presented my wife with a very nice box of local chocolates ( her favorites) and wished her a very Happy Birthday! We were impressed that he could remember something like that after meeting and speaking with so many other guests the night before! Considering that we had no idea where we should stay in Honolulu when we booked our trip, I think we made the right choice and had a lovely holiday experience by choosing the Aloha Surf. We would come back any time. Thanks again to Tim and all his staff for making our stay a pleasurable experience.
Tried to change our reservations because of a cancelled flight and they would not even honor their own reservation policy! Front desk staff was rude, unhelpful and refused to listen.

Aqua Aloha Surf & Spa was a very comfortable place to stay....we were a group of 3 couples & our rooms were clean, with everything you need, a little small but overall we were very satisfied... we stayed on the street view side & it was a bit noisy, so we were awake early, but this got us up & going to enjoy everything Hawaii has to offer...The Tuesday Managers get together was fun, thankyou!!! The staff were very helpful & even provided us with poncho's on the rainy day...The breakfast was a little different with cakes & donuts on offer, but we survived by adding some fruit & real milk, from the panty next door through the car park.... Great location & We all had a great time......I do reccommend Dukes & the Cheesecake Factory for meals... UNREAL!!!!

I stayed here a few days before Christmas. It is a nice place, only a few blocks from the beach. The value for the hotel/location is excellent and service was outstanding and the room was clean.They have a small gym (located in kind of of a weird place), they have 3 pieces of exercise equipment available to use from 5am on. It is located at the back end of the lobby in an open area, I used the treadmill and it worked fine.The only thing I did not rate highly was the air conditioning for the room. The a/c worked fine, however it is located by the base of the floor on the opposite end of the room from the bed. We all know that hot air rises, so the fact that the cold air starts off at the bottom of the floor really does not help cool down the room and even though the air was blowing cold from the a/c unit, it did not have a lot of fan speed behind it so the room really never got that cool. I had it blowing at 60 degrees, but it was still a bit warmer than I normally liked. My room was facing the street so there was a certain amount of street noise that could not be avoided late at night, so if you want a room that is quieter, you may want to request a room facing away from the street.They also serve a very nice continental breakfast, pancakes, oatmeal, small muffins, slices of fruit, toast. (Included with your price of the room). Overall, a nice hotel for the price and I would stay here again.

Fast free internet (much faster than the paid internet at the Hyatt down the street), free continental breakfast, clean rooms, comfortable bed, friendly and helpful staff, close to the main shopping area and 5-10 minutes walk from the beach. The only minor issue was a noisy air-conditioner, but turning it off over night solved the problem. All in all, excellent value for money and would definitely stay again.
The Aloha Surf has great staff, a wonderful lobby, and is close to the beach and world market.

We stayed here for our very 1st time in Hawaii and what an amazing hotel! The staff are all brilliant and helpful,rooms are small but spotless,beds are sooo comfy and yes the continental breakfast is full of carbs but it is free and totally satisfying...eggs,bacon,sausage available down the block at denny's!($$$)The Wipe out cocktail @ the Tuesdays weekly reception free and delicious! The pool is awesome!We totally loved Hawaii and where sad to leave! We will be back and we will stay here again!!! Thanks for the memories!

Just got back from Hawaii and loved it! I really enjoyed staying at Aloha Surf, although it doesnt have the brand name of the big hotel chains, the stay was definitely value for money! The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, often offering tips on what to do and where to eat. The free continental breakfast was surprisingly good and the rooms are pretty spacious and clean.
user_name:
Valerie Z
Jersey City, New Jersey

review_body: I was visiting my daughter who is attending university on the Island, and one night we had a couple of her friends show up and needed an extra room. The hotel staff was so nice about taking care of us even late in the evening. Housekeeping did a very nice job refreshing our room daily. The rooms are small but efficiently arranged and very nice. I liked the location as a runner, right next to the canal and close to the park where one can run on out past Diamond Head/around the crater. It is also within a block or two of everything happening on Wakiki. I worked one full day out of the hotel room - Internet access was reliable and fast. I would highly recommend the hotel and will stay there next time I'm in Honolulu. It is a great find in Honolulu.

Nolan was great in the front and took care of us like a champ- Mahalo. Watchin football on the outside TV was nice as well. We stayed there 4 days and it was nice to have the grocery store next door. The breakfast was OK for a quick bite but we could of used some meat. 3 block walk to the beach, prices seemed better than most. Little pool but was perfect for the little ones. Good time Good People.
I liked almost every thing except the Breakfast no choice at all. In my opinion it better to charge a fee for it and have more choices.

This is an excellent hotel for the budget conscious. I booked early and prepaid to get a discount. The staff are helpful and friendly and there are perks such as a continental breakfast, entertainment and free cocktails on Tuesdays, no charge local calls, and beach towels. The hotel is about 3 blocks from the beach, close to the Ala Wai canal. The Food Pantry grocery is on the same block. I paid a little extra for a "superior" room with a sofa and coffee table. It is really a small studio suite. Dishes and cutlery are provided. It would have been nice to have a dish towel - I had to use a bath hand-towel in place of one. There is a fridge, microwave and kitchen sink, so you can put simple meals together. I didn't use the barbeque by the pool but that's an option for more cooking.Tim, the manager, Helen on reception and Nolan make this a specially warm hotel. There is lots of opportunity to meet other guests and chat at breakfast which is a real plus if you are traveling solo.A couple of things to be aware of is that the pool is too small to do laps - it is more of a plunge pool. Also, if you need protein or fresh milk with your breakfast, you will have to provide that yourself. I prefer to swim in the ocean anyway and I chose the oatmeal for breakfast, so these two things didn't matter to me.I recommended this hotel to a friend who also loved the place.

My stay was pleasant, the room was very clean and had everything that a traveller needs. Safe,iron, hairdryer and a great comfortable bed, the coffee machine, microwave and fridge was a bonus. I was very pleased with the value for money that the hotel gave, I booked and paid 60 days in advanced and got a great deal. I booked the basic room and even through it was small it met my needs as a single traveller. I look forward to returning to Hawaii in 2011 and will be looking at booking at Aqua Aloha Surf & Spa again.

Nice place to stay. Our room has been recently renovated. Everything is new except for the drapes / blind which is probably the last thing it needs. Great location, not that noisy. Manager's reception was great, especially the free drink served by the manager himself. We stayed in the bigger room which is nice, not that we needed it, since we just in the room to sleep.

When my husband and I booked, we really weren't sure if we booked the right hotel, for we had booked the one across the street at first....However for what we paid, we were very happy. If you are looking for a comfortable, clean room, with a breakfast that is included, then this is the place!! The bed was extremely comfortable and overall, clean. The staff is very nice and helpful and we thoroughly enjoyed the Manager's Night, a very nice added touch (especially for a three star).We laughed when we read the review about a barking dog, because he is very annoying and we would like to add the singer that thankfully we only heard once from 5-6 in the morning. People should remember that Waikiki overall is very busy and noisy and I think it would be noisy anywhere that you stay, except maybe the expensive ones with the rooms that face the beach.We were overall happy with our stay and would definitely stay there again. We used the extra money that we saved, to explore the island. Thank you to the staff of Aqua Aloha Surf and Spa.

We stayed in a city view room on level 8 of this hotel, and had a very comfortable stay. Just a few tips/ inside knowledge for travelers wishing to stay here in the future. The room title are what they say: We overlooked the rooms of many apartments on the other side of the street.The service is good quality: Rooms are cleaned everyday, staff are warm and friendly, beach towels are provided free of charge, on Tuesdays they have a Hawaiin cultural afternoon where cocktails and live music is all done free of charge, Coffee and cold water is available free in the lobby and the hotel was kept very nice (christmas lights and all).Breakfast: Occurs betweeen the hours of 7 and 8:30am. It is mostly sweet (being Australian I am used to cereals, youghurts and good old vegimite on toast) hot pancakes are served, a selection of a few fruits and a few desert items such as cupcakes and donuts. Coffee, juice and iced tea is also served.To Waikiki main strip: The walk is about 10 minutes to the main strip of shops, and a few more minutes to Waikiki beach.So all in all this hotel is definately recommended by me and the rest of my family.

This hotel is a good value for the money. The room was adequate in size and clean. The service staff was very good and always helpful when we needed them. The location - a few blocks from Waikiki Beach -- was also a plus.When I go back to Honolulu I plan to return to this hotel.

My husband and I took my Mom, who lives on Oahu, to the Aloha Surf Hotel for Thanksgiving and to celebrate her birthday, the next day. She loved the huge, comfortable bed in the one-bedroom suite. The free breakfast was a treat. We've stayed at the Aqua Aloha Surf many times but this is the first time we've stayed in the one-bedroom.

This is the perfect little suite to throw a intimate little party with friends. The balcony was romantic and the beds were soft. The interior was funky and had a friendly feel putting everyone in a good mood.. I would definately reccomend this hotel for people looking for a night away from the pressures at home.

This is our second time with Aqua hotels. First time we spent 4 nights in Bamboo, and this time 4 nights in Surf and Spa. Surf and Spa is cheaper than Bamboo, and actually quieter if you get a room at higher floor( 10 and above). We got a ocean view room, which is a plus. The room was clean but a bit small. Nice and comfortable bed. The service crew were all nice and helpful. We highly recommend this hotel to you if you are on a budget. It is close to everything, especially to bus, ABC and Food Pantry.

I would like to thank all the staff at Aloha Surf for making my stay very comfortable and relaxed. Nothing was too much problem and I would definitely stay there for my next trip. The lobby and pool areas were attractive and the Tuesday Wipeout was enjoyable and great way to interact with other guests. My room was without hesitation spacious, clean, quiet and very comfortable. The location suited me very well, easy walking distance to everything. Mahalo to the staff, can't wait to come back and stay again!

Hi,I just returned from my trip yesterday so I thought I write some general remarks while still fresh. Even though I was going on a budget trip I had an amazing time. I wanted to stay under a $1000.00 for air/hotel. So these comments are just my opinion. I have done some travelling so I know what I like and dont like.Hotel was basic but clean and the staff where very friendly.Room-well, what can I say it was very small with two single beds (not doubles). I bit dated, bathroom was small and only had a shower. The windows in the room had those panel so it was very noisy. My room had a fridge and we also had internet connect but had to use cable. We made a comment to the hotel manager and they offered to upgrade us to a bigger room but we decided to stay in same room since we did not spend alot of time there.Hotel Location-was about 2 blocks from beach so I was fine with this. Parking-they do have parking but it was 20.00/day (bit expensive) and one night there where no parking for us.Breakfast-I am bit fussy here so we only ate the first morning and that was the apples/oranges and the toast. Very basic. There is a restaurant 1 block down on the corner with breakfast for 3.95 (2 pancakes, bacon and eggs). I also purchased some fruit from the ABC stores and had the spinach egg wrap from Starbucks. There are many options.Beach - was pretty nice. The water was cold but on those hot days it was refreshing. We had nice weather during our trip. The beach was busy at times but we where ok with this. We where going to rent some umbrellas at the beach but found out our hotel offered those cheap ones and they worked just fine. They also offered boogie boards and the matts. You can buy the matts for $1.99 at the ABC stores.Restaurants-lots around but our favorite is the cheesecake factory. We had this salad that was big enough for 3 people. Drinks are expensive. 8.95 for tropical ones. Duke's another favorite-right on beach and live music. Starbucks is one block up and 2 blocks over. We went to Honolulu to this restaurant called Aloha Tower-very nice, had live music. We also went to Jameson's by the Sea in Haleiwa (north shore).Car Rental-we rented an convertible for 2 days. We went to the North Shore (Waimea Bay) and to a luau at Paraside cove (booked thu hotel) for $125.0 for deluxe package which includes seating at front, meal is served, 4 drinks, picture and a mug. I didnt drink since I drove there. You can take tour bus.If you are driving anywhere, leave before 4:00 or after 6:00 since the highway is very busy.North Shore beaches where amazing and quite - we went on the monday so not as busy. Also, if you see the red flags up beware. People are in the ocean but that is the locals and they know the water. The power of the ocean took us by surprise!!We went to Pearl Harbour-very interesting-you cannot take your back packs in so leave in car. you can take camera.So overall I had an amazing time. We would stay at this hotel again-yes. I would get a different room. There is alot to see in Waikiki but drive around the island. It is amazing!!!

Kind and helpful staffs.. Nolan is the best ! Manager Timothy's Tue's special-wipped out drinks are the BEST ..The hotel is walking distance to everything. easy to commute w/buses to everywhere..a couple of blocks to International Mkt.. and glad to find a nice/cozy small Chinese Rest. near the mkt where Cheesecake Fact was pack w/tourists from everywhere..
user_name:
DaJennster
New York City, New York

review_body: Hotel has bright and open lobby, surfing activities on the monitor’s gives a feel of being in Hawaii right away, front desk was friendly and quick to help me check in. Room was on 12th floor and I had an ocean view from the Lani. My room was clean and the Microwave and Refrigerator were a nice convenience. Hotel is walking distance to all of Waikiki, Waikiki beach and Duke’s were only 3 blocks away, Restaurants were less than a block away and night life 2 to 3 blocks away, close enough to walk to but far enough away you do not here them at night. Room was quiet and comes with an air conditioner with a thermostat to adjust as needed. Free Breakfast is very good. Overall a great value.

My husband and I could not have been more pleased with our five night stay at the Aqua Aloha Surf and Spa and the affordable price in November 2010. We were especially grateful to a front desk clerk who responded immediately and went out of her way to help us find the location and phone number of the local Kaiser Permanente HMO when my husband thought he had gotten a sting in the ocean. We found all the staff to be helpful and friendly.We upgraded to a superior city view room that was perfect for the two of us. For us, it would not have been as enjoyable with any more than 2 adults. The full wall of windows with the sliding glass door onto the lanai made the room feel light and airy and we enjoyed sitting on the couch looking out. We appreciated the many amenities. The in-room safe allowed us to be carefree when we went to the beach for our surf lesson knowing that our valuables were locked up. The mini-kitchenette with plates and silverware allowed us to "eat-in" 4 very simple suppers and pack lunches. It was great to have the Food Pantry right next door. I was pleased to find cooked oatmeal, bread for toast, pancakes cooked on a griddle, and orange wedges on the free breakfast line rather than just sweets. We were amazed at the high benefit to cost ratio of staying at this hotel.

My husband and I recently returned from Waikiki, Oahu, Hawaii and stayed at the Aqua Aloha Surf and Spa. We went with this hotel as it was part of a package deal of which Flight Centre had put together for us. We both found it to be a very average stay.When we could eventually check into our room we found it to be small and pokey but neat so we thought we could manage. However we soon established that the room was dodgey. You couldn't have the lamp and window aircon on at the same time or it would short out. We managed to get another room from the disgruntled staff. However, the rooms in which we stayed in faced right onto the road and there was sooo much traffic noise all throughout the night!The breakfast which they supply was substandard in our opinion. Pancakes and fruit we felt was a little lacking.The hotel is situated a couple of blocks away from the beach which, in some respects, is good depending on personal preferance.Overall we wouldn't stay here again and we were disappointed with what the hotel had to offer.

We just stayed there for one night. The room was clean, pretty big and the price good. The bathroom was tiny and you couldn't close the sliding door properly. The area was quite noisy but beach and shopping area within walking distance. Nice view from the balcony. Service was friendly and very helpful.

I just want to say that after the reviews, I thought it could go either way. But, I thought overall, it was a wonderful stay! Clean rooms, friendly staff. The continental breakfast could use some work, in the way of protein. I was kind of disappointed that we didn't get upgraded, since my travel agent let them know it was our anniversary, but, I guess that is the way it goes. Great pool, great bed, overall, would definitely stay again! One side note...on our final day, we booked a tour because we had a late flight. Our tour ended up being late and we almost missed out flight shuttle bus to the airport. I just want to say that from the moment we asked if we couid stow our baggage at the front desk, to the moment we picked it up, the front desk staff was AWESOME!! Don't know who all was working at the front desk on Friday, November 12, but they were all awesome! My husband is an insulin dependent diabetic, and they were so helpful about keeping his insulin cold for us! Anyway, great stay! Would definitely recommend and stay again!

Let me start off by saying that we would definitely stay at the Aqua Aloha Surf & Spa again, despite the cons I'm going to list below. It was a tremendous value and we're quite happy overall with our stay.The hits:- awesome location- clean rooms- friendly staff- really comfy beds- wicked powerful A/C in the rooms!- Ethernet cable for in-room internet provided at no cost- free beach towel and beach mat lending service- we always found parking (and always underground for 7 of our 8 days!) in the hotel lotThe misses:- Aqua's website is misleading in terms of internet accessibility...wifi is only in the lobby; rooms only have a wired access port. I'm not saying that they should spend the money to put wifi in every room, but clarifying the website would alleviate guest disappointment - just let us know in advance that there's only wired internet up in the room, that's all.- the 'continental breakfast' really wasn't up to snuff (unless you're into eating nothing but sugar for breakfast). Pancakes, cakey muffins, toast (only butter - no other condiments), some sad looking apple slices, powdered donuts, and chocolate cake (seriously!) were on hand, but that was it. That being said, cheap Hawaiian breakfast can be had in pretty much any direction within a block's walk for the $3.75/person range, so it's really not that bad.- this is a little picky, but a higher grade of toilet paper would sure be nice...it's not like gas station toilet paper or anything, but definitely the cheapest stuff I've ever seen in a hotel. But that's easily fixed by picking up your own if it bothers you.Overall we're really happy with our stay here, and would go out of our way to stay here again - and would definitely recommend it to others. It's sure no Moana Surfrider, but you definitely get more value than you pay for in dollars.

Get down early for Breakfast, as it gets very busy. theHotel is very well located and the staff are very helpful and friendly. Rooms are good siz but bathrooms small however showers very good . Excellent value.

We had 4 nights here at the end Oct/beginning Nov - Location is great - Rooms clean and no problems there if a little basic - but what was expectred for the price - Staff were friendly but in the 4 nights they could not get the internet working in our room - They allowed me use of wireless internet in the lobby which served the purpose if a little inconvenient.Forget the breakfast and eat down town - Breakfast was full of sugar and carbohydrates - sweet muffins, pancakes etc - Orange Juice was so sweet that I believe it might have been cordial - Rolled oats was the only cereal - but no milk - The tea was so weak that we resorted to bringing tea bags f& milk brought from the supermarket which was very conveniently next door - Maybe that is the American taste In summary a good clean basic hotel that need to lift their act for the breakfast

Stayed for almost a week at this property. Let's start with the highlights: Location is good. Right near the canal and four longer blocks from the beach. Enjoy being away from the madness of the beach hotels. The lobby is bright and airy with a large TV. Nice place to seat to plan your day or wait for a tour bus. Also received a good rate.The rooms themselves are average. Decent size with a nice touch of mini fridge, sink, microwave and plates & utensils in your room. I was on a higher floor and had a nice view of the city. Didn't find this hotel any noiser than any other hotel in a big city. The shower was great, but no bathtub if you want that. Sink and vanity are outside of the shower/toilet room. Small, but enough space for my toileties. Didn't have to wait long for either of the two elevators. Free papers each morning in the lobby.Now for the downside: The furniture is dated. My sofa had stains all over it. The lighting in the room is almost non-existant. If you want to sit anywhere but the bed at night, you won' t see much. The room also had a strange smell to it. My balcony was covered with water leaking from my airconditioner and bird feces. Didn't use it during my stay.They offer Wifi in the lobby. If you don't have a computer, they have (a self named)"world's greatest internet cafe" in the lobby. It was only open once during my week and then the employee told me that the internet was not available.The hotel offers a complimentary breakfast. It is sparse. For someone who is looking for healthy options, they do have fresh fruit, which is nice. The breakfast is from 7-830 daily, so if you arent up early, you will miss out. They state they have a fitness center. It looks to be two machines off the lobby. The week I was there, both had big bags over them saying out of order. Asking the front desk for other alternatives, he told me he knew of none.This brings me to the bigger issue I have with the hotel: The staff. With the exception of the hotel's manager (who could have not been nicer) and the woman who works overnights at the front desk, I was surprised at the demeanor and service the front desk offered. From the man who checked me in to the afternoon and evening staff. No one ever had a smile or friendly greeting. This is Hawaii, so as someone who travels there often, I really expect more. At this hotel, I felt that I shouldn't. You really felt like you could have been at any big chain location along any highway in the country.Though I love the location and this hotel has much potential, because of the lackluster staff, I would definitely have to think hard before returning.

Very nice hotel. Walking distance to Beach, shopping, restaurants. Very comfortable beds. Rooms had balcony, frig, and microwave. Free breakfast saved us a lot on money. Would definitly stay here again. Great value.

My sister and I spent one week at this hotel (October 10 to 17, 2010). We had stayed at another Aqua resort in spring 2009 and had an idea of what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised and pleased to discover this hotel surpassed our expectations. This hotel so much better compared to the other Aqua resort we stayed at last year. Everyone at front reception/desk staff was extremely helpful pleasant and professional. I dealt with a lot of the staff at the front desk because of internet problems (my computer was not configured properly and I had to try and sort this out with my IT department back at home). One staff member (unfortunately, we didn't get his name) was very helpful providing directions and making suggestions for how to spend the day - even to say advise us "Ladies - medium rare" for amount of sun exposure we should get.The room was a bit dated but that was OK because we weren't spending our vacation in the room. The beds were very comfortable (new pillow top mattresses) and they gave us clean towels every day. Note, at this Aqua hotel, they provided towels for the beach. Last year, we had to take bath towels to the beach. The breakfast though predictable was better than other hotels where breakfast is included in the price - pancakes, oatmeal and fresh fruit.The hotel was closed to public transportation, shopping and within a short walking distance to the beach.I would recommend this hotel. If I ever come back for another vacation I certainly would consider staying here again.

My sister an I arrived early, was able to check in though room not ready (knew that, was ok with us) Hotel had storage space for our baggage so we could start sightseeing right away. Only a short walk to Waikiki beach. Close to many restrauants, shopping and The Bus, this was necessary as we did not have a car. Complimentary breakfast was more than rolls and coffee. Hotel very clean and the service was great. Made our 3 day after cruise visit a relaxing and enjoyable time. Would stay here again and I tell everyone if you are in Honolulu you would not go wrong staying at The Aqua Aloha Hotel and Spa.

This was our first time in Oahu, we were celebrating our one year anniversary. We chose the Aloha Surf and Spa because it was only two blocks from the beach and it was inexpensive. It is also very close to the International market place and other shopping. The room was clean and the bed was super comfortable. The bathroom does need some updates but was fine. We enjoyed and appreciated the continental breakfast each morning because the cost of meals in Waikiki can get quite pricey. We went to the Managers reception where Tim the manager made these yummy wipe out cocktails for everyone you could also get massages or sketches of you in the lobby while we sipped on drinks and listened to the ukulele music and singing. What a great way to get to know their guests. Nolan at the front desk was super helpful. He helped us plan our daily activities, told us the best ways to get around, and helped us with the bus schedule. He does an A++ job! Thanks to all the staff for a super memorable stay. We will be back for sure!

The hotel was exactly what I was hoping for. 3 minute walk to the beach, free continental breakfast, close to restaurants, grocery stores, coffee shops, shopping...everything! Very clean, affordable and nice, friendly staff. Fridge, microwave and dishes in the room.

This is my third trip to Oahu and my second stay at the Aqua Aloha Surf. I stayed here the last time I was on Oahu and was very happy with it so it was an easy choice. We arrived after an 8 hour flight to find that they had no record of our room that we'd booked 6 months earlier through Delta Vacations! I was ready to freak out as we'd already paid but Vinh at the front desk quickly told us not to worry and that he'd take care of us. He said that on our first night we'd have a small room but if we could hold out, he'd upgrade us the following day. The next day we went on a tour and when we came back, sure enough, we were all set up with a bigger room and they'd even moved our luggage for us. I was very happy with the service and the room had a balcony, a microwave, refrigerator, sink and dishes. We enjoyed our stay here very much and the price is right too! It's not right on the main drag so there wasn't really a lot of street noise either. I think the rooms must have been pretty well insulated because we never heard any other people on our floor at all. We joked that the whole floor must have been reserved just for us! I slept like a baby too, I don't remember the beds being that comfortable the last time I was there!I was also glad that this time I was able to attend the manager's reception on Tuesday night! I only made the tail end of it but was very glad that I got to try the legendary Wipe Out cocktails which were very good by the way. And free breakfast was also a money saver! I don't think many places offer a free breakfast so I was very happy about that! They had fresh pancakes, fruit, donuts, muffins, oatmeal, juice and coffee and round the clock ice cold water in the lobby. I love this place - though not really high end, it is friendly and clean and is a hidden gem if you ask me.

As others have mentioned, this is a "value" hotel. Not a fancy resort, but that's ok. We stayed there for a week and enjoyed the clean room, open air lobby, free towel loans at the front desk, complimentary breakfast, wi-fi in the lobby, and Manager's Reception with free drinks, music, and chair massages. We were overall quite happy with it. I won't fault them for the garbage trucks in the morning--not their fault.I will mention a couple points that could be improved, both of which have already been mentioned. First, the breakfast is just sweet carbs. Pancakes, muffins, and actual chocolate cake for breakfast. There was oatmeal and some cut fruit, true, but the breakfast really needs something else...I like the previous commenter's suggestion of hard boiled eggs. Or at least milk to go with the starches. The fake juice was a bad drink to start the day with. Second, they really need to be clearer about returning the parking passes. Exactly like the previous person, we had no idea we were supposed to return it, so when we checked out, they tried to charge us for parking for all days. We convinced them we'd only used it one day, so they corrected it, thank goodness. If they weren't as accommodating, this would have been a huge bummer.So I spent more time on the two improvement areas than the rest, but really, the rest of it was all pretty good. Note: I didn't use the spa, so I can't comment on that. I'd have no qualms about staying here again or recommending it. Especially on a Tuesday for Tim's Wipeout cocktails!

Clean and nice rooms. Good service. Close to ABC store and only a 5 minute walk to the beach. The rooms on the road side of the hotel is a bit noisier than the rooms on the inner side. We would definitely stay here again!
Over the years I have visited Honolulu once or twice a year. My favorite hotel is the Aloha Surf. Reasonable in price, great location & best of all a great friendly staff.

This is the second time we have stayed at an Aqua Resort in Hawaii and have found at both resorts the staff very helpfull and friendly and would definately stay here again.We had a room on the 9th floor near the lift which was very convienent .The deal was good with a continental breakfast included.Although this resort is just over a block back from the beach area it was very close to the rest of the action in Honolulu.

We had a great stay. We chose the option to upgrade if it was avaiable and it was well worth the extra charge. The breakfast in the morning was more than enough for what we needed. We really enjoyed our stay and look forward to another visit

I've been to Oahu twice before, but this was the first trip I booked for myself and was definitely pleased with the Aqua Aloha Surf & Spa. My girlfriend and I were considering multiple hotels, but location, room accommodations and affordability made the Aloha Surf our top pick. Being located right along the canal offered a wonderful view of the neighborhoods north of us in the hills. Each morning you could watch as the clouds cleared overhead revealing the mountains just as the sun touched them. Amazing! The walk to Waikiki was also pleasant, maybe 8-10 minutes if we took our time. The staff were all great. I wish I would have remembered a few names. All were helpful with towels for the beach, directions to local hot spots and made check-in and check-out painless. Even though our room was a bit snug it came with everything we needed to enjoy our trip at it's fullest. Besides, we were hardly in our room except to crash at night after a full day of trips around the island. We would certainly look at returning to the Aloha Surf in the future and most definitely recommend it to our friends.

It's not a five star hotel. And it's three long blocks from the beach. But you're also not paying $300 a night. This hotel goes the extra mile, something not so common these days for a 2-3 star hotel. Front desk staff - and room service, for that matter - are cheerful and helpful. Rooms are a tad dated, but in excellent condition and kept spotless. Never ran out of hot water. A stack of newspapers are at the lobby elevators. Towels are terrific and there's a never-ending supply of them at the front desk if you want to take them to the beach or use around the pool. The pool is too small and the loungers seem always to be inhabited by the same people who missed the kindergarten lesson about sharing — but the most famous beach in the world is three blocks away so why stay at the pool? A couple small gripes: the included breakfast is too sweet and desperately in need of some protein — perhaps a hard-boiled egg would be a cost effective way of responding to this. Also, parking is available if you book a day or two ahead — but make sure that when you return the car to the rental agency that you let the front desk know that you don't need parking anymore, or else they assume you still want it and charge you at the end of your stay (actually, when we explained ourselves, they took it off the bill, but you may not look so honest or pitiable). This chain is the only Hawaiian-owned chain, so the money stays in the local economy. Next time, we'll stay at an Aqua Hotel again, but perhaps a different one just for the change. Oh, and make sure you ask for a balcony if you want one.

From beginning, over the Internet with Tim to end, we really enjoyed our stay. The only thing I didn't like was the garbage trucks waking me up at 7:30 in the morning, so next time I'll ask for a room on the other side. However we had a view of the canal, which was great for people watching. Tim is a lot of fun at the Wednesday reception and even managed to spill a drink on himself as he was making them. Aimee at the desk was our best friend by the time we left. She was so incredibly knowledgable and helpful, it was just amazing. So, if you decide to stay there, ask for Aimee, you won't be disappointed and I was bugging her every day. Will definitely stay there again!

My sister and I stayed at the Aloha Surf for two weeks and we loved it! It was quiet, clean (enough) and within walking distance to everything. Comfortable was what we wanted and that was what we got, I suppose. The cleaning was a bit uneven though. The first few days it was perfect and then it wasn't. The shower had obviously been overlooked and the dishes were poorly cleaned. We assumed it couldn't possibly have been the little sunshine of a cleaning lady whom we met the first days since she always left the place spotless. It does feel petty to complain about two or three (four?) days of not so great cleaning when everything else was super, but there it is.In conclusion I suppose the only thing I didn't like about the hotel was that I couldn't take Nolan home with me. How can anyone be in such a good mood as early as 7 am? In all the staff was very helpful; Lance for instance was complete and utter awesomeness for printing our boarding passes and fixing our hotel key in the middle of the night. I'll definitely come back to this hotel and then hopefully Vinh can finish explaining the rules of American football.

The bed was wonderful!! Location is great!! Rooms are spotless! Bathrooms are a bit small and in need of some upgrading (but plans are in progress). You could hear some noise outside at night, but nothing overwhelming. I chose this hotel based on lower rates and high customer reviews . . . it lives up to it's ratings!
