For someone who'd rather spend extra money on shopping and outings I was very happy to find a hotel in this location, with this level of quality at such great rates. Thanks for the awesome vacation!!

It was great value for money (with breakfast included). Staff were really nice and always had good advice when it came to planning what to do with our days. Location is good as it is next to the largest supermarket and away from noise.Good place to stay if you want a good base in Waikiki.

Nice spacious modern lobby but not reflected in our room which was dated and a bit crowded for four. Partial city view might have been an exaggeration too. No breakfast as our bus came before the 0700 opening of the breakfast bar. The staff and Kevin in particular were very helpful finding us a wheelchair for my injured daughter for which we are very grateful. Thanks Kevin & Co.

We often stay at this high value hotel when we don't want to drive back to the country after a late concert or dinner with wine in Waikiki but this time I stayed with my mom and sister to show them around Waikiki. I got to see through their fresh eyes. Before, they've stayed at a (famous) hotel right on the beach but, here, appreciated not having to hear music from the beach when trying to sleep. The beach is just a several block walk. Then there was the real aloha spirit (as it existed in the old days) from the staff. With that and the fabulous location (wonderful restaurants and shopping all around...including a 5 min. walk to that famous hotel) and free WiFi and free continental breakfast that is WAY better than most, I think they are done paying 5-6 times as much for that other hotel. Tempted to keep this hotel to myself but I enjoy others' tips from their cities so I'm sharing. This is a GREAT place!
Room was good always clean beds were very comfy hotel was within 5 mins walk to beach and shops. The free Breakfast was a bonus make sure that you arrive before 8am they shut at 8.15am

We just returned from spending 7 days at the Aqua Aloha Surf and Spa. This is our second stay at the hotel because we like the location and staff there. This hotel is located on the canal side of Waikiki, which means that it's less noisy and busy than being on the main street. The amenities are nice....breakfast, newspapers and Wi-Fi in the lower lobby. Our room was very basic....a view of the condominium complex next door, but it was fine because we didn't spend much time in the hotel. An air conditioner is a necessity on Waikiki; ours kept tripping the circuit breaker but we were able to get it going by resetting it. My only complaint is the $20 per day to park your rental car. We did not know of this fee and were informed by their staff that "all the hotels charge a fee" to park on their premises. This may be true but $20 seems exorbitant and this fee is not clearly stated on their web site. Unless you want to hunt around for street parking this is the only sensible alternative....expensive though it may be. If you plan to park in their underground garage, keep your vehicle small....it can get tough maneuvering in those tight spaces. All in all.....this is a very nice hotel in an ideal part of Waikiki. On my next visit, I would consider staying there if I couldn't find a place to park less expensively.

This hotel was just perfect for our trip it was a really great value. We had reserved the least expensive room available and we were pleasantly surprised. We had a kitchenette balcony and the bed was super comfy. We were on the 7th floor facing the main street and with the door closed we didn't hear much noise. The air conditioner in our room worked wonderfully and kept us cool. We were in walking distance of all the big attractions in Waikiki. We had free internet in our room which was super helpful. Everything was clean and the staff were all very nice and helpful except one lady at the front desk. We had a really good time at the managers reception and the drinks were really good.

I have been coming to Hawaii since 1978 but in the last year I have made 4 trips to the Islands and have stayed at 5 hotels and hands down Aqua Aloha is the BEST!!!From the moment you enter the lobby you are made to feel welcomed and in no time at all you feel very much at home and I can honestly say in all my trips I have never felt that way. Check in was quick and friendly and unfortunately I didn't get the name of the gentlemanbut he took the time to tell me what the hotel offered and where to find everything.Check out was just as quick and friendly, there was not waiting time as people have mentioned, everything was quick and effiecient.Upon reading some of the reviews I was unsure of what the rooms or location would be like but I can say everything was perfect. The room was large and very clean and the location was great. Close to the beach and activities but far enough away (about a 5 minute walk) from the beach and the main strip Kalakaua which I have stayed on many times and can be extremely noisy and crowed. And the beds they are so-o-o comfortablethat some mornings were hard to get up.The extra touches in the room made it feel very homey, a couch and coffee table elimating the need to always sit on the bed to watch TV, The microwave, fridge and dishes allowed you to eat in or have snacks when wanted and helped the budgetThe breakfast was great and I don't understand how people say it gets boring because unless you eat everything offered everyday there are at least four days of variety and I can tell you breakfast included in a hotel in Waikiki is extemely rare and if it is, it''s normally coffee and pastries not the variety offered here.The Tuesday night Managers reception is a great place to meet other guests at the hoteland is a very enjoyable hour with music and the Wipeout is fantasticLast but definitely not least the staff, from the front desk to housekeeping and anyone else you meet during the stay are the nicest, friendliest and most helpful group of people you will ever come across and I must send a Big Mahalo for making this my best vacation yet and I can't wait to come back, Hopefully in March 2011Aloha and Mahalo to AllHope to see you soonJudy

I stayed at the Aloha Surf for 10 nights. When I checked in they upgraded our room which was a nice surprise. I booked through the hotel website this summer to take advantage of their promotion at the time, of having every 5th night free. The room was a nice size, it looked like their pictures. There was a couch, coffee table, large bed (which I will add was extremly comfortable). There was a small kitchen area with a fridge and microwave, the bathroom was on the small side, a very small shower, but the water was hot and the pressure was great. the continental breakfast was great....pancakes, oatmeal, toast, and various store bought pastries. There was always fresh fruit, tea/coffee and iced tea. I will say though, after a few days, you get tired of it, would be nice to have some variety. I wont complain though, as its rare to find a hotel that has a complimentary breakfast. There was also free wifi, which is a great find as well. I didn't find the rooms noisy at all. I stayed on the side that faced the apartments, that may of been why. There is likely no nice view at this hotel, unless you're on the top 2 floors. But that wasn't important to me.The rooms appeared very clean, I saw no bugs at all through my stay, and the housekeeping is extremely friendly. However, on our 8th night, we misplaced our safe key. On the hunt for the key, we looked under the kitchenette, surprised to see a broken beer bottle (not from me), and under the bed was the back of a panty liner (not mine). The desk staff were nice, but a little blunt at times. They were very qick to mention charges when I requested things (parking, replacing the safe key, printing off an itenerary, local phone calls, etc.) . Parking is $20 a day, and I was upset to learn that to replace the safe key was a whopping $50. The managers cocktail hous on tuesdays was great, the "wipeout" is delicious, the massages are great. I never visited the pool, it was quite small. And surprised there was no nice restaurant or souvenier shop. There is a little "cafe" open certain hoursI will definatly stay here again, simply because of the price, the free breakfast and wifi.

I can honestly say that the staff at this hotel has made my first trip to Hawaii memorable. Jasmine is super friendly and helpful. Whether providing me with a surf instructor or her impeccable ability to remember names, she makes me feel like VIP. Mark, between ensuring that the plumbing is perfect, suggests restaurants I have fallen in love with. Then there's Nolan. His kindness cannot be described and he is always quick to provide bus schedules. Kalei is awesome to talk to, Aimee's smile lights up my evening, and Keoni is super nice despite all the bags me and my friends made him deal with. If they weren't all this great, I wouldn't have remembered so many names. EVERYONE there is fantastic, regardless of whether I have mentioned them here. I can't wait to return! Oh, and thanks for all the apples!!!

The Aqua Aloha Surf & Spa is a wonderful, smaller boutique hotel on a quiet residential street just two short blocks from the beach in bustling and noisy Waikiki. We absolutely loved the hotel. We stayed for one week in a one-bedroom suite with a gorgeous view of the mountains from the 16th floor.The staff and service was excellent, and the hotel offered many amenities that larger chain hotels did not, including a daily complimentary continental breakfast (my dad loved the hotcakes and fresh pineapple), a manager's reception on Tuesday with complimentary cocktails & music, free beach towels check outs, free wired internet, and lovely body wash, shampoo & conditioner, and lotion (something most hotels cost-cut, but not at the Aloha Surf).As for our suite: I loved the fact that bathroom was in the hallway between the living room and bedroom, which made sharing the space very convenient. The suites are quite large with huge balconies. The kitchenette area was stocked with all the essentials too: microwave, mini-fridge, coffee-maker, plates, bowels, silverware, kitchen towel etc. It was very convenient for making a quick mid-day snack.My thanks to Tim, the manager and Nolan for making my parents' trip to Oahu so enjoyable. They had a wonderful time, and I would definitely return, hopefully, on a vacation of my own without the parental units!
user_name:
filomina
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This hotel is one of the finest in Waikiki due to the excellent price and services from the employees. The staff is always very courtous and professional. Great Continental breakfast and perfect location to all the action in Waikiki. Would like to give a special thanks to Florence Daga, Analiza and Carmen for making our stay one of the most memorable!

I spent 6 nights at the Aqua Aloha with my sister on a quick get-away. The hotel itself was very nice upon entry and the free breakfast was a selling point for us too. We had rented a car but didn't want to spend $20/night parking, so were always able to find free parking along the canal - even though the walk was long at times.The staff were very friendly and they always had a basket of fresh apples at the desk - something we readily enjoyed. They were also very knowledgable and were able to quickly give suggestions and tips about things to go and places to see.Waikiki/Honolulu is very similar to any other major big city in the US, but the beach is amazing and fun! One thing to note: the bathroom in the room was very poor - a make-shift sliding door, a cracked-tile shower with dingy curtain, etc etc. However, the rest of the room was fine and even had a nice kitchenette and sitting area. We didn't spend a lot of time in our room, so it was certainly sufficient for the price we paid on hotwire. The breakfast included was also very nice and had a great variety of fresh foods, as well as toast, oatmeal, etc - the usuals.

this was a good value hotel in waikiki especially if you are not concerned with a view of the ocean. you are within steps of the main streets of waikiki and there are plenty of amentities close i.e grocery stores and eateries. the staff at the hotel were always very friendly and helpful with any questions we had. we stayed at this hotel for a total of 12 nights 2 seperate times. the first time the only downfall to the room was that we had a very noisy leaking toilet. room was always well cleaned, and in both rooms were comfortable. overall a good priced hotel that i would recommend.

My wife and I travel to Oahu once or twice a year for business. We have been staying at Aqua Aloha Surf consistantly since 2006. The staff is very freindly and helpful and the location is excellent only being three blocks from one of the best spots on Waikiki Beach. You won't get a beachside view of the ocean but it's a very short walk to get there. Shuttles to all the major shopping pick up less than a block away. The only downfall is that the Hotel is going to need some updating and remodeling soon. The bathrooms are a bit small but have all the traditional amenities you would expect. I would recommend the Superior rooms at the very least as they are more spacious than the Standard rooms however, either way, they are all comfortable. This Hotel is an excellent value with an excellent location. I will definitely stay here again when I come back in April of 2011 and would recommend this Hotel to anyone staying in Waikiki.

I love staying at the Aloha Surf, it is not only well located in the middle of Waikiki, moreover it is well priced. The staff is helpful and friendly, there is a spa located at the hotel, parking is available, you can walk to everything in Waikiki, there is a daily continental breakfast, a great place to meet other guests, you don't want to meet the tuesday manager's reception, the hotels famous "wipeout" drink. I think that you will enjoy your stay if you stay at the Aloha Surf!!

I stayed here the second week of August 2010 after competing at the Polynesian Cultural Centre the previous week.The stay was enjoyable, nice hotel with very nice staff in a very good location. No real complaints, the rooms were ok but the bathroom could have done with a spruce up as paint was peeling off the wall and it was a little dark...apart from that the room was function (but not as large as European rooms).Having said that, the bed...oh the bed...was absolute heaven! As many others have already said, the bed was easily one of the best beds Ive ever slept in...only bettered by that of the Sofatel in London (at 20 times the price of the stay!)!!!The room also cost next to nothing and was an absolutely fantastic deal with such a touristy spot for a time of the year that all of Europe is on holiday!! Parking was a bit of a bother, having to squeeze our tank in behind another tank that had not made best use of its spot in the front of the hotel! But after a 40 point turn we managed to get in :)Breakfast was also complementary and I quite enjoyed the pancakes :) Internet was available for free, where the room connection was wired but WIFI was available in the lobby.There is a swimming pool, but its location and size made it impractical (no sun) so we didnt use it.Would we stay again if traveling on a budget? Absolutely! Cant recommend this hotel enough!!

My husband and I stayed at the Aqua Aloha Surf and Spa for two nights, before flying to the big island for the rest of our vacation. The room was bright and efficiently laid out, perfectly comfortable to suit our needs. The only negative was the very loud traffic in the morning (we were on the 5th floor, so perhaps the higher floors are quieter) and a view of apartments from our balcony. However, this hotel was significantly less expensive than many of the others that we had considered, and I feel that the lower price more than made up for the noise and less-than-ideal view. The location was convenient, very quick walk to the beach, shopping, and restaurants.The staff were extremely helpful, professional, and knowledgeable. They were also quite proactive, as they called us the night before we were leaving, to see if we needed any help scheduling transportation to the airport. We happened to be there on a Tuesday and attended the Manager's Reception, in the hotel manager, serves complimentary "wipe-out" cocktails (very tasty!). This was a nice touch. Overall, I would say that this is a reasonably priced hotel with nice bright rooms, a somewhat noisy (though convenient) location, and staff who perform well above expectations in this price range.

My husband and I recently stayed for 2 weeks. It was a great place to stay. The manager, Tim Clark, recently had all the beds replaced and they are wonderful. We had the best sleep ever in a hotel. The hotel staff was very friendly. For the last week we were upgraded to a room with a balcony at no charge. The rooms are small, but with the balcony it was very comfortable. The breakfast each morning was good. I am allergic to wheat and so I appreciated the fresh oatmeal and pineapple every morning. There is also ice water available in the lobby for guests which was great after a hot day in the sun. The hotel is in a good location, just a short walk to the beach. It was a great place to stay and I would stay there again.

My husband and I stayed here for 12 days for our One Year wedding Anniversary which the hotel knew about before we arrived. We arrived at 9am from a 10 hour flight from Sydney, and were exhausted. Unfortunately for us, with a 3pm check-in time and no rooms available for us to be able to fall into and crash, we were told to come back in a few hours so we left our suitcase there and headed down the street.We went back around lunchttime and asked if there were any rooms yet. The lady at the counter said that it wasn't on a high level, but there was a room on Level 7 we could have. Anything was perfect at that time of the day when all we wanted to do was crash out.We booked a Superior room, with balcony...which faced apartment blocks. The room itself was quite pretty and spacious - with a couch and plenty of room to dump all of our shopping bags & large suitcases.We arrived in on a Tuesday, in time for the Managements Welcome cocktail party, which was really nice. The wipeout cocktails were really yummy, and it was a good opportunity to relax and talk to fellow people staying at the hotel. We only went to the 'free breakfast' twice during the 12 days, as we're not massive fans of the things that were available for the breakfast - toast (but the only condiment being cream cheese), pancakes, and then pineapple pieces, mini muffins & mini donuts. The coffee was good though. This free breakfast is only available between 7am and 8.30am.The thing I'd like to say about this hotel is don't expect it to be a 5 star hotel at a lower starred price. We paid $79 US a night (before taxes) which is an amazing price when other hotels in the same region are charging $200 US + a night. The bed was comfortable, the shower was hot, the fridge kept things cold - can you see the pattern here? Our room facing the apartment blocks / street was quite noisy - my husband is a light sleeper and could only sleep for 3-4 hours a night due to the noises of a nighttime, then at 6am onwards with trucks, cleaners on the same level shouting to one another and over their walkie talkie etc. If you're a light sleeper, maybe ask for a room on a higher level or facing away from the street.If I was to go back to Hawaii again, I probably would stay here again - just with those pre-requisites in place for our room - higher up, and away from the noisy street. But it was a great rate for a nice hotel! Thanks for the stay.

This hotel is a great place to come home too after a day of sight seeing. The house keepers have made your very comfortable bed, cleaned the bathroom, put in fresh towels and they even do the dishes if you have any. The hotel is not fancy but excellent value for your dollar. The breakfast included in our stay was ample and catered for a wide range of tastes. The coffee is excellent. The staff are all very helpful and work hard to assist you with your needs.

Well,what do you expect from a 3-star hotel? that was my first thought when i booked for this hotel.I read some review @google, expedia, and some other hotel booking websites and it was not that great.However, the staffs were really friendly and the housekeeping service was super excellent!! It was way beyond my expectation and that's why i am writting this review for you guys. Just remember this is not a 5-star hotel then you will enjoy your stay! - I stayed for 8 nights and I got more than what I paid for! This hotel is just 2 blocks (about 5mins) away from the waikiki beach, BUT the Ala Wai canal is right beside you and you can enjoy the "park view" instead.Parking is available (USD 20 per day - just like most of waikiki hotels)Be aware! All the luxury brands shops such as Tiffany & Co., Louis Vuitton, Chanel are on the Kalakaua Ave. which is just one block away from the hotel. (is your better half reading this review with you?)check out the google map for the exact locationhttp://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&view=map&q=aqua+aloha+surf+and+spa,+444+kanekapolei+street,waikiki+beach,+hi+96815&sll=21.129981,-156.781769&sspn=0.257472,0.441513&ie=utf8&ll=21.281977,-157.822938&spn=0.016075,0.027595&z=15&iwloc=bTipsfrom my experience, It was the cheapest to book through their own website.My package included free internet (wired @room, free wifi @lobby) & continental breakfast - considering that some hotels (especially most of 5 stars) charge USD 20 + per day for internet & same for breakfast, you can save more than USD 40 + for extra.I also brought my wifi router for my iphone and it worked fine! (no wifi router rent available)Another thing,If you want to take a look how this hotel looks like, click the below link (virtual tour)http://mediaserver.vrxstudios.com/flash/app/flashviewer.htm?template=150&id=20568#It helped me a lot to understand how each room type look like.Please understand that English is not my first language. :)

Our stay was perfect. The hotel & staff were wonderful. Reasonably priced so we could save our money for food & gifts. Parking was a little tight, but the hotel helped make accomodations. I would definitely stay here again - the heart of waikiki, 3 blocks from the beach & shopping!!

We were very happy with our stay at the Aqua Surf. We arrived early and the staff had our room ready and allowed us to check in early. We were given a great corner room on the sixteeth floor with a beautiful view of the golf course, mountains and the city. The room had new matress which was very comfortable, newer carpet, flat screen T.V. and plently of room for our family of four. We also loved having a safe in the room. The location was great - close to everything. We always felt safe. On Tuesday night the hotel offers a fun social hour with Hawaiian music, guest photos and a great drink called the "Wipe Out". All of this and more is included in the room price. The staff at the front desk were so nice and helpful. They reccommended good restaurants and made reservations for us. They were able to get us a great time for dinner and a table that was ocean front. The front desk staff even loaned our boys boggie boards to take to the beach. The staff also provided driving directions to avoid the traffic and ocean safety tips. Our whole family had a great time and would stay at the Aqua Surf or any of the other Aqua hotels based on our positive experience at the Aqua Surf. Tim, the hotel manager was also very kind to us too. I almost forgot, we loved the breakfast too. So nice to not have to find a resturant first thing in the morning.

We were so pleased with the clean accomodations and the friendly staff. They went out of their way to make sure our stay was great. The location was within walking distance of Waikiki, many shops, restaurants and had parking for our rental car. The breakfast was great.

A great budget hotel for waikiki. It is literally two blocks from the beach. There are tons of reastraunts real close, and there is a small grocery store right next to the hotel which is super convienent. The hotel rooms are not the biggest but the one we stayed in had a queen size bed with two nightstand a small three drawer dresser with a flatscreen on it, a coffee table with a sofa and then a small sink area with a mini-fridge and a microwave. It was perfect. We stayed here on our honeymoon and we liked it. we wanted the nice hotel with the beach view but my wife didn't marry into any money so we stayed at the Aloha Surf Hotel and it was great. CLEAN, No bugs and just a nice room.

The staff of Aqua Aloha were absolutely sensational, the first night we were there they had their cocktain welcome which was the perfect way to start a trip to Hawaii. Whilst there all the staff were extremely helpful and went out of their way to assist - I particularly recommend their tour guide, she did a brilliant job and went above and beyond any time we had a question or request. I recommend this hotel to anyone.

My husband and I booked this hotel through Priceline. When we checked in we told them we would need a crib for our son. She asked "are you sure, it is $25 to rent a crib?" We said yes even though we have never had to pay for a crib in any other property we have stayed in.We got to our room and were shocked at how small it was. The room DID NOT resemble the rooms on the website or even other pictures I have seen. There was a full size bed pushed against the corner of the room and there was not enough space between the bed and desk to wheel the luggage in (it was so close). There was no bed side table because there was not room for one. The crib did not fit through the space either so the staff left it in the little hall right next to the front door.When I complained to the front desk I was told "well, you booked through Priceline". They made no attempt at getting us another room or fixing the situation. There was no way three of us could stay in a room that small. We checked out (refused to pay for the crib since we didn't stay). The room was smaller than any I have seen in the US (reminded me of a European hotel) and the service was terrible. The lobby looked fine though. Apparently, the hotel does not cater to anyone who books at a discounted rate.We checked into the Embassy Suites and it was wonderful and since it was on vacation I am glad we changed hotels.

This hotel exceeded my expectations. With the complimentary breakfast, clean and quiet room and the friendly and helpful staff lead me to highly recommend this hotel. The free 'Wired' internet connection in the rooms was a plus. The Manager's Reception on Tuesdays welcomed all guests in a true Hawaiian tradition.

Let me start off by saying that the customer service from the Aqua Aloha Surf and Spa is probably some of the best that I've ever had to deal with. Everyone from the front desk to the woman who cleaned our rooms, we're all very friendly.During the second day of our trip, one of my friends had dropped her bathing suit from our hotel room and it landed on the roof down below. When we asked the hotel staff for help they were very accomodating. One of the staffers (I forgot his name but he was very nice!), climbed on top of the roof and got my friend her bathing suit with absolutely no fuss. The contintental breakfast was also more than i expected. I was expecting just a tray of pastries and juice, which is what other hotels offer when they say they serve continental breakfast. However, this hotel served fresh pancakesm juice, fruit, toast, coffee, and some other little snacks. Having one less meal to pay for during a trip makes a big difference!I've stayed at multiple hotels in Waikiki but the location of this hotel is my favorite. Being located in the back of Waikiki your far away from the street noise of the city. I've stayed at hotels in Waikiki where I've had trouble sleeping due to the noise from the street (One time there was a street performer playing steel drums till one in the morning!). At the same time the hotel is located less than 10 minutes to the beach, international market place, and other great tourist things.Overall i would recommend this hotel and I would definately stay there again!

The managment and all the staff of the Aqua Aloha Surf hotel are really very professional, nice and helpfull, always there with a smile. I stayed there 23 days, with a great service, I would recommend this hotel for the special treatment that each client receives. The location is also very good, near to the beach, the bus stop, the restaurants, the shops, the international market, the farmacy, the food pantry and the parking.You have every thing around the hotel, no need to cross the city to get something.I will come back again at the Aqua Aloha Surf, I was very satisfied of the quality.

Okay, the rooms may be small and the showers are really small but who stays in their rooms in Hawaii? Clean, simple hotel. I traveled with 2 teenage boys and the sofa was a pull out bed (the boys alternated with who had to sleep with mom). Who cares if there is a room a/c...it worked and kept the room cool. Beds were fine and I liked the fact that there was a small fridge in the room and especially the FREE breakfast. Yes, it is pancakes but I have two teenage boys and it kept them from whining they were hungry before lunch time. The staff was absolutely wonderful, with suggestions and maps and you know, just plain nice to everyone. Free manager's reception on Tuesday which my boys liked. Never saw any bugs in the hotel . We basically only slept and showered there. This hotel is within easy walking distance of everything.

The Aqua Aloha Surf and Spa is a great place to stay in Waikiki. It's a short walk to the beach, but it's out of the way from the hustle and bustle of the main strip. The staff is so friendly and helpful and they make you feel right at home. The room was very comfortable and affordable. I would definitely stay here again!

We had a nice stay at the hotel. The staff was helpful and service good. Breakfast is only from 7-8:30 in the morning. It's not anything special, but they make fresh pancakes for you. Parking can be expensive. At the hotel it's $20 a night, but we found free street parking about a 10 minute walk away. There's also $10 ramp parking a couple blocks away. The hotel staff can direct you to this parking. The beach is about 2-3 blocks away and there are some good restaurants/shops very close by. Would recommend the hotel, but be prepared for a pretty small room and window AC. The bathroom could use some updates, but it's all functional.

was nice when we got there and rooms are ok for a budget but i felt a crunch and i has stepped on a roach the size of my hand i went to front desk they said all hotels have them what do you want me to do that was the second night we where ther then elevators didnt want to work when we where leaving so we went down steps they where loaded with roaches if you dont beleave me when you go look in stairway i go to hawaii all the time 3 4 times a year and ill stick with marriott and aston on beach we left that morning to go to marriott 4 blocks down

This charming hotel was remarkably comfortable and relaxing. It is just small enough to offer that "boutique" hotel feeling, far beyond its affordable rates. The staff and management were exceptional;, always available without being overbearing, efficient and effective but calm and professional. The Aloha Spirit is alive and well at the Aqua, from Manager Tim Clark's warm and competent demeanor, to the low-key hawaiian themed furnishings and decor, to the staff's disposition. It was truly a pleasurable difference from the large-chain hotels we frequently stay in. In the big-branded hotels, you could be literally anywhere...and that defeats the purpose of a vacation in Hawaii. In contrast, the Aqua Aloha Surf and Spa has a true local feel to it. And having lived in Hawaii for 25 years, I can tell you that there is no bigger compliment or better measure of success in Hawaii.

We just returned from a stay at the Aqua Aloha Surf Hotel in Waikiki. We liked it so much that we have already booked reservations at the Aqua Aloha Surf for our next trip. We loved it! This is a great tourist class hotel located two blocks from the beach, and anything else you may need - restaurants, music, buses, or shopping. So convenient. They provide a daily breakfast which includes pancakes, oatmeal, fresh fruit and more. We found the entire staff genuinely friendly and eager to help with questions. Even the maintenance department had restaurant ideas for us.

Just wrapped up 15 days in Oahu, staying at the Aqua Aloha. We had a fantastic stay. The entire staff, from maintenance to housekeeping to the front desk was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and taken care of well. The included breakfast was a fantastic way to start the day. Thanks Tim and staff for a great 20th anniversary/family reunion trip!

My family (with our 2 year old son) went to the Aqua Aloha Surf in May 2010 for a realxation beach trip. This hotel was excellent for the price; however, remember the price factor as there are some minor issues. The hotel location itself is excellent as it is located within two blocks on the main part of Waikiki Beach. It is a very easy walk with the hotel being very close to many restaurants and the Food Pantry Supermarket (kind of pricey for some food but good for some making a few lunches and snacks). The lobby of the hotel is very nice with a lot of Hawaii charm and nice staff. Check out the manager hour for free drinks, massages, and music on Tuesday at 5PM. They even gave my son some coconut and pineapple juice. We paid extra for a upgraded room and it was still a little cozy but had a balcony. The room had a nice kitchen for basic preparation for snacks and a balcony. The view was of a apartment complex across the street but had some nice mountain views to the east. The room was a little but worn but overall it was comfortable with amenities. There was also a small pool with cold water which was nice for a dip on hot days but not really a place to hang out. Overall the stay was very pleasant and nice as the staff was very friendly, location was excellent, and the room was adeqaute. Again remember the price, you may be able to find a superior hotel but for the budget minded traveler, this hotel is supurb and made a memorable vacation.

I spent 4 days here with my teenage daughter. The location was perfect for us... about a 5 minute walk to the beach, and just off the beaten path enough that I didn't worry about the hustle and bustle keeping me up at night. We had fun at the Managers Reception where I enjoyed complimentry Wipeouts, chair massages and chocolates. Only one downside... the pool was a bit cold for my taste. Granted - it was about 7pm when I checked it out, but I would have prefered a warmer pool! Anyway - will definitaly return to this location next time I'm in Hawaii!

our stay at the Aqua Surf was fabulous. What a way to vacation, good value, a clean and comfortable room and best of all an excellent staff. I am recommending all my friends to be sure if you are looking for a deal while visiting Oahu, and to be in the heart of Waikiki this is the hotel to be at. MAHALO, everyone at the Aqua Surf.

My wife and I stayed in this Hotel for 4 nights. When we made it to the island we were greeted at the front desk by Mr Kalei Dias. He was very helpful, and was willing to go the extra mile to ensure our satisfaction and comfortability. The rest of the staff, went above and beyond to ensure that the took care of all our needs. The house keeping staff greeted us outside the elevator and enquired about the quality of our room and wanted to know if there was anything additional we needed of them without asking. All in all we were very satisfied with our stay. I am sure that the next time we visit Oahu, we will be booking our stay at the Aqua Aloha Surf. Thank you you all for making sure our stay was a memorable stay. Mahalo

Ok, so I'm just getting around to reviewing this now even though I stayed here months ago but I have to post a review because I really enjoyed staying here. I traveled with a friend and we were on a budget and we got a decent price for this hotel. We were prepared for budget accomodations but were pleasantly surprised! We got one double bed which meant sleeping in the same bed but we were in Hawaii for goodness sake so we were fine with it (we also didn't ask for two beds either so I'm not complaining!). We had interactions with the staff on several occasions and they were always very pleasant and helpful. I was very impressed that there was a hotel near Waikiki that offered free breakfast - that was a major plus for someone who is on a budget!! And it was good!! We did not have the opportunity to use the pool but it looked just fine. Our room was very clean and I don't remember any problems with excessive street noise. You have to walk a few blocks to the beach but again, we're in Hawaii and 3 blocks is nothing!I'm just bummed that we didn't get to go to the manager's reception as we were not there on that day. However, I'm going to be traveling to Honolulu with my cousin in October and I plan to attend this time! I booked my next trip through Delta Vacations and was happy to see that this place was one of the options! Even though this time we could have booked hotels that were closer to the beach and more expensive, I opted to make reservations here because of my great stay last time. Why take a chance when you already know that you like a place? I'm looking forward to my upcoming vacation and staying here again!

I first booked with the Aqua Surf & Spa Hotel back in May on their website. I booked more than 30 days in advance so I saved a nice chunk of change on the room. Im a big guy at 6'11" so the most important thing to me was having a king bed. I called to book a superior room with a king but was told there were no kings available at that time. So I just booked the next room up a deluxe with a king. A few days later I decided on upgrading to a junior suite and emailed them about it. I was told it was no problem. If I recall the junior suite was $135 more for the 7 nights I would be staying there. Mahina handled all my emails and was great. A few days later I emailed her asking if it was possible to be on the top floor (Honolulu can get loud at night) and she said she'd put in a request for it. Then I asked to have the room facing Diamond Head if at all possible. (The other side of the hotel doesnt have as nice a view as the Diamond Head side btw) She responded that she'd also put that in the request as well. I arrived arould 1pm on June 24th, two hours early for check-in. They held my bags for me at the front counter as the room wasnt ready yet and I spent the next two hours wandering around Waikiki and grabbed lunch. Came back at 3pm, and what do yuou know.....my room was on the top floor (room #1608) and facing diamond head! Couldnt have asked for anything more than that. I never had any issues with noise from outside or from the other rooms. Its definately worth it for the top floor. The bed was brand new (manufacture date on the tag was 6/15/2010!) and was very comfortable.  Yes some of the furniture in the room shows signs of wear, but then again you arent paying $300 a night at the Hilton Hawaiian Village or $450+ at the Moana Surfrider. The balcony was HUGE! compared to the other size rooms that werea floor below us. It also didnt have the white plastic furniture outside that the units that are below a junior suite have. It was all wicker. Four seats total with a nice table and a bench seat as well. Internet was free which is a huge plus for someone on a budget. Most hotels charge $15 plus a day and not having to spend money on that free's up cash to do what matters most on vacation, sightseeing, great food, etc. All I had to do was ask the counter for an ethernet (probably a 15 foot one at that which is nice if you want to sit outside on the balcony and use your laptop). I dont know why people complain about the free internet being slow. It worked fine with my laptop. The bathroom was adequate for our stay. Nothing too fancy. The bathtub/shower did show some wear as well as the fixtures in it. The toilet did run after it was flushed but all you had to do was jiggle the handle and it stopped right away. If there is one thing the Aqua Surf & Spa should upgrade next it should be the bathroom. But again, it was fine for my needs. The kitchenette is a nice addition to the room. It had a small microwave, mini-fridge, small sink and actual flatware and silverware to eat with. We stopped at the Food Pantry right nextdoor and stocked up on some drinks and food. The Food Pantry nextdoor is a great thing to have. Whatever you need they pretty much have. Yes its a little pricey but then again what isnt in Hawaii? The parking garage is small but we never had any trouble finding a spot for the rental car. Parking is $20 a day which is pretty standard for most area hotels. During our stay we wanted to know where the best place to rent a decent surfboard was (places on Waikiki Beach can be ridiculously expensive). The front desk told us that Mark the facility maintenance guy at the hotel was a surfer and could help us out. The first day in our room we called the front desk and within 3 minutes he was knocking at our door. The guy was great, telling us where to rent a board, great places to grab food, etc. He should seriously be in customer service or relations or something. For the remainder of my stay there whenever Id bump into him we'd stop and have a chat. He always remembered my first name. Its nice to see there are still employees like him around. The one thing I was bummed about (though no fault of the hotels) was that our luau at Paradise Cove (amazing experience, if you go pray you get Cousin Bronsons bus, he's a riot) was the same night as the hotels free cocktail party with Tim Clark the manager, so I missed that. I did a lot of research and reading of reviews on the hotels in Honolulu/Waikiki and decided on the Aqua Surf & Spa because of its quiet location (the walk to Waikiki beach was around 8 minutes), the price of the rooms, free internet and most of all because whenever there is a bad review written here, Tim Clark the manager always leaves a comment and is very polite about everything. Stuff like that goes a long way with people, Im proof of that. I hope this review is helpful (as are the pics) and that if you choose to stay at the Aqua Surf & Spa you have as great a time as I did. Nextime Im back in Oahu i'll be staying there again.Aloha & Mahalo!

I guess I'm a little spoiled after previously staying at one of the higher end Waikiki resorts during my last trip to Oahu, but the Aqua Aloha Surf & Spa is an OK choice if you're on a budget while in Honolulu. I'll start with the positive; the hotel is in a prime location that's within walking distance from Waikiki beach and all of the shopping destinations in the area. If you want to hop on the Trolley and head to Ala Moana the pick up point isn't far away. The hotel itself is pretty clean and doesn't offer any added frills which keeps the costs down. My mattress was a little in the old and uncomfortable side but they are in the process of replacing them all with new beds. The staff was friendly and accomodating. I don't have a lot of negatives to add but I will say that the entrie Waikiki area is very noisy and you may hear traffic and/or sirens going off. This is unavoidable and really isn't controlable for the hotel. The only thing that got on my nerves was the extremley slow and small elevators. There are only two elevators that always seemed to be packed with people and the wait could be a little while if there were a lot of people or it was a peak time. The only thing I would recommend the managment to address would be asking the housekeepers to spend a little extra time cleaning the showers. My room's shower reminded me of a gym shower stall after rush hour. Other than that I don't have any real complaints but next time I'm in Honolulu I'm going to spend a few extra bucks and stay at one of the nicer resorts.

From the first time I arrived at the aqua aloha surf it was a very positive experience. I spoke with Vinh at the front desk ,explained to him that i asked for early check in,it was only 8a when we arrived,he apologized and said they were sold out the night before ,but took my cell # and said he would call me as soon as a room was available, He did just that within 20 minutes he called me to say they had a room available and even gave me alittle larger room to accomodate my disabled husband and child's bed. The continental breakfast every morning was wonderful!! Pancakes made fresh while you wait, toast,juice oatmeal, donuts,coffee, fresh fruit and a smiling staff and a free Honolulu newspaper to read,much more than i expected, saved us about 20.00 a day for breakfast. and the staff was great. friendly and quick to accomodate our needs, I stayed at the Hyatt regency last year with an ocean front room,while that was nice, the aqua aloha surf was a much homier feel. and the managers reception on tuesday night was a great opportunity to meet Tim the hotel Manager,he was bar tending. and no limit to the drinks. there is a laundry facility in their basement,they have change at the front desk, with an ABC store on every corner very convenient,the Beach was 3 short blocks away, Parking was 20.00 a night, but a little birdy in the hotel lobby told me about a hotel down the street about 6 blocks that was only 10.00 per night, a 10 minute walk. on Kuhio avenuethe Aqua Aloha Surf is a.Great Hotel I will stay again we travel there twice a year to visit family and will recommend this to everyone,as far as noise every one speaks of, yes there is alot of street level noise we were on the 11th floor, but you are on vacation in beautiful Waikiki, why would you want to sleep in and miss the beautiful sunrise,or go for a walk on the Beach ?

This was a delayed honeymoon - we got married 3 years ago at a destination wedding and never went on an "official" honeymoon until now.Like many people, we use this site because it provides a very fair assessment, both good and bad. Before going into the details, I will say that we had a wonderful visit, and would definitely return. Here are the details:First, Tim (the manager) is the best. We communicated via email before our trip and he was quick to reply (unlike most managers) and assured me that all my requests would be met (room away from the street, high floor). Upon arrival, we were pleasantly surprised with a room upgrade and wine/chocolates because he remembered that this was our honeymoon. The hotel entrance was great - it was recently remodeled and is very inviting - open layout, comfortable chairs, TV, etc. The person checking us in was quick, nice, and professional.Our room was exactly what we needed - a comfortable bed, functional A/C, sofa, mini-fridge, microwave, coffee-maker, etc. As most reviews point out, the rooms are not huge - but it all depends on what you want and need, for most people it's large enough. The sink was clogged when we arrived, and maintenance repaired it in 15 minutes. I mention this because any time we needed something, they took care of it immediately. High-speed internet is free, although wired (they provide cables). The hotel offers beach towels - you just sign them out and drop them off when you're done. This was very convenient since we didn't have to pack beach towels and we had fresh ones each day.The free breakfast is hit or miss. The food is great considering most hotels don't offer free breakfast. There was coffee, juice, muffins, fresh fruit, toast, and pancakes. The only issue we had was that some people were very rude - note that this has nothing to do with the hotel, it is with some guests (I won't mention where they were from, but I've run into this a few times). They would cut in line rather than wait their turn, and a few times as I was waiting for pancakes, they would put their plate over mine and "steal" my pancake. If they somehow had better crowd control, it would have been more pleasant.My wife took advantage of the spa in the lobby - and had a wonderful experience. She highly recommended a massage (I did not get one).The location is one of the best things about this hotel. It's centrally located within walking distance from many eateries, drugstores, shopping areas, and the beach. Everything is within a 10-15 min walk. Parking was $20/night and we chose to pay it for convenience. Apparently there are places nearby where you can park for less, but we thought it was worth the extra money. There aren't many spaces, but we never had an issue finding a spot regardless of the time.The staff as a whole was great. We don't remember their names (sorry!). I do remember Nolan helping us a few times, and of the 3-4 people we interacted with, they were all wonderful. As I said in the beginning, Tim the manager made sure we enjoyed our stay from beginning to end. In summary, we had a wonderful stay, and when we return to Hawaii, we will definitely stay here again. It is by far the best deal - you get a great room in a wonderful location with excellent staff. To Tim and the rest of the staff, thank you for making our stay a wonderful one.Michael

My family came into town for a view days to visit me on Oahu, and I decided to get a room one night so my boyfriend and I could stay down there for dinner and not have to hurry back to the Windward side of the island. My mum booked the Aqua Aloha Surf for their rooms, so I booked it for mine too. When I checked in I was greeted very nicely by the front desk staff. The lobby was very cute and very clean, and the check-in process was quick. We jumped in the elevators and went up to our room on the 8th floor.Now since I was only staying one night, I booked the Deluxe Room with a Private Lanai. Best Decision Ever. The room was very nice and very clean. The couch and coffee table was a nice touch and the lanai was nice to chill out on. The linens on the bed were very crisp white and the kitchenette area was clean. There was a microwave, small refrigerator, plates, silverware, cups, etc. The deluxe room was large too. I heard some complaints from people who said the regular rooms are too small. But the hotel prices are usually so low that it should be okay to splurge for the upgrade.The bed was extremely comfy and I did not hear any excessive noise like other people claim to have heard. I had no issues with this room and thought it was excellent.I had one small issue, and I discussed it with Tim, the hotel manager, at the end of the Manager's Reception when I was visiting my family on Tuesday night. He took care of the small issue and was very polite about it. He even gave me his business card if I felt it necessary to contact him in the future. And btw, the reception was great! My parents loved the free cocktails and I enjoyed my pineapple juice (due to the under-21 factor). Another employee was walking around taking pictures of guests and took e-mails so that everyone got a free picture of their family emailed to them. Yet another employee was walking around with chocolate-covered mac nuts, all while free massages, charactertures, and live music was going on.The pool is small, but it's warm, clean, and deep. The pool chair are very comfortable and their is a large grill that guest's can use next to the pool. Take advantage of making your own dinner one night next to the pool! Oh, and the hotel checks out beach towels for the pool or the beach, yet another freebie.The hotel has a free breakfast from 7-830am (I think that's the times). This was surprising a good breakfast, there was juice, coffee, tea, donuts, fresh pineapple, muffins, toast, and an attendant making pancakes. My family ate their every morning, probably saved them $20 each day. I had it when I stayed, it was really good and a nice treat to have breakfast ready in the lobby.I've stayed at the Double Tree and the Hyatt before, both in Waikiki. Between the three hotels I've stayed at, I'm choosing this one again. I've been recommending it to people I know coming to the islands and anyone else that is looking for a Waikiki hotel. The price is fantastic and the hotel is clean and a great deal!I am planning to stay here again at the end of July, I really was that impressed by the value. Whether you're visiting the islands or you're a Kama'aina, I suggest this hotel. Now, nothing is perfect. So if I had to make suggestions I would say that the elevators was a little warm and stuffy, and also that you should plan on parking somewhere else because it seemed like there are maybe 20-25 stalls total for the hotel and they are $20/night. The fitness center is like two work-out machines behind a screen in the front lobby, go for a run on the beach or a swim instead. Also, the lanai furniture is just basic plastic patio chairs. But it works for chilling on the lanai at night!So thank you Aloha Surf for an excellent stay and thank you Tim for the lovely reception.(Yeah, I know this is lengthy, but my favorite reviews are the helpful ones with lots of info!)

I wasn't in the mood to complain about our horrible stay when we got back. Until 10 minutes ago when I chequed my credit card statement and saw that they have charged my credit card 3 weeks after we got back. I prepaid our stay and there is absolutely no reason they should have charged us this extremely high fee. I called to ask why they have charged me and they don't have an answer. I will be disputing this charge with my credit card company tomorrow.On to our stay...very loud, parties in the parking lot right outside our window. Somebody trying to knock our door in in the middle of the night. We saw cockroaches in the room, it was absolutely disgusting. I actually wanted to get home.If you decide to stay here(please, please don't) watch your credit card for a long time afterwards.

Honestly an Ok 3 star property.Booked over 6months before travel and had email contact with the Hotel reservations area from date of booking stating that I was travelling with 2 adults and 2 children (3 & 1yrs.) was told all along that "we love to have the Kids along at Aqua Hotels" and Kids stay free.. When checking in we were give a tiny room about 3mtrs x 3.5mtrs with 2 single beds. I went down to reception to discuss the room situation and was told that's the room Priceline booked you and thats what you get. If you want a bigger room you need to pay a surcharge per night. ( If I was told by their Reservations people I would have pre arrange and pre booked the upgrade. It felt like I was being "nikel and dimed" the whole stay. Breakfast was a nice suprise Staff were very abrupt.. I felt that being an Aussie (we arent known as the best tippers.) was to my detriment and I got service accordingly. Therfore I tipped according to the service received.Regrettably I have to say. I will avoid staying here in the future.

My husband and I stayed here for a week in mid- May 2010 and were extremely pleased. The rooms are small, but are well laid out so the size is not a problem. The hotel has been recently remodeled into a modern stylish look that makes it feel a step up from typical moderate priced chains. It is truly only 2 blocks from Waikiki beach- close enough for an easy walk to the water, night life and food, but far enough that there is less street noise at night than at some other hotels (this is important at 11pm when you're body still thinks its 3am). The staff were amazingly helpful with everything- transportation advice, referrrals on car rental agencies, directions, food recommendations, upgrades available- everything (thank you Nolan and Helene- you were a great help!). The manager, Tim, is very friendly and accessible, and does a reception every Wednesday evening with free cocktails, chair massages and a man playing ukelele and singing- all while you sit in the open lobby or by the pool and relax. There is a large propane grill by the pool for guests to use if you'd prefer to cook, which is nice given food prices. Breakfast in the morning is pancakes, oatmeal, toast and fresh fruit- much better than the typical danish and coffee spread at most places. We were very please with Carmencita in housekeeping who did a great job in our room every day too. Could not have asked for a better stay, and don't think it's possible to find a better value for such a perfect location. We look forward to coming back!

We stayed here for one week and had a wonderful vacation! We were upgraded to a deluxe room which was very spacious and had a couch and coffee table and plenty of room for all our stuff. Previous hotels we've stayed at (Marine Surf and Maile Sky) had tiny rooms and we always felt very cramped. The bed and linens were very comfortable too which I was worried about being 7 months pregnant! All the staff were very friendly and accomodating. The beach towel service was a huge plus as not all hotels do this. The breakfast was just enough to get your day started! Parking is $20 (which is the same for ALL hotels in Waikiki) but we managed to get parking on the street 5 of the 7 nights we were there.The location is terrific and you are steps away from everything!I've never bothered to write a review for anything, but felt compelled this time since I was so happy with our stay!

We have just returned to Australia after a wonderful holiday. This hotel's staff did everything possible to assist us in any we asked. The light breakfast, which is included in the tariff was great and we had a wonderful time at the Manager's reception. There is some street noise but it has to be expected if you want to stay in such a great location. The hotel offers massage and some spa treatments and the staff there were also very obliging. This location is close to bus stops, supermarket, the beach and the main activity area of Honolulu.

We stayed here twice during our stopover to/from the Big Island. Both times we experienced friendly staff at the front desk during check-in. The first time we got a complimentary upgrade from a standard to a deluxe room. The second time we had made advance reservations via travelocity.com but the hotel didn't have us in their system. The hotel was full, so the front desk person called travelocity to see what happened with our reservation. He was kind enough to wait on hold for a long time before reaching someone. After learning that our reservation had not gone through, he gave us a jr. suite at the same price we paid online. I was thankful that we didn't have to go to another hotel (it was almost midnight). The whole thing probably took nearly an hour to resolve; they went beyond the call of duty in my mind. The rooms are nothing fancy, but meet your needs for a clean, convenient place to sleep. The only complaint is the noisy location (hard to avoid in Waikiki).

We loved our stay here.We were on a tight budget, but still wanted a really nice stay. This hotel was perfect, only a 5 minute walk to the beach. The room was small, but there was enough space for us to relax and feel comfortable. It was very clean & there was a microwave & fridge with a set of dishes, wireless internet worked in our room, so we had just what we needed.The staff was very friendly & helpful, especially the gentleman looking after our bags the day we checked out (we weren't flying out til 10pm that night). We accessed our bags several times that day & he was always very accomodating.We used the pool & shower beside it for a last minute clean up, & even got to enjoy a few free margaritas each at the manager's reception! They were not keeping count and were very generous! The free continental breakfast was great too...light & tasty. Fresh made pancakes, toast, oatmeal, muffins & pastries, tea, coffee & juice. Not fancy, but filled our bellies enough til lunchtime. All in all, we'd stay here again for the $75/night pricetag.

This hotel was completely adequate for our needs. We were just staying in Waikiki for a couple of days before driving to the North Shore. Its a very quick walk to the beach. The lobby was lovey, the staff friendly and helpful. Our room was small but comfortable. The sheets were soft and clean. We even had a mini-fridge! Breakfast was nice. There was fresh fruit and pancakes. The bathroom could have used a fan. And its true, the truck noise at 6 am is obtrusive. We pricelined the room and we got a reasonable deal for what we paid.

I’ve stayed at the Aloha Surf a dozen times on business. The hotel was remodeled a few years ago. It is modern and stylish. The rooms are also nicely decorated. The upper rooms have a wet bar, micro, and frig. Parking is extra cost, and a limited number of stalls. Street parking is scarce and tricky. Phone before your trip and request a parking pass. Breakfast is minimal. Many restaurants, tourist stores, and markets nearby. The neighborhood can be a bit dicey. I have been approached by a dope dealer and a well-dressed hooker, but never saw any serious crime. The most serious problem at the hotel is noise. The louver glass windows do not hold back noise. Rooms facing the street will hear buses and traffic all night. Rooms at the end toward the beach will hear trash trucks at 0530. Request an upper room on the rear, toward the north end.
We really enjoyed all 6 days at this hotel. It was clean and very well located. It is great place to stay, very clean and well staffed. Nice people.

Recently stayed at the Aloha Aqua Surf Hotel - 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach. Having read the reviews on Trip Advisor, we knew it would be perfect for us. The rooms are small - and I do mean small! But so what - we only used it to sleep and shower in - had microwave, small refrigerator, coffee pot - coffee was supplied daily. This hotel is CLEAN and the service was top notch - from the front desk to the housekeeping staff, this was an amazing bargain to stay in Waikiki. Breakfast was included (700-830 am) and was fresh fruit, numerous pastries, pancakes, juices, coffee, tea, oatmeal, etc - and the front desk supplies ethernet cables (no charge) for wifi in your room. If there is an area they need to improve on, it is their wifi capability in your room - always "low" and not so reliable. But this is one of the very few hotels in Waikiki Beach with free breakfast and free wifi - and the prices to stay are a real bargain. We have already decided to return and will definitely stay at this hotel again - it was everything we needed and there are many restaurants, a grocery store, convenience stores, etc within a one block area. All in all, one of the best vacations we have had (and yes, we have been before but never at such low rates) - if you are looking for a high end, beachfront hotel, this will not be the place for you - but if you want clean, friendly and only 2 short blocks from the beach and all the action of Waikiki Beach, this is the place for you!

We arrived at about 9pm local time after about 18 or so hours of travelling and were greeted very warmly by the receptionist. I didn't get his name but he was very friendly and informative. He asked if we were celebrating any occasion during our trip such as an anniversary or honeymoon and we told him yes, our anniversary. So he said they would send us up some champagne and we never received it during our 9 night stay. I thought that was really kind of strange and it upset me. Why even ask, right? Also during our check in we were told that their parking lot was full and told we could park at another hotel location a few blocks away. I asked if it would be discounted due to the inconvenience and the answer was no. Luckily I was able to locate parking at a better rate online prior to our arrival and that's what we used for the duration of our trip. During the day (from 10am-6pm I believe) the hotel offers their parking for free to their guests. One day after we parked during these hours and then told the female receptionist just for courtesy she asked how long we would be there and said we may have to move our car by 4 even though it was free until 6. I never understood this. It all ended up working out but made me feel like other guests were more important than us since there were empty spaces at the time and it was free another 3 hours. Free is free right? It was first come first serve so this upset and confused me.The complimentary breakfast is better than most hotels but near the end of our trip the pineapple seemed a little rotten and we couldn't eat it. The first 6 or 7 days it was great. All the other food was good. I liked having the oatmeal and fruit everyday. There's a good variety sure to please everyone. Toast (white and wheat) with butter and cream cheese, donuts, muffins, oranges, pineapple, coffee, tea, juice, water, oatmeal (brown sugar on the side), and pancakes and syrup. I think that's everything : )We had a corner room so our balcony was open on both sides instead of having a wall on one side. It was a gorgeous view of the Ala Wai/mountains/downtown that we enojoyed daily. If you prefer a view you'll be on the street side and if you're a light sleeper you'll want to bring earplugs. The windows don't block out any noise and there's a lot as early at 4 am. I would stay in this room again though just because I think the view is worth the racquet and we're east coasters and were in the habit of waking up by 6 or so anyways. It didn't really bother us.Our room had everything we needed and more. A good sized safe, maybe 10 x 14 or so..?, a mini fridge that's on the large size which we put to great use, a microwave, coffee maker, 3 large drawers that all our clothes fit into. We were realyl happy with it. Everything was very clean. Like other reviews I read the only thing I would say is the tub area could use a re-do but honestly it's not that big of a deal. We were in Hawaii so the last thing on our minds was our shower! We were only in the room to sleep and shower and the room served that purpose just fine. Don't get me wrong, we had a great trip and if/when we return to Oahu we would probably highly consider staying here again. It's about a 5 minute walk to the beach and is very centrally located. I would recommend it.

Rooms small and shabby with peeling paint and toilet roll holder falling off wall but the beds were comfortable and that's the main thing. Breakfast was deplorable - insufficient seating and very limited choice of bad food. The pancakes ran out an hour before breakfast ended, only two kinds of fruit were available (and those were the same every day we were there), the oatmeal/porridge was vile and where was the milk?Some hotel desk staff unfriendly and unhelpful. Maintenance staff however were prompt and helpful. Internet was cable only, not Wi-Fi. Pool incredibly tiny but we did only use it once as there is so much to do and there are beautiful beaches close by. Honolulu is fantastic, so you don't really care where you stay because you are always out enjoying the sights, sounds and tastes (go to the Cheesecake Factory!).

great, clean, good-sized-rooms. Nice, but simple breakfast, and good pool area, though very small and shady. But it's 5 minutes from waikiki beach, so thats great. The staff was very helpful and friendly! Highly recomended!

-The location of this hotel was great. -The staff was very friendly though sparse (I waited in line a long time to check in). -The room was a good size but the city view was horrible, I was facing an apartment building with underwear drying on clothing lines. -The bed was an atrocity. It was completely sunken in the middle. I had to sleep on the edges. -The room was dirty- the curtains and the furniture were stained. I simple did not want to touch anything. Im usually a go with the flow type of person but I ended up moving to a much nicer hotel.

My wife and I have stayed in Oahu 3 times now....on the beachfront and twice within 2-3 blocks of Waikiki. This hotel is clean, in a great location and has some really sharp staff. Tim Clark, the Mgr is top notch. We stayed on the 15th floor, had a nice view of the water and mountainside and our room was cleaned nicely every day. I will return to this hotel on my next visit without hesitation and would recommend this hotel to travelers with family, on a honeymoon or on business. They serve a complimentary pancake breakfast in the morning. On Tuesdays they have a Manager's reception with Tim's famous "Wipe-Out" cocktails (very good) and free massages. Wi-fi is available in the lobby and wired free access in the room which is nice. Our room had a small refrigerator and microwave. You can check our beach towels in the lobby with no problem. Parking is underground and we never had a problem finding a space. There are 2 washers and 2 dryers in the basement as well and we did laundry one night which was nice.I read lots of reviews about this hotel prior to my visit and communicated with them a few weeks before we arrived. These folks are great communicators so if you have special needs or requests, they are happy to try to deliver. They did for us. Aloha!

The Aqua Aloha Surf & Spa is a great place to stay during your visit to Hawaii. The location of the hotel is only two blocks from Waikiki Beach, the hotel staff are helpful, courteous, and friendly. The rooms are just a little small but are clean and well maintained.

When I booked this hotel, I knew we were not booking a 5 star hotel. We were looking for cheap, decent accommodations in the heart of Waikiki. They delivered! The rooms were decent and clean. Not too many amenities on the place, but everything worked well. The Free Breakfast was an awesome!If you like us, spend most of our vacations outside, you will be comfortable!

I booked the place via hotels.com and was given a room on the 3rd floor towards the road (hotel front.). The room looked quite worn. Wall paper wasn't changed the last 15 years I guess. The room had the charm of a low prices motel with its cheap furniture. Size was small too. The bath room was small too, but looked somehow newer and more acceptable.The windows had zero sound insulation and every vehicle that passed, or people talking outside on the road by was noted. Worst was the rubbish truck that came every morning about 06:00 am and parked with running engine some time in front of the hotel.After our complain we were given a room to the rear of the hotel which was more quiet. Still worn though. A few other points: Location: About 5 Minutes walk to Waikiki. That's very good.Lobby: quite open and spacey. Nice looking.Breakfast was included. It was quite simple, but absolutely sufficient for me. The coffee (important for me!) from the dispenser was good too. What was not good was the timing from 07:00-08:30 - and it closed 08:30 sharp. We were on holidays and don't really like to get up so early to catch breakfast. That was one issue, the other issue was that the breakfast area had limited seating. On days when the hotel was fuller guests had to venture to the lobby to find an empty seat. IMHO they should extend the breakfast time to at least 09:00 - or better 09:30. Internet: The rooms have free wired internet which works well.Staff: There wasn't too much staff interaction for us, but they seem all very nice and friendly.Conclusion: I would not stay in that place again. I would maybe have a closer look in one of the other Aqua hotels or in the Ohana. BTW, we moved out after a few days and moved into the nearby Ohana Malia. Similar price, much bigger, newer and quieter rooms.

Stayed 2 nights in March on the way through to the Big Island, the reception staff were nice and helpful. Rooms were adequate, a bit older and smaller, but clean and everything worked. The balconies were small and we didn't use them. Its close to a small supermarket that has everything you might need for a snack or drink, a short walk to the heart of the Waikiki area and the beach. So the location is wonderful. For $109 a night, its what I expected. We did Pearl Harbor, took the city bus which worked super for $2.25. I hate Roberts Hawaii, the "express" bus from and to the airport was horrible, 1.5 hours for their stated "45 minute" trip, the only thing express about them is the name. Pay the extra $15 or $20 and rent a taxi, and save 1 hour of time each way. Their drivers were nice, but beyond that, the routes they take and the large number of stops to pick up an drop off were horrendous, and I'm not normally a complainer :)

Not a bad place, I paid $120 a night tho, and compared to a lot of other hotels in same area, way too expensive, the budget, low end rooms are small, and not so nice, but sleepable, pay for ones with a balcony, and even then not worth what you pay in other places.

I was undecided to rate 4 or 5 as I personally think nothing is perfect. However, when I could not think of even one negative remark I felt morally obliged to rate the hotel 5.Reception - Most of the staff very friendly and all were helpfull with information etc.Location - Great, 10 yds from a small supermarket, 40 yds from the bus stops, an ABC, and a great buffet restaurant with typical american foods at only 13 dollars a head for dinner. The beach was about 200 yds away.Room - We had a two room suite as we were there 12 days and wanted to be as comfortable as possible. I looked at a lot of booking sites but we got the best deal from the hotel itself, by booking 60 days in advance. We had been thinking of booking one of the superior rooms and met a couple who had a superior room. They were extremely happy with it so maybe next time we will save a little and book a superior room. I never saw any of the smaller rooms on the lower floors and would not have considered booking one as I had read on trip advisor that they were very small. That said, I thought the smaller rooms were very good value for the budget traveller as, room aside, the rest remains, (location, breakfast, extras etc).Bed - really big and soooooooooo comfortable, with lovely fine sheets! I would have taken it home with me if I could.Cleanliness - Fine, no problems there.Breakfast - freshly cooked pancakes, toast, cakes and muffins, fruit drinks, fresh fruit, coffee and tea. More than adequate! There was no jam, I bought some, problem resolved.Extras - It was nice to be able to check out towels for the beach every morning. We managed to attend two of the Tuesday cocktail hours and found the cocktails really nice. I ventured down to the basement and used the laundry room, first time I have done that on holiday but found it quite quite usefull.It was our first time in Hawaii, Aqua Aloha Surf helped to make our holiday memorable and we hope to return next year.
This was a great hotel about 2 blocks away from the beach. It was clean and comfortable. Great views from the room & the balcony!

Good foyer with free wifi that runs good & quick. Ethernet in room - free. complimentary breakfast.Rooms are clean & tidy. Coffee maker & Microwave. A safe for possessions. Turn right out of the front walk to end of street you have many shops & convenience stores.A coin op Laundrette. Banks a little further up the road to the right.Waikiki beach just 2 blocks and good eating - try Dukes for good food & value. Staff at AASP are so helpful and reliable.Altogether a hotel that tries. hard for you.

We didn't know what to expect booking into a 2.5 star hotel, but we were very satisfied with this hotel. It offers excellent value and the staff is friendly and helpful. Great location--a little off the centre of things but still very close somehow. The open air rececption area is a nice touch as is the pancake/toast/muffin/fruit breakfast. Initially we were put in a room on the 3rd floor that was somewhat dingy, so we asked for a room upgrade. For an additional $15 per night (total) we were put in a 4th floor corner room looking out onto the canal--a beautiful view. One night we could hear people talking in the room next to us through the locked adjoining door. The hotel might want to deal with some sound-proofing there. Other than that complaint, the room was clean and everything (shower, taps, toilet, t.v. etc.) were fully operational. no problems. We'd come again.

I didn't want to spend all my money on hotel, instead I wanted more $$ avail to go do stuff. My only complaints about the hotel was the tiny pool, lack of hot tub, and they might as well not bother with the workout equipment. However, the breakfasts were decent, the staff was excellent (especially if you need help planning your day), and the room was comfortable. I was travelling w/ friends and the room was perfect for budget travellers going on vacation. I'd come back under the same conditions. However, if you're looking for something more ritzy/romantic, I'd keep looking

A big bouguet to the Staff ( front end, cleaning ,maintenence and all the rest which we were invovled with) You made our vacation very memorable and you made us feel like we were special. We will definitly be coming back. Every one is friendly courteous and go out of their way to be helpful and always a friendly smile.One has a choice of rooms which incidently are very clean and thats important to us.Since you are situated centrally every thing is very close to alot of anemities.Thanks for wonderful Vacation!!! Marvin & Jean Chmilar Alberta Canada

This hotel was very basic and simple put perfect for what we, (and the budget minded traveller!) needed. It was within walking distance to most things, including Waikiki beach, buses, shopping. They even supplied towels for the beach if you needed one.  When we arrived at the airport, we decided to take a taxi to the hotel rather than the crazy shuttle and it was a $40 ride (including tip), the driver was very talkitive and friendly, in fact everyone we encountered were friendly and helpful, especially the hotel staff. (The day we were to leave was the day of the Tsunami warning and the hotel staff were great dealing with all the questions everyone had as to what we were supposed to do. The manager of the hotel was there also and he was very helpful too.)  The room was your basic hotel room, with a small fridge, sink, dishes, coffee maker and a microwave. Our room was facing the main street along the canal so it was very noisy, I would suggest getting a room that faces to the back. We had a few VERY small problems and they were taken care of right away. The continental breakfast consisted of toast, cereals, baked goods, muffins, pancakes, juices, fresh fruit! and tea/coffee, very good to get you started for the day. Lots of places to sit and enjoy it or take it back to your room.  The Aloha Bistro tours in the lobby area will book any tours or call a shuttle for you. Joyce, who runs it is very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. We booked a Lua and the Polyanesian Culture Centre from her as well as a few shuttle pick ups and she was great, thanks Joyce!! There is also an internet cafe in the lobby area as. $1.50 for 10 minutes and $1.00/page to print for those that just can't leave their work at home! :o) The laundry is in the lower parkade. There are 2 washers and 2 dryers at $1.25 ea.
