The larger laundromat around the corner charges $2.25 a load so it's better to stay at the hotel and do it, but get there early as there are residents in the building too and it can get busy if someone is inconsiderate and uses both machines at once. Parking is also available for a charge of $20/day. All in all, the hotel was perfect for our 2 week holiday and I would recommend staying there to anyone who asks.

I was completely shocked at the state of repairs in my room. The room was very small and had many holes in the ceiling. IT had no desk to write or use the computer on.It had a great breakfast, staff and most everything but the owner needs to upgrade the rooms at least 1400 and that was considered a superior room. Was not as nice as a YMCA room.

My partner and I stayed at Aqua Aloha Surf & Spa for the last leg of a two week stay in Waikiki. We were greeted by VERY friendly and helpful front desk staff and invited to the Manager hosted Happy hour(s) that evening, complimentary cocktails, and chair massages made us feel very welcome. At ALL times any staff/team member we spoke to smiled and were happy and helpful, one guy even chased us down the street to pass on a message! Aqua Aloha Surf & Spa may not be on top of the beach but is close to alot of restaurants and nightlife and is a wonderful place to stay, Mr Timothy Clark and crew, MAHALO NUI LOA

OMG!! it was beautifullllllllllllll....we went for our Honeymoon we never had and had the time of our life..everyone there is so nice to you and helpful in finding things to do..cant wait to take our children there as well...

My husband and I stayed here at the tail end of a business/leisure trip that started with a stay at another Aqua hotel, the Hilton Hawaiian Village for a conference then a couple of nights here. We received a room upgrade which gave us a great view of the canal side but it was real noisy since it faced a busy street. The room set up was awkward with the tv sitting on the same table where the internet connection is at and had no chair high enough to sit on to work on the computer. The bathroom was cramped. Bed was not the best and beddings worn out. Continental breakfast was served but I suggest you go early to avoid the fiasco in the dining room or avoid it altogether. For a few more dollars, I prefer the Aqua Bamboo and Spa.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two days in February. We had read the mixed reviews on trip advisor, but decided to give it a try. The price was great, $80/night, plus an additional $20 for parking. Our 'superior' room was small, but the furnishings were nice, we had a good view of the canal and the city from our balcony, and there was a handy fridge and microwave in the room. The location was also good, near all of the action in Waikiki. We also enjoyed the free breakfast every day. My biggest issue with the hotel was the cleanliness of the room. The floor clearly hadn't been mopped in a while. There was a lot of dust around. The bathroom walls and door were dirty. The hotel would have been so much better had the room been properly cleaned. We also ended up moving to a much nicer hotel which was only $30 more per night.

My husband and I were extremely disappointed with our overall experience. As soon as we arrived, there was no one to greet us and we had to carry our own luggage up to the lobby. Even though we stood there looking lost, no one approached us or told us where to go. When we went to the receptionist, even they ignored us and it took us a couple of times to get their attention. Finally, when we had one receptionist's attention, he was extremely curt and rude. We thought Hawaii was supposed to be home to friendly people and offer exceptional service, boy were we wrong. My husband and I have traveled to many countries and stayed in MANY hotels; out of all the places we've stayed at, this was the worst place. The room was tiny and not worth what we paid for. (you also have to pay $20 for parking). We were so turned off by the service we checked out the next day and moved hotels. It was THAT bad. Moving hotels was the best decision we'd ever made. We moved to a hotel only $30 dollars more expensive which turned out to be a 5star hotel - let me tell you, it was a completely different experience. For only $30 more, we received exceptional service and our hotel room was huge, clean, comfortable. It was such a stark difference from Aqua Aloha Surf & Spa. I honestly cannot get over how disappointed I was with the service at Aqua Aloha. 2 receptionists we interacted with were horrible. These 2 individuals should not be serving guests. When we spoke to the manager (through the phone, because he wasn't coming in until the afternoon), even HE gave us attitude! What type of hotel are you running if even the hotel manager has attitude?!I do NOT recommend this place. There are TONS of other hotels in Waikiki where you can get a better deal and MUCH better service.

I have stayed here twice. Both times, the hotel was fully booked. The first time, I stayed with family and we rented out two suites on the top floor, fl 16. Excellent stay that time. Breakfast was good and we had a great vacation. I came back a year later with friends and we stayed in a cheaper room. I got an upgrade for coming back but we stayed on the 6th floor. This was not great since we got a smaller room, even with the upgrade but hey, we didn't complain because of the deal we were getting. What were the 2 things that prevent me from giving this place the same review as the first was that the breakfast seemed to go down in quality. Not a huge deal but I just remember more fruit and more juices the first time. The second, and bigger issue was that our room was next to the parking lot of the grocery store next door. There is an enormous banyan tree in that lot which has been around forever. If you're staying on the lower floors, you'll find that as soon as the sun is about to rise, those birds start chirping like nuts. Yeah, this is Hawaii and birds are everywhere but it's like that tree is the local Denny's or something. They're all chirping up a storm. For someone who likes to sleep til 8am or 9am, their chirping at 5am caused a problem. I asked to change rooms but the hotel was full so I used earplugs but I could still hear them... If you're a light sleeper, just pay the extra for a higher floor or a room on the side farthest from that tree. But still, it was a good stay for the price.

We stayed for our honeymoon. The staffs are very friendly & nice. Customer service is great.Excellent Location which is only few blocks away from Waikiki beach, international market, and all the shops, restaurants, etc. You do not need a rental car if you plan to stay around Waikiki. Even the zoo and aquarium are within walking distance. Free breakfast (we enjoyed every morning) and free high speed internet (we didn't have time to use the internet). If you are planning to go on cruise or Polynesian Cultural Center, the free shuttle pick up location is just around the corner of hotel. The travel agent at hotel is really helpful and some of her price is even cheaper than booking directly.In the room, there are microwave, refrigerator, plates, forks, etc.It's nice to keep some ice cream or cold beer in the room or have some late night hot snack.We are planning to go back and will definitely stay at Aqua Aloha Surf Hotel again. We will recommend the hotel to all our friends as well. Mahalo for wonderful staying experience :)

This hotel is such a great place. Front end staff at the place are always such a good help. They truley do have tha Aloha Spirit. The rooms were well looked after every day and meeting the cleaning staff in the halls was always with a smile.The little walk from the hotel to the beach was always an adventure, great to get out and explore places around Wakiki. "Wipe out" Tuesdays was a great promotion put on by the hotel for gets to meet and mingle in the loby over a few drinks. The bit of noise from garbage removal in the mornings is somthing we learned to tolerate.( It just has to get done.) If i have to one small complaint, it was the continental breakfast.Morning oat meal with no milk to go with it is a bit of a bummer. But you are within walking distance of several great places to go for breakfast at reasonalble prices. I say get out and enjoy all Waikiki has to offer. The Aloha Surf and Spa comes with Two Thumbs Up.

My wife and I spent a couple of weeks on Oahu and the Big Island and this was our first hotel for 2 nights on the Islands. It was a great value and although a little worn, that only enhanced the charm for us. There was no real view but was fairly close to the beach and next to Kuhio Avenue and we enjoy walking around. The staff were great and quite helpful. The hotel even left us 2 small bottles of champagne and a box of macadamia nuts when they noted we were celebrating an anniversary! We were very touched by that and said we'd be sure to leave a positive review on TripAdvisor when we were back. A great place to stay and we'd certainly return.
This was a great place to stay. I love the hotel management, they were very accommodating.

Just returned from a 4 week stay at the above hotel , lovely location near all amenities, advise you to have a high floor so less street noise and great views of the canal/mountains in waikiki.great value and the complimentary breakfast a nice thought too.friendly staff on reception too,with possibly the exception of Lance on reception who gave us a low floor on arrival 2nd floor so small it was ridiculous for two people but referred to other more friendly staff who the following day placed us on the 14th floor for our 4 week stay.With this one exception ignored as there is "always one" I Suppose a great holiday and great value for money Thanks to the friendly Aloha at the Aqua aloha Surf and Spa.

Incredible value for its location -- a few blocks from Waikiki, more importantly three blocks from the Cheesecake Factory. The lobby is incredible, great for relaxing, and the rooms were surprisingly modern. I was expecting problems with cleanliness and the air conditioner, both of which are issues at another Aqua property, but I was very pleasantly surprised.There were a total of 14 of us staying in 6 rooms for a family reunion for 9 days. The only complaint we had was it was difficult to get them to set up the booking in advance and get the quote... kind of had to keep pestering them. (It finally took a message like, "Really? In this economy you WANT us to take our $6000 down the street?") But once we eventually got the quote, we were delighted with it, and the service at the hotel itself was fantastic.The pool, and poolside area is a bit of a joke, so if that's what you're looking for, you'll probably want the Princess Kaiulani down the street. It has a better setup overall (big pool, sunning area, restaurant, bar, live music at night), but if you're mostly looking for a room for crashing, the Aqua's rooms are nicer. I will definitely stay here again.Make sure to ask for the rooms that face out onto Kanikapolani (?), those give you a view of the canal, and DON'T have you looking into the rooms of the hotel 30 feet away across the alley.

My friend and I needed a good but cheap place to stay for one night on each end of our trip to other islands in Hawaii. I found a good deal on the internet and tried this place. We had good service. The rooms are an adequate size, comfortable, clean, secure. I'm curious about some of the negative reviews here - not sure what the writers expected. It's not a beach front 4 or 5 star but I wasn't looking for that. Unless you like street noise get a room on the back side of the hotel (great views of the inland mountains from the 11th floor).

We stayed Dec 21-29 2009.Location: Our exchange rate at time of booking meant a hotel on/very close to the beach was a little out of budget. Originally thought we might have a bit of a hike to the beach from the Aqua Aloha but were very pleasantly surprised! A few minutes pleasant easy walk with all the beach gear and a 6 year old (who generally didn't like walking far at all in the heat!)Right next door to the Food Pantry supermarket, and our favourite inexpensive eating spot "Perrys Smorgy" was on the same block. Very close to bus stop. For our purposes we couldn't have got a better location.Hotel amenities/services: Loved the lobby with the surf videos playing behind the desk. The free breakfast was much appreciated, yes it does finish at 8.30 so we needed to be organised but were happy with that. Pancakes, donuts, toast, fruit. Can't quite remember if there was cereal as well (getting mixed up with other hotel breakfasts!) You do need to show your room key to enter the breakfast room, we saw a couple of guests argue about this but I think it is a fair enough rule. Only possible downside to breakfast was that at the time we stayed it got very busy, by 8.15AM both the breakfast room and lobby seating got quite full but you weren't able to take food away to your room.Didn't use the pool but it looked fine.Weekly Managers reception with free drinks was a nice touch.No problems with room keys, elevators etc.We loved how this hotel was smaller than a lot of others and seemed quite peaceful compared to the full on activity in the lobbies of the larger hotels.Room: We had a triple all-in-one room on 12th floor and were thrilled with it, couch plus table, kitchenette and enough play space to keep my daughter happy. Room was clean and well maintained, saw one cockroach on first night but he didn't return and I know a few bugs are to be expected in a tropical climate (according to the guest book the hotel will attend to them if reported). No noise issues at all (apart from a few sirens going past which is par for the course in a city).Staff: All of the staff whom we came in contact with from housekeeping to maintenance to reception were friendly,approachable and helpful. We had a lovely chat to Mark the maintenance man who came in to change over the lightbulbs (he should have an official guest relations job!). Our housekeeping lady was lovely and always arranged my daughters toys nicely on the bed (daughter really appreciated this!) The desk staff were very helpful with sightseeing/attraction information. The lady on the desk ordered a taxi for us to get to the airport and she ran through our schedule with us to make sure we would be there with time to spare (this was a few days after the security breach which led to extra checks and longer lines at airports). On a prior trip to Hawaii we had stayed at a hotel (since demolished to make way for a new shopping complex) whose desk staff were quite indifferent towards us so we were really appreciative of the Aqua Aloha's employees.We would definately stay at this hotel again, even though the exchange rate has picked up considerably!

I found a package on Orbitz for the Aqua Aloha Surf Hotel and came here for a long weekend with my boyfriend. Compared to all the other hotels in the area, it's soooo cheap! It's only a 5 minute walk from the Waikiki beach and serves a fairly decent free breakfast. (Pancakes, toast, muffins, fruit.) Unfortunately the price and the breakfast are pretty much the only saving graces, because the hotel is horrendously run down. We booked the the cheapest room in the hotel and it was advertised as having a queen bed. After checking in we walked into a tiny room with a tiny full bed and a crappy, dingy stand-up shower. The room was on the 3rd floor and we were woken up at 6am by next door construction and traffic noises from a nearby busy road. This wasn't going to fly, so for 20 bucks/night we upgraded to the deluxe suite on the 14 floor. This room was considerably quieter, had a normal queen bed and a balcony. It also had a very stained couch, very stained drapes, a dingy bathroom, and a toilet that wouldn't stop running. Since this was one of their nicer rooms, I'm assuming all of other rooms in the hotel are in a similar state.So if you are broke and just wan't to go Hawaii, this place is for you. However if you care about things like mysterious stains, noise, and running toilets, then I suggest looking elsewhere.

Cons:My husband and I stayed here for our 5 year anniversary. It was less than to be expected. It seemd that there were good reviews on trip advisor but the rooms were quite small & looked like they were poorly re-done. (baseboards chipped, missing. tiles chipped, etc.) We had a view of the roof and only about 300 square feet of room counting this bathroom. Food is very expensive in Honolulu as well (but we knew that ahead of time) The fitness area is 3 pieces of equipment hid behind a screen in the lobby. Pool was tiny as well. We purchased our trip on nwa.com so I suppose since we had already paid they stuck us with the crumby roomsPros: great free breakfast (but it ended at 8:30 so you better be an early riser & you can't take food to your room) The location was relatively nice, only a couple of blocks to the beach but there were so many sirens I felt like I was staying in New York City.Overall I would spend a couple hundred more and stay at a nicer place.

Briefly reading some of the reviews i was curious as to what people really expected when staying here for $60/nite? My girlfriend and i traveled here on a shoestring budget and didnt expect anything... we were highly impressed. The location was a short 5 min walk to Waikiki beach, the hotel was a small, but had everything we were looking for. Who comes to Hawaii to stay in a hotel room?? We had clean sheets, hot water, a NICE breakfast every morning and great service.We are in our mid 20's and the last thing we are looking for is a high end hotel... we would much rather spend our time outside enjoying Hawaii, the beach, the food, the people...............................

As long as all you just need in waikiki is a clean room and a bed to sleep on, the aloha surf is perfect. Centrally located in Waikiki, you can't beat the price in the area. I would recommend this as a budget option if you want a quiet alternate to the hostels in the downtown area. Cleaning ladies also very friendly!!

The front desk associates were always helpful right off the bat, the room was always kept clean w/ great housekeepers, I loved the location- blocks/minutes away from activities & transportation, complimentary breakfast was a plus! :-)

I stayed at the Aqua Aloha Surf because it was recommended by the CAA. In fact, the hotel was booked as part of a package. I had just come off a seven-day Hawaiian Cruise on Norwegian Cruise Lines PRIDE OF AMERICA. As the saying goes: "You get what you pay for." I got exactly that: a decent room with limited amenities at a fair price. I needed something close to everything and this hotel is close to the beach, shopping, and local tourist attractions. One added convenience was the free internet and free local calls. If you do not have your lap top, you can access the world wide web for a fee in the internet cafe which is situated in the lobby. The service from all employees from the front desk to the chamber maids was fine. All my requests were met efficiently and with a great deal of professionalism. The Aqua hotel is part of a chain and there are a few of these properties with different names such as the Wave and the Surf, in and around Waikiki. Even though I was there at the peak of tourist season, during the Christmas holidays, I was gratified that the hotel was smaller thus catering to a smaller number of guests. The major resort chains such as the Hyatt and Hilton were filled to capacity and each of those properties house over one thousand guests. If you are looking for moderate accommodation and a decent price, I would recommend the Aqua Aloha Surf Hotel.

Well, we were booked in for two weeks with a family of 4 but checked out after the first night. Rooms are cramped, beds are uncomfortable and everything was very old and worn. The other reviews that state you get value for your money are dead wrong. Our family does not want the best hotels or the best service but when you are paying $89 a night plus $20 to park your car then you would expect something a little better than the local Honolulu Hostel just two blocks down the road. Not in a million years would I recommend this place to anyone with so many other hotels within the area. The only plus about this place was the free breakfast and nice reception area but unfortunately you cannot sleep in either of these areas.Stay clear and search for something else.

Very friendly staff and clean room. Great balcony that looked out over canal. Nice sized room with couch and coffee table and kitchenette. Tuesday's management happy hour had great free drink - Wipe Out! Breakfast buffet was better than expected too with oatmeal, fresh fruit, pancakes, donuts, toast and variety of juices, etc.

I stayed here a week with a colleague on business. A few blocks from the beach. Crystal gives an excellent deep tissue massage at the Spa. Craig the facility director was very friendly and helpful when we had a minor electrical problem in the room. He apologized for the inconvenience and later brought up a box of chocolate covered macadamia nuts. Nice!

We had a great stay here. The complimentary breakfast was good - oatmeal, toast, pancakes, fruit, pastries, juice, coffee, tea. The staff were great, no faults. The location was good - a couple of blocks from the beach, close to everything. The pool and lobby area were a nice touch too.I would recommend the hotel, great value for the price you pay.

The hotel is located close to Waikiki beach, however is behind the big hotels. The moderate city view room was a 1 person room at 2 or 3 floor, sold as 2 person room because it had a queen bed. Because it was way too small and w/o balcony, there was no way 2 ppl could live there without stepping on each other's toes. We requested a bigger room, we had to pay extra $120 and we got it, with balcony, with half mountain view and a tiny strip of the ocean :) (really really tiny, between the hotels).The furniture was old, the curtains were penetrated and broken by time or who knows what various sharp objects. The room was somehow clean however the feeling was diminished by the old furniture and because of the yellow-green, beige and brown colors.The breakfast was a joke, opened from 7 to 8:30 AM (come on....!) and was offering pineapple and oranges, pancakes, coffee, muffins and porridge (and maybe something else that I missed). At 8:30 the doors were closed and I also saw funny discussions between customers and staff ("it's past 8:30, we're closed!" "no it's not, let me in, I just want a muffin!") I say again: come on! :)The staff was somehow friendly to our requests, however we faced many issues with the magnetic keys that had to be reset each day in order to unlock the room and to allow us entrance. Because of this, we faced also arguments like "don;t keep your door key near the phone or other magnetic cards like credit cards, because this is the reason why our door keys are getting broken". Again I say "come on!".It has fridge in the room and plates & silverware + microwave oven and coffee filter.it had a/c but we didn't have to use it since the temperature was perfect :)

Stayed here for a week during one of my bestfriends's wedding in Hawaii in May'09. Highly recommended for its value for money: - breathable, laid-back and spacious family vacation room design. The bed is too soft for me but overall the furniture and facility functions are just about right for a short trip in Hawaii.- decent breakfast: toasts, fruits and oatmeals plus hot beverages to start the day. - Bonus: nice porch near lobby to sit down and enjoy the mountaneous scenery as opposed to the beach which is also very close by.- Swimming pool seems to be functioning only as the hotel's accessory; but then who would swim in one when you have the waikiki beach waiting for you only 1.5 blocks awaySome tips:- Book through the aqua's website for the cheapest rate!- Ask for the bus routes on the reception desks, especially if you plan to hop in and out of some nice spots along honolulu and dont plan to rent a car.

This hotel is quite nice, the rooms are nothing overly special, but decent size, quite clean and have a handy kitchenette. We got upgraded for free which was nice. Only a couple minute walk to the beach and the main strip on Waikiki. The free breakfast was decent, muffins, fruit, toast, oatmeal, pancakes, tea and coffee. The staff was always nice when we needed assistance, quick check in and out. I would definately go back when I'm wanting a decent hotel for a very good price.
This is a good place with value for money. None of the claustrophobia associated with the big hotels. Great breakfast as well. Highly recommended.

The hotel was great just 1 and 1/2 blocks from the main shopping district. THe room was clean, staff great, and breakfast wonderful. I am shocked I didn't pay more for this hotel. The only drawback is the noise of the garbage trucks in the morning. The fitness area was small and consisted of , if I remember , of only 2 machines. But I didn't go there to exercise!. The open air lobby fit well into the hawaiian decor

We just got back from our trip to Oahu. I know this place has a lot of good reviews but i read all of the bad reviews before we left for our trip. Those people were probubly looking for a 5 star hotel at a 3 star hotel price. I saw reviews about noise but we were on the 4th floor and noise didnt bother us. Some reviews were about bad costomer service but everyone was very friendly and very helpful. On busy seasons, parking may be a problem but there is a paid public parking right next door so its just like paying for parking in the hotel overnight. so not a biggie. The rooms are not as small as some other reviews mentioned. We had a standard room the had a patio, living area, microwave, fridge, sink, and everything else a regular room offers. Great kama'aina rate. If you book 30 or 60 days in advance, you get more of a discount on top of kamaaina. Place was very clean and housekeeping was also very friendly. 2 blocks away from main street of waikiki and international market.

Aqua Aloha Surf & Spa has been nicely upgraded... the open air entrance is welcoming with nice colors of blue, representing the ocean. We didn't try out the Spa however it looked quite inviting. The pool is extremely small so if you're looking for a place with a great pool, this isn't it. The ocean is only a five - ten minute walk away which brings you to Waikiki Beach in all it's splendor. Less then a five minute walk to the main street where all shopping, restaurants and more are. We were upgraded for free when we arrived, our room was lovely. It was a quite hotel, with a balcony (no great view). It was very clean, modern, a/c worked well and had a small TV. Then again who goes to Hawaii to watch TV or stay in the hotel room. For the price and quality it was wonderful and I will gladly stay there again.

The location was excellent, a block away from the International Market Place which I would coscider the center of Waikiki. There were all the restaurants nearby. Excellent bus service around the corner. Everythng was clean and in working order. The bed was very comfortable. There was a coffee pot and free coffee in the room as well as in the lobby. The was a free ice maker and ATM in the lobby as well as complimentary daily newspaper The free breakfast was acceptable including fresh made pancakes, toast, pineapple, oranges juice, cerial, coffee. tea. etc. All the staff were very helpful and friendly. The fridge and micowave were very handy and the flat screen cable tv was quite good. There was a network modem port for Internet access in the room and a free loan of a network cable if you needed one (I did). There was a pool and spa which we did not use so I can't comment on them. The lanai (patio) overlooked the Ala Wai canal and mountain beyond. The air conditioning was great as the weather was quite warm and humid. All in all. it was great value for the money. We would definately stay there again on a return visit.

My new bride and I spent our honeymoon here. We spent months looking for the best deals on hotels. She found this little gem just blocks away from the beach and central to most of the shops and restaurants. The lobby was clean and pleasant. The staff was helpful. Our room was nice...better than expected. If you're lucky enough to be placed on on of the higher floors, the view is really great.

I stayed for a business trip and was somewhat disappointed. The room was tiny. I was not expecting much but the air conditioner made so much noise and I could not sleep. Upon my arrival I asked if there was a local restaurant wth local food since I just got off a 10 hour flight. the manager referred me to Hy's Steakhouse which was next door. He said you could get a steak and rice for $6.00 and it was the local grind. The steak house was not open but when I checked it out the prices were extrmely high and it appeared to be a high end restaurant. Parking was tough to get in and out of with an economy car. Will not stay again.

Started out great, check in took only a few minutes and along those lines the check-out was good, they let us stay in the room an extra which worked out well. Overall the breakfast was good, choice of toast, pancakes, muffins, assorted fruit and juice. The lobby and main areas are all very clean and so was the room. If you do not keep the privacy sign on the door they will come in give it a clean and change your towels. The location is great only a 10 minute walk to the main beach, if you walk an extra few minutes they beach is a bit less crowded. Also the main street is there as well and all of the shops are in walking distance.As for the people talking about the noise, it is a bit noisy but we got used to it after a dat or 2 so its not such a big deal as people are saying.

I had a superb time here and the staff, amenities, and room were very excellent and friendly. I really enjoyed the helpfulness of the staff and the location of the hotel. All was excellent and I definately will stay there again and would recommend others to save their money since most people arent in the room. It is Hawaii :) Aloha and Mahalo to the staff!

This hotel is cheap, clean and very, very noisy. If you don't want to listen to traffic, sirens wailing and drunks screaming all night, then choose another hotel — or, better yet, another island. Waikiki used to be kitschy, charming, low-key and family-friendly. It is now lined with LA-style shopping malls and populated by prostitutes, drug addicts, homeless people and the sort of vacationers who start their days with a Mai Tai or three. On our first morning, we saw two people throwing up their hangovers on Waikiki Beach, and every night we had to stroll past hookers en route to the hotel. Then, around three a.m., we were woken up by the jerk next door who liked to party all night. Other parts of the island are great, but Waikiki is a horror. Never, never again.

we could not afford to stay right on the beach and having seen how crowded Waikiki beach is i am so glad we couldn't. The hotel was a few blocks from the sea but walkable annd close to supermarket, shops and restaurants. The rooms were fine, a liitle noisy with the traffic below but not so bad you couldnt sleep. Breakfast was included, it was not much to write home about if you don't eat donuts or muffins for breakfast, but free is free.Reception staff could do with being a little more smiley and welcoming. We only stayed here for 4 days and then took off to the quieter shores of Punalu'u - beautiful.

Overall, my 3 night stay at this hotel was a positive experience. My room was clean & well maintained. I’ll always opt for a small refrigerator and a microwave over a big screen TV (which I seldom turn on, anyway). After trying the anemic looking pancakes on the first morning, I bought cereal and milk from the nearby convenience store. My biggest dislike was the constant din of noise from the outside. I ended up using ear plugs every night.

We liked this hotel especially because of the location. It is about a 5min walk to thebeach as well as very close to all that waikiki has to offer. Our room had a microwaverefrigerator,sink and even dishes and cutlery! The rooms are a bit on the small sidebut we did'nt spend that much time in it anyway. The staff are all super friendly and we particularly enjoyed chatting with Mark! A bigaloha from the General Lee and Brenda! This was our first trip to Hawaii and we arenow hooked! We are already talking about next year! I would recommend this hotelto anyone looking for a good value place to stay that is centrally located.

My Fiance and I stayed at the Aqua surf in November of 2009 and it was awesome! The room was always clean. (The cleaning staff were very friendly) The breakfast was good and you could just grab it to go. The location was the best part about it, we walked everywhere from the hotel (to the beach, the international market, even the hard rock cafe) Also if you wanted to go somewhere and didn't rent a car the hotel is literally a block away from the major bus routes. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for an inexpensive hotel.

When you first arrive the lobby looks nice and people are very accommodating. The thing that really upset me was the fact I was asked if I wanted to upgrade for $15.00 more per night for a balcony room with a partial ocean view; I thought that would be nice so I did. The room literally smells like a sour towel. I told the front desk and they said they would send some one up to clean it. When I returned later the room still had a bad oder. The handle for the bathroom facet fell into my hand as I went to turn on the water. I woke to the sound of trash trucks at 6:00 am in the morning. I also went to shut the black out curtain because the light was shinning in my eyes, I realized I couldn't because a section was completly torn out. The place also had cracks in the bathroom walls. Paid $20.00 extra for parking that wasn't there.Had to park in the turn around and give the key to front desk so they could move it when a spot was available. Upon leaving I informed the front desk of the issues, hopefully they have been fixed.
